description:
I'm from SD and my friends and I took a trip to SF for a weekend and decided to check out the night life. 

We opted for this place based on music, free cover (before 11pm on app), and the not so strict dress code. Overall, we thought it was OKAY. 

**The good.
They offered a guest list for no cover and they didn't have a strict dress code. Music was pretty lit and people were chill. Place was pretty small but it was nice inside and AC wasn't too bad.

**The bad.
The prices for the drinks were WILD. $16 for an AMF for a half cup size?? Bruh. In SD it's like $10-$12 for a full cup and it's waaay stronger. Henny shots were also $14/e like WUT??? I don't know if this is pretty standard but we're used to paying $7-$9 for shots. 

So if you're new to SF night life and are coming here, pregame. I would've honestly gone with 2 stars if we paid for cover too.
author: Adrienne N.

description: This place sucks, security doesn't even know their own rules lol. Lmao they told me to go find the owner to ask for the official rule. So you're telling me security doesn't even know how to do their job, get outta hereee!!!
author: Wyatt L.

description: Do not come here. A drunk mission street hood rat her ratchet prom wearing friends jumped me after the lil broke b accused me of stealing her phone that her mommy bought her. The 6 foot tall notorious big looking female security guard jumps in and assaults me. They stole my bag and gave her my phone. Never found hers though and I wasn't hiding it up my ass. I have bruises everywhere lumps on my head. I ended up barefoot in the middle of market. The company still has not returned my call.
author: lone n.

description: This club is a smaller more intimate club but it is a lot of fun. The crowd is diverse, as well as,the music. You can contact the club or the bottle service girls to book a table. Ig cottoncandycoral has the hook ups on comped bottles.
author: Coco V.

description:
As someone who has been to different clubs in different areas (SD, SF, Vegas) I have never had a worse experience as I did at Holy Cow. Disorganized, rude, and a ripoff. The only reason there is one star is because the female security guard was nice to us. 

Service: Came here for a birthday party where someone set a table is for us. My friend put a card down and everything. We get there and everything goes up in flames. The people working there don't know what line we're supposed to be in, they're constantly yelling at each other because they're so disorganized and apparently they don't know the name of our promoter but they have our name for our table? Not only that but we find out the price that was told to us wasn't really the price. So not only did we have to pay an entry fee of 30 dollars but they were going to charge 20 people 80 dollars each for a half section of seating in the back corner where you couldn't see anything with a super small table that was probably going to get us one drink each. 

Ambiance: DJ was okay. He kept skipping through songs really fast which didn't give us the time to dance or scream the songs we knew but pretty good song selections. Lots of people there with no security watching what's going on on the floor. The layout is whack and it's stupid hard to walk through there while it's packed. 

Tips: Don't come here to preplan a birthday or anything like it. Also if they say there's going to be a performance expect it to be past 1:00 (they close at 2:00... you do the math). 

I'm not usually the type of person to be this upset but when you run into problems with a large group the LEAST you can do is apologize and try to make it right somehow. You ruined someone's birthday. I hope you feel terrible now.
author: Courtney O.

description:
I went here for the first time last week and it's definitely not my cup of tea.

The crowd looked super young (mind you I didn't get carded upon entering and i'm well over 21 lol).

There's no dress code (gold teeth, Jordans, and random designer clothes).

Smoke everywhere! I'm pretty sure I got a contact high and ended up smelling like smoke after leaving this place. (If you're going to allow your clientele to smoke in the club, at least have some type of ventilation).

Music sucked (the dj clearly didn't know how to do transitions between songs and played some songs twice).

Can't really comment on drinks since I didn't buy any (but i'm sure it's expensive for no damn reason).

Venue was okay, not very big. (There are two bars, and different corners sectioned off for bottle service. Also there were two stalls in the women's bathroom).

I will not be back, so glad I didn't have to pay a cover cause it's NOT worth it.
author: M. H.

description:
Yooooo! This place did not fail tonight - Sunday Funday - July 2nd, 2017! Especially when you got a legit and reputable DJ - Mind Motion aaaaand Los Rakas that was the cherry on top! I used to come here when I was in college at SF State, this place did not disappoint after all the other times it was going through before getting renovated... Latino and hiphop top 40's never fail and you know thag if you witnessed this tonight!!! We were all sweating and getting low. The music, the people were all good times before we left! Please have these nights with great Latino vibes again! I promise you will $$$ more if you do! We are fans of this place and when you got good music and ppl thats all you need! 

Please note, the stamps we got stamped with made us concerned when the security guard dude said no in and out.. whats the stamp for then? I was like hell no! We back in cause we paid! All we did was eat and come back because tonight was beautifully contagious! So to the owner, manager please inform your guards that its not cool to get ppl twisted about having to repay. Or else thats what causes problems and people get jumped... 

Other than that, like I said I'll be back.

We'll be back!

Sabrosura señor! Thanks!

Xoxo and I hope you wont disappoint. Ever!
author: Alessandra E.

description:
Too expensive for such a shitty club.
30$ after midnight. Like really?
there's no in and out. 
No good beers; no wine
etc.
author: Vasilii G.

description:
Just left this place, and there are a number of things contributing to the two star review. 

One bouncer in particular was extremely rude, had some type of superiority complex and would literally just shove people when walking through the crowd. The security staff that I encountered in general were very short with me when I inquired about bottle service. 

We actually already had bottle service for our party but initially we wanted to spend a little more, but after the attitude we received we decided not to waste our money. 

As the night progressed so did the piles of trash/beer bottles/ and empty cocktail glasses on the dance floor. The women's restroom ran out of toilet paper and seat covers by 12:00am and were never restocked. We arrived at 11:00pm and at that time the bathroom floor was already covered in toilet paper and water.

The DJ was okay... If you were drunk enough you wouldn't notice the sudden tempo changes between songs and that he only played popular songs for a few seconds before switching to something that killed the mood. Sometimes there was even a couple seconds of silence before the next song would play... But hey, maybe he was new? 

The only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars instead of 1 is because of the bottle service ladies, and the bartenders. They were professional, helpful, and cheerful. But still, I will not be returning.
author: Sasha C.

description: Fake News. Don't present a show as free before 10:30 and let people in at 10:20. I cannot.
author: Arturo S.

description:
I have been here a few times.
Only once the outdoor area was open.
Its very nice out there they should always have it open!
Love a place with at least 2 bars which this place does.

I met the owner & witnessed him handle a difficult situation very well. 
I understand it can be challenging with a club full of drunk party people
I typically love the music here, I prefer 90s not all the "trap" stuff so I guess it depends on the DJ and night you go. 
Restrooms are always acceptably clean!
author: Jasmine-Desiree L.

description:
Looking for a hiphop club? This is the place . It reminds me of the cellular .  Holy cow had great  booty bumpn hiphop music ! Not sure if it's a particular night or if they play this type of music every night , but I love it ! We all loved it! We danced the night away :)

My friends and I ( first timers )  decided to celebrate our friends bday here . Heard it was nicely remodeled and  ratchet AF ! So yes we wanted to TU, the ratcheter the better ! Haha 

 It was a packed Saturday night! Since we got bottle service ( to the right , the first table you see when you walk in ) we got there at 11:30pm and surprisingly there was no line/ wait . 

As you walked in, you noticed a podium with a stripper pole in the middle of the dance floor and the DJ stage to the left . As you walk down, there's a light background thing and bar  to the right , dance floor in the middle and bathroom at the left, end . The club was pretty small and had a diverse crowd . 

As for the bottle service experience , it was okay. Prob one of the most chill ( good thing ) and lazy service ever . Getting our bottles took forever . fOREVER!! Our pregame drunkness started to fade and we all were waiting impatiently  for our bottles. The bottle girls didn't even pass out the drinks after they poured it ! I would solely rate this 3/5 . If we had a better bottle service experience, I probably would give this place 5 stars .

In general, I like this place ! I would come back :)
author: Alicia N.

description: The place has gone down hill since new management took over or since they've gotten bought out...very over priced, never really that packed, extremely ratchet crowd...I've been 3 times since the remodel and new management trying to give it another shot, same outcome each time.
author: Kimberly J.

description: LOL worst experience! Very unorganized, false advertising. Definitely not worth waiting one hour in line. Not worth waiting in line at all really.
author: Isabella B.

description: This was by far the worst club I have ever been to. We were supposed to have bottle service for a birthday party and the people outside were so unorganized. They first had us wait in one line then moved us over and then sent us back to the same line we were in the before. We wanted our spots back in line and one of the security guards outside continued to say "no end of the line". We finally get to the door they checked our ids at least 4 times. We get inside and the bottle service for 20 people was the smallest table and we had to share with another party. All around worst experience ever. Don't go there ! It's a waste.
author: michele g.

description: This place is awesome for club/dance music and as a late night after hours spot between concerts, but they do tend to be more expensive than most other bars or clubs in the area. Not only will you have to pay a cover charge between $10-$20 to get into this club, but your drinks will also cost between $12-$14 each. Also, the bouncers and other employees tend to be very rude here, I understand that they are supposed to be an authority figure for the establishment, but that does not justify treating patrons with disrespect or humiliation. All in all, I would return to this place, the atmosphere is very chill, but I wouldn't expect too much hospitality.
author: Joseph A.

description: Was not my cup of tea. Some of the songs were cool however when we went the DJ stopped playing music twice or something happened with the sound system. The shots are also kinda pricey.
author: Gabriela C.

description: If you're looking for a ratchet festival come on in to this poorly ran nightclub. There are two unpleasant situations I experienced and will be the reason I will never go back. One of them was when my friend went to smoke a cigarette he tripped over a crack on the sidewalk and the bouncer wouldn't let him back in because he was supposedly too drunk and the DJ I don't know if it's the same DJ every night but D'D'D'DJ GIOOO literally gave me nightmares last night. If only this DJ would play different songs and take his playlist off shuffle things would've a lot better. He remixed his name about five times into each song and I'm not even exaggerating. The bodyguards let men roughhouse woman in this club and it's just a very non upscale nightclub it portrays itself to be. #Trashy BTW TO THE THREE PEOPLE AT THE FRONT DOOR WORKING LAST NIGHT PLEASE STOP ACTING LIKE SOME IMBECILES AND DO YOUR JOB YOU HAVE ONE JOB STOP MAKING A NIGHT OUT COMPLICATED.
author: Finau F.

description: Haven't been to holy cow in forever. The layout is awesome great staff roomy and lots of seating. Full outdoor area two full bars nice bathroom. Typical price for cocktails.
author: nancy w.

description: I liked this place. Came here on a Friday. Parking is scarce (no surprise there) but theres a lot less than a block away for $15. They played really good music, have two bars, a big dance floor, and it was clean and new looking inside.
author: Bernadette T.

description:
This place is awesome for music and somewhat of a low-key nightclub scene. It doesn't get too packed in here which is perfect. The drinks at the bar are eh and the cover fee is ridiculous ($20 for Friday nights). The DJ last night could've done better by not repeating his music over and over. 

I danced my a** off so that's fine. I go too mingle and dance with my co-workers, take vodka shots, etc. I love how there's no dress code and I like the friendly environment! This place is excellent for rap/hip-hop music only and a place where it won't get over stuffed with people and elbow to elbow.
author: Allister D.

description: Let me save you guys future hardship. This place is horrrriiibbllleeeeeeeee. Went to to Holy Cow for the first time for my friends birthday party and it was a terrible experience. The place is super misleading. When you walk in to pay a 20 dollar fee to get in, they have a huge black curtain covering the hallway so you can't see if it's poppin or not. When I walked in, the place was super dead. If I was a little bit more sober I would have told everyone to leave to a different place because no one had fun. I am pissed because management knew it was dead and with that being said, they should not have had a high coverage fee like that. Who ever is running this show doesn't know anything about brand image. I hope the couple of dollars you made that night was worth it because it cost you a lot of business. Sure, this place had better nights and it might be a lot of fun... but I just don't think it's worth the risk.
author: Thien D.

description:
No offense if this is your spot, it's just not for me. Definitely got the "I just turned 21" vibe here. Some girl was all up in my face for no reason trying to fight me! Maybe she drank one too many Mike's Hard Lemonades. I have no clue. Spent about 15 mins. here and that was more than enough. 


1 star for the clean bathroom.
author: Grace V.

description:
I went here for the NYE party last month, it was aight. It's an average club, and apparently there's a patio however that night they didn't open it. Music was cool and mostly hip hop / Top40. The crowd was ethnically diverse, and looked like mostly in the early 20's range. Cool people. 

The downside to place is that it's cheap, as in cheap quality, yet way overpriced. It was NYE and they didn't even hand out champagne toasts for people -___-, lame. The bartender straight up said "yea, they're too cheap do that here". Every drink, even well drinks, are $12-$14. Coat check was $8, yikes. If you're going to be an expensive place, that's fine but make it worth it. Try serving cocktails with garnishes or something more upscale.
author: Delilah B.

description: Sf gate article said they were going to play the mcgregor mayweather fight for $15. They were closed.
author: Doran I.

description: They let girls dance on the platform but when a guy comes up they say "no guys allowed" FUCK YOU GUYS HONESTLY. We're in Sf. If anywhere, here. Go get a diploma bitch
author: Josh M.

description: Remodeled and looks better than before, but still not all that. Bartender was extremely rude to me and my friends for not tipping her. I usually don't tip until my second drink, she had the nerve to say "you guys are fucked up for not tipping" she could have said can you please tip next time. This place was a shit show to begin with and being rude is not going to get people to come back.
author: Sharrol S.

description: Celebrated homegirls birthday and everything worked out. Got to a point where apparently my homey got too fucked up but club security came out TWICE to bring him a water bottle & look out for us. Fuck what everyone gotta say, they'll take care of you. Just come out and have fun. They watching.
author: Alvin L.

description:
How rude and disrespectful of a place waited in line got to the front only to be told I couldn't get in because a guy in front of me had a marker like come on. Then had the audacity to say "I know how you tagger kids are."
My first and last time attending that place
author: Finnzz L.

description:
What an anti-LGBT and sexist establishment this is...

My group of friends and I went in after leaving a club that played music that no one in our group liked and decided to move to a more dancey hip-hop scene and went to Holy Cow.

We got our own seating and bottle service. With what we paid, cover was included.

I went out to the floor with my girl friends and they decided to dance on the pole since no one was dancing. After a little bit, they pulled me up. I mean, I was hesitant to dance because.. you know, people need to pay for that show ;)

Anyway, after a little bit, one of the bouncers took me down and said only girls can dance. I was like wtf? Never heard of that rule lol but okay. It's not like any other girls were gonna dance.

After that bullshi happened, we went up on the stage with railings and a huge LED background where you can only see shadows from the floor and where creepy guys scout for their predators.

So my friends and I danced the shh on top and what do you know... Another bouncer comes up and says her and I were "dancing too hard" and that we might break it. LOL WTF? I'm like 115 pounds and she was like 110. Obviously, if we break it, they obviously need to fix it since it's a liability. There was obviously bigger people dancing.

Never going to this club ever again. By the way, the female to male ratio here is lower than the gay clubs in the Castro so I don't know what they were trippin'. I guess since it's a "hip=hop" club, they have to reinforce its heterosexual image.

But wait...

I also heard someone say a group of guys pulled down their pants and showed their penises.

LOL I"M DONE.
author: Aj C.

description:
4 STARS for the remodel, they did a good job and the design is pretty cool. 

I haven't been to this place in ages! Last time I came here, it was just a casual bar with some booths and a pool table. Came here on a Friday night recently for a friend's birthday and man, did it change! 

You enter the door that used to lead you to the pool table, but instead you'll find a cashier and coat check. Behind the curtain is a straight up club! The DJ is on an elevated platform looking onto the crowd and there are two bars - one in the main room and the other on the side of the DJ. There is a huge electronic screen behind the main bar. There are several tables for bottle service throughout and stairs to dance in front of the electronic screen. 

Now with a remodel like this, you would think they would expect more from their customers. But nope, people were in there with a mix of club attire and super casual clothing. If you're going to invest in a remodel to make your bar into a club feel, why not hold the standard throughout? Especially when you offer bottle service? It was odd seeing a nice remodeled place with a crowd that showed up in sneakers and tees. Also, I'm not sure if it's because of the remodel or the night we went, but when Holy Cow was a bar, the usual crowd was youngsters and newly turned 21 yr olds. The night we went, it was a much older crowd. 

Perhaps they need to raise the standard for their guest to uphold the "club feel". I wouldn't come here again by choice.
author: Jenna T.

description:
pretty cool club, nice visuals and ambiance.

They have some decent drink specials and even a coat check.

Of course  this is a club soo your gonna be highly packed in with others up against you but that should be cool with you and of course its gonna be loud but the music is great. 

I like the patio, its a nice area to talk and get away from the packed in crowd.

They also have stages if your brave an wanna be dancing on it in front of the crowd.
Sometimes its not about bravery but about drinkery.

I love the cow out front, very historic.
author: Luke S.

description: Got bottle service... it sucked ass! If I asked for a carafe of " tap water " and the hostess told me I needed to go to bar and buy  bottled water... umm really?!  Cause, I just paid how much for bottle service and you can't bring some tap water? Also, for a Saturday night you'd think there were be a nice crowd of people.... umm nope.. maybe cause it was Santa con and everyone was spent... who fuckin knows.. doubt I'll be back anytime soon.. oh, and the dj... not so bueno.... repeats... ain't cool it's 2017. Not done... guy to girl ratio... terrible..
author: stephanie i.

description:
FYI SF residents DO NOT have free admission before 12am. This is false advertising! They need to take that information off and update their website. I was upset when we asked about this. They said that the information is outdated. Seems like they were able to update their upcoming events though....

Cover charge is $20 after 11pm but I feel that all dancing clubs are like that now. The updated interior has a larger dancing floor and separated lounge areas, you know...for the VIPs. The drinks are $$ and I think the sound system is pretty good. I like the atmosphere and crowd here. This is a good place to go dancing. The drinks are mediocre, shots are around $12.
author: Nika L.

description:
The renovation is nice, but the DJ played so much of the same type of hip hop that it became monotone. Also he skipped between songs too quickly so if a song was good we didn't have long to dance to it.
I felt like he thought he was at home mixing and practicing...
author: Virginia R.

description:
I came on a Thursday night. Pretty good music. Top 40s and 1990s hiphop. My jams for getting down. 
Not that many people on Thursdays haha but good for small groups.
author: Amin B.

description: I'm not sure who Omar' s manager is but that guy has a serious attitude problem that shouldn't be consistent with even the worst customer service standards.  Thumbs down to employees and management for letting that slide.
author: Sid A.

description:
NEVER. EVER. GO. HERE.

I came here last weekend to celebrate my birthday with a large group (28ppl). I called the number on their website and coordinated with a woman named Michelle and put down my credit card info to reserve two tables ahead of time. I get this confirmation email back "Your tables are all set for Saturday. Thank you for celebrating your birthday with us. Can't wait! See you soon. Michelle. Holy Cow Nightclub" -From: info@theholycow.com

I show up for my birthday party that night with **28people* AND THEY HAVE NO RESERVATION UNDER MY NAME. THEY SAY THEY HAVE NEVER HEARD OF MICHELLE AND WON'T LET MY PARTY IN. They make me and my entire group wait outside and finally after enough yelling and screaming they agreed to let us in. I was so upset how either 1) disorganized they were to the point where they can't locate my reservation with my credit card info or 2) they were discriminating bc many of us were in costume as we were coming from a themed party bus. 

Either way, I've never been so poorly treated by an establishment considering we were paying customers and IT WAS MY BIRTHDAY. Instead, they treated me like I was trash and I didn't belong in their elitist club. Except wait. IT'S HOLY COW. Remodel looked nice but the place was basically empty, music was basic, and my tables were in the back far corner where I couldn't see anything. 

PLEASE DONT COME HERE. GO TO DNA LOUNGE INSTEAD. Way better vibe, way more people, way more fun. And it's one block away. Also there is Audio or Butter. Go anywhere else.
author: Kelly K.

description: There bartenders will tell you your debit was declined and still charge your account. Not cool Matthew not cool. Did my review help you?
author: Nick S.

description: First and last time ill go to that nasty small hole. Went there on 10/30 to celebrate my bday, it was a horrible experience the security, bouncers and front desk people were rude, with lack of social or communications skills. They talked to us like we were animals lining in a farm. The crew/customers were so nasty as well and to complete the horrible experience my friend's  cellphone was stolen from her small bag. Plus the flyer for the party said they were going to be prizes for the best costumes and every hour Victoria Secret gift cards giveaways which it never happened  (false advertisement). Bartenders were the only nice people there. Don't go there if you dnt want to be rob or mistreated
author: DianaCarolina M.

description: I am completely over this place. Thanks to the ratchet b*tch who got in my face because you obviously owned the dance floor. Get out of here...And to the hypocritical bouncers who don't give crap, y'all need to do your job. Do not threaten me with a video when I didn't do anything.  I will get this establishment shut down because of how poorly I was treated. I do not fight anyone EVER (I'm classier than that) but I had defend myself for almost getting jumped. Do not come here unless you want ratchet hoes tryna fight you for dancing next to them. Get over yourself.
author: Joey C.

description: I've been here twice, and that was around 2007, 208. The club is ok, but the manager, or owner, I'm not sure what he is in there, but, he is the worst manager ever.... I don't know his name, but he is a short guy that walks with a handcuffs surrounded by securities, and he thinks that he is a bad ass cop.... but he is rude and scare their customers away yelling at you if you a man. I wish a could see him out of there someday...... But I bet he is not like that not surrounded by his securities.... I won't come back ever..... thanks
author: Rafael O.

description:
The new HC is just another douchey bay area night club, which is sad because the original HC use to be an amazing no cover at the door, friendly bartenders and great DJ kind of place. Now it's just overpriced drinks, weird mix of music (the DJ was not on point) and there is no place to "hang out" outside of the dance floor anymore. I have very fond memories of this place, but it's completely different and utterly un-enjoyable now. 

If you're looking for a great place to dance with friendly people and great bartenders, just walk about 8 blocks down Folsom and hit up Raven. It's worth your time.
author: Crystal R.

description: These guys are scam artists.  They sold tickets to an event, the ticket buyers showed up and the place was closed.
author: Charles Z.

description: First off, I got my wallet stolen here so that sucked. Second off, drinks were a little more expensive than I though they should have been. Dancing was fun but crowd was a little sketchy. All in all this place was decent night out.
author: Brady A.

description:
The place is like any other pop-club: Overpriced beer and drinks (no beer on tap), hired dancers wearing skimpy clothes, vip areas, and enough bouncers to stop an all-out riot. Plus, in this case, a terrible DJ.

I enjoyed myself the first couple of hours I was there but the repetitive and badly mixed music gets annoying after some time.
author: Malthe J.

description: For sure deserves five stars for the most AMAZING and a FRIENDLIEST bartender ever. Brandon you are the coolest and make Holy Cow the place to be!!! Thank you :)
author: Samineh H.

description:
I used to go to this place when it was considered a dive bar. Used to get cheap drinks, place would be packed on Thursday/Friday/Saturday nights. Have a lot of fun memories. 

Now - they remodeled. It is nice, but it's more a douchey club now. Went there about a month ago on a Friday. No cover because we went early and got on the guest list. Bought 3 drinks at the back bar and it was over $30. A little later, bought 3 more for my friends and myself, was over $40. Strange. Didn't know going to a different bar within the club would mean different prices. 

Club was dead. 11pm rolls around and we decided to leave to meet up with a friend elsewhere, but intended to return after midnight hoping more people would be in Holy Cow. Wrong! We returned, 12:30am, club had fewer people in it compared to 11pm. It was sad. So we called it a night. 

Back in the day, it used to be PACKED up until closing. I don't know who or what to blame. Was it the remodel? Part of me thinks so. I miss the old Holy Cow.
author: Sarah K.

description:
Went to Holy Cow this past Sunday for their day party and honestly it was a great time. The music was great, they served tacos, and the vibes were dope. However, we left the party around 8 PM to check out another party. Now the bouncers did tell us that there were no ins and outs but we decided to come back around 10 pm anyways. 

I fully understood that the three of us would have to pay $30 again to get in which we did without asking any questions, but when we got back inside the place was completely dead. There was about 10-15 people left inside and after 15-20 minutes they kicked us all out. Why would they even let us in and make us pay cover with the club closing so soon?  They should've at least warned us (which most venues do).  Holy Cow, I hope it was worth losing three customers for that extra $90 (one of us was even seriously considering booking the venue for an event before this incident).
author: Aman G.

description: Hi, I was just at holy last night and it was absolutely horrible. Jon B was great, but the lack of security guards not doing there job how they're supposed to is outrageous. I had saw people doing drugs in the bathroom and also I saw a little short security guard with a beard, he was at the front for a while, I literally heard him talking about people cutting lines and also free admission for giving the guard some weed. That's not professional at all and it's just not fun to be here. The security sucks Scotty the owner is an awesome man and it sucks I have to write this about his club because the guards are literally kids in uniform there to have a good time! Not to mention security guards making snap chats with females and other people while their supposed to be doing their job. I wish I can get payed for working a popular club and get to be on my phone or rude as ever to people. Holy cow is a good club but the security sucks point blank period.
author: Erik W.

description:
I've been a regular at Holy Cow since the 1990s. I just recently discovered they had remodeled the place, and I had not been there for a while and decided to take my girlfriend out dancing there on a Saturday night. My opinion is that overall, they did a good job creating more dance floor area than had existed, and the feng shui works better. The lighting, color, and basic theme works, although it now has the feel of a strip club, even though it's a dance club. 

That's about where my positive review ends. I was pretty disappointed to find that, despite the fact that they have created more seating areas as well, ALL of the seating is VIP and requiring bottle services. No more stools at the bar, either. If you want to sit down anywhere, you better be ready to pony up $300-2500 minimum for a bottle. There is no guarantee you will get a seat, either. They like to reserve these tables and pretend like they're doing you a favor to give you one. I don't go out clubbing as much as I used to, and I'm not familiar with this bottle service trend that has developed. I guess it's a way for dance clubs to bilk patrons out of lots of money, just to have a good time. Have fun paying $14 for a drink at the bar, too--that's clearly overpriced. I understand that rents and costs of doing business in San Francisco have recently tripled due to the tech boom, and maybe night clubs have no choice now but to find ways to make up the difference with their current prices, but it could be an opportunity to gouge people, too. I'm not going for it. The city really is turning into a playground for the rich, if the Holy Cow is no longer a sacred one!

Traditionally the Holy Cow enjoyed a clientele that was ethnically mixed and multi-generational. On the night I was there, although most of the crowd were 20-somethings, I was glad to see much of the same old demographic showing up. This has always been a club for the people---unpretentious, inexpensive, great weekend dance fun, with everyone having a blast, spending lots at the bar, and making love connections. The Holy Cow may be (inadvertently?) extinguishing those wonderful historical qualities now. Looks like it's pay to play from now on.

The DJ sucked. We kept waiting for him to play some dance music, which is too much to ask for on a Saturday night, apparently. I'm not even picky. Any current pop-infused hits or techno or throw back 80's stuff, or whatever. Anything! He just kept playing hour after hour of that raunchy, industrial, back alley rap beat that is not good for dancing. I can understand playing some of that as warm up music, but come on. It just became degrading to the crowd after a while. Most people were not dancing to it, and there's an obvious reason for that. 

My girlfriend and I made the most of it and just kept dancing with each other because we were determined to have a good time and have a few drinks. And we did, overall. But am I returning to the Holy Cow any time soon? NO. We're going to find other venues that have better dance music and an atmosphere created by the venue owners as less elitist.
author: Michael F.

description:
I went here Saturday for my birthday with a bunch of friends and I had a really good time. They recently remodeled so I was my first time coming here in a while. I liked the new layout, I liked that the bottle service tables were elevated, it made it seem like there was more space. 
I liked the music but some of it was weirdly mixed, like at one point the DJ played an Indian song that was remixed with trap or something. Super weird but most of the songs were top 40's remixes. 
And the bass was pretty intense but once you have a few drinks and shots in you, that thought slipped away. 
If you sign up for guestlist, you can get in for free before 11 (I believe) but we got there late so we paid $10. For my friend that didn't put his name for the guestlist, he had to pay $20.
author: Stephanie Z.

description: I wish their was an option for 0 stars, this club does not even deserve 1. First of all, one of the bouncers tried to get my friend and I to pay when we got there before 11 and we were on the guest list. Second I got my phone stolen when it was in my butt pocket. Some girls literally took it from my pocket and refused to give it back, when I told the bouncers about the incident they did nothing about it. Not to mention they tried to fight me over MY phone. Dress code didn't seem to be enforced by the way people were dressed. The staff was really unorganized and had no manners. I've never written a review before but in this case I thought it was very necessary.
author: Saudy A.

description: Went here Saturday night for a friends bday and paid way too much ($15) for a half filled club with tons of heavy faced chicks and weak bottle service. It's hot as hell and super small. There's a problem when I can see huge gaps between groups of people dancing. It ain't poppin'. I soon left the club and got an incredible grilled cheese sandwich next door at V Cafe - go check out my review on their channel as the only positive thing that happened for me that night at HolyCow lol
author: Vern D.

description: Holy Cow is the new club that opened a few months ago. I enjoy this club. The girls are pretty and the music is on point. I've been here once but definitely want to come back! We paid to get in, I think it was about $20. There are plenty of young people here.
author: Amy Y.

description: Holy Cow is what you say when they charge you for drinks. A shot of tequila $12.00, a vodka and Seven Up $12.00 x 2 =$48.00. Drinks are nothing but ice water for cheap ass made. It's hard to dance with drinks spilled all over the place, only a couple stalls for the bathroom, no where to sit unless you pay $900.00 for VIP. Holy Cow remodeled and took that small awesome vibe down the toilet. Waste your money somewhere else, this place sucks.
author: V W.

description: Super nice inside. We were on the guestlist, which meant we came in way before anyone else did. But it was fast and eficient! Although it wasn't crowded, I knew this was one of the places to be on a Friday night. Drinks are a little pricey, though ( $12 for a crown & coke?) But the GoGo dancers were very cute, the stage was nice, the VIP sections were super swanky and we're perfectly placed throughout the club to give you that privacy, but to also make sure you didn't miss out on any of the action on the dancefloor. Good DJ, too! The bouncers were super sweet, too! I'd definitely come here, again.
author: Michelle M.

description:
I just wanted to give an update while I walked by Holy Cow to go to Butters...where there's good munchies....great vibes and nice people....go to Butters or the Cat Club!

Walked by Holy Cow...and deja vu....another fight broke out on the street.  If this continues...next thing are drive bys...I won't walk past Holy Cow anymore..too ghetto..

Go to Holy Cow if you want 

cheap drinks + douche bags = sexual harassment
smelly barf infested bathrooms + date rape drug = therapy & a police report
STD unwashed/reused cups = Herpes for life
fight + racially discriminated = youtube video fan club
author: Poppy M.

description: I went here before and it was pretty cool, but that was when I just turned 21. They renovated the location, so there's a main dancefloor surrounded by VIP seating and two bars. The music was either old 90's, bay slaps, or Drake. Danceable, but it was weird how dead it was (Friday), and it picked up around 12:30, but not even. I just basically said screw it and went out, regardless of the crowd. Guestlist is legitimate if you sign up online, if not, $20.
author: Sean H.

description: The skins wack ass duck I don't know who's worst the female or the male. The white people act like they're scared to dance when black people hit the floor. I will never come back here!! Ever
author: SHRONDA J.

description:
Just went here on Halloween only because they renovated the venue and though it is now more visually appealing than before, there is still work that needs to be done. 
My friends and I chose to get bottle service there was about ten of us and for the amount that we spent for that venue I expected more exclusivity. For instance, we were by the DJ booth and we had to jump up to our area (not safe). Also, people were walking into our area and there was no designated wristbands or security that controlled the bottle service area. I just feel like if you're going to try to attempt to renovate a venue to be like a nightclub try not to cut corners. Overall, of course my friends and I have a great time wherever we go, yet, I just wish we could've had a better experience. Maybe, I'll try this venue again simply because the waitresses were actually very nice and tried to accommodate us. 
However, I was very upset that we had a guest that came late and they wouldn't let them in. The communication from the promoters and security was not done well and it left us with an unfortunate experience, again.
author: Sherice L.

description:
I'd like to say that it doesn't get any worse than this, but I'm afraid that's probably not the case. The truth is, Soma is probably full of the kind of vulgar onslaught to the senses that is Holy Cow. 

Loud thumping and people pathetically moving their hands and nodding their heads in a way that they hope will be distinguished as dancing through the drunken haze of everyone else. 

These are the people and this is the kind of place that all worthwhile scenes rebel against.

Read this and consider yourself a lucky individual if you never come here.
author: Jon T.

description: Went to the day club there on Sunday during carnival weekend to watch Los Rakas perform. Had a super wonderful time with my friends. Great music and friendly staff. I would have given it 5stars, but I felt bathroom could have been better maintained. I wish they could have had an extra bar tender working or maybe hire extra bar backs to assist bartenders so they don't have to do the extra work. And would love to see some plants or foliage on the patio. Would give it so much more of a outdoor atmosphere.
author: Cara D.

description:
Yeah. this place is like an endless Kesha and Pitbull music video coupled with cheap Tequila and a side of hangover and Advil. 

Not to mention letting in the seediest people who just stand in the back and look around- (why would you roll through the bar with like ten guys and just stand around and mean mug people).

Avoid.
author: Geo D.

description: They renovated this place so it looks totally different from what it used to look like. Drinks are diluted so it's a total rip off. Music is OK, the dj only plays a couple seconds of the song and switches it right away. There's no transition to the music at all, very random.
author: Tien H.

description:
SWORD FIGHT to the max!

came on a wednesday night... what a motly crowd this place attracts
- balding gray haired old ass men in their 50's
- 30 yr old creeps with beanies on who stand on the wall staring at girls
- large groups of guys wearing plain T's
- former inmates

you know this place is NOT classy when 
- guys and girls share the same rest room (obviously piss all over the floor)
- guys try to reach from behind and grab your boobs
- everyone pushes and shoves
- girls bend over with their butt up and head near the ground and dance like that all night
- they let in people sporting full faced beards
  
You will suffocate in here, its crowded, hot and sweaty, and if you try to go to the back, it's like smoking in a tent, and all you breathe is second hand smoke.

no cover = cheapos.  creepos.  old guys.  gangstaz.

no ratio enforcement = 90% guys

I did have fun at holy cow (as long as i'm dancing everything is ok) but this is a disgusting place to be.  I won't be comming again unless i'm hanging out with a sausage fest of my own to help cock block.
author: Tina A.

description: Ugly blonde waitress telling us to leave the bathroom because she worked there. Excuse me but we paid to be here. She told us to shut the fuck up and leave. Maybe y'all need some better employment.
author: Bekah C.

description:
Holy Crap. I can't be the first that has used that right? There are few places that my friends and I are just completely disappointed in and this has to be one of them. I had heard so much hype from others and I think that played into it but most of the reviews are pretty spot on with this place. 

We went there once in the three years I have been here in SF so that should give you an idea of the experience you will get here. Now I am wary of the term ghetto or hood because it could mean a number of things to people but whatever it means to you then that is exactly what Holy Cow is like. Sketchy people doing sketchy things check. Unsafe walk to the place and unsafe area around it? Check. Overzealous bouncers and staff check. Terrible dancing and even worse people on the dance floor check. So now that all that is covered you have all the ingredients for a terrible night. 

Given the location there are just too many other options to go to even if you lived out here. Given that we don't it is definitely not worth the trek over here and shouldn't really even be experienced once. I don't say that about a lot of places. Everyone is just too young and too shady for this place to be fun. The bar set up was nice making it easy to find a spot at the bar but the drinks are expensive and not strong at all. 

The music was decent and there is always a star for a club that will play some hip hop or the djs that actually try to keep the party going. But its not even fun half the people are dancing up on elevated areas and the other half are half dancing around you it just all feels half done. 

The dance floors are incredibly packed and don't even feel like dance floors they just feel like extra space around the bar that people decided to dance in. I just felt uncomfortable the entire time I was there. Like something could go down and no one would be around to stop it. 

The cover isn't worth the experience and in the end I think that pretty much settles on why this gets such a bad score. If I can't justify spending five or ten dollars and wouldn't even consider spending more than that to get into your location then it is just not for me. It could be your style of place but there are so many better clubs that do what they do in a safer environment and with less chance of running into issues. I haven't been there in about two years so maybe things have improved dramatically but the fact that I have had no desire even once to see if that was the case should tell you something.
author: Nick R.

description: I hate leaving bad reviews but this place deserves one! I was first introduced to this place many (10+) years ago and it was awesome! So much fun. Last night I went there and was told it was under new ownership. I paid the $40 freaking bucks it cost for me and my boyfriend to go in and the inside was redone and very nice. The patio was closed which was a very nice space before. I feel so bad for the bartender, he was very nice but they only supplied him with crappy, cheap booze. I kept trying to order drinks with the alcohol that we prefer but he didn't have any of it. I don't know what kind of place this is now but they asked to check my purse and confiscated my pre-natal vitamins while I was inside. ( I guess they like to sell their own drugs out of that place and don't want me supplying vitamins to anyone). Needless to say we left after our first drink. Best decision EVER.  Don't go here, huge rip off!
author: Danielle A.

description: I'm not a fan of SF bars, lounges, or even nightclubs but I had a blast here.  The music was really good and it had a very cool vibe up in there.  The VIP area has a great view of the crowd with the dance floor front and center.  I'd definitely pay this place a visit again when I'm in town.
author: Oanh N.

description: Took someone here last week because it used to be FUN, it used to be the place to go on a weekend, did not know that they renovated the place and had an entrance fee now. Club was nice, bigger, cleaner but not fun anymore. Crowd is diff now, it's dead and its sat too. There more guys then girlS. No one was dancing. Hayz. Never again. Miss the old place and crowd
author: Neng A.

description: WTF!!!the cow used to be a dive bar that was always fun to go to, the crowed was always good and u always had fun. I went for like 20 min Saturday night  and had to leave .the only good thing was the music  and that was it. What a disappointment.
author: Susana C.

description:
Holy Cow gave away my Driver's License and Debit Card to a random stranger. So be careful opening a tab. They could have checked the picture on my driver's license before giving both cards away. It's ok though....I just won't go out for the weekend, drive my car, make any purchases, such as food, bills...no hassle what so ever.

And to top it off, I'm traveling out of state in a couple days and need to rent  a car. Hopefully, they don't ask for a DL. Thanks Holy Cow. You're the best for regular service. Making my life fkn difficult. Visiting the DMV and getting a License will be so quick.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Last night my friend and I were grilled in front of holy cow about our ages because the bouncer didn't know what a real California ID looked like. They asked what my friend's bday is and when she answered correctly they then asked her how old she is, what her astrological sign is and for the year she graduated from high school. Anyone who ever goes to bars in California would know how to check if it's a real CA ID and not need to ask multiple questions. Furthermore, that bouncer then asked another bouncer to look at our IDs because he still couldn't tell if they were real. It was ridiculous. Once we got inside we were so turned off by our entry that we left about 2 minutes later. Y'ALL SAW THIS ONE COMING!!!!
author: Olivia M.

description:
Jam packed with Asian people and I CAUGHT THE FLU HERE.

Needless to say I will never go back.
author: Claire W.

description: Holy Cow is a nice change of pace from some of the other places in the area. This venue is beautifully done - it evokes class and sophistication, but at the same time is a welcoming space. They have an impressive drink selection and the friendliest staff. I'd definitely recommend this place to anybody who appreciates a nice crowd, good drinks, and great music.
author: Jin K.

description: Went here for a happy hour event sponsored by a few orgs I'm acquainted with. It was my first time there. I ordered two drinks and left my tab open; a half hour later I came back to order another drink and a beer, then a half hour later I came back to close my tab and the total was already $53. I said this can't be right, for three drinks and a beer? The waiter then told me that someone else had ordered a drink on my card... I was in a good mood with good company so I said sure, whatever. But lesson learned, don't leave your tab open with error prone waiters. The place was clean but nothing special and the DJ and his choice of EDM was poor. I won't be coming back.
author: Vang B.

description: This is a tough review for me to give but I think it is accurate.  I've been to this place about 20-30 times between 2008-2010. It was always awesome.  I recently returned to this place and it is completely different, in a good and bad way.  The interior is completely redone and now includes areas for bottle service.  It was a $20 cover.  I paid for my friend and I and they tried to trick my friend into paying even though I had just paid for him.  It's not listed anywhere but this is essentially a cash only bar.  The music they play now is exactly the same as it was 5 years ago.  The Humpty hump is still a popular song.  Luckily, the girl/guy ratio is still pretty good which is the only reason I gave it 2 stars instead of 1.  5 years ago this would have been a 5 star place for me.
author: Brendan A.

description:
Thirsty Thursdays are 1/2 off drinks til Midnight. No cover charge!
I used to come here all the time while I was in college so I have seen a lot of ranges in what Holy Cow becomes.

Normally, this place is filled to the brim with super creeper status dudes who I saw every week, still trying to talk to the same girls that rejected them last week... Dude, she is probably not interested.

Even with the type of strange scary dudes that they let in every week, they wouldn't let one of my friends in because he was wearing plaid. They also get a little crazy about their dress code occasionally, when they feel like kicking people out... To give you an example, I had a lot of friends spilling money on the bar, like shots after shots after shots... And my friend took off his cardigan because it was getting hot (unfortunately, he was not wearing a t-shirt and only a beater) and was threatened to get kicked out...

Sorry Holy Cow, but you ain't no high end establishment where people do not climb on the bar tables to dance and don't have sex in your strange bathrooms. Also, you see this strange liquid all over me. It ain't my sweat, I haven't even started dancing.

As a college kid, sure this place works out fine. As a woman in her mid-20s, I'm not entirely sure this is where I want to spend my free time if I'm not trying to get buck fucking wild. So if you do come, come with friends who will watch you (no promises that you won't get taken, booboo) and you can enjoy being (wild) with because this is no place to get dolled up and have dudes treat you nice.
author: Winè C.

description:
Yes, this place stinks..literally. The floors are sticky from all the sloppy drunk ppl. Girls will give you the evil eye in the restroom. Guys will not even bother to talk to you and will just dance up on you instead, sweat and all. There will be that one couple that decides to have a drunken fight in the middle of the dance floor and you will get banged in the shoulder if you don't get out of the way. 

If you put your coat/purse down, don't expect it to be there at the end of the night. You really should know better, so when all your cash and your new iPhone with the COOL AS HELL case you got in NYC goes missing, you only have yourself to blame. And when those "cool cats" you meet at the end of the night offer you some toke, it makes perfect sense to go to the dark alleyway next to the bar. And when one of them accidentally punches you because he mistakes you for his friend, again..you only have yourself to blame.

Because without all this, Holy Cow would not be what it is. You don't go to a bar with a goddamn animal hanging out front expecting class and a jolly ole good time. No. You come here for some whack experiences that make you wake up the next morning and think...damn, did that really happen last night?? And seconds later...hm, when can I do that again? Thank you, Holy Cow, for being exactly who you are. It's places like you that make me love SF.
author: Anh-Dao T.

description:
This place is absolutely ridicules the bouncers outside littlerly gave me shit for not being an organ donor (seems like they are a little bored with their jobs for even looking at it) told me I have to check my jacket even though it was extremely cold and I had to get it 10 min later, I probably spent close to 100$ on the bar just to not pay attention to how lousy this place was 
I don't see any reason for people to actually go there consider how uncomfortable the staff and bouncers make you feel, really bad for business, it's almost seems like they try to give themselves a bad name
author: Dean W.

description:
I'm not gonna be nice anymore. 

This is my third review and it's only gone from 3 stars to 1. FIVE people's iphones got stolen in one night! Mine included. ONE gotten his wallet stolen! And those are just the people I know, I wonder who else got their stuff stolen! 

There were definitely pick pocketers, and it's BECAUSE there's no cover and it's so crowded!  That's the whole reason why everyone likes this place, but it makes low-life and immoral thieves like this place too! 

Gross, ghetto, shady ass place.  If you think you're saving money and gonna have a good time by coming here, be my guest. Just don't go crying all night like I did.  I warned you.
author: Raquel Y.

description: I came here over Memorial Day weekend and it was awesome! The dj was great and the place looks much better after the remodel. There were girls competing with each other on the pole in front of our table so it was an interesting night. The drinks were great and not too expensive. Overall I would totally come here again when I'm back in SF!
author: Alice S.

description:
Sometimes you just want to dance. Grab your girls and party from one spot to the next. Don't like the music, let's move on to the next club. Although I don't go clubbing much, when I want to dance I usually find myself at the Holy Cow late night for some fun. 

Holy Cow usually has no cover and always playing the newest dance songs. It's pretty hot in there, so you can find yourself escaping to the back patio for a little SF cool weather. 

And then back to the dance floor!
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Holy Crap....

I used to love clubbing, dancing, drinking, etc. in SF. Hit up this place because there was no cover! YAY +1 Star. WAY too many clubs in SF say things like "Guestlist gets in free before 11" but you're standing in this pathetic line wondering why they hold up the line until 11 instead of passing out stubs for those that got there on time! 

Anyways, like I said, we went here because there was no cover and Ana Madera happened to be one of those places that hold up the line. The security guards were nice. I like that. Once I stepped foot in there though...

TIPS:
+GET FANS OR AIR FILTERS!! This place reeked so so bad. I thought I smelt urine on the way in and I hope it's cause someone pissed themselves that night on the way in.
+$25 dollar minimum for credit card use? Boooo....
+It was impossible to breathe in there. It smelt like all kinds of nasty and cheap. 
+When going to the patio for fresh air, you can't get none cause it's the smoker's section.
+When going in the front to get fresh air, you still can't get none because it's also the smoker's section. 
+Thumbs up for a good Hurricane though! Try it :)
+Music was a good mix but also some wtf songs.
+Lock your cars and throw everything in the trunk before you park. My friends' cars always get broken into in SF.

Now if you're in a dilemma or thrown off from the reviews, consider:
+I was sober that night.
+People who rated it highly was:
a. drinking. or drunk.
b. got their bump and grind on.
c. got laid.

I miss clubbing in Santa Barbara... :(
author: Mary C.

description: I looooove this place, chill people, awesome bartenders and DJs.  Patio is awesome and you can take your drinks out there. Met my husband there almost 8 years ago, this place is by far one of my fav spots in SF.
author: Katey H.

description: Seems like everyone today is renovating to attract a crowd (i.e. temple), so I had to check out the new HC.  First things first, sign up on guestlist or you'll end up paying $20 for cover, guys.  If you've been to the old Holy Cow, this will astonish you as it went from being divey to "classy".  Came here on a Saturday night and it was pretty empty.  The DJ played some slaps, but overall, he was all over the place.  It had the crowd going up, and then all the way down.  Even the go go dancers looked bored at times.  They're definitely trying to go for the classy vibe as I didn't see any house alcohols, only premium grade stuff which were $12 for a mix drink -_-  I don't think I'd come back here.
author: Alex G.

description:
Holy Cow f*cking sucks. If I could give this place negative stars, I would. I've come here (against my will) with friends so many times on Thursdays in the past when it was even filthier than it is now.

Today, I'm completely done with this place. Everybody who works here is a Grade A+ certified prick!

The blonde female bartender that night decided it was more important to flirt with male customers than take drink orders. The place wasn't even half full, and the bartender was clearly drunk because she had no composure at all.

The Asian bartender also ignored me several times. Finally I got her attention and asked her for a glass of water.

"Sorry we don't serve tap water, you can buy a bottle though for $3" she said.

"Seriously?"
"Yes, seriously"

I scowled, "My buddies literally spend $100+ on drinks and I'm the designated driver. I just want some water because my throat is sore."

Well, she rolled her eyes and said "I'm sorry, the owner won't allow it."

I asked her to tell me her name. She refused. I asked her for a business card and contact information of the owner. She refused. I told her this absolutely has to be a violation of health or municipal code to refuse a paying bar patron a glass of simple tap water.

"I'm sorry." She shrugs and runs away to a tall older Caucasian fellow who must obviously be the owner. I stand there, pretty pissed off and he glances at me out of the side and shakes his head. The Asian bartender keeps her distance until I throw my hands in the air and walk away.

Look owner and employees of Holy Cow, your bar is a complete waste of space that can't even half fill on a Friday night. Obviously it was so bad there wasn't even any cover charge. On that note, are you really going to leave a sour taste in the mouth of the soberest guy in the bar who just drove FOUR thirsty ass people who all spent quite a bit on drinks that night?

Really? Does this make business sense guys?

No available tap water, drunk employees on the job, and filthy bathrooms so dirty that they would make Oscar the Grouch blush.... 

Moral of the story:
Don't waste time arguing with mental midget bartenders and heartless owner. Submit a formal complaint to the San Francisco Health Department instead =)
author: Doug R.

description:
I went here a few Saturdays ago to meet up with some friends. The place was dead when we got there at about 10:45pm. The music was ok. The place got pretty packed by 11:45. There were a lot of predators out there, creepy looking predators. The only decent thing about the place is that they have a outdoor back area where you can go for a smoke or sit down and relax for a bit, thus the reason for the 2nd star.

No, I won't ever come here again. My suggestion, try out the new Uptown area in Downtown Oakland, much more mature crowd. And when I say mature, I mean little boys aren't sneaking up behind you and trying to grind against you.
author: Raquel F.

description:
The coolest thing about this place is the pierced-uttered cow hanging from the outside of the building.  Otherwise the insides only look good in the dark and once it's filled with people it doesn't look any better.  Bridge and tunnel spot for sure so be prepared.  Every once in a while you'll get a crowd of people who have wandered out to this "hot-spot" who has no clue what they've gotten themselves into.

Unless you want to revert back to your just-turned-21 days, I'd say move on to another spot... there are plenty around.
author: Kevin J.

description:
I love this place! No cover and cheap drinks. Great combo for broke college students. I've only been here on Thursdays and its pretty crowded. However, the place is bigger than I expected and i rather have the place crowded than empty. Moreover, more people crowd around the dance floor in the back and the front is semi clear. The girl/guy ratio at this place is actually reasonable too. I mean guys still out number girls 3:1 but i've seen a lot worse. 

The bad things about this place that it is extremely hard to order drinks. Everyone crowds around the bartender trying to order and you have to be aggressive to get the bartenders attention. I would order in bulk so you don't have to waste time in the crazy lines. The bathroom is also located all the way in the back where people dance do you have to push your way through just to take a leak. Finally, people LOVE to steal wallets and cellphones especially from girls. Be careful not to put your stuff on the counter when ordering and always check your pockets. One night, I had 5 friends get their cell phones stolen. Obviously there is someone there on a mission to steal your stuff. Beware. 

Overall, great place to get drunk for cheap with friends. Drinks taste good and they don't cheap you by skimping on alcohol.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Went here last weekend with a group of friends for a birthday. Cover was $20. Kind of a shock.

Bouncers cut us a deal: $10 for the guys, girls get in free. Cool.

My friend paid with a $50 and was given $10 in change. Not cool.
author: Charlie K.

description:
NO COVER & HALF PRICED DRINKS

that's the usual draw to this place. so while other guest lists close at 11 and you didn't make it in because they held up the line so you end up paying their cover of $20 or more... come here instead.

the place has a pretty good mix of the top 40 and old school. the crowd is usually chill with an older crowd that are just out to have fun. but more and more it's starting to get more popular with college students because there is no cover and the drinks are cheap.

QUICK TIP: though this place is pretty chill they are serious about the dresscode. not strict but you should dress correct at the very least.

i remember one night when i went here with my staff directly from work and had trouble getting in. there was no line and we were all good... but one of my friends had shorts on. so we got DENIED!

so we went across the street to Mercury Lounge which had a chiller dress code and had a couple of drinks there... not the type of team to accept FAILURE we schemed a planned. 

we were determined to party that night. the plan was simple the old switch-a-roo... we had our friend in shorts wait in the car and everyone else walked right in with no problems. 
once we got in, we convinced one of our friends to go to the bathroom and take off his pants and chill in the stall. thanks to unisex bathrooms we had another friend come in with her purse and stash the pants. 
she walked out of the bar/club with the pants in the purse to retrieve our waiting friend in the car. 
he put on the pants and stashed the shorts in the purse. they walked in smiling with no problems. *SCORE! they went straight to the restroom and then switched back.

WIN!

until next time

cheers!
author: Jerico P.

description:
I've been here twice and I can honestly say that it is not my cup of tea. 

There is absolutely no cover, so you can roll in at any time. There are shot specials on certain nights and drinks are relatively cheap. 

There is actually only one bar, but it loops in a circle, so that people can order drinks from both sides. the chairs side and the dancefloor.

Bathroom is a little dirty -- probably from all the cheap drinks. Hehe

Whenever I go out, I like to wear my heels since I am quite petite. But whenever I am here either  1) Step on a pile of alcohol 2) Someone spills alcohol on my shoes. As a typical girl, one of the perks of going out is getting ready, but if I am going to get drinks on my cute shoes, or get felt up by a sweaty creeper. I'd pass. 

I like to get my dance on, but I would like to dance in a nonhazardous (alcohol can get slippery) as well. I haven't been here over a over two years. I hope the next time I come I am able to re-yelp this venue with a more positive outlook.
author: Phuong V.

description:
I just remebered 3 stars means "A-OK" and that 2 stars means "Meh, I've experienced better."

I am updating my review to reflect my views accordingly.
author: Emily D.

description:
I lost my coat check ticket. That part is my fault, but when I brought it to the attention of the girl at the coat check, she practically said "F*** off." I tried to explain reasonably (I was drunk, but I definitely was not being rude) that the jacket hanging right there is mine, but she says "It ain't my fault you lost your ticket, come back tomorrow cuz I ain't dealing with this shit."

What the f*** do you mean you're not dealing with this? It's your JOB to deal with this, you're the COAT CHECK PERSON. I could understand if I was being belligerent and rude, but I was being very much nice and reasonable and she instantly adopted a condescending tone as if I was bothering her by asking her to do her job. I tried to call repeatedly the next day to see if they have my jacket, but it kept going to voice mail. Their voice mails something about "...pride our selves on having the friendlist staff..." It's like they're rubbing salt in my wounds.
author: Mat K.

description:
Hahahahahaha!!!!! If I had a penis and needed to get laid really quick, this is the first spot I would make that attempt in. And I'm betting it would be successful. Actually I'm thinking if I had like say a Mercedes keyring in my hand while there my chances of a threesome would go up exponentially... Never in my life have I seen so many fall-down drunk Korean 22 year old women in 5 inch heels; perhaps that's because I was hanging out someplace else and they were all here, so I missed them. And these gals are always being led outside at bars closing by a blond dude who basically has to carry them out. And maybe, JUST maybe, he's got a Mercedes keyring. 

For the record, the reason I know these things is because I know folks who do security there and when we go pick them up, I get to watch all of these travesties unfold while I sit in the car. Its actually kind of amazing.
author: Dolores A.

description:
Wow. This is the word that struck me when I visited the Holy Cow for a friend's birthday. The good thing about this place is that their slogan is "Always a party, never a cover." From there it's all downhill - It's like going to Tony Roma's in Japan: no local flair what so ever. 

I felt like I was at a bar in my suburban town except it was slightly bigger and in the city. The music was identical to what I had heard when I went bar hopping in my home town...even some of the clientele offered some entertainment except for the classy trannies and a few other classy people were spotted in the crowd.

In the short amount of time that we were there we noticed a girl wrap her legs around some dude where I got a show of more than I wanted that night. Some dude forcing himself on a girl who clearly wanted none of it among many other scantily clad meretricious girls. Holy Cow what a sight for sore eyes. 

Even though there is no cover, I'm not sure if I'll be back.
author: Amy J.

description:
So, remember how I basically said that this place was a huge meat market?

Well, after returning after a bit (I guess a year), I've come to find it still is. AND

It is also a huge fish market. IE, it smells HORRIBLE in here!

I mean, you can only give so many stars for free cover and a good dance song half the time. But I prefer my sausages tasty and fish not to smell like vomit and crap. IE, this place is a BIG no-no. Even if the place you went to before was way boring (eg, Mist).
author: Kate V.

description:
When AudioDiscoteque is a little bit too much and monotonous, it's fun to go to Holly cow!
There are all kids of people there, music is top40 and Joel is a very that type of bartender tha makes you feel welcomed!
author: Katie K.

description:
This was our last stop on our party bus bar crawl, & honestly, we were just happy to have a place with music & dancing! No cover, & very casual. The bar takes up the entire middle, but is 360 so you can order from either side. The dance floor is in the back of the bar & is not that huge, and has a tiny corner stage to get up on. There is a quieter corner towards the front where guys who don't dance and aren't having any fun sit or play pool. 

I would not come here if you are looking for a club, are dressed nice, or are looking to meet people, but we were all in costumes and brought the party of 30 people ourselves, so we all had fun. If you like a dive bar, but also like to dance, this is your place!
author: Kimberly A.

description:
I always have so much fun here. It has a nice open dance floor with the bar conveniently adjacent. The drinks aren't overpriced like some places like this. They have a coat check that's reasonably priced. The bartenders are really friendly. They play good music, and the best part is that it while it gets busy, it doesn't get completely packed to where you can't be comfortable, or have to wait forever to get a drink or use the bathroom. Could use a little more seating.

A fun place to drink and dance.
author: Kelsey L.

description:
Holy Cow is such a fun place.  I've gone here so many times and seen it at all its different shifts.  When the place is slow, I have an amazing time ... when the place is packed, I have an amazing time.  Yes, yes I decor is tacky, the bathrooms are disgusting, and the bartenders aren't very nice/attentive ... but whatever.

Every time I've been here the music is always the awesome, and the drinks are cheap.  Sold.

** Be advised that they won't let you in if you don't at least look decent ... so don't show up in sweats or saggy jeans, you know ... none of that crap.  ;X **
author: Pia V.

description: The one star is for the DJ! The music was good, but no one was dancing. I hadn't came to the HC in a few years and I use to have a lot of fun when I did. First off there's a cover fee now. $15 for men and $10 for women. It's Thursday, it should at least be half off! Anyways as soon as you walk in to the right there's someone taking your jackets and to the left there's someone charging, there is no sign with the cover fee's so I had no idea we had to pay, If i hadn't asked the young lady behind the counter i would have just walked in.  The venue itself looks a lot better then before. I don't know how long ago they remodeled it but when I asked the bartender she said she thought it had been at least a year. The drink's are too expensive, they use to be $5-$7 (half off) now they are about $14 a drink. What else can I say? The crowd is different, I remember everyone was always dancing and having a good time, tonight was different. The bar I use to love coming to has now turned into a club. I don't know if I will be back maybe tonight just wasn't the night!
author: Stephanie J.

description:
Sure this is a huge bridge and tunnel spot on the weekends, but if you know what you're in for before you arrive, it's possible to have a pretty OK time.

For some reason, I've only been in on Thursday night when Holy Cow has a pretty incredible deal where you can drink anything in the bar for 1/2 off. I say "for some reason" because it's never my intention to drink blue cocktails at 50% off the normal sticker price, I guess i've just been lucky enough to dip in when it's cheapskate day in SOMA.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I came here for the first time about a week ago for a birthday.  My brother loves Holy Cow and wanted us to check it out, so we did.  There was no wait outside at all which was nice, plus there is no cover charge.  When we walked in it wasn't super crowded yet so we were able to get a large booth.  We ordered the birthday boy a chocolate cake shot, a AMF, a long island, and a shot of something (not all at the same time of course), and he was shmammered so I guess the mixed drinks were strong!  The bartenders were cool and we didn't have to wait long for them to help us,  plus they had blue moon so I was happy. 

I really didn't like the music they were playing when we first got there, but it got much better as the night went on.  There was no wait for the bathroom which is a huge plus and every time we had an empty glass someone came and cleared it off of the table.

My only complaint is that there is a 25 min for drinks although i guess its not really a complaint because I understand why they do it.  Next time I come I'll try to remember to just bring cash.
author: Steph L.

description:
We went to The Holy Cow on a Thursday around 8:30 PM. We wanted to get drink before heading into Slims for a show. We decided to grab a drink here since there wasn't a cover; we had stopped at The Eagle Tavern first and they had one at the time. The place was fairly empty except for a few of the bartender's friends and the staff. However, the decor was awesome. I loved the interesting lights! We ordered 2 drinks, a whiskey sour and a Sierra Nevada on tap. The bartender was super friendly and interesting, and he made my whiskey sour with Jack, not some bottom shelf booze. Our two drinks together only cost $6!

 I definitely would come in here again. Cheap drinks and fun decor, although I have no idea what the crowd is like at peak times. This place is only open Thursday, Friday, and Saturday  nights though.
author: Rebecca G.

description:
I sat down on Friday at 9:30pm, and I was the only one in the place. Luckily, the bartender was very friendly and welcoming, and the crowd started to trickle in through 11pm. Speaking of 11pm, happy hour until 11pm?? 

There's a lot of great bars in this stretch and I've overlooked Holy Cow for way too long. A lot of the reviews here mention that it was great when they were in college, but they don't approve now. Well I wasn't anywhere near here for college, but I had a damn good time. The place is unpretentious, cheap, and has a raucous crowd. I couldn't ask for more!
author: Kevin B.

description:
Wow, after experiencing this place for one night I can safely say it really sucks.  I almost want to give it a one star review but then when I think about it... there are worse places in the city.  Plus I came in with three other girls so it wasn't all bad. Bar/Club setup that night with strange rooms with benches.  We came for a b-day party outing after their dinner and didn't know what to expect at all.  I ran into one of my HS friends outside DNA lounge and then headed here.  DNA was closed for a private event.  It's funny that they call it Holy Cow, cause I definitely remember seeing some big girls here and there.  

The music wasn't great and they had a lota ghetto hood rap, and crappy music with no beats you couldn't dance to.  People spilling their drinks all over the place and there is little space to move around....cramped and ventilation kinda sucked.  Crowd was pretty ghetto, kinda a strange area for a few SF nightclubs anyhow. Toward the end some girl got up on the bar I was standing near and then kicked a drink off the bar and spilled it on my hand/arm.  Something like this happened on the dance floor too that got on some of us.  Ghetto, never coming back here.  

2 stars cause it's probably not the worst club experience ever.  Don't come here if you like places with more class.
author: Kenny P.

description:
Everyone has said it: Thursdays = half off drinks. It's a great deal if you don't mind strange men grabbing you, women pushing you to get through the crowd, and getting your wallet stolen RIGHT out of your purse. 

Yes the latter happened to me. Someone stole my wallet and used my credit card. It was a very upsetting situation but the security at the holy cow really tried to help find the perpetrator. Unfortunately, we couldn't find the person but I appreciate their sincere apologies, which is why i give Holy Cow and extra star. The bartenders are also really cool and not stuck up like at other clubs in the area.

 Younger crowd with a handful of weirdos.. Cheap place to get drunk . I'll be honest and say this was one of my favorite places when I first turned 21, not so much anymore.
author: Ashley C.

description: It's called Holy Cow, but it looks like they've got a Red Bull hanging outside their front door. Kind of hopeless if they can't even get that right
author: Steve H.

description:
The basics: All out divey dance party, really young crowd, this dude dancing up on me had the face of an 18 year old and braces to match... smh...  I swear fake id's run amuck here, half off drink specials that apply to the top shelf on Thursdays. If you want one of those crazy nights where you dance on top of some boxes and tables - this might be your place.

But - I do have to warn you - this place can get sketch because they let anyone and everyone in here... so be safe and smart and you'll be okay!
author: Christine B.

description:
I MoOooOoo for $5 shots of GG and Holy Cow Thursdays!
