Holy Cow is a "budget friendly" prelude to a weekend of frivolously throwing down $$$$ on alkie. It IS a recession after all, so why not take advantage of HALF-OFF drinks until midnight right?!?!?

LINE: 
I've only gone to HC on Thursdays and Fridays and there usually isn't a HUGE line before 11 PM. So, you can normally get in anywhere from 1 min-15 mins. 

COVER:
Free.

DRESS CODE:
None, so why is that chicks still come in cocktail dresses with stilettos? It's HC, NOT Infusion, Sens, Ana Mandara, XYZ, etc; I just don't get it.... 

STAFF:
Friendly bouncers and bartenders, so no complaints here. 

DRINKS:
$9-10 for Top-shelf liquor and cocktails, which means about $5 drinks on Thursdays (Half-off from 9-11 PM on Fridays)! WHOO HOOO! They don't skimp either; stiff cocktails and shots in cups that resemble a double!

$25 min for CC which is pretty damn hard to make on a Thursday night. So BRING cash! There's also an ATM located to the left of the left of the entrance way.

MUSIC:
Top 40s, Hip-Hop, Old-school, Rock and some 80s Pop. The music could be better though especially with the transitions which are not smooth. 

CROWD:
Mixed YOUNG crowd with 60% being Asians. Most are 21-24 max. so, if in your late 20s like I am, don't be surprised to meet people from your HS that graduated 4+ years after you. There's about 3:1 ratio of guys to girls. Sorry boys...

Nonetheless, the crowd is pretty chill (w/ the occasional d-bags/creepers) and just out to have a good time. It GETS packed after 11:30 PM and although you get shoved, elbowed, and pushed, most people DO say "excuse me" and "sorry". 

AMBIANCE/DÉCOR:
HC is located among a sea of other bars and clubs like Paradise Lounge, MIST, Butter, WISH and Bootie, but you can't miss it as the large cow out front easily distinguishes it.

HC is a great change from the upscale venues I like to spend my weekends at; it's very low-key, divey, and dingy. As you enter, there's a main bar to the left and 3-4 booths to the right. 

Behind the main bar to the far left, there are additional booths and benches; a great place to hide from the madness and chill and "attempt" to have a convo with people.

DANCE FLOOR:
Small, packed, and is located before the entryway to the patio, which means good luck trying to squeeze your way back and forth without getting a hand/elbow/arm shoved into you or getting stomped on.

Platforms are located on the left and right side for GIRLS only (when packed). It's the best place to dance since there's fans located above and you can get away from the creepers. 

BACK PATIO/SMOKING AREA:
Larger than the size of the dance floor, it's another great place to escape from the craziness from the main bar/dance area and to get FRESH AIR. There's wooden tables, stools, and booths all around which is a major plus so you can take a breather and relax. 

RESTROOMS:
Four dingy stalls with one sink. Ummm, at least there's toilet paper available? I don't get why there's a huge naked statue of David to the right of the sink--eye candy when there's a booty crowd?

PARKING:
Street parking. Since HC is located around many other bars and clubs, try to arrive before 10 PM to snag street parking because there is no nearby garage or parking lot that close late. 

HC isn't a place I would spend my Friday or Saturday nights at, but for half-off drinks on a Thursday night, it's MoOoOo-TASTIC!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
This place isn't what it once was and you can blame the staff there. Unfortunately I had gone quite a bit before but after the last time I went and the way the doorman and his boss think they can treat people I will never go again. 

I went with my friends after the Giants game to celebrate them winning the divisional series and wanted to have a good Thursday night out. Instead when we got there one person in our group was singled out for having "baggy pants". His pants were not touching the ground and his belt line was not under his rear end in anyways. But for some reason the doorman claimed it was too low, even though I walked in no problem with the same length pants, and told my friend to talk to his boss. Now either his boss was looking for a bribe or was just being rude, but in either case we left. And that would be the last time I would ever step foot in Holy Cow. It was fun once but now it's not what it used to be and the way the "security" staff is there is no wonder why the place was only half full. 

I'm sure this won't deter people from not going to this place, but service does matter and this place doesnt have the quality of other locations in San Francisco to be as cocky as they are
author: Christopher C.

description: I heard YG was performing there on Saturday night. Me and boy did some research on this club and realized it is fucking wack. We ain't going
author: Nate W.

description:
Half off drinks on Thursdays.  Hennessy triple shots for $5?!  I used to love this place, got me drunk, played good music and all for the cheap.  Even found the love of my life here x)

But got my phone stolen out of my purse last week.  So boo you Holy Cow.
author: Kristina I.

description:
One of my old college haunts. I was a complete dumbass back then. Forgive me. 

Yes, no cover. But eww to everything else. Creepy ass dudes that can't keep their damn hands to themselves. Baby barfed just thinking about the events that occurred there. *shivers* Overpriced drinks. Gross bathrooms. Smells like feet in every crevice of this joint. 

Done and done.
author: Abigail D.

description:
I went here this past Friday around 10:30pm. 

2 words: Meat Market.. 

It was fairly crowded with a wide range of people, we didn't have an issue getting to the bar and lucked out on grabbing a booth for the small group of us which was nice to have as the evening went on.

The music was really great, a good mix of new and old, great beats, which are my favorite part and a bit of Latin Flair, which was wonderful.

The dance floor was jammed with people, mostly 21 year old girls drunk off there butts spilling out of their shoes (and skirts/ dresses.. and NOT in a good way) and unable to dance (or maybe they just lacked rhythm) fun to watch, and by fun I mean comical.. 

Their was a $25.00 minimum on the tab which we were NOT told about when we opened the tab up. We had only spent $10 at the time and had 0 cash on us. We ended up just having to buy a round so we could close out and head home, this was upsetting and frustrating. Not to mention it took forever for the bar tender to get back to us, even though it wasn't THAT busy.

They have a coat check. 
They also have a pool table.
They have an outside smoking/ chill area.

I would go again for the sake of my friends, but otherwise, I'm not interested if I get to choose the location.

Star 1 - Music/ Dance Floor
Star 2 - Decent drinks
- Star 3 - Not being informed of tab limit.
- Star 4 - Bath rooms
- Star 5 - Over all experience was eh.
author: Meghan L.

description:
I know, I know. Four stars is probably generous for Holy Cow but hey, all the times I've been here, I've had a blast.

PARKING: fairly easy. Never had trouble looking for parking around the area. If you choose to park at the garage nearby, just a heads up that they close at 2am so no hanging around with the guy/chick you just met. Best to call them the morning after. Lol

COVER: Free! Need I say more?

DRESS CODE: I feel like there is none. I've seen people with various styles of clothing. Although if you're wearing a hat, bouncer's will probably make you take it off.

CROWD: Mixed, diverse. I do see some regulars here, considering that I go here quite a lot, usually on Fridays or Saturdays. You get the slutty girls to business-attire Asian guys to booty-shaking big girls. Love it :)

DRINKS: Fairly priced. I believe they have half off drinks till certain times on certain days. Thursday till midnight, I think.

MUSIC: Mix of house, trance, Top 40, and hiphop. Depending on the DJ. Totally danceable though.

ETC: Smoking area in the back patio is where I believe most of the socializing goes on. You see smokers and non-smokers alike dying for a smoke break or getting a breath of fresh air while chatting it up with other people. It's a cool atmosphere out there.

Bathrooms are easy access! I don't know if the bathrooms near the exit towards the smoking area are meant to be unisex but I've used both sides. Oops. There are also bathrooms behind the DJ booth. Tons of stalls for you ladies! Almost no lines at all!

Btw, they also have a pool table near the entrance. That's always a fun way to meet random people and play pool with them. Provided you don't smack the ball across the table and onto the floor (like I do).

Ladies -- just watch out for creepy dudes. I've had quite the experience with a few but I don't let that put a damper on having a great time :)

Totally coming back. Again and again.
author: Michelle B.

description:
fat chick busting out of her dress: holy cow.
couple fu**ing on the dance floor: holy cow.
man taking a piss in the corner: holy cow.
oh, you dont take credit cards: holy cow.

this place is flithy and disgusting. i sound like a 50 year old woman, but that's how i feel when i walk into this place. being 21, there are much better places to go to than holy cow. it's stuffy and musty and smells like wet dog. the first time i went here, a man looked me up and down and asked me to dance. i refused and he said "what, you don't like a colored man" nuff said, never coming back.
author: Andy H.

description:
i signed up for yelp to give this place 1 star...and i would have given it less if that was possible. i was not allowed in for having a hat, not having it on, just having a hat in my pocket. when i tried to put it in a friends purse i i was still not allowed in and basically told i had to throw it away before i was allowed in. half an hour and much arguing later i was told i could come in, but i had to coat check my hat for $3. 

fuck this place and the piece of shit bouncers and manager who seemed to be enjoying not letting me in! i could maybe understand the no hat policy (i will never understand treating a customer like that) if the place was nice inside, but it was a shit hole. filthy bathrooms, bad music, drunk douchebags, and the same dick bouncers from outside paroling the inside pushing people out of their way for no reason.

avoid this place at all costs! if you're looking for a good time in the neighborhood go around the corner to butter.
author: Matthew R.

description:
Half-off Thursdays are amazing. The guys there are always creepin' except for this one gentleman that I met from Portland. This place can be a little sketched, because someone dug into my clutch and stole my phone... Therefore, I lost Mr. Portland's number. The music they play are mostly the top 40's... There isn't really a dance floor, because this place gets packed by 11:30 pm...

Anyways, Mr. Portland... if you read this, please holler back. hahaha :)
author: Candy C.

description:
Only started coming here recently. 

It's always crowded on a Thursday maybe because of the drink specials?

The only con I have for this place, besides it being on the dirtier/grungier side is the super packed dance floor, the long lines, and it's always like a high school reunion here. Unless that's something you like, then this is the place for you.

Definitely I love it here. Music selection is pretty cool. I just wish it wasn't as crowded all the time. The wait line to the bathroom, to the bar, to get in, to the smoking area, is just pretty ridiculous.
author: Josie W.

description:
My first and likely last visit to The Holy Cow left me feeling a bit violated.

I was impressed by the size of the place and cool LED bottle light fixtures, and the outside smoking section in the back is cool. Unfortunately it's awkwardly laid out inside with random walls killing serious dance space potential. The drink I sipped on was supes weak, so even at half price (Thursday) didn't feel worth it. The crowd is pretty trashy, with a healthy dose of creeptastic older guys that sort of stand there and watch. Crowded in a bad way. PDA lining the walls and in every corner.

If you're into getting groped, eye-fucked, tipsy at best and witnessing ugly babies in the making, Holy Cow is your spot!
author: Sandra S.

description:
This is one of the most poppin spots in the city on Thursday nights.  Half-off drinks before 12, and even after that the drinks are pretty cheap. I like the music: seems like hip hop more towards the beginning then transitions into Top 40/popular house songs.  Crowd is on the younger side, probably correlates to the cheap drinks.  Seemed like a lot more men than women but thats pretty common in SF I guess.

 Last time I was there they let waaay too many people in. The main dance floor was nearly impossible to walk through.  There is another bar in the back near the bathrooms that isn't utilized as well as a smaller hall with a couple tables but really EVERYONE was on the dance floor.  And with a crowded room, watch your purse! A friend of mine had her wallet stolen one night.

Parking isn't too hard to find, might have to walk a block or two. Staff at the Holy Cow do their job at a minimum, nothing notably special about them. In fact the girl at coat check is a bit rude.

All in all, its a fun place for dancing and cheap drinks.  If you're from the city you're nearly guaranteed to run into someone you know or once knew (can be good or bad).
author: Siobhan T.

description:
So one moment I'm in the Castro, and the next minute my newly made friends have convinced me to go to Holy Cow. I guess the Sunday night Beatbox event, is once or twice a month (im not sure). But I step into this place, and I'm not sure if its gay, straight, gender questioning, whatever, but it is jumping! The DJ is mixing the most euphoric sounds of tribal house music ever heard upon my ears. Nonstop hard hitting beats! Where has this DJ been hiding!?!?  People are dancing, sweaty;but the vibes are positive and you can tell that this is really the spot to be. I danced my @$$ off for nearly three hours, and made tons of new dancing buddies.
 
I can't tell you about the drinks, but it looks like the people I was surrounded around were buzzed when they arrived (me included). So... No overpriced watered down cocktail for me. 

The smoking deck was... Well smoky. I steered clear.

The bathrooms were... club standard, so not that great. 

Overall I would DEFINITELY come back to party it up here again.

Hang on to your coat check tix, and don't act like a drunken or high hot mess, and I think you'll have a good time here. 


The only bad thing is that getting a taxi after the club closes can be a pain.....
author: James C.

description:
Cheap drinks, pretty ladies, no cover. What else can you ask for. What I love about this place is that almost everyone comes here to have fun. People are here are a bit intense at times. I come here on Thursdays and the drinks are always half off until twelve. It makes me feel like a big baller when I come here since I would be buying my friends drinks. 

The place is a bit " ghetto " but places like these make our cities unique. This club could be really packed which leads to sweaty people, but its fun. I love the environment of this place, and the half off drinks.
author: Benjamin C.

description:
holy cow is often hit or miss. I most often hit up this place on thursdays. Get there early, and it'll be worth it. Half Price drinks before midnight!! can't beat that!! the line gets ridiculous, so if you plan on getting there late, bring girls with you, or have a vagina and boobs, or get ready to pay off the bouncers. 

The music is cool. They play a wiiiide range, and i mean wide range. They don't play too much hard/hyphy hip hop stuff. and almost always they'll throw in journey, bon jovi, pitbull, lil jon and all that other crazy shit. Hot totty bartenders are a plus.
author: Alvin P.

description:
This place deserves negative stars. I GOT MY IPHONE4 STOLEN RIGHT OUT OF MY ZIPPED PURSE THIS WEEK. 

This place is digusting filled with grimy pickpockterers who's only goal is to steal from patrons. If you read the reviews below me, it seems like everyone who attended in July and August had multiple times taken right out of their zipped purses. 

Also, although some security guards were helpful, I am sure some of them know these pickpockters as well because how can so many people robbed if they employ so many security guards?  

My other experience here is when a girl told me that she found my wallet and turned it into the coatcheck but the worker at the coatcheck station told me they didn't have it when I SAW IT BEHIND HIM. It wasn't until a nice man next to me started to get mad at the worker is when he actually gave it back!! 

My friend's older brother ordered a drink at the bar once and two men came up behind him and put pills inside of his drink--right in front of him! He quickly handed the drink back to the bartender and left Holy Cow. 

The bartenders are rude and asked us if we know what tip is. Yes, but because you are not attractive and was incredibly rude, we decided not to tip. Duh. 

Thankfully, my new replacement iPhone4 is paid by my credit card company but I am still very angry that this kind of thing will still happen to many other people.

So if you want to get your stuff stolen, be my guest and go to Holy Cow. If not, I would avoid this place like the plague.
author: Vikki K.

description:
I GOT MY WALLET STOLEN OUT OF MY BAG HERE LAST NIGHT. and by the end of the night, there were multiple other people all looking for stolen items as well.  even the manager admitted someone's been working this place!!!!!! 

DO NOT COME HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

plus it's soooooooooooo ghetto.  and the people that come here are hella ghetto.....last night was my first and LAST time.  and plus, unisex bathrooms? COME ON!
author: Liz W.

description:
HOLY COW! Celebrated my best friend's birthday here with a few girlfriends on a Friday night and had a fantastic time! I was expecting Holy Cow to be divey in an awful way after reading all the Yelp reviews, but was surprised when it wasn't as gross as everyone made it seem... Or perhaps we just didn't notice after several rounds of drinks, ha.

Drinks were half off until 11pm so we started the night off with shots that tasted like birthday cake, extremely appropriate and very delicious. Kamikazes, Tokyo Teas, a Four Horseman, and a few more drinks later... and we were quite happy and grooving on the dancefloor. Mainly Top 40, which I like. A few MORE drinks later from friendly strangers and the birthday girl was ready to go home. Birthday success!

Tips: 
-no cover
-watch your stuff (theft is a problem here)
-$25 credit card minimum so bring cash or split rounds
-cab or have a buddy drop you off/pick you up since it's not the best neighborhood
-WISH, Butter, Bootie, etc are all within a 2 block radius or so if you want a change of scenery (we had some strong free jello shots at Butter before moseying on over to Holy Cow)
author: Michelle C.

description:
Hehe, I love the caption for the one-star rating... "Eek! Methinks not."

That is actually what you will be saying if you are a lady here on a Thursday night. I mean, if you REALLY wanna get hit on, then yeah, go for it. Otherwise... -__-

It's always sweaty and gross in here. Guy to girl ratio is about 8-1 so they let in as many women as they possibly can, holding all the guys outside in line. They may be going after that whole Vegas concept of letting ladies in... doesn't quite work for you, Holy Cow. 

I made the same mistake twice of going back here. Never again. *quiver*
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Thirsty Thursdays and nothing more.

Most of the time, this place is a creeper bar. But on RARE OCCASIONS, the stars are aligned and Holy Cow is near (if I dare say) the perfect dive bar that I needed. Sometimes, the crowds are younger, less creepy. The music is pumping. Bar tenders are actually doing their jobs.

Can't complain though. No cover, big dance floor for a bar, dancing stage, cheap drinks, big crowd.
author: Azn B.

description:
$6 AMFs on half off thursdays? HELL YES.

I had a great time. The reviews had me scared but all I did was dance, dance, dance :)
author: Lauren L.

description:
Tonight because I turned down a guy for a dance,  I got pushed HARD against the wall, slapped in my face and then he  spilled a drink on me. THEN security kicked me out as they laughed with the guy that did this. Security did say that they were going to kick him out but I could tell that was hardly the case.

OK I get it wasn't like a soccer punch or a malicious hit but why have security when they don't protect?

I've never been so hurt/sad for the safety of me and my girl friends/other women in the city and I've heard a general " I don't go there because the guys are horrible," word-of-mouth from other woman in the area too.
author: Krista N.

description:
This place has become so much fun! 

Boy, what a turn around!

There's always great decorations, cheap drinks, hot bartenders & good music!

I was there for the pink party after Folsom st. Fair... AMAZING. Great music out on the patio, cool crowd.. Not too young... More like 25-35, which is just perfect in my opinion. 

The Holy Cow has come a long way... :)
author: Samantha R.

description:
*This review isn't for the actual bar, because my group wasn't able to get in because of Holy Cow's dress code. From a quick scan of the Yelp reviews, it looks like a bunch of Yelpers have had the same issue.* 

The rundown: I live in SF and Holy Cow is definitely not my type of bar, but a big group of friends were in town from Santa Cruz for the Giants game (we won! Go Giants!). Someone in the group suggested the Holy Cow after the game so we all piled into cabs and headed over, all of us decked out head to toe in Giants gear. 

One group got there first and was already inside by the time my group arrived. The five of us headed toward the door and the bouncer said, "Nope, no sports gear. There's a dress code." We stare at each other, all probably calculating how naked we'd each have to get to be able to get in, and realized it just wasn't doable unless most people wanted to go shirtless, girls included. One of the drunker friends from our group started sassing the bouncers a little bit -- "come on guys, its the GIIIIAAAAAANTS. WORLD SERIES CHAMPIONS. Do it for Timmy" -- but the bouncers weren't having it and started getting more aggressively rude. There was no discussion about whether we could turn the shirts inside out or anything like that... just a repeated statement that we couldn't come in. It was very clear that they didn't really care to have us in their club.

We asked about our friends who were already inside, who were also definitely decked out in Giants gear, and the bouncer just said "No, no they're not. If they're wearing Giants gear they're NOT IN MY CLUB." We then proceed to call said friends, who come out of the club.... all wearing Giants gear. 

I have no problem with dress codes, if they are clear and consistently enforced. There was a sign on the door that said "DRESS CODE STRICTLY ENFORCED" but didn't specify what the dress code was, and obviously it wasn't strictly enforced. Nothing kills the mood faster than a bouncer on a power trip. Ugh.
author: Lauren K.

description:
The name of the club speaks for itself....HOLY COW! Where the hell did I end up?!

I used to love partying here when it was crackin' on Thursdays and Fridays. I have no idea what had happened over the last few years. I guess the club scene around SoMa has changed drastically? 

If you don't want to pay for cover and looking for a cheap place to get your groove on with Top 40s, mix crowd (ugly or slightly attractive), and cheap priced drinks...you've gone to the right place!

Security guards aren't rude and you'll easily get in with no hassle. Decor? Let me put this in a nice way, it's a cross between a rundown bar with a slight look of an old western saloon. Yeah it looks that pathetic. Smoking section....you're better off inside. Not worth getting bottle service here if you plan to celebrate someone's birthday. Ambiance? Definitely not inviting but it's worth your pocket change if you're only looking to get drunk and dance the night away. Trust me, I'd know. I party enough to realize this isn't your perfect place to get doll'd or suited up to a club. Walk in with no dress code enforced!! That's bonus points for me. 

Why does it smell? I guess if you're wondering what that stench is the minute you walk in....drunk people who can't hold their alcohol and yack everywhere!! I don't even want to get into details about the restrooms....gross! 

If you plan to buy drinks, make sure to either carry cash or spend $25 due to their minimum tab. Really? $25 minimum?!! Otherwise, they make a mean hurricane drink to get you messed up by the end of the night! Happy hour is certainly worth the buck, for frugal people!

Why two stars? NO COVER and NO DRESS CODE.
author: Fraulein C.

description: I would give this place 0 stars if I could.
author: Dipesh G.

description:
I went on a Thursday w. my Gfs, & boy was this place packeddd!

Like others have mentioned, Thursdays is basically Asian night. & the boy to girl ratio is soo ridiculous, like 8:1, haha. Seriously! I mean, being a girl, I like that. But this was just overwhelming. Everywhere I danced, I was encircled by dudes, like 6 of em! The guys were really aggressive that night too. & I basically got manhandled for not wanting to dance w. someone. Thankfully my Gfs saved me, haha. But on the real, it was straight creeper status!

The music was cool, they played top 40 & hip`hop/rap. But what I was dancing on, Idek if it should even be called a dancefloor, was soo damn tiny & superrr crowded! I personally like some space to bust a move, ;)

& oh yeah, I got seperated from my Gfs for a bit. & walking about the club looking for em was such a dreadful journey! Hahah. Oh mannn, if only you could imagine. Tiny oh me, a bit gone, walking through the crowd, dudes` hands everywhere. Ehhhh. Not cool.

& they kick out drunkies, haha. & just to emphasize how many dudes there really are; when we left the club early, there was a good line w. alllll dudes. My goodness. All I can say is, what a dick fest.
author: Jenny P.

description: The well they use is extremely cheap ($5 for a handle on amazon). The DJs are also extremely rude. When I requested a song they then flipped me off and ignored me. If I had not gotten in for free, I would have requested my money back. #rudeDJ
author: Zoe G.

description:
I would love this place if it wasn't for the creepers.....you know which ones I'm talking about. 

My cousin and his friends call it the "Gazelle/PredatorTactic". Let me illustrate it. The "predator", aka creeper, will not pounce on the gazelle when she's surrounded by her gal pals. Why? Because he knows he doesn't have a chance against those numbers. So he tries to separate the gazelle from the pack by asking to buy her a drink or to dance, etc. By breaking the gazelle away from her gal pals, predator tries to plan his pounce tactic. 

Poor predator, even away from the gal pals, the gazelle doesn't fall for it. 

Sigh....aside from the Animal Planet scenarios all over the place, Holy Cow has a funky, eccentric decor---AND cheap drinks!!! Again, not a destination bar...but if you're in the neighborhood, worth popping in for a drink. :)
author: Nam N.

description:
I had a blast at holy cow!!

plus FREE COVER!! great for all you virgin drinkers & broke ass college students :)
author: Fat C.

description:
2 and a half star only? Really?? I read a lot of reviews and found complaints on 

1. My friends got headlocked by bouncers (3 reviews)
2. Urine smell outside (20+ reviews) 
3. Crowd being too young (20+ reviews) 
4. Minimum tab 25 (40+ reviews)
5. Pool table complaints (10+ reviews)
6. Bouncers/establishment racist (10+ reviews) 

Answers
1. Headlocking sounds like a personal issue? ahahaha I feel for you guys though....really...get a lawyer? 
2. Seriously there's bums all over the place you don't expect any urine around? Seriously people! 
3. Yeah...some of them did look young....
4. Seriously the drinks are freakin cheap start a tab or bring cash
5. Did you really come here to play pool? Are you sure you're not drunk? 
6. This place has a a really diverse crowd....over 70% of the crowd is from a minority group.....

I'm shocked a place with so many issues still in business....I've had nothing but good times here...still love it!
author: Sam T.

description:
This review list is like people asking me for crops for their farms on Facebook. I not only delete that app, but I also block the people. And the people's people. I go Kaizer Sozay on them.

In the wonderful mix of eclectic, inventive and beautiful city that is San Francisco, one wonders how certain businesses not only exist, but also how they continue to operate and survive. 

Holy Cow is one of those places. And the answer is, the locals don't go to these places. And that is exactly what and who you will find in here. A mildly to ragingly bridge and tunnel crowd that is here to party and get hammered. Not that there is anything wrong with that, but the 2 times I have been there, I have had to stop myself from shaking my head and enjoy my overpriced drink.

The first photo for this biz on yelp says it all. Overweight shiny girl with skirt hiked up to show her panties dancing on a bar. A loud and obnoxious bar with girls you don't want to bring home to mom.

Lacking in class, individuality and taste, this place attracts the meat head club jocks and mini skirted group gossiping shiny drama queens. Avoid it all costs, and go to Wish next door instead for a classier ambiance.
author: Anish B.

description:
Still a solid 4-star club. I went this past thursday and it was much more crowded than last time but the music, bouncers, bartenders were all great. It was stuffy and humid inside but bouncers opened up the 2nd door to ventilate it more where that front area pool table is at. 

The bartender this time was a hott brunette who made some decent vodka tonics and washington apples.
Always a fun chill time here and its always free to get in.
author: Andrew Z.

description: A lot of women became single mothers 9 months after a night at holy cow. A lot of men... Sausages on the hunt. Go here if you're desperate or if you like the attention.
author: Mark R.

description:
Admittedly, I was not sober when it was suggested we try this place. I was with two gay guys and I guess they wanted to go because it was House music night or something. They enjoyed themselves but I was not impressed and was actually a little frightened.

We got on the dance floor and, I'm not sure whether this was "real/good House music" or not, but it was lyricless, almost beat-less yet somehow repetitive noise. It sounded like the bridge of a good techno song on repeat. There were lots of couples grinding against each other with looks of ecstasy on their faces. And I do mean Ecstasy. I started to feel uncomfortable as I looked around the dance floor and it seemed like everyone was high out of their minds.

My friend tried to get me a drink since he thought I was just being uptight. It was very hard to hear the bartender and she rushed through helping us even though the bar didn't seem that busy (after we payed she went back to chatting with the same guys she was talking to before we flagged her over).
I finished the drink quickly and begged my friends to leave with me. I felt gross and a little violated for having been there.
author: Ashley W.

description:
Hmmmm, last time I was here I was 20. 

That prob says something. 

I was dancing on the bar.

I fell off the bar. Kinda.

I didn't get kicked out.

I don't think.

I was wasted.

Maybe from here.

Most likely not.

Blurry fun.
author: Shira O.

description:
I am creating a more detailed review as a response to an EMPLOYEE messaging me.  

What is a bar without the patrons? The patrons have a lot to do with the overall experience of a bar/club (hence why people look for this in reviews) and here it created a bad experience.  Someone else referred to it as a bad frat party and I would say it was muchhh worse.  

Furthermore the music, the drinks, and the most importantly the bartenders were LAME.  After waiting for 10 minutes for a bartender to help her (totally understandable in a busy bar), a bartender took almost 20 minutes to give my friend back her credit card and then copped an attitude with her like it was so much work to close her out.  HELLO she's not asking you to change her diaper, just to do your job.

So although the one star MAY be harsh, it is well deserved.  Plus, I do what I want so BYE.
author: Josie A.

description:
Yes my main concern is that I want to celebrate my birthday next week at the Holy Cow but they are remodeling, I have tried to call them but no answer. Nobody knows when they will be open? 
and as well, does anybody can recommend a place similar to Holy Cow in the City?
author: Bladimir O.

description:
The only reason why I had even an ounce of fun was because of the people I went with.  Other than that, this place is the worst.  I'm pretty chill when it comes bars/clubs (usually good music and company is all I need) but this place sucks.

The bartenders were total douchebags who were so full of it, they totally think they're better than everyone there.  They should try to understand that people come here to drink and have fun, NOT be lectured at like a child because they can't hear what we're saying to them over the music.  HOMIE YOU WORK IN A BAR it's going to be loud.

Also, this place's dresscode is so inconsistent and I'm pretty sure they target people based on what they look like.  My friends and I didn't have any trouble getting in, but this sober black guy wearing a nice button-down shirt, black pants and shoes couldn't get in.  

This place makes me so angry.  Come on Holy Cow.
author: Aurey L.

description:
GROSS.
I went there on Friday thinking it might be as fun as it was a few years ago and I was surprised  to see how the place has degenerated. We were in and out within three minutes. 

I wonder if it was always this trashy or if my standards were really that low in the recent years.
author: Karla g.

description:
Me and my friends seem to only come for the open bar from 9-10pm every first Friday of the month or for the half off drinks from 9-11pm all other Fridays. I believe this only applies to well drinks...shots or simple mixed drinks. It's an awesome deal but be prepared to get intoxicated early in the evening from cheap alcohol! We have had a few fuzzy nights here and many empty glasses.(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/F877QW8fR8CKIdPBWKyzLg?select=kMckVsM6KkCjen0gC_NVdg)

I would consider it a fairly huge bar with more than enough room for dancing and an outdoor patio area for the smokers. I haven't had any problems with the bartenders here either except it could be difficult to grab their attention when it gets busy. Their drinks are pretty strong so pace yourselves! I like that their bathroom stalls aren't too cramped either with standing room inside. 

The DJ isn't bad at all and I even have a picture with him...I will post that later. No cover and typically no line either if you get there early...woo hoo!

* Jenny L. and I with the DJ! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/F877QW8fR8CKIdPBWKyzLg?select=JBrlxLorgGC7W4dQZ7CTRw)
author: Karen Y.

description:
Holy Cow was my very first 21 and up! I LOVE their happy hour! Every Thursday is when it gets the most crowded and drinks before 12 are probably the best deal yet. Drinks range $2-3 Beers, $5 shots, and $6 mixed drinks. & Boy, they are strong. I was introduced to one of my favorite drinks here it taste like sweet soda but it's a creeper... called a Panty Dropper (Vodka, Peach Snapps, Cranberry Juice) SO GOOD try it! 

The crowd is mostly Asian. Sometimes/ most of the time it's a sausage fest (all dudes) No COVER! The venue isn't large nor too tiny. They have a big smoking patio outside where you can go and socialize, talk with your friends, get away from the crowd and the loud music! Speaking of music, it's not the best. Too many mainstream songs they play every thursday. Its cool when im drunk because me and my crazy gfs just karaoke the lyrics from beginning to end. But im pretty sick of hearing the same radio music crap. 

The reason i really like Holy Cow and you could never go wrong with it basically is because there is no need for pregaming, drinks are strong and cheap, theres no cover, it was always gets poppin later in the night, and its somewhere you can take a huge group of friends to have a good time AND a few friends and still have a freakin blast.
author: Rosenel A.

description: This place was awesome! Went with a few of my girlfriends and had a great time. The vip lounge is elevated so you're not bombarded with the crowd on the dance floor, and would love to have a birthday celebration here. The drinks were reasonably priced and the servers were nice and efficient. The layout is great and the music was so good. Couldn't keep myself off the dance floor. As long as they keep having that same dj, I will be back often!!
author: Esther C.

description:
oh holy cow...what happened?! I haven't visited in a year but went the weekend b4 last for my friends bday, and it totally changed.  Part of the reason I liked the holy cow was for the mash up and variety of music! If I wanted to listen to straight 94.9 or 99.7 music Id go somewhere else.

The dj sucks,or the one that was there on Saturday did. "Come on over" by Christina A?really bro? lol i'm sad its not the same anymore waaah. 

And the ol coyote ugly thing with wasted broads on the bar dancing? SMH hot MESS....

The bartenders are coo still but if you get stuck with the female bartenders you might be waiting a long time. Felt like I needed a D*ck in order to get a drink. The lil asian one got to me eventually and was very helpful,(thanks girl!) I understand it was beyond packed at the bar.. not the one on the other side(lil brunette) she was busy flirting with her coworker.And would acknowledge only guys. .
They have a picture guy now, which I guess is cool.

This place is attracting racketness also....Sucha shame. I really loved this place ..Oh well.NEXT
author: Gloria C.

description:
As much as I want to give this place 2 stars, I just can't cause I'd be lying if I didn't give this place 4 stars. Seriously, as weak as this place is, it really isn't. haha

So first off NO COVER! How can I not love that? But the downfall of that is you get what you pay off. I pay nothing and therefore I get a bunch of uglies up in this mugg. Alright Alright, so it isn't always about being surrounded by a bunch of hot people or "potentials." Alright I'm lying it's atleast worth 50% the other half is coming here with good people and just chill and have a good time. And I always got that covered, I always have a good time here with my friends. And what adds to the fun is using the money I saved on cover on drinks instead. Yeeeeaaah!

Anyways this place plays pretty good music, and it's usually a good spot to hit up on a Thursday night. I've been here way too many times and I'm ashamed. Okay not that many times, I can count on atleast two hands how many times I've hit this place up. However I haven't been here as many times as that one 40 year old african american who wears a du-rag and dances on the tables and harrasses drunk little ladies to come up and dance with him. Yeeaahhh you know who I'm talkin' about and don't deny it! But I've been here enough and people watched enough to know that there happens to be a guy like that, that is exists. So just so you know YOU'VE BEEN WARNED!!

Oh Holy Cow, my go to spot when I'm bored. I hate you, but I like you. You've made some interesting nights. I'll see you next week. haha Just kidding! Or am I? *dun dun dun*
author: Mellani L.

description:
I guess it really depends on what you are looking for in your night out on how you will feel about this place.

If you are a single guy with flexible standards, there were 3 bachlorette parties here when we were and all of the "friends" looked like they were having just as much fun as the bride to be. 
If you are on a budget, there is no cover and the beers are typical 5 bucks. 
If you want to dance and like hip hop then you can get both of those here.

The things that kept me from rating this bar higher:
All of my beer glasses were sticky...ew
The service at the bar was painfully slow
When I told the bar tender that a girls shoe (one of the drunk girls dancing on the bar) had fallen into the beer cooler she was a b*&^h about it. ?!? wait what ?!?!?
Girls were allowed to dance on the bar even if they weren't wearing underwear and you could see their hooha. Feet on a bar is also gross.
Not sure there was any type of dress code enforced here which could have helped weed out some of the other reasons I wont be going back. 

So like I said, single guy wanting to get laid: this place is for you, group of peeps looking for a good place to drink and dance keep walking.
author: Tuesday C.

description:
I've been here a few times on Thursday night and it's definitely more of a male-dominated 19 to 24-year-old crowd. I would have to say that San Francisco in general is not known for its attractive women, but the girls at Holy Cow were definitely on the lower side of the scale. At one point a reasonably attractive, but by no means super hot, girl walked in and the guy-infested dance floor parted for her like the Red Sea...it was quite amusing.

Even though my review isn't glowing, I would say go check it out yourself as it's a staple of the SF Thursday night pre-college and college crowd. Make your own opinion, but I am confident that you will find my review to hold true.
author: Andrew M.

description:
The Holy Cow is the place to go if you are a girl that enjoys being harassed and openly gawked at by men in button up shirts while:

- ordering shots of Jameson (what!?! You drink WHISKEY!?) 
- not drinking light beer (so, are you lesbians?) 
- displaying your tattoos, not your boobs (can I touch your arm pictures?) 

Sometimes my girls and I are those girls.
author: Elyse M.

description: Horrible!!! I would take away stars if I could. This placed ruined my night. If you want my opinion there it is, if you want the story continue reading. I went there with my fiance' , our first night out since she moved here. Some girls were giving her dirty looks and making her feel uncomfortable. I told the security there that I thought they were trying to start something. He ignored me and told me to sit down. That's when it happened, they came over and started shouting and pushing and we got thrown out. The girls that started the whole thing were still inside. The securty guard that I told the situation to was the one who threw me out. I asked for the owner he told me he was the owner. The worst part about the whole thing is that we just got our drinks, so we weren't able to drink our drinks.
author: Reggie S.

description:
207 reviews and only 2 stars? Are you sure you want to go to this place? You've been here before and it wasn't awful? Okay then.

Let me start the the very beginning.  This place is like grand central station on crack in a mosh pit. If you don't smell of alcohol and you havent been touched six ways to sunday you haven't actually been inside the door. 

You get spilled on, pushed and men will grab you and start grinding until you push them off. Then they have the gall to smack you when you're outside waiting for your ride.

The patio and seating in this place are it's only redeeming characteristics. There's tons of seating.

The bathrooms are disgusting. There's only three. One has no lock and the other has no toliet seat. OMG ick.

I will never EVER come here again. NO NO NO.
author: Meg T.

description:
ATMOSPHERE:
This is a very divey bar like no dress code divey. It's dark to the point you can barely see anything and very crowded. I seriously sweat in here and it takes a lot for me to sweat. It's probably due to the musty/wet air. They do have an outside area for you to smoke and get some fresh air which is a nice. Also seating and a pool table if you want to just chill.

CROWD:
This place reminds me of college probably because it's swarming with college students during holiday breaks. Also their drinks are CHEAP! i think thursday it's 1/2 off drinks? 

The crowd is mixed, but if I had to give it a label I would say a bit "ghetto"

LOW DOWN:
This place has no cover, but they do have a maximum capacity so it sucks if this place gets crowded. You'll be stuck outside for awhile until someone leaves or if you have a high girl to boy ratio (that's not even guaranteed for you to get in).

It's a place where you can just hop on over if your other plans fall through and just want some place to go and party.
author: Dorris W.

description:
Started there as a Bouncer...moved to Wednesday Night DJ. Really miss the place. So much fun and memories there.
We had a great Security Staff back then. Miss all ya'll when we used to throw out all the trouble makers.
Wasn't the cleanest place...but you went there for friends and fun!...You usually left with fun memories!

I always recommend this Club to City goers.
author: Anthony M.

description:
I've been to The Holy Cow a couple times & had a good time with my friends. A good place to go for the night or after the club if there's time for it.  

NO COVER = MAJOR PLUS! :)  I love a place with no cover.

Drinks are decently priced. Half-off on Thursdays. They do their job, haha. 

Small dance floor, so it gets super crowded. Actually, the place gets pretty packed the later it is. But I guess that's the fun of it. Sometimes there's so creeper guys, so beware!

Small location & not the cleanest, but it works. There's a pool table here, but I've never actually used it, haha. Oh, you gotta love the huge cow at the entrance ;P 

Street parking around.
author: Jessica A.

description:
Don't know why I haven't reviewed this spot yet, but this review is for Thursdays only.  I've never been here on any other night, although I've probably been here easily over 50 times probably closer to 70, in the past 2 years (sad, I know.)

The good:
This place used to be my favorite place to go when I turned 21.  There's no cover.  Drinks are half off until 12am.  5 shots of the Heem for $20?? oh word? i'll take 5 more.  The lady bartenders all have their tatas hanging out.  The cow have upgraded their decor throughout the years.   There's a dance floor, and they play pretty good music.  And drinks are half off until 12am.

The bad:
This place is hit or miss.  Back when I was freshly 21, it was always a poppin night, and when I mean poppin, I mean I can't remember if it was actually fun or not.  Now, that I'm 23 it's just not the same.  Some nights it's crowded and there's plenty of girls, some nights it's crowded but it's a sausage fest, and some nights no one even shows up.  And when it is crowded it's like a can of sardines.

The ugly:
You're bound to have something stolen from you.  Luckily, I've never had anything taken from my pockets, but that's probably because I wear tight jeans and I can feel any movement in my pockets.  That being said, I know a ton of people who have had their wallets and phones jacked from them.  


Shout out to the back bartender Rudy!
author: Anthony N.

description:
This update is really about the crowd which management really can't control.

However...watch your belongings at this place. I got my wallet and my friends Iphone4 pick pocketed from me.  That was a few months ago, but last week my friend got her phone and ipod touch stolen out of her purse, which pushed me to write this review update.  

There are people who come to this place for the sole purpose of jacking your shit.  Half off drinks = a lot of drunk people who get careless, less aware of their surroundings, and the crowd here will take advantage of that. 

Do not bring in your phone, only bring necessities such as ID and cash, and put that in yours or your friends front pocket.  

It's unfortunate that this place has become a hot spot for kleptomaniacs, I know way too many people that have got stuff stolen here, myself included.  So with that said, The Cow is definitely a fun place, but my friends simply won't be coming here as often because of that fact. It's tough to regulate, but i suggest How Cow step up their security, better monitor people coming in, maybe implement a small cover charge to weed out people going their on a mission?

 I really have no idea...but it's just getting to the point where it's not worth it anymore; especially when you have to drive the girl back home who won't be quite because she just got her phone and ipod touch stolen. (jk Jo).

PLEASE *BEWARE*
author: Randy N.

description:
"If a bar and a club had a baby, it would be Holy Cow"

My first night at Holy Cow and I had a damn good time. Half off drinks before midnight so get there early to get your drink on! $25 minimum for cards at the bar so if you're not trying to buy a shit ton of alcohol bring cash. Dance floor is pretty chill. Mostly just the area around the bar and a little corner. Be careful for the creepers who feel the need to creep up on you. Crowd is usually pretty chill. Outdoor area to smoke/get some air. Bathrooms were a little sketch but when you're that drunk a toilet is a toilet.
author: M C.

description:
I was TOO drunk to be here.

First off, they lost the only good part of the bar, which was the swing on the patio.

Other than that... sucky service, sucky management, and sucky crowd. I can't believe I got talked in to going back here.
author: Brie P.

description:
The Holy Cow has been submitted to the Yelp Obituaries.

The Holy Cow has been reported dead for the past few years, but has a functioning cadaver like the one from the movie Weekend at Bernie's. The reported cause of death was years of bad management and employing too many rude meathead bouncers.

The Holy Cow attempted to be a cool, relaxing college bar, but quickly ran into problems. They made the unfortunate mistake of acting like a chique South Beach or Vegas club when they clearly are not one. The bouncers held up the line for near an hour too allow more women in this dump in a futile attempt to fix the 'ratio'. 

Maybe, they were close to capacity. In this cadaver, the cadaver of a place is half empty (that is right I am a pessimist, forget half full). Sadly, the layout is poorly planned because The Holy Cow situated the dance floor by the door to go outside. Fortunate for this cadaver, it is the one part of this place they got correct.

With poor music, bad music, obnoxious underage college kids, and mediocre drinks, nothing could save The Holy Cow's slow death.

My condolences will not go out to The Holy Cow family. It will remain next to my bitter heart.

It is reported that college kids who do not know any better still frequent the cadaver known as The Holy Cow (this place sucks).

P.S. This cadaver has a cool hanging cow above the entrance.
author: Richard K.

description: Went there once on a date and had a great time. It was fun to just have some place to dance and hang out.
author: Alana P.

description:
$10 cover charge to get into a bar.
$10 shot of patron with no lime or salt, and the patron was warm
Not even that big

Bouncer never even checked for ID. A shit load of people keep leaving, but they continue to hold up the line. When it was all girls, they let them in. When it was a group with guys and girls, they just held them up then suddenly bust out a wad of cash, as a BIG hint that they want a bribe. When it was our turn, we waited another 30 min (we had 4 ppl in the group) while fkin ~10 ppl left, and then looked at me, and asked, "so, who's the gentleman for tonight?" Took my cash, never asked for ID, nothing.
author: Calvin D.

description: Ghetto crowd. My purse was stolen here last night. My advice is to avoid the BS and go somewhere classier.
author: Alanna R.

description:
HORRIBLE.   $25 minimum on credit card. They have a hot chick who works for them walking around talking to guys trying to get them to buy alcohol.  its funny. 

The line gets super long sometimes and its all guys.  im not down. 

 that and  a bunch of ghetto people keep me away from this place
author: Jason D.

description:
This place is terrible! Bouncers are Jerks and act like it's a high end club when it's really just a BAR!

The truth is I got punched in the face by a bartender for pretending to be tough. :'(
author: Cristiano L.

description:
Holy Cow is exactly what I said when I walked into this place.

I will leave it as that.

3 star for no cover and decent music.
author: Oriana C.

description:
"You look really eloquent tonight"-random dude from Oakland to my friend.

Oh Holy Cow...How do I love thee? Let me count the ways....I came here as the last stop on an ugly christmas sweater bar crawl. We arrived to no cover, a free round of shots from the bartender,a d.j. that actually took requests (except for Natalie's "Stanky Leg" thankfully), a few dance offs and $3 swill all night.I know it all wasn't just a product of spiked eggnog night, a great night that was had by all.
author: Greg J.

description:
Definitely a place where good times await. 

Very laid back. But people are still dressed to impress. 

Came here Saturday night and it was packed. Walked in and they were giving free samples of Malibu out. 

The dance floor was a pretty good size but it was definitely hot with all those bodies on the floor! More air would have been nice. 

The drinks were strong and priced way better than the norm of SF. 

I would come back again. I had a lot of fun and so did my friends!
author: Ashley K.

description:
I can understand all the shitty reviews of this place and the fact that it is semi-ghetto, but really, this place is FUN though. And that matters a lot.

They have half-off drinks before 12 (is it on Thursdays only? not sure). I've only came here on Thursdays, as this is the "fun" night supposedly. I came here a lot in my younger days, but I haven't came here in at least half a year or more, but from what I have heard, it hasn't changed much. Yes, there's definitely a lot of creeper guys, but the vibe is good here! Although it's a "bar," it definitely turns into a clubby scene. Maybe it's the one-too-many drinks that I've had here that makes it fun, and the stage that many girls decide to venture up on, or the free cover and the fact that girls do not ever have to wait in line, but this place is half-way decent compared to many other places. 

But super con: this place gets REALLY stuffy and hot and sweaty and yucky. Good thing they have a back patio/outdoor smoking area that you can cool down. But, it sucks that I just get engulfed in smoke to my left and right. 

p.s. From what I remember, there's always a long line for guys. So guys, bring a few girlfriends and you can walk in with them without waiting.
author: Diana L.

description: Happy hour was so cheap. That's the only reason to go to this has-been place. If you buy $150 bottle service here, I would prefer for you not to tell me.
author: Andrew K.

description: The one time when friends and I went into this place, I would have rated it 2 stars for total vibe, and I really didn't want to be there anyway. I felt like I was at a college frat party with a bunch of drunk 22 year olds, and I was in my 30's. The final vote would be 5 stars though because I met my husband that night 8 years ago!
author: Jodie S.

description:
Well, I've been here more times than I can count. This place just isn't as fun as it used to be. We only came here on Thursday nights because of the half off drinks on Thursday night before 11:30pm. However, it's just not worth it anymore. Long lines outside and almost always a sausage fest inside. Too many creepers. Ugh. The bouncers usually let the girls go in while the guys wait outside but it sucks if you're going with a group mixed with guys and girls. Then what do you do? 

Also, because of all the business, the bartenders are usually in a bad mood, trying to handle all the customers. They won't chill our drinks for us and it just takes a while to try to get ahold of the bartenders ALL THE TIME. Also, I believe this place charges you $2 for a bottle of water. Can't you just give me a cup of water for free? 

There are better places out there. I don't think I'll ever come back here anymore. I've simply outgrown this place.
author: Connie Y.

description:
If you are looking for Cheap Drinks and Cheap Women / Men then this is the place for you. 
I prefer quality over quantity.
author: Mariel F.

description:
Best place to pre-Drink and for Happy hour. $5 bucks for any drink and shots. No Cover. Good times with homies. 

Only thing is getting there early other wise if you show up by 10:30pm, chances of getting in are a matter of patience because it gets super krakin.
author: Anthony P.

description:
***Good***
Big. Good place to dance without creepers or anything to sleezy. Cool layout, and can sit outback, stay indoors and lounge, or hit the dance floor. Other good bar options close by as a well.

***Bad***
Standard clubby drink selections (not a club). In ghetto-ish part of SOMA. Crowd can get a little hipster or spill over from the club scene. 

***Recommendation***
Make this an early spot in your night, rather than later.
author: Nick K.

description:
Blah.

Dress codes are stupid, covers are stupid, college kids dancing to top 40 tunes is stupid, big huge cow above the bar... kinda cool!

It's always packed with nasty people, I don't like it here. I have nothing nice to say about this place.

But, if you like dancing on tables, chairs, anything you can climb up on then go here. Make sure you're not wearing any panties too, it'll get you holy cow points.
author: Debbie P.

description:
I had heard a lot about this place and I was hopeful that it would be fun. nope.

The club life is a delicate one, where you have lots of guys desperate for girls and using cheesy pick up methods. And then you have girls who are desperate for attention. Balancing this with regular people is hard for clubs to do.

This venue, at least when I was there, had a ton of both, but it was constantly like one girl was trying to out-skank the other. It was sad that they thought this was attractive... people wonder why I meet girls anywhere but clubs, hah.

Disregarding the crowd, the music kept on being great, then lame, I don't know if the DJ is actually a DJ or just some random guy. It was not great at all. I was also surprised when I walked in that the door and saw a huge bar. Sadly, the bartenders give terrible service. The girl bartender was too busy getting ones stuffed down her bra. Yeah, it's cool unless it takes me 20 minutes to get a drink.

In summary, if you are coming here just to dance and have fun, pass and go somewhere else. There are many, much better clubs to have fun at with real DJs, even nearby. Don't cheap out on a cover.

If you just want to get attention and get drunk with friends (we all have those "moments") then this is the place to come to.
author: Bryan R.

description:
I went to this joint for about 10 minutes total.

There wasn't anything that cool about it other than the drinks were really cheap. It might've been because it was before 10 or 11, not sure. I think I paid $3 for a Corona. It was $3 for beers on tap as well. That was cool.

The music was TOO loud. You had to yell at someone just to tell them something. It didn't seem like there were too many people when we got there (it was early), so maybe it would've been better if we stayed a little longer.

We just went here for a minute to use the bathroom as we were looking for another spot called Mist.

If I came back, it wouldn't be to dance, but to drink. The place isn't too bad but they could make the inside better.

The bar stools had a cow-design on them which was kinda cool.
No cover is also cool.

I consider this place a pit-stop but check it out if you're curious, it's not the worst place ever.
author: Marlon T.

description:
I came here on a Thursday night and I was not disappointed. With no cover fee and a speedy entrance, I had a feeling that I was off to a good start (which I was). They do have coat check but I am not sure how much that was... I'm guessing around $3 - $5 bucks. Also, they have a pool table but seriously... who is going to play pool when you can dance the night away? I was pretty surprised to see how much seating they had and how conveniently placed they all were. Seats near the bathroom... bar stools... additional stools on the side of the bar... and yes! booths! And speaking of the bathrooms, I love the statue in the women's restroom! HAH. I was on my way to the sink when I noticed the randomly placed window. Oh how I wish they had that in every women's restroom! Random yet awesome. 

Now about the bar, or bars shall I say because there are more than one. The main bar, which is in the middle of the club, is pretty large. It's basically this huge oval which means a bar on your left and another on your right. When my friends and I arrived at Holy Cow, we headed on over to the left side of the bar (which was a bit crowded towards the dance floor) to get drinks. We got there at 11pm so we had to drink up if we wanted to take advantage of their deal. Before 12 all drinks were half off! A Mai Tai was $4, a beer was $3 and an AMF was $6. Pretty cheap if you ask me. Some blonde chick made my Mai Tai (the first drink of the night for me) and gosh, it was HELLA weak. I thought I was drinking fruit punch or some type of juice. So I decided to work my way up the bar and try a different bartender.. that was a good move because he made my AMF pretty strong. 

The dance floor was fairly small but given the amount of space they had to work with, I guess you can call it decent. The DJ played a lot of house, electro, hip hop, techno, top 40's... basically music with a beat you can dance to. Not the best playist I've heard but I was content with it. The crowd here was awesome. Everyone seemed to get along with one another and it was easy to start a conversation with someone. There were a couple of dogs on the dance floor but you should expect that at any club you go to. 

Overall, I am really diggin this place and I would recommend giving it a try. I would have given them five stars but I knocked a star off for the crappy drinks I spent money on.
author: Rosa L.

description:
Pros:
Thursdays - half off drinks
no cover
cool lights

Cons:
CROWDED
hard to order drinks because of the crowd
LONG LINES
no dance floor

I'd come again a lot earlier this time for the cheap drinks!! It is pretty crackin if you put aside the crowding!
author: Jamie Y.

description:
Usually I tend to stray towards the nicer bars in SF, but came here last night with a bunch of friends just because the drinks were 1/2 off before 11. It wasn't too crowded, the music was half decent for the first half of the night. The place is definitely not clean by any standards whatsoever. But its nice that its laid back, you don't need to dress up, there's no pretentious-ness: no girls flaunting all they got, or guys acting like they are way too cool to be here. 
I think its good if you just want to have a chill night with a couple of your buddies and get some cheap (not too watered down) drinks
author: Caroline C.

description:
Good things: No cover charge; Trendy music
Bad things: Creepy dudes..Cheap looking girls... I guess that's the consequence of having no cover charge.. Depends on what you look for, some people might like such aggressiveness.. oh well.
author: HP L.

description:
Ready for a Thursday night with my girls.

My review is a little biased bc I dont have to wait in those long lines, waiting forever to get in.  

The thing that did PISS me off here, which I HAVE NEVER HEARD OF in any lounge, bar, club, etc...IS THE DANG "RULE" to spend minimum$25 when youre buying drinks with card. What the...I was just getting my bff and myself a drink from a bartender who was SUPER nice, darn it forgot her name already (a blondie), said "sorry, thats not enough" okay, so add another Jameson & coke I replied. She added total on her fingers, "umm..thats not $25 yet :/ " 

Guess how many Jameson & cokes I had left the bar with!?!
4! Wow & you guessed it. I was dunzo.
author: Christine F.

description:
Holy Sh**!!! I was here on a thursday night party and this place was crackin off the hook! No cover charge and half priced drinks ? !!! im in yo! i got two double shots of Jameson for only $14!!! 
Only thing is that this place can get a lil overcrowded sometimes and the crowd is mostly Asian but its all good if you wanna party ur butts off!
author: Sandeep R.

description:
This what happens when you cross fake IDs with a bar mitzvah. You've got half the room ferociously grinding on each other while the other half is awkward and unsure how to approach someone for a dance.

Only been here once, but I counted THREE lightweight BZs puking (one didn't make it to the bathroom and only found a cardboard Corona box to yack in just outside the door), eight glimmering pouts of braces and two drunk heffers dancing on the bar -- I think they took the whole HOLY COW name too seriously.

The whole "never a cover" thing is cool, but no thanks.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
I must admit something.  For the past 4 years, this place has been the place which I took all my friends out to for a good time.  

No cover charge: Great!....This is a great spontaneous spot to go.  

Never have to wait in a long line:  Awesome.....The bouncers are usually nice.

Music:  Not the best DJ....I don't think the DJ has never heard about iTunes.  The transitions to the next song always never go together.  Lets just say, I remember all the ending songs when it is closing time.  When you hear the old classic rock songs like, "Sweet Child of Mine" by Guns and Roses, you know they will start kicking people out.  

Bathroom: Ok.....The ones by the back smoking area is nasty.  But the ones by the side bar is a bit better.    

Bar Service: Ok to good drinks.....Just order alot of drinks and get drunk so you don't ever remember the weird guy approaching you from behind.

Crowd: Mixed and sometimes full of good-looking people, usually in the age of 21-45.  You will occasionally get crowds there for a birthday party who usually don't come there.  

Clothing attire: Make sure not to come in boots or bad running shoes, they will not let you in.  Jeans are ok.  No hats.

Dancing:  There are two corner dancing planks that people can go on an off.  You will see often girls with low cut shirts, short mini dresses drunk and dancing up there with a bunch of guys staring at them from the bottom.  The dance floor is also very crowded in the middle and everyone wants to weave in an out every second.  This can get very annoying.

Well I hope this has been insightful for you coming from a Holy Cow Veteran.  I wish to pass on the cheetah spotted cow to your next adventure at Holy Cow.
author: Moua L.

description:
My first time there. Popped my cherry on the 30th.

A long line on a cold night basically made my night in Holy Cow.  Drinks are cheap but you basically gotta booty bump your way up to the counter. And, when the announcer dude from nowhere said "dance floor", my friends and I laughed. WHAT DANCE FLOOR?! Ohhhh, the area where no one happens to be moving but are stuck in one spot? Gotcha.

Anyway, it was a night to lie about your name, pretend to get drunk, and leave with a disgusting stank from the overpopulated bar.

It was an okay night for me~!
author: Karry D.

description:
AMAZING!!! Bachelorette weekend for my niece and did ALOT of research on location,cost and accommodations. Bridal party agreed to get a VIP booth @ Holy Cow. The best night I have had in years. 

From the moment our limo pulled up, we were greeted like royalty. Escorted inside with chocolate covered strawberries, como cozi's and the staff was beyond what we imagined. Our VIP booth was totally private with easy access to the dance floor and restroom. We had a semi private bartender that was always stocking our drinks. 

Music was a mix of old school and today's big hits like pitbull, prince,usher, jlo, Justin timberlake, salt n pepa! Just to name a few, the dj was great about getting the crown involved. We danced all night. 
Bartenders were fun, sexy and easy going! Drinks were Devine and priced reasonable. 

We closed the place down and the staff made sure we were taken care of, would definitely recommend this club to anyone!!!
author: Mia g.

description:
Im my party days, I visited The Cow frequently.  A little older now, my friends and I were on the hunt for a user friendly place for a Bachelorette Party...a place where we could dance and have a good time.
One phone call to Bill, the manager/owner? convinced us that The Holy Cow was the right place to go, and he wasn't wrong.  We had an overly-good time...the bartenders and manager of the night were extremely friendly.  There were people there from their early 20's up through early 50's..all enjoying the D.J. music.  The bride, normally a reserved person, ended the evening doing body shots and dancing on the bar.  Overall a GREAT night!  I would return in a heartbeat!  Thanks to everyone who made it a memorable evening!!!
author: Ashley S.

description: Yelpers are being a little too anal about reviewing this place. It is meant to be drunken fun so it's going to be kind of trashy, and stinky. If you're in the mood for casual drunken fun, with no snotty atmosphere, this is the perfect place!
author: Faye P.

description: It's either a hit or miss for Holy Cow! I come here on Thursdays with my girls (we always have a good time no matter where we go). There's a lot of thirsty dudes but hey, it's  a club. Happy hour til 12? Yes please! Thomas is THE best bartender ever!!!! (We love you thomas!!) If you're a fan of fruity drinks, ask for  a panty dropper. On the down side,  they used to play good music when I first turned 21, but now they mostly play edm. At least mix it up a bit with hip hop,  ya know? They played good music on (june13) cause they switched up the dj. The bouncers are nice in the front. No cover all night!
author: Sara L.

description:
Came here on a Friday night to celebrate Cathy's birthday and man, was this a whole different experience than before.

One of Cathy's friend was denied at the door.  WHY?  Because he holds a Mexico ID and the bouncer said, "no wetbacks."  SERIOUSLY?!  OK, I didn't hear this myself, but Cathy was there and told the bouncer that it's her birthday.  His response, "I don't care."  WOW.

The only good thing about this place is that they don't charge a cover and they have an outdoor patio in the back.  THAT'S IT.
author: Jennie P.

description:
I have been to HC several times, and so far have not had a bad experience. The thing I like the most is that its a bar type of atmosphere but has a DJ that usually plays good music, the drinks might be a little pricey but they are definitely STRONG, and people actually dance. People who go to this venue are usually laid back and are there to have a good time. 

If you read other reviews some mention that its  a "sausage-fest" and others mention that there are "too many drunk girls". All I have to say is that it depends on what night you go, and it usually doesn't matter because everyone goes there to either drink, socialize, and dance (or all of the above!)

Pros:
-no cover
-strong drinks
-DJ and dance floor
- friendly people
-you can either get dressed up or go casual
-in and out privileges

Cons:
-small dance floor
-not always playing the best music
-can get really crowded
author: Nicole S.

description:
I went here thurs and happy hours were great. The crowd was a bit diverse. The dance floor, well was packed and hard to move around. And yes, its dirrty because people tend to drop their drinks.

The bouncers were really harsh on the men, but they were really cool to us gals.

You tend to bump into people that you know.
author: Mandy D.

description:
As an almost 25-year-old, I give this place 2 stars, but when I was newly 21, I would easily give this place a 4, some nights even a 5.  Thus, it averages to a 3.

Holy Cow used to be my go-to place on a Thursday night.  I'm pretty sure I spent almost all of my Thursday nights in 2008 and 2009 at this place.  By Thursday morning Facebook status updates were reading "Who's down for the Cow???"

When you're in college, this place is pretty amazing.  No cover, half-off drinks before midnight and unpretentious as hell.  Sure it was crowded and hot and the ratio of creepy guys to nice guys was a billion to one, but I don't remember ever being that bothered by it back in the days.  It was like a modern-day Cheers bar for the SFSU undergraduate -- you knew practically everyone that was there and you start recognizing the bartenders and the bouncers and they start recognizing you too.  

Unfortunately, I am not 22 anymore. Gone are the days of not having to be able to fully function at 8AM on a Friday morning and gone are the days when I used to not mind getting stepped on a few times as long as I was able to elbow dance people out of my way too.  The last time I was here was almost a year ago and I left before midnight because it was just TOO crowded and I couldn't stand it.  That's when I realized I was getting too old for Holy Cow.  And it was a very sad thought.
author: Alyssa S.

description:
I'm biased because I met my fiance here and came back 3 years later for my Bachelorette party. No cover and room for dancing (on the stage or not) and bar area for drinking.

Since the last time I've been here, the crowd has changed and the night I came, the crowd was really...in-teresting. I had a good time and the music first started off as hip/hop and then changed. We left after 1-2 hrs.

Although the crowd was different, I hold a special place in my heart for Holy Cow.
author: Janel Y.

description:
Too much of a good thing. It's a love/hate relationship, really. 

No cover, cheap drinks, good music, fun crowd. Pretty much guaranteed good time...until you start frequenting it everyyyy sinnnnngle thurrrrsday. As much as a hate to admit it, you've been good to me in the past. But I think it's time I move on...
author: Denise L.

description:
I have only been here on Thursday nights, I use to come here more back in 2007 when I was living in Cali (I am back now) and the only, only reason I come here is HALF-PRICE DRINKS on Thursday nights before midnight and than there is NO Cover charge.

Okay, when there is a packed bar and so many bartenders you are going have to wait, and just like any bar you can help your own cause.  People that whine about waiting are just haters who thinks everyone is equal at a  bar or club.  There is a smoking area in the back and they have this new addition towards the back but this place is still pretty small and it can get packed.  There are couple of small tables/booths along one side of the bar so if you want to sit down than you maybe out of luck.

Lets summarize: Half-price drinks, no cover charge, can get pretty-packed.  Recommend here for cheap drinks and to screw-off with some friends before you get to the "club"
author: Tom Y.

description:
I think this place improved drastically and drifted away from the old reputation.  Bill is always a great host and respects his customers. Chi is a great bartender with great skills and and unique personality.

Good neighborhood spot, great place to chill and dance!
author: Alex R.

description:
-no cover
-cheap drink specials
-typical (but still good, not too weird) top 40 music
-spacious
-stage
-outdoor deck
-fast service

sounds good to me
author: Mark A.

description:
I came here on a Thursday night and it was packed. I waited in line with a friend around 12ish for about a minute until a security guard came up and asked if it was only us two girls. It sure was, and we got escorted inside without waiting in line (sorry boys!). 

Half off drinks until 11pm/12am, but if you're a girl, just flirt with some boys and they will buy you drinks :)

This place is way too crowded for my taste on a Thursday night. I can hardly get through the crowd without getting grinded on from every direction! ahhhh! However, I do like the vibe of "anything goes" at this club. People dancing everywhere, tables, stage, you name it. 

I haven't seen anyone getting kicked out, so that's a good thing!

I'm not a fan since it's way too crowded for my taste!
author: Sandy T.

description: This place is awesome! I was attracted to it by the cool-looking cow over the front entrance, and was lured in by the fact that it has no cover. I liked it so much that I've told most of my friends about it. We go in here just to dance. Music is top forty, which my friends and I are really into, especially for dancing. The crowd was full of cool people; everyone was really polite and nice. The drinks here are great as well; this was one of the first clubs I went to after I turned 21 and I can't really complain. Minus one star for the slightly sketchy location.
author: Hima B.

description:
This place.....

man.....

+1 star for pretty good drinks.  I'm a heavy drinker so for a place to impress me means they pour em right.

+1 star for having a really attractive crowd, very talkative and friendly.

-1 star for the worst bouncers in the city.  I myself have worked in the security sector of San Francisco for a while.  I've been a bouncer, LPO, worked clubs, strip clubs, retail whatever.  These guys are just thugs who get off strong arming anyone smaller than them.  

+1 star for having ... a literal holy cow there.

I guess that about sums up why I gave this place 2 stars.  Honestly all they have to do is clean up their security act.  I heard it was under new management and they fixed it but everytime I go through or hear friends who just had a night there it seems like the problem has not been resolved.  News flash guys, and take this from someone also in the same line of work.  Your size doesn't mean anything if you can't use your brain.
author: alex l.

description:
Total creeper club.  

You know what I mean.  The dude creeps up behind you and starts dancing up on you and before you can react his other creeper friend is there in front of you and both creepers are wearing faux leather jackets and smell like cheap cologne.

Other than the cool cow sign out front, not much else about this club is worth remark.
author: Jessica F.

description: I came here on a Saturday night with a group of friends. I didn't expect it to have a  pool table for the guys to chill, an all around bar which made it a lot easier to get drinks from the bartender, and great music. Every song played for the two-three hours we were there were just amazing! When you first walk in, you think it's small until you go further into the lounge. There really nothing to complain about aside from the broken doors in the bathroom stalls but it's no biggie. I would definitely come back. Great place to have a good time and the bonus? No cover charge. How much more awesome can the place get?
author: Famthay S.

description:
My friend decided he wanted to have his bday here, so I figured why not it's half price drinks. We arrived pretty early to get good parking. Parking was pretty easy to find.
