We walk in and right away my birthday friend hands me a buttery nipple. Man oh man it was yummy. I figure I might as well order my tic tac or cactus cooler(socal name). My thoughts were if you mess this drink up I am leaving. I was pleasantly surprised Marcus(the bartender) made it taste so delicious. My friend had never had it before and said it was quite tasty. All night I ordered them up for friends. Even if he didn't know how to make the drink he was willing to try to make it. So I racked up 3 beers, 9 tic tacs, and a random drink Marcus made me for like 50 bucks. 

As the night progressed, the place started to get crowded. At one point my friends and I were just circling trying to find each other. The crowd was pretty nice and not too rude. So all in all good priced drinks, friends, dancing who could ask for more.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I walked into this place to the sound of Dead Or Alive's You Spin Me Round and then I saw The Rocky Horror Picture Show on the screen above the bar. For a second I honestly believed I had been transported to the 80's; this wasn't my first stop of the night. I don't know if that's typical or if it was part of their night before Halloween shtick but hearing the most overplayed song of the 80's and the movie that almost every bar played non stop through the decade with the sound off made me stumble for a second.

This bar has been here a long time, even longer than I've been in the city, and somehow I'd gone 20 years without checking it out. I didn't hate it; in fact I liked the half priced drinks till 11:00.
author: Manny F.

description: OMG. My first time here and it was pretty fun! I loved the music and the people here were super nice. I will definitely visit again. Great drinks and good company is all that you pretty much need here! Oh and good music too ;) Missing one star because... the bathroom was kinda ewwwww... But ya know, its a club.
author: Marevie T.

description:
Really stuffy and small.  They charge $3 for water too! 
There was no cover charge, which was nice, and the music was fun (top 40, plus some old school Michael Jackson!)
I think if I go back, I'll stay in the back area, where it's cooler and less crowded.
author: Kei H.

description:
We popped in to kill sometime before a show and have a quick drink - it left a lasting impression.

It was a bit early in the evening and quiet to provide an accurate review of the atmosphere and clientèle, but judging by the décor it would be a fun place to spend a night. very interesting lighting and plenty of seating areas to relax.

The bar staff were very friendly suggesting drinks and general chit chat about the venue.

Our 2 drinks were crazy cheap... he must have like one of us, a Sierra Nevada and a Jack Daniels whisky sour for $6.
author: Chris M.

description:
I don't understand how this place only has an average of 2.5 stars while a crappy place like Chug Pub has 4.5. It should be at LEAST 3 since there is no cover charge. Everytime I come here I always have a good time as well as my wallet. Drinks are half off which means you can get drunk with 1/2 the amount of money!! Cheap drinks and free admission are good perks but they don't mean anything if the crowd and music suck. I've talked to some people here and most of them were pretty nice unlike the ghetto crowd at Chug Pub...but thats a different story. Anyways, most of them came for the same reason as me; to have fun without breaking the piggy bank. Thats probably the reason why the crowd rules here.

As for the music, how can anyone hate a place that plays "Don't Stop Believin" and "Living on a Prayer"?? It's awesome when everyone sings those songs together on the dance floor.

The one complaint I have is that if your a guy you NEED to get there early because it'll be impossible to get in later at night. Other than that awesome music + cheap drinks x great crowd = fun times. It's a good date spot too because you'll probably need a girl to get you in here. (unless you're already a girl).
author: Michael Y.

description:
It's a bar. yes. duh.
When it gets packed with people, it's literally REALLY PACKED. You can't even move. You gotta be pushing people outta your way.
Super long line to get in most of the time.
The bartenders there are pretty nice. One time...I guess my friend tipped the bartender a nice one...and the bartender bought a drink for him! how awesome is that? =)
I like how they have a pool table. But too bad you gotta pay $1 a round. =(
I love it here though cuz it's like a reunion everytime I come here. I see my buddies I knew since elementary to high school! It's crazy!
author: Annie H.

description:
Holy cow is right.  Take a hick country-western themed bar, throw in a bunch of asians and old men, bring up the stink level a bit, and you got yourself Holy Cow.

And just in case you're unsure of where Holy Cow is, they have a giant cow above their door.

But there is ONE thing i like about this place, and its their outdoor patio.  plenty of benches and chairs, nice vine-laced fencing, and lights that glow a soft hue of yellow are a nice touch.
author: Eric C.

description:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed Holy Cow! But what can I say that hasn't already been said? 

Holy Cow, the one I use to know before it got revamped and honestly the one I kind of miss:
- FUN!
- The place to be on a Thursday night
- Locals only
- Casual
- Hip-hop, top 40, make you shake your ass on stage kinda music

The Holy Cow now-a-days:
- Full of creepers
- Grimey
- House Music -- I don't have anything against house music, I LOVE HOUSE MUSIC, but I use to find some comfort in the fact that I could depend on Holy Cow playing non-house music, but it has now changed
- Not a place I want to be at at all anymore!
- CROWDED AS HELL - ZERO PERSONAL SPACE

I'm not saying I won't come here ever again cause I will prob. come here on a Thursday night in the future for old times sake, but HC is just not what it use to be.

PRO: Half off drinks before 11 p.m :)
author: Jackie M.

description: I usually come here on Thursday nights. I love the half off drinks before 12 and thats pretty much it.  This is a casual place so girls doesn't need to get all dressed up.  The girl/guy ratio is crazy; there were always more (and way more) guys than girls here.  Parking is manageable before 11:30p.  I stop going to Holy Cow because it just doesn't get crowded enough on Thursdays night anymore.
author: K L.

description: Seriously not impressed. First off, the drinks are overpriced like crazy. Half off thursdays my booty. It's a cool spot if you have a group of friends to go with who are out to dance on a thursday night, but lock your belongings to you with chains and industrial locks. My camera was stolen out of my purse by some degenerate who had a fabulous plan. Have one friend distract me by making me mad by groping me while his pal ripped me off. I know I'm not the only one, apparently 8 cell phones were stolen last night as well. It's got a cool atmophere and the dj knows how to party but the crowd is super shady.
author: Nicole C.

description: Happy hour prices for drinks before 11:30 was the bomb!!!!!!!!!!
author: Janeau L.

description:
My friend took me here on Thursday after we left Impala, bc he's Mr. Frugal when it comes to cover charges. Lol. I really enjoyed this club. The silly floating cow in the entrance is a nice touch, although I do agree with Dennis L. about the cheetah spots on the cow. Lol. I guess when you are faded, it doesn't matter what kind of spots are on the Holy Cow. Neither does it matter if the Holy Cow is really a donkey or a horse. 

Just as long as you can dance to good music (they play a variety), it's all good. I don't remember much from this night now (damn drinking) except for blips in my memory that include the sinks being OUTSIDE of the men and women bathrooms, dancing with my friend, hearing the TI - Whatever You Like song, trying to dance to some salsa song that came on, seeing lots of Asians and a lot of young 20-somethings, looking at the crowd in the mirror behind my friend (we were by the wall), seeing the platform where some people were dancing, and just having a good funkin time here!!! All in all just about 30 seconds of memory really come back even though we were there for about 2 hours. Hahaha.
author: Julie A.

description:
Ok so i took a party bus here with a group of 15-20 people for a birthday last night and it was LEGIT. =)

Idk if it had to do with the fact of comsuming almost an entire bottle of Vodka before even arriving or what, but i really didnt have complaints about that place. I was a lil bummed that 2 of our girls got kicked out within the 1st 20 min for beinf "too drunk." What is "too drunk?" I say as long as they aint pukin in public; they good! =P

we got the VIP tables and bottle service, but that went REAL quick. not sure how much that was, but watev!

I can't comment on the drinks and prices because I didn't get anything. 

I can tell you that the DJ was goood. played so hella classic throwback songs like 2Pacs "California" and all the recent stuff like Rihanna's "S&M."

The crowd was aight; there were a lot of creepy/shady guys just lurking for chicks - gross!

Overall it was a good time and i would most def go back!
author: Ana M.

description:
This place is always a great time, the bartenders are so much fun and make great strong drinks! 
I would give The Cow 5 stars but I cant just yet. Everything is GREAT except they dont play enough house music yet. I am a house fan and they mostly play hip hop/top 40s. I do like that kind of music everyonce in a while so you will definetly see me at the cow gettin my fix at least once a week :) If you like that style then this is the perfect spot. Its super laid back, drinks are like $5, and everyone who works there is super hott and so much fun. They make sure everyone is safe, comfortable and having a great time. The energy at the cow is contagious. It lifts me up and sets the stage for the rest of the evening. 

There is an outside area with tables to sit at/drink/smoke/conversate.... cool lighting. The club has been remodeled, it looks so cool! Awesome lights! There is a private area in the back with its own Bar. You can reserve that whole area and they block it off for you so only your party can be back there. Super VIP :) I had my Birthday party back there and had sooooo much fun. 

Theres tons of stuff near by too. Its fun to just walk the block and get some food or stop in at the other bars near by. 

There is a sunday night house music party geared towards the gay community that fucking ROCKS. Tons of space to dance, and lots of fun ppl having a great time. 

I hear they are going to start playing house music on Friday nights! Holy Cow will have a 5th star from me once that takes off :D.

Best night to go to the cow in my opinion, Sunday nights!!! Hope to see some of you fun hot yelpers there this weekend :) xx
author: Jena D.

description: Oh cow... you really are either a hit or miss in my books. Been coming here every Thursday for a long time now.. I do have a lot of good memories with you. Drinks are usually good.. a few do justice.. the half off before 12 doesn't hurt either. Be prepared for a crowded mess.. and the feeling of being packed in a can like sardines. Nonetheless it's quite fun if you make the best out of it!
author: Tiff C.

description:
A good place to go to if you want to dance. The only time the music is good is when they play old 80s/90s stuff to get people excited again though.

For the occasional dance-itis I get, I go to Holy Cow.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
I've visited Holy Cow on Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays.. 

Thursday -  seems the most crackin.. more on the younger crowd and college students.. there is always a line when we get there.. no cover which is a major plus since its a bar.. They've also remodeled the decor a bit with some new lighting and some wall decor.  Its always PACKED on Thursday night.  It does get stuffy and sweaty, especially if you're trying to dance! Its a hassle having to go to the restroom because you have to manuver your way through the crowd.  You are literally rubbing yourself up against anyone and everyone trying to make your way across!

Music is usually good.. Drinks cost the same almost anywhere you go.  I take shots so my budget is $10 a shot.. I think I've got charged $8? for hennesy/grey goose.  

Parking - you can probably find street parking.  Or there is a garage the next block over, the same as Mercury, lounge for $5.

Friday and Saturdays - I believe it was a more older crowd.. but who cares as long as you're with good people.. plus NO COVER again.. and good music.
author: Elaine H.

description: ...and years later, they still play the same old tracks. I think that they just have a sound system with a CD playing on repeat.
author: Susy C.

description:
Went here a couple of weeks ago with some friends.  This was our attempt to bar hop after 9 years.  We were celebrating a friend's 39th birthday.  

The crowd was an older crowd and probably not the same clientelle that you'd see at places like Ruby Skye, etc.  But the ones who were there had fun.

The music was a mix of current and cool '80s, so it wasn't bad.  I don't think the mixing was very good, but we were all able to bust a move or two.

The drinks were stiff and not too costly.  There was no cover.

Just an overall average okay experience.
author: Anh L.

description:
YEEE HAW~

not the cleanest club/lounge to be at on a thursday/friday/saturday night.. but the music is great and very diverse. They tend to play alot of "old school" songs along with the current ones as well.

This place is known for their NO COVER entrance. Admit it-- who wants to PAY these days to get their freaky on when it can be totally free? Besides, the economy is horrible and the $20 that could've possibly gone towards  cover could buy us more food..... to yelp about :) 

Anyway, we like this place cause its more like a "I DONT GIVE A F.." type of environment. People are there to have fun with a mix of races. 

HOWEVER LADIES!!! if you dont want to be chased around by weird, creepy men.. and you dont know how to say NO- or if your friends have really bad beer goggles and can't give u the sign that thats "HELL NO!"... then dont even bother:) 

But i give it 3 stars for being such a chill and fun place to be.
author: Hanna K.

description:
You know how you have that one comfort spot -- that one spot that reminds you of a bar at home, or one you frequented every Thursday as an undergraduate?  Yes, Holy Cow is that spot for me.

For those of you from UCSD, PB Bar and Grill basically defined Thursday nights.  There was nothing as chill and non-pretentious as PB in SF . . . until we stumbled upon this little, crowded, crackin' place!  

True, the dance floor was a bit small, but you can always dance on that elevated platform (suuuper fun).   True, there are quite a few creepers who tried to holla, but that beats all the bars down the street . . . which were empty.  True, it wasn't the cleanest or newest bar, but damn was the music awesome . . . everything from top 40s to Journey's Don't Stop Believin'.  

I wouldn't want my birthday party here or anything, but call me on a random Thursday night and I'd gladly put on my dancing shoes!
author: Yvonne P.

description:
I'm definitely a fan of Holy Cow.  I've been coming here for the past 5 or 6 years on and off and I've always had a good time here.  I even hooked up with a random girl for the first time here!  Ah memories.

The DJ is great on Saturdays, drinks are there to get you drunk and nothing special.  Holy Cow's major advantage is a very large size, with multiple rooms and a sound system setup that draws the crowd into one particular location, so if you want to grab a table or chill it's easy.  If you can hammer your way through the crowd there's even a back porch area.  

The other big plus here is that the people I see here are not pretentious but also not ghetto.  You won't see Marina Chicks or gangstas here, just a lot of people having a good time.  In a city where change is rampant, this place has been a stalwart.
author: Scott S.

description:
The bouncers here are DISCRIMINATORY.

My friend was put in a headlock and literally sat on by two bouncers. This was in result of my friend trying to reenter the bar after making one phone call.

The bouncers made unnecessary calls for the San Francisco Police Department and testified false stories, accusing my friend for violent actions that never happened.

I encourage anyone reading this to CONTACT THE HOLY COW NIGHTCLUB (415-621-6087) and URGE THEM TO STOP THE UNLAWFUL ACTS OF DISCRIMINATION AND HARASSMENT on their customers.

Minorities of any kind do not deserve this kind of treatment.
author: Joe L.

description:
Holy Cow.. is a hit and miss for sure. 

The only day I come are Thursday nights, which is when they offer half off drinks till 11:30 or was it 12? Anyways, besides from that they also have a dance floor, a few tables, and outside lounge for smokers. 

Getting a drink here after 12, is near impossible. The line is crazy, but if you hold out your money you might get lucky! Some bartenders are nicer than others (pouring double shots, rather than one), but then again that all depends how you tip as well. 

The main reason this place is a hit would be the people there. Most of my friends come here and it's always pleasant bumping into them. Overall though, the place is CROWDED, if you want to bother getting in, I recommend coming before 10:30.
author: Austin N.

description:
Great place to chillax after work or just to go out to with friends. Cant beat the fact - Half-off drinks on Thursdays! 

Music was so-so, really expected to see more house dance, instead I mostly heard hip-hip. I am letting this one slide as if I was looking for a great dance club, there are better options close by.

Overall, good crowd, decent drinks, and great bargain = Good times.
author: Mike S.

description:
I came here with a few friends on a Thursday night a couple weeks ago and was instantly smitten. With a name like Holy Cow, you can expect that any and all pretensions are left at the door. This venue is casual, friendly, and fully committed to making sure it's all about the fun.

First off, their Thursday night 1/2 off special is amazing, especially considering how generous they are with their pours. Getting your buzz on is definitely not an issue here. 

The music was the perfect mix of well-known favorites, more underground dance hits, and a handful of hip hop throwbacks. The dance floor starts getting crowded around midnight, but you have no problem claiming your space and moving around. The laid back, anything-goes atmosphere of the joint lends itself to cooperation among all of its patrons...meaning you won't have any girls rolling their eyes or huffing and puffing if you accidentally bump into them while navigating the dance floor. If anything, you'll make some new friends and join them for a dance or two. 

This might not qualify as a "night on the town" for those who are looking for a swanky feel, but it's definitely a winner if you're looking for a chill place to dance, drink, and hang out with friends.
author: Aylin Z.

description: This place isin't so bad, First time it was chill. Music was on point. Watch out for the Bartender the bald buff one, he be playinggg with drink prices. My GF & I first got 2 beer's 8 dollars, we come back order the exact same thing he charges us 10 bux. WTF? Making your own prices or what? Go to the lady or the other guy AVOID THIS GUY, I mean its a 2 dollar difference but that could of been tip. They were giving free shots as well!
author: D M.

description:
Holy Cow! I had the best time ever that first time I came in...NOT. 

The dj was sorta awesome, the bartenders were cool, there were so many people in there that I felt like I was in a mall and couldn't even walk through. 

I see some old geezers and stood in line with some cougars. The best show on earth was the dude who got his @$$ beat by some people he went to hs with. The neighborhood is shady and my friend's car was broke into, but for the money we paid, this place wasn't really what we were looking forward to. 

+3 stars for the drinks and service.
-2 stars for the neighborhood and the cramped space.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
This is an EXCELLENT place to go to for dancing, drinking, hanging out with friends in booths, in the pool-playing room, or outside on the cute patio (which also has chairs & wooden booths to sit at with friends). It's great for everyone, and cigarette smokers don't have to go stand out front- they can just go on the patio. 
The coat-check was FANTASTIC- and only $2 for the night. The girl kept letting me go back to get money from my purse for drinks. Really nice staff. 
And no cover charge!
author: Kelley M.

description: This place has got to be a fire hazard. There are way too many people inside the club. Bodies on bodies on bodies from the coat check, to the bar, and to the dance floor. Forget about trying to get through the sea of people on the dancefloor--it's impossible. The only pros would be that you can get cheap drinks here and you will possibly run into a long lost friend that you haven't seen in forever. Then again running into people you haven't seen in forever can also be a con. The bouncers the night I went were also very rude to the people in line. There's a line between having authority and enforcing rules and being a completely a-hole. I would never suggest to go Holy Cow, I would only go back if the majority of my group are planning on already going there.
author: Kevin Joseph A.

description:
let's just say that... I AM NOT GOING BACK. 

well, unless i want a cheap drink and dance with weird guys...

Bartenders= RUDE.
I get that they are busy, but the guy took my order and he said 'one moment' then he walked away. WTH. The girl bartender told me that my friend didn't tip her so she refused to serve me. I always give tips, but I went with a large group of ppl. so i did not know half of ppl i went with. what am i suppose to do? tell them to go back and tip the bartenders??? If they are acting like that, no wonder why my friends didn't tip them!!! I was so mad and frustrated at these rude bartenders!!

place=packed on Thursday, but ...
people are okay. place is too small and dirty...

personally, i would not go back there again.
I'd rather go to many other places that are so much better than this club and pay little bit more for drinks.
author: Sora B.

description:
Look... none of you be a gangsta bitch, so stop acting like it, aytt?

The Holy Cow sucks... I don't dig the scene nor the gangsta rap wannabe bullshit but whatever...   What really bugs me is they can't make a decent drink.  The bartender has that deer in the headlights look, which, seeing as he's huffed so much glue, doesn't completely surprise me.   His brain cell is doing overtime.  Still, if you can't pour me a decent martini and you ain't got red bull and vodka... then fuck you and your gangsta bullshit, fo shizzle byatcccch.  I didn't ask for Rockstar, motherfucker... I asked for Red Bull.  Just cuz you have problems deciphering the difference doesn't mean I want to drink the shit you serve, ya dig?  And I know that sounds lame and petty and frankly, I could care less, but I keep getting attitude thrown at me from everyone:  bartenders, bouncers, patrons, the wannabe gangsta bitches from the 408.  Can't we all just get along?

The city's got so many cool clubs and bars, stay away from this one.  It sucks cow balls.
author: David O.

description:
For some reason, I swear this place got lost in placement. It seems like it should be in the Marina.  When i go there with my buddies, I feel like i'm almost at a frat party.  Not in that "double popped-collar" kinda way, but just the " i can drink more than you.  I don't even know you, but i'm sure i can POUND if faster"
good outdoor patio, good music, with a mix of 80's music and 90's music
the bartenders are extremely gorgeous, and a good diverse crowd.

check it out if you ever get a chance
author: Ken T.

description:
Raging frat party ! Wuahhhhhhhhh! I was in a fraternity and I definitely don't want to re-visit the experience of the frat party. 

sticky floor: check
mysterious drinks: check
crowded: check
crappy top 40 music: check
scantily-clad females of questionable character: Definitely!


To be fair the only plus is that it's free. 
If this is your thing, go for it. I left that behind in 2003 when I got my diploma.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night.  No cover, no line.  I told my friends that if any bar/club plays Afrojack I will give that place 5 stars automatically on yelp.  Other Djs promised to play afrojack but never deliver but this place DELIVERED.  duck sauce + afrojack + new britney spears with all the wubwubwuwbubness.  Even though the crowd was more the top 40 crowd, the dj kept his promised and my night was made.  

Drinks are relatively cheap and there is a lot of room outside the "dance" area to just chill.  Also the dark atmosphere is cool with the shifting lights...reminds me of when I used to play lazer tag as a kid.  I would definitely come back if I was ever in the area again.
author: Brian H.

description:
Holy Cow is awesome. All these people yelping are just angry trolls. Holy Cow always has half off drinks in the begginning of the night. But just because the drinks are cheap doesn't mean you need to be. Treat your bartender with respect and they will do the same. 

Enjoy Holy Cow for what it is, a good freeking time!
author: L F.

description:
Came on a Friday night... not too crowded which is a big plus.  Decent dancefloor and pretty good selection of music. 

Big plus that there are booths to sit in and rest those tired dancing legs and hang out with friends. 

Downside... slow and snobby bartenders.  And there's a minimum charge of $20-25 on your credit card.
author: Vicky T.

description:
Went here on a Thursday night. Mostly Asian crowd, mostly in large groups, and for the most part pretty attractive too. Lots of SF State students there since the semester had just ended. Staff was really friendly. 

Three highlights:
1) No cover and no line, even at 11 pm
2) Cheap drinks. Johnny Walker Black and a Corona for $7 is unheard of in the Marina.
3) The men's room has a trough to pee in. Takes me back to high school.

Only real con is how packed the small dance floor gets.
author: Brandon N.

description:
Came here with a group of friends celebrating their dirty 30 bday.

Had table service which should have included a free bottle but they neglected to deliver it. Since we were partying so hard this wasn't noticed until the bill came and it was a headache to get anyone to help us.

good music and cool patio to hang out on for when it got to heated in the bar area. they co-ed bathroom was weird though
author: Matthew J.

description:
My first time there was couple of weeks back, and I had a blast with the 1/2 off drinks deal. The patio in the back is pretty awesome, with tables & seats set up. Maybe it made that particular day extra ordinary since it was my friend's birthday. 

Other than that, there's not much else to say... music was alright in my opinion. The bartenders are chill though.
author: R T.

description:
After circulating from North Beach we ended up here. 

Pros: no cover, big bathroom, 3 bars. 

Cons: small, 4x4 dance floor, overly crowded. 

overall; i did enjoy myself here this night, and meet some nice people, but not my top pick for a night out in the city.
author: Juana S.

description:
I went here twice in one week and it wasn't on purpose. Although the crowd was diverse and the music was dance-able, it seemed to be full of people who thought they were a lot better looking than they really were. Especially when dancing on the speakers.

On the positive side, they have half-price drinks until midnight on Thursday nights and it was no cover on Saturday night. 

But cheap is not always good and this is the perfect example. If you're looking for somewhere to go for drinks and dancing... look elsewhere.
author: eileen b.

description:
I'd give this place a 5 if it wasn't for shady people being there.

It's a fun place with a giant cow right above the entrance so you can't miss it. They have coat check right by the door and inside, there's a pool table, bunch of tables and seating right by the bar. And a small dance floor by the corner. The hallway into the bathroom has even more seating and lights that make you feel like you're in a room playing lazer tag.

Drinks are good and reasonably priced. Bartenders are good and even for a Saturday night it wasn't too crowded where you could breathe. Same with the dance floor, and the dj played top 40s songs. Although one of my friends requested a series of songs and he actually played it. Not bad.

Now, why it lost a star. While dancing on the dance floor, my phone fell out of bag and I didn't realize I had lost it until we went back to the bar. I retraced my steps to try and find it but it was no where to be found. We tried calling it but someone had picked it up and kept ignoring the calls. We asked the bartenders and bouncers if anyone had returned a phone but unfortunately, that wasn't the case. I left this place without my phone.

Other than happening, this place was fun and I'll be back, but I'm holding onto my phone next time
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I came here last year with a bunch of friends. It was my first and only time in here. I liked it because it didn't try to be trendy with a weird design and no cover charge like everyone else. 

Walking inside was kind of small, people were friendly however. Just the counter and tables were not well maintained.
author: M C.

description:
So I go to the Holy Cow on my birthday to celebrate with a night of dancing and drinks and what began as a fun birthday turned out to be a HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!!

My friend who is a tall and friendly asian dude goes outside as our night is winding down to make a phone call and the bouncers with NOTHING BETTER TO DO pounce on him!! TWO HUGE DUDES compared to my 140lb friend, WTF?? After they pinned him to the ground they followed it up by calling the cops who then harassed my friend by telling him, "We don't fucking want to hear what you have to say, if you don't leave in 5 minutes we're arresting you!" 

Firstly, the bouncers were completely OUT OF ORDER to assault someone who just wanted to return to his group inside and my friend also saw other people re-enter the bar and ask to merely be allowed re-entry.

Secondly, what happened to innocent until proven guilty? The cops didn't even HEAR what he had to say or hear the situation and just threatened my friend with an unjust arrest.

Then the bouncers LIED saying my friend tried to CHOKE THEM? HAH! What a lie!!! Who would choke two 300lb bouncers to get into a bar after last call?? That's right, sounds like bull to me!!!

Never go to the HOLY COW is my only message. There's no parking, it's grungy, the crowd sucks except for your friends, and the BOUNCERS are racist A-holes who totally abuse power. Fun time? I think NOT!
author: Anna Lizette H.

description:
Never going there again! The bouncers assaulted my friend last night just because he wanted to get back into the club after making a phone call. My friend never provoked or used violence against them but ended up restrained on the ground with not only 1 but 2 bouncers?! The bouncers then called SFPD and fabricated stories about how my friend had acted violently. No doubt we are filing police reports against this place.

For a place with no cover charge, expect commensurate "customer service."
author: Simon W.

description: Had a good time here. Some of the bartenders charge you different prices for the same drink... umm?! Played a lot of good music and there is lots of dancing going on.
author: Angelique M.

description: Came here again, this time on a Thursday night - it was really empty before 10pm, then by 10:30-10:45pm it was packed!!  They also had servers walking around handing out free (but weak) shots - but I can't complain, it is free!  Good music, good times....
author: Beatrice W.

description:
Some sketchy ash shush goes on around here. let me tell youu.

First off, I've heard alot about this place. I've been told that it was a chill place to throw back some shots & dance w/o having to worry about the dresscodes and such. 

We got there pretty early.. before 11 on a Friday night. & just as we walk in.. we're already offered free shots by the bartender as we were a group of ladies. Yee. +1 

And the night starts off great, awesome happy hour (1/.2 off before 11) and super awesome bartenders! +1 

-3
SKETCHY ash security. After flirting with our group, this one specific security guard moves on to 2 Caucasian ladies (they seem to know each other) .. who then proceeds to walk into a room in a corner, not the restroom, ladies & gentlemen, a storage room. Yes, I said a Storage room! The Security guard follows them in 3 mins later. Together, they're in the room for 25 mins before the ladies walk out and he follows minutes later, all while he's fixing his pants. We're pretty disgusted at the close distance he's standing from party so we move onto the dancefloor. Later, we see him dry humping another random girl on the dancefloor with her legs wrapped all on his waist. Then he still has the nerves to come back and ask us to take pictures. DIRTY DIRTY DIRTY. I kept thinking, don't touch me. Even more sketch, is that, after talking to other nice security guard who were doing their job, we come to find out these girls are associated with the owner, one is even the GF. 


Can you say... Awkward.
author: Dee W.

description:
Holy Cow!!! Cheap drinks for a San Francisco bar/club....pretty good vibe...nice mix of music....though a little bit too much of Lady Gaga, which I am not really going GAGA over..but other than that, they go from 80's type of music (Michael Jackson) to 90's and then to the new stuff, so it pretty much caters to everyone's kind of dance music. Though I am more into electronic type of dance music (techno), but this would do as long as the music has a great beat and pumping. And no cover charge. For one thing, I would rather use the money for the cover charge to buy my booze. And for this alone, they get five stars from me.

But one thing that stands out is that they do not have a lot of places to sit, so you are forced to stand. But that is okay 'cause this is a dance place, so everyone should be dancing, right? So what can I say about it? I like it.
author: Christopher R.

description:
I've been here probably 5 times over the past two years (between 07-08) since my residency in the Bay Area. There's a lot that confused me when I got inside (is it a dive bar or a western bar), whatever it was, Holy Cow is the perfect way to describe my initial feelings about the place. It was a miniature saloon space with no mechanical bull, but a backyard patio and a small dance floor to get your groove.

Drinks from what I remember were stiff for its worth, and the prices were steady (about $6.00-$8.00 a drink). The crowd was pretty diverse but nothing extraordinary to go crazy over. It was a nice getaway if you didn't want to be bothered with trying to go to Temple, Element Lounge, or any other spots in and around the SF area on a Thursday/Friday night. Majority of the music ranged from Top 40, the occasional club hit, and even a rock anthem for good old times sake. The bartenders were quick and courteous, and the bouncers weren't douche bags which really helped.

I haven't been back since, but all I know is if I ever wanna stroll through memory lane. This is one of those places that remain in the back of my mind as the old alcohol hole.
author: Ryan M.

description: Fabulously fun place to have a couple drinks and dance the night away to groovy music. The location is shady a bit but that ads to the dive bar feeling that makes Holy Cow so much win and little lose. Love the classy ladies.
author: Gerardo S.

description: I love this place esp their service and No-cover entry and cheap drinks. The bartenders are awesome too. I would give them full Five points if they fix their pool table but it is still playable. I hope they don't start charging for cover when the bar remodels. Does anyone know when the bar will reopen. Their website provides no info on the date so I guess they might not have decided yet!
author: Manan S.

description: I am one lucky lady right now...after spending the day worried about losing my purse...which included $120 in cash, cell phone , id, ATM card, and house key. I received a call on my mom's phone saying that one of the body guards found my purse. Even better EVERYTHING was inside :) Many thanks to the Holy Cow Staff!!!! You all are amazing!
author: Christine H.

description:
I have soooo many things to say about Holy Cow, and not all good. I will give them 5 stars for many reasons but first let me say if my rating was based around the bouncers it would be less than 1 BECAUSE THEY ARE DOUCHE LORDS! The semi fat guy with the pony tail is super rude and acts like he's private security for Obama...you work at a bar dealing with drunk people hun...calm down its not that serious. 

Now, the reason for my 5 star rating. This bar is not pretentious like so many of the others that I have been to. The music is fun and the outside smoking/mingling area is amazing. I love love love this place, except I wish that Thursdays didn't make me feel like I was trapped in a Tokyo train station. It can get a little packed but I always have a blast (when I'm not arguing with their egotistical bouncers! LOVE IIIIT
author: Alex M.

description:
You never know what type of wild adventure you'll get yourself into at The Holy Cow.  You don't have to pay to get in, but be prepared for a packed house.

The Holy Cow is tiny, but it packs a HUGE punch.  It typically gets full.  The DJ spins all of the right jams to get you wildin' and dancin' while you're getting your drink on.

One time, this guy was standing on top of a bench on a corner and throwing out bills to the crowd like he was Diddy! Seriously, how ridiculous is that?  I was cracking up!  

Don't expect a cool, calm, and classy vibe to this place.  You come here to have a fun time, not to be prissy.  The Holy Cow also has good drink specials during the week!
author: Jessica C.

description:
I could never complain about the awesome no cover and 1/2 price drinks - 4 for $12. Dancing on the corner stairs up to nowhere above the speakers. The bass volumes tingle your toes as you wiggle around with your "search the crowd" and "flapping chicken" moves. It was a fun crowd (moar fun than Atmosphere). Lots of dancing. Slow start to the evening but it got crowded soon after.

But what is up with the guys fighting to take over the dancing corner steps? It was cute at first but then it was almost all guys on the steps before the end of the night. Now, I'm not saying guys shouldn't be having their fun up there in the spotlight too, but at least be considerate of all the ladies in their heels up there! (However, I understand that the air is much cooler and breathable up there - NOTHING would've made me come down...unless I was leaving haha)

I also enjoyed the random movies played on the screens above the bar. I had no idea what they were. But there were subtitles.

Watch out for shady parking guys on the streets who try to direct you to "parking" with their rolled up magazine batons.
author: Ellis L.

description:
So as a 6'2" male that used to live a block away from this club i have one story to tell my feelings on this place.... So it took me about a year to actually walk into this place after all the bad reviews i have heard about it. So one night i decided to check it out. I walked in between 9:30 and 10 pm on a thursday night and it was DEAD!.  I did a lap in the place when sat at the bar. After 10 minutes some little asian deusch bag sat next to me for 5 minutes. This little prick dropped something into my drink. How do i know? because i walked out of this shit hole and woke up the next morning not remembering shit after my initial walking out the door. If your in the Soma neighbor hood and you are trying to figure out a destination Wish and Butter are much better options. I personally prefer Butter. If you go to the Holy Cow watch your drinks closely ladies. As a man i would recomend any and all women to avoid this place at all costs. Oh also the Bartenders had a holier than thou attitude. Avoid this place if you want to be treated with any kind of respect.

Happy Travels.
author: Tim M.

description:
Holy Cow?

More like, Holy Ineverwanttogotothisjointeveragain.

Let's start with the positives:

1. If you're a girl, you never have to wait. So guys, go with girls. A large amount of them.

2. No cover!!

3. Good music, but the moo sounds gotta go. I don't care if you're Holy Cow.

Ok, time for the negatives.

1. The bartender was slow, but I could tell he was stressed.

2. I felt I was in a can of sardines trying to dance! My arms were crossed and I kept getting smacked from all the other people dancing.

3. I was grabbed, groped, slapped, hit on...mercilessly. Is that how SF guys do it? Yall need some lessons in respect.

4. This venue is INSANELY small. Don't let the mirrors fool you.

Yeah...never wanna go here again.
author: Agnes F.

description:
Damn what can i say about this place that hasn't already been said. Its a double edged sword. Sure the drinks are awesome on Thursday nights being half off. The crowd is pretty mixed which is always a plus. But what the hell is up with all the creeps.

First of all it was totally uncalled for picking a fight with my friend who was just chillen with his gf, when she was being hit on. So they come and call him out with 6 vs 1, till I and his bro step in... wow really I guess that's how ppl do it nowadays. Of course the security was no where to be found.

Other than that it can be a great place to get your drink on!
author: Terry W.

description: If you don't mind an older crowd with DJ's that play everything except for Hard Metal and Screamo, and you enjoy the most random group of people you'll ever see this is the place for you. I like coming here when I don't feel like paying a door fee and I just want to drink and listen to a random mix of music. I've always had a good time here, however I don't usually stay for more than 2 hours. The later it gets I usually walk next door to Wish for some intimate and less crowded feel.
author: Alex S.

description:
Yes I'm giving it a four star. Holy Cow has yet to fail me. They really have good music even though the place seems to be really crazy. I really enjoy the music, definitely just puts me in a good mood. I also enjoy watching people dance. It's a bit hilarious but I think it's because people are just having fun, without a care in the world. I think you just let loose here. Being here brings me back to my undergrad years. Might sound a bit trashy but it's crazy fun, which is what I need sometimes.The dance floor definitely gets really crowded but it's because they play really good music. 

There's no cover charge nor a strict dress code! Say what?! I'm there!
author: Anette N.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night. There was no cover charge, bar tenders were really quick. Depending on the bartender, some made the drinks extra strong. Half price drinks were pretty nice. But the place is PACKED. So packed, you can hardly get anywhere. A plus would have to be the bathrooms are pretty clean, and there's more than 2 stalls. Thank goodness. 
There is a $25 minimum charge for credit cards btw.
author: Annie W.

description: Aw the Cow....No Cover, Half Priced Drinks, packed wall to wall...always a fun joint.....this is that bar you never want to go to....but you always end up there at the end of the night.....
author: Brian W.

description:
Young crowd, very young crowd, are they even legal to go out without mommy's permission? I felt old there and i still have a few years before I turn 30...

Cheap drinks and dancing. 

Other than that nothing special...
author: Sandra M.

description:
I've been to this spot on and off for the past 3 yrs.

Pros: 1) No Cover Fee 2) Good Music (hip hop to old school r&b to rock?) 3) Mixed Crowd 4) No Dress Code 5) Outdoor Smoke Patio 6) Good starter spot for a nite out

Cons: 1) Super Crowded (I'm sure over capacity) 2) Limited drink choices (I asked for a mojito, but said they didn't have the ingredients)

*Side Note: Be prepared to get at least one drink spilled on you if you plan to hit the 'dance floor.'  It gets super crowded, so if you're looking to really dance and move around HC is not the place to be.  If you're looking to just have a good time, have a few drinks, listen to good music and chit chat then you've found a home.
author: Jasmine S.

description:
Oh Holy Cow. I hate/love you. 

I've spent many a Thursday night here drunk off my ass (but still sober enough to remember, mind you), dancing the night away to Journey/club hits/it doesn't matter anymore after a certain number of drinks. It doesn't seem the same when they don't play Don't Stop Believing. Love that song! 

I would never go there on a Friday or Saturday...dead. dead. dead.

Holy Cow is the place to be on Thursday nights (half off drinks til 12!). But you have to be in the right mood. Don't come here dressed to the nines expecting a classy joint and little sippy drinks, you will be sorely disappointed. Ladies, please do not wear stilettos to Holy Cow. It just makes no sense. Come if you want to have inexpensive, unpretentious, crazy kind of fun. Its pretty dirty/crowded/hot in there so I always come in my chucks and jeans. The smoking area is pretty big for you smokers out there...

I suggest getting there at 1045-11pm to avoid any sort of line (for guys or girls), pounding all the half off drinks you can take and hitting the dance floor IMMEDIATELY to secure a spot for you and your girls. 

Note: hold on tight to your driver's license. I've lost it a few times there in my drunken stupor LOL
author: Michelle L.

description:
yeahhhhhhhhhhhh i'm not so sure about this place. 

compared to the other reviews, i don't think it's a DUMP.. but it's definitely not somewhere i'd make an effort to come back to. i try to avoid places downtown like this anyway because parking sucks, but i had to go for a birthday celebration. 

first off: there is NO cover. you gotta admit, that's pretty cool. i'm a girl so i didn't have much trouble with the bouncers but i guess they're kind of anal with guys. once inside, i realized how small the place was and how PACKED it was. if you wanna dance, good luck looking cute because you'll be sweating all over the damn place. 

the drinks ARE cheap, but i'm pretty sure they're cheap in quality too. i didn't drink much but i felt like crapppp the next day, kinda like when you drink alot of cheap vodka. no bueno. i'll pay a little more and avoid the hangover, please. 

the DJ does alot of mash ups which is kinda cool, but kinda not when the songs just don't go together. there is an outside patio where you can smoke and chill out and the bartenders are actually very quick here.  if you go, i'd advise you to pregame before so you don't have to drink there and bring a big group of folks. =]
author: Angela L.

description:
I have been going to this place like for 10 years. hasn't change a bet.
I still love the martinis it serves..Great crowd. Chilled.
author: Peter G.

description: TOTAL SAUSAGE FEST CLUB. It was nice to see more guys than girls, but if I didn't know any better, I would have thought I came on its Gay Bar night. It was nice that their drinks were heavy on alcohol even though they were half off on Thursday, but the atmosphere was way too sketchy to overlook. There was no air conditioning so luckily we were seated close to the door. The dance floor was tiny and basically the whole area around the bar and tables becomes the dance floor too. When people said Holy Cow was something to "experience", should've known it was gonna be sketch....
author: Shelly U.

description:
Well, I file this place under your typical get wasted and listen to top 40 hits (of all times not just like 2 years ago) bar. Crowd is mixed, young to old. Interior is a mix of Western, Diner and stripper poles. 
I belive we didn't pay cover since we were there early enough. I guess it is fun when you want to get wasted and act obnoxiously in a club. If you want to have a drink and converse, avoid this place.
However there is one good thing, the outside smoking area in the backyard.
author: Sonja S.

description: HOLY COW.......oh memories hahah. I used to come here on Thursday nights in college and I haven't been back since! Yea it was fun back then, 1/2 off drinks before midnight, crowded, and just a buncha broke college students down to party. There's always a few older creepers too....The area isn't in the best location, cuz my friend's car got broken into....but looking back on things now...I don't think I'd come back here. It's really dirty, and sticky, and everyone here is usually 21-22. It's kinda sad, but I still know a few people my age who come here....of course they're guys....
author: Diane L.

description:
I'm never going here again.  Yea, it has no cover... but it's DEFINITELY NOT worth it.  The dance floor is small and there are nothing but creepers at this place. 

The bouncers are also very rude and assaulted my friend for trying to get back into the bar after making a 30 second phone call w/o warning him about the "no in and out" policy.  After pinning my friend on the floor, they unnecessarily called the police department and threatened to put him in jail.  They falsely claimed that he was threatening the bouncers, but how can my friend do such a thing while being pinned by 2 huge bouncers on the ground? 

I'm totally turned off by this place and it is definitely not worth spending a "night in the city" here.
author: Christa N.

description:
one less star for the sweaty packed atmosphere it becomes throughout the night..

other than that...

LOVE the music everytime i come here.

LOVE how I didn't have to wait in line at all.. girls were able to walk up and in.. and that went for couples too! while all the groups of fellas had to wait.. boooo awwww :)

LOVE the insanely cheap half off drinks/shots they have before midnight!  That just made the night all worthwhile! THAT is the reason why people come here on a thursday night to have fun! This was proven to me by these attention seeking DRUNK girls dancing wildly and on top of each other on the bartop.. one was throwing her cowboy hat all arounddd.. trying to seduce bartenders.. dancing with the wooden poles that were holding the place up! It was not a very attractive sight i may say... haha

The outdoor patio is a major plus because of the sweaty environment inside..

The moo-ing throughout the night kinda distracted me though.. haha i feel like it got louder everytime!!!! 

MOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO
author: Kathy D.

description:
My friend got her phone stolen from her back pocket!

Although this place has no cover on weekdays, there is some shady ass shit going on. Parking is coo, music is actually good, but the crowd is a no-no! Most times there are just too many guys, (who ever really is looking forward to a sausage-fest), and shit gets stolen like it's the thaaang to do. 

Other than that, it's an alright place to kick it, a mix of people in chucks and stilletos, and an outside area that's pretty chill.

Ps. HD on point though. Watch that shit drunk and you feel that there really is Something About Mary!
author: Rachel M.

description:
No cover. that's good.
1/2 off drinks on a Friday from 9-11. that's awesome.
Outdoor patio. sweet.

25 tab minimum at the bar!! NOT COOL!!
NO TAP WATER AT THE BAR!!! FUCKING HORRIBLE!!!

Nice DJ/good mix.

The crowd did seem super young and I guess there's this creeper that looks like Dwight from the office that dances there. DO NOT dance with him. I still cannot believe they would only SELL me water, that has to be illegal!!

I don't know. I would rather look some place else to dance....
author: Susanna B.

description:
THIS IS A THURSDAY NIGHT REVIEW


I'm 27 and I havent been here since 24 or 25...but nothing has changed. Still loving the half off drinks on thursday and still loving the good crowd. Music is decent, vibe is decent, and for San Francisco women are friendly for the most part. The free cover is always nice so if you want something to do on a thursday night then I for sure recommend this spot!
author: Eric S.

description:
Gimme a moo! 

MOOOOO!!

I love that cow.

Holy Cow is great for a random night out to throw back a few and act a fool with everybody watching. So skip dancing in the living room or in front of the bathroom mirror and do your thang at the Cow

Quick question for all the ladies...Doesn't it irk you when the bouncer looks at your ID then looks up at you , then your id again...then you? Are they trying to be funny? I really hope not. Standing in line plus SF weather...BRRRRRR...B*t*ch, please? I'm in no hurry to throw my hands in the air but I much prefer to that indoors than in the freezing weather! Luckily, I didn't experience that with the bouncers at Holy Cow. They are all super nice without the entrance drama that you encounter every now & then

In addition, no entrance fee and this is every night I hear.

Bartenders were eye candy however one of them almost charged us twice and we caught it just in time. The tight t-shirt hugging the pecks didn't distract me one bit and I almost lost myself at the wink but...no sir..I got it under control

Can't get rid of them but once in awhile there are douchebags lurking in the corners at Holy Cow. Be careful.  It's inevitable but just remember to utilize that kung fu grip in case you get cornered. It's powerful even at times of tipsiness
author: Charmian D.

description:
I went to Holy Cow at the stroke of midnight on my 21st birthday.  I was already pretty hammered and ended up drinking five more drinks inside.  Needless to say, I don't remember much from that visit. 

Fast forward to three and a half years later.  I was having an absolute horrid time at Blow Up (don't ask) so I headed over to Holy Cow, where some friends were hanging out.  The drinks were kinda tasty.  They have a $25 minimum on credit cards. Way lame and annoying.  

I have to give some props for the guys at the front.  The only thing I remember from my 2005 visit was the bouncers.  They saw that it was my birthday and they were so sweet about it.  They were even sweet to me when it wasn't my birthday.  Gotta love that.

My biggest issue with Holy Cow is the quality of men that were in attendance.  There were some ugly fuckers there, man.  I usually don't mind ugly, but these dudes were shameless and trashy.  I went into major man-hater-mode.    

Appropriately, the night ended with me slapping someone in the restaurant next door.
author: Annie G.

description:
Thursday nights at the Holy Cow are quite crazy... It could have something to do with the half-price drinks!  The girls dance on the bar, and wherever else they find space.

The men's restroom was, well, disgusting - dark, murky, and the trough wasn't draining, so there was a vile pool of pee...

The patio was full of nicotine fiends.

It seemed like they were trying to save on mixers, because the drinks were 3/4 alcohol... Stiff!

Average age was 21-24.

The extra Star is because, with everything said, we had a good time...
author: Kristian P.

description:
Doesn't this place belong in Walnut Creek?  (or "dub-crizzle" if you are exceptionally lame)  Right next to Crogan's, maybe?  All I can say is "wow!"  

Hot times for the suburban-ites to get down to all their favorite jams they hear on Movin' 99.7.  Really, there are much better places to go dancing in the City.

OK, 925-ers!!  Everyone grab a piece of this building and carry it back over the bridge and through the tunnel.  You will all have a shorter trip to shake your groove thing if you could just move this place to where it actually belongs.
author: Kiki G.

description:
One star for the cheetah cow above the door.
A half-star for the pool table.

Round up and that's two stars.
author: Anne Marie S.

description:
Holy Cow, there is bovine hanging over your door! You can't miss this spot, it is too close to Costco. 

Three stars, why?

1) Thursdays = College Night = 1/2 off drinks = failing to wake up in time for work in the early AM, post-Divine Bovine.

2) Top 40s, occasional rock songs, here and there and some oldies. Last night, the DJ threatened to only play rock songs for the rest of the night cause so many people were standing around. Haha, what the fuck?

3) "Shoutouts to the baby mamas and ugly people shut up!" Too many hands went up. I was a bit concerned, who is taking care of these baby mama's babies?!

4) The dance floor is just wayyyyy too small, elbows are usually thrown (some catty bitch elbowed me because we were trying to get through the crowd to find an area to dance in), drinks are usually spilled. Ladies don't wear anything you don't want soiled. I showed up last night in a black t-shirt, a pair of jeans and some Converses. 

5) NEVER A COVER, NEVER A LINE! The latter only applies to the ladies though. 

6) Lots. of. Creeps. *shudders.
author: Maggie H.

description: So I never really go out to soma and I stumbled upon holy cow last night (may 25, 2013) because there was no cover. Drinks were good and there was a great vibe inside. Overall it was cool.  Until upon leaving at say 1:45am the 200+ pound 6'2"  bouncer with a pointy mustache would not let me use the bathroom.  He got in my face and told me to get the f out. So I turned around and started heading for the door. And I was suddenly head butted in the back of the head by the bouncer.  Now I'm not sure if that is in the job description of a bar bouncer, but if it is I'm pretty sure it's called assault.  It is really unfortunate that such a cool place can be ruined by one aggravated employee. I work in the same industry and this is not any way a customer should be treated.  I also hate that this review is out of anger and not praise.
author: Max S.

description:
I came here on a Thursday night. The line outside was pretty long. I was sitting in the taxi thinking, "Damn it...I really don't want to wait." My friend and I got dropped off in the front and as I was walking past the bouncers, one guy asked me if I was coming in. I said, "Yeah." He gestures me to come right to the front. I glanced back at the line (mixed with males and females) and walked right in. Sweeet. No cover. Sweeeet. I got up to the bar and ordered two shots of grey goose for $10. That really caught me by surprise and shortly after I got two midori sours for $6!

Drinks were cheap which was a plus. Overall, not a place I would come back to. It's like a sauna in here and to get to the patio, you have to walk past the men's bathroom which isn't covered all the way for some odd reason. You can see guys peeing as you walk in and out. Gross! Music was good and bad, but bad for the most part.
author: Dung N.

description:
This is a whatever review. I shouldn't be making this review anyways because its totally influenced by the people I know and what went down. Here are the parts that are impartial to what happened regardless. 

1.) getting shut down at the door. Me and my wingman came fitted for a friends bday. They tell us more  no dudes until 11pm or so. Me and said friend say hey no prob and go find a dive bar. We kill time at butter and get in around 10:45pm. Place is already full and loaded with dudes.

2.) hey half price before midnight, hurray! drinks on me... sorta lol. I'm glad everyone came early and loaded up before I got there. I'm still down to buy shots but this is getting ridiculous.

3.)decent crowd and no cover. For some damn reason I forgot my contacts so I take off my glasses and a lot of women are looking hella fine. Add the beer goggles on top and we got a winning combination!

Oh well time to pass out and be ready for work tomorrow, til next time yelp.
author: chris c.

description:
I hate this place and it hates me. So, I'll call it even.

I am wondering how in the Hell this place gets so completely air gasping crowded when it smells like cow dung. The floor in this place is so gross that it's like dancing on the back of one huge sticker. Drinks are cheap...yeah...whatever.
author: Liz K.

description:
Holy Cow are choice words......

This place must be where the bridge and tunnelers go to get laid.

Within 30 seconds on the dancefloor I had some guy come up behind me and start grinding on me with a full on boner. Yuck. Somehow, I get the feeling, this tactic works for him at this place. Didnt work for me so I quickly walked away and started drinking to try to deal with this awful violation of my person..

I had 3 sapphire and tonics...no buzz.

My friend was served a beer in a warm glass.

My other friend came back to the table from the dancefloor with a similar story to mine...but completely different guy. I wonder if they were related.

At this point we knew it was time to leave and never come back.
author: Drue C.

description:
This is the place where my best friend coined the following term:

Shiva hands: a slimy act by a slimy dude attempting to woo a woman, wherein he sidles up from behind, starts butt humping the woman whilst waving his arms under hers; at which point, that woman's friend dancing opposite sees the second pair of arms sprout unexpectedly from her friend's hips.

That for me, is the Holy Cow.  (And no, I'm not the Shiva hander, I'm the Shiva handee.  Not a favorite way to spend the evening.)
author: Ravena F.

description:
alright so i decided to check this place out on thursday, drinks are cheap as hell during happy hours, shit i bought 2 shots of grey goose and 2 beers for 12 bucks, thats DIRT CHEAP for a bar so i liked it....then the clock hit midnight and i saw an influx of them street goons and they were on girls like that prince chasing cinderella and her shoe... well there was one bartender named marcus, he was super cool so everytime im here my friend and i bought marcus a shot each and he hooked us up with some free shit too, that was good and the music was pretty standard, hiphop, top 40, some old school, etc, id come here w a group of friends, but not to pick up girls or have a bottle service here, no no, it was alright overall

3 stars
author: Michael K.

description: this particular venue is grimy! prepare to have drinks spilled on you, if you try to dance or walk through to the back patio which is smoke infested. Not a good time if you are looking to meet classy people or hold a conversation. Need to hide out in a booth in here. Drinks are cheap though!
author: joey p.

description: This bar is a blast during the Folsom Street Fair. It was so welcoming, and warm! Ensure the bouncers are not racist, because there's a yelp review that says his black friend couldn't get in because he had the wrong skin color for the dress code. Call them out on that business!
author: Em L.

description:
It would be unlikely, if not impossible, even with my executive bitchcakes vocabulary, to put into words a more apt description of Holy Cow than the very picture posted above:

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/F877QW8fR8CKIdPBWKyzLg?select=IWL8LSDg2iC7Ejy0GTweyA

Mein Gott In Himmel! I would rather eat my own ass using only a spork and a crazy straw. The words are in me, but forming them into sentences just makes it all too real. 

This ends here.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
I was standing outside WISH (across the street from this shithole) and saw a tourist bus stop outside and a guide dump all the folks from Fresno (they certainly looked like it) into Holy Cow. Well, thats what it is  - a mini Fresno.

Dont even think about it .
author: Sav B.

description:
"Eek! Methinks not." - Yelp Rating Quote

I used to come here occassionally on Thursday nights since it was pretty poppin' but I stopped after I realized other things were poppin' ...aka bullets. Two people (one was a bouncer) got shot outside Holy Cow within a 2 week span.

NO THANKS. I WANT TO LIVE.
HOLY COW INDEED.
author: Heidi C.

description:
When I was young and single I loved this place because....

I could dance, get liquored cheaply, and get lucky if I wanted. Let's just say I dragged a few friends here when I was having one of those "I just wanna dance! moments" in my wild and crazy barely legal days. 

So because I have so many fond memories, I have to give it at least a few stars. But going there now is more like this... 

"Ooh! No cover!"
"Wow, cheap drinks!"
"Um, no I do not want to touch your peni5."
"Hey is the bartender wearing underwear? Oh! Nope...."
"I said NO, I do not want to touch your peni5."
"OW! That biatch just stepped on my foot with her 8" clear plastic heels. Ugh."
"Yep, still am not interested in touching your peni5 dude. You might want to try hitting on someone else."

And that's about when it's time to hit the door. If I ever have a relapse and think I'm 21 again, I might come back, but it's quite doubtful. 

So you youngins... Go get your freak on! But you oldies, like me, stay far far away. Unless you are a total pervy guy who wants to stare at the hot half naked bartender girls and try to sleep with college girls. 

And yes, I have actual had more than one guy ask me to touch his peni5.
author: Ali R.

description:
Holy Cow! This place is like 3 steps away from Wish.

Judging from the star ratings of this place, I must of hit Holy Cow on a good night. Now, I know why there was a lack of Asians at Wish... they were at Holy Cow.

The place was packed with a good mix of guys and gals. It was nice to get away from the droning house music at Wish to the hip-hop and 80's music at Holy Cow.  Now that's my kinda music!

People were dancing and having a good time. After a while, a couple of my buddies hopped back and forth between our party at Wish to hang out at Holy Cow.

Good times.
author: Sam T.

description:
NO cover, thats the best part!

They have smoking area outside in the back. 

They also have two bars, one in the front and one in the back where there are more seats and slightly quieter with a naked male statue .  

Drinks are priced perfectly for pple who are broke =)
The music was decent... usual  hip hop, top 40.
author: Helen Y.

description:
3 stars for a Saturday night when school is out of session.  Not as crowded, still cheap drinks, but no happy hour like on Thursday nights from 9PM-Midnight with the half off everything drinks.  The crowd was a little older this night and more Mexican and the DJs played more Reggaeton and Salsa-Like Hip-Hop music over here.  And you can't go wrong with the hot flirtatious bartenders that they always have working over here.

But I think if I ever come back here, it would have to be on a Thursday night while college folks are still in session.

I think it's safe to call this spot a smaller SF version of Taste from San Jose with a more bar lounge like atmosphere with cheaper drinks and a really small ass dance floor next to their ghetto small bathrooms that you have to walk through to get to their small outside patio area.

I felt bad for my homeboy cause I told him they changed their dress code here to where guys have to wear a collard shirt, but you can still wear kicks and not dress shoes, but they made him tuck his hoody in on his jacket if he wanted to wear it in the club and he couldn't wear his baseball cap either.  But then again, he knew we were going bar hopping around SF and most people dress up around SF unless we were only going to like a more hip-hop/urban loungey/club spot like Club 6, Poleng, Milk, Rickshaw Stop, The Independent, The Fillmore, The Mezzanine, The Mighty, 111 Minna, The Cellar, Fat City, etc.

We probably should've went to Levende or Temple SF this night, and Temple SF even had a bunch of cop cars parked in front of it when we drove by, so that probably meant that it was crackin, either that, or they were just there to help regulate for ghetto ass Club NV across the street.  Or maybe we should've just went to Club Icon down the street.

And that Giant Cow in front of Holy Cow makes me laugh every time I see it.

Boo to the Grilled Onion Hot Dog Cart outside for upping their prices to $4 a hot dog.  I remember it being $3 just this past March.  They don't even got bacon on their dogs!  Boo!
author: Chris T.

description:
It's not every day you see a leopard patterned cow with pink lace up boots on, unless you happen to live or work near The holy Cow, which I did for about two years without even thinking about stepping in.  It wasn't until a couple friends of mine decided to take me there that I realized it was actually a bar, and a decent one at that.

The bouncers were nicer than I would have expected from the other reviews.  Rumor has it that they recently hired mostly new staff.  After walking in and checking my coat I walked around the very long square bar with several bartenders manning it.

After the bar got a bit more crowded they opened up the bar in the side room so we pretty much had a bar to ourselves.  Getting drinks was quick and painless.  The bartender pours were generous and half price drinks from 9 pm till midnight on Thursday nights made this a spot I can definitely see myself returning to with my friends.  The flirty Brazilian tourists hanging out with us didn't hurt either.

Now while the crowd is not necessarily my kind of crowd, between the drink specials, bartenders, and good times with my friends (and Brazilian tourists) I can definitely see myself returning here in the future.

This is now my dangerous go to spot for Thursday night entertainment with my friends when I'm in the area.  This place is definitely A-OK.
author: Theron L.

description:
I've had lots of fun nights at this place. Whenever I miss a clubs guest-list cutoff time, I always end up here. 
The crowd has been mixed every time I've been here. I never know if I'm going to be in the midst of an Indian bachelor party, or a frat house outing. But who cares, you come here to let loose and have a good time dancing! It can get a little crowded here on a weekend, this and the drinks is why I gave this place 4 out of 5 stars. I don't like being squashed between a couple of sweaty dudes. They never have a line whenever I've been here, but they should limit entry to make sure it doesn't get overcrowded. 
The drinks are hit or miss. I've had some of the best and some of the worst drinks here. Some were soooo bad that I couldn't even finish them! I understand that it gets busy and it gets crazy for the bartenders to make so many drinks (I've bar-tended, so I know) but c'mon, don't half ass the drinks.. It only hurts your own tips!

All in all, you can't have extremely high expectations for this place, it's free to get into after all! If you're looking to have a good time and dance and don't really want to dress up too much, then this the place for you!!

PROS: FREE entry, clean bathrooms, smoking/outdoors area, good music, place for sitting, fun atmosphere. 

CONS: drinks(sometimes), overcrowding.

And for everyone giving this place 1 star because something was stolen out of YOUR purse is just being unfair! It's your own drunk-ass fault for not keeping track of your belongings. A club is NOT responsible for your stuff, unless it was stolen out of coat-check. I always keep an eye on my stuff and have never had this problem at any place.
author: Olga D.

description:
I'm not giving this place five stars so much because I like it, but because I respect it.

How do you not respect a place that has a huge ass cow flying around outside of it?

How do you not respect a place that is free to get into, is big and roomy (compared to some of the tiny places where the junk in my trunk is unable to maneuver around anywhere), has the crowd moving and dancing about, and even offers space to sit?

The place defines the whole Bay hyphy movement and is what going crunk is all about.  It's a piece of the bay that envelops all of the B, along with all of the T into one sanction where caveman and civilization meet and collide as one.  

The Holy Cow is what you make it--it's bad enough so that you you can go in with the lowest and worst of expectations, but when inebriated enough anything above the worst night of your life makes this place a real champ.  That is how you tackle the beast, that is how you buy the cow.  

Often you may come out of this place some plain beans, but every once in a while you'll wake up laying some golden eggs.
author: Tien N.

description:
whoa.

Yall don't like holy cow?  You guys don't like the big cow sticking outside with its awesome teets?! HOLY COW, you guys are crazy.

I like it here.  I know its small but its diverse.  You don't know who'll you run into.  The big mirror gets me every time.  It looks big with that damn mirror, just like in chinese restaurants.  You think theres whole other section there but its a god damn mirror.

Happy hour till 11pm?! Where else can you find this craziness.  2 heine's and 2 shots of jack for 12 bucks?!  Holy Cow!  Music is good too and they got a lounge with couches to hang out and a POOL TABLE.  

Plus, they got the mexicans around the corner for the Dirty Dogs.  Bacon wrapped hot dogs with mayo.....,mmmmm,,.I'm hungry now.  

They don't allow hoodies for some reason. But they are cool.  

I don't understand what not to like about this place.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
Came here last night with some friends for the half off drinks deal from 9-12. Not the prettiest place inside but drinks half off made it worth coming. Ordered 4 drinks, tokyo teas and raging bulls. Tokyo teas weren't bad for $5 and the raging bull was pretty bleh, probably cuz of their dispenser mix.

Would come back for the half off deal but not on a regular night.
author: Steven C.

description: If you're actually 21, go somewhere better. Crowds have gotten a little creepier and bartenders are still rude.
author: Helen Z.

description:
I went once and that was one time too many.

The only people who actually like going to the Holy Cow are under-aged college kids who don't know any better. They are the same type of people that let it all hang out at Senor Frogs during spring break.

For the rest of the population, The Holy Cow is like a bad frat party complete with TERRIBLE DJs and the lowest rung of sleazy guys drinking beer out of plastic cups while flailing their arms and legs about in what they call "dancing."

Ladies, you don't need to be piss drunk to throw up here.
author: Viv C.

description:
"Where there's always a party and never a cover." 

They must mean a slumber party because this place is pretty  *yawn* boring. Plus....no covers at a slumber party (wtf)? If you feel like actually doing something....go to Wish which is just next door or around the corner to Butter. 

But to be honest...I have been here soooo many times (not by choice but at least I'm not the DD). Its pretty hit or miss. Last time they wouldn't let us in because they said there were too many guys in there. I guess they did us a favor.....but still...fuck em' . I do have to admit though that the best thing they had going for them would be the hott bartenders...hubba hubba.
author: Angelo F.

description: Best happy hour 9-11 Thursday and Friday. Friendly staff  Good DJ. Still trying to figure out why no one shows up until after 11. Good place to get the night started.
author: Nathan M.

description: I used to go here when I was a teenager with a fake I.D. and I enjoyed it a lot.  In a nutshell. it's a good bar for young straight people.  Not people in any scene, just normal straight folks who want to get drunk.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Holy Cow has become a Thursday event for me and my girl friends... again half off drinks till midnight, you cant loose, well you may loose something but not your money.  Unless you buy drinks for everyone to be nice, like me recently.. but it was all worth it!  I have met Art, who I believe is the manager of the bouncers and he is very very nice and he remembers me which is big for me!  Also the bouncers Dennis and Will are helpful as well.  I will tell you that there is a dress code, for good reason.  I understand, I don't want to see men's leggs in shorts, this is San Francisco for begesis!  I will tell you that I did get poured the strongest double of my life that i could not even drink.  I asked for a double jack, but I'm positive I was poured something different but was too lazy to ask for a remake.  Even though this happened, I will forgive them, it was very busy.  Bathrooms are kept up by a nice woman who is constantly cleaning and dodging drunk girls trying to take pictures in the bathroom?!?!? I mean the David out the window is cool, but 5 photos is a row is a bit excessive!  The line does get long after around 11:30 but if your a girl, just politely go to the front and ask if you could please, please get in... there guys, it should work!

The main dance floor is a bit too much for me, I dance where I can near the back bar and grab a booth to throw my stuff and sit on occasion.

See you next week boys!
author: Megan L.

description:
i only come here thurs because nothing else is really open well that i know of

half off on drink is really cool

wack small dance floor

wack bouncers

wack dress code no plaid shirts allowed. WTH never knew that was gangsta.  i mean i see guys wear tap out and ed hardy tee but no plaid shirts

long story shirt my friend had to wear his tank top and cardigan to get in

next time doing something better like sleeping
author: Justin I.

description:
Yes, I really did just give "The HOLY COW" 3 stars, here is why: 

First of all, if I were basing this on the people watching alone, it would be 5 stars. Seriously, I don't know how to explain this so you really get a good picture... I mean REALLY get it...but I will try: 

-to the girl in the "JLo" outfit (with the gold brass buckle at the top)- Thank you for trying to pole dance with the table in front of us. I am only sorry that the candle on the table you were grabbing to try and look sexy did not fall on you and light your aqua net hair on fire (if that would have happened we would have a 5 star review people) 

-To the girl in the sluttiest red prom dress I have ever seen in my life - You got down with your bad self on top of a speaker on the dance floor. Fabulous! By the way, EVERYONE can see your girl bits because you forgot to put undies on... a Britney want to be folks. 

-To the pimp in the white suit, 1 word, I am going to break it down into 2 syllables for you (because you are THAT cool) SA-WEET. 

-and my FAVORITE- to the girl in the one piece, booty shorts, jump suit complete with zipper. YOU ARE AWESOME! I mean, the camel toe on your already unflattering outfit really did top it off for me. I couldn't stop talking about you or following you around all night just to get another look at you, because seriously, your outfit was that horrible and I really just needed to see it over and over- I really should have just sucked it up and asked you to pose in a picture with me... I really would have liked to show my friends. 

Folks, don't worry, I am only on the first hour of my "Holy cow" adventure. 

Now, the drinks...
