I can admit that I was snobbish when I went in, I read all the reviews and I was prepared to "catch an STD" from the glasses, but ALL WAS SAVED by my BFF Lyn, she knows a guy that works there, so all of our drinks were half off, which makes them taste that much better. Our bar bill was 38 dollars and let me tell you, we definitely had our fair share of liquor (see above description of people who were there if you want to know why we needed all the drinks) - Yes the glasses were warm sometimes, but really after your 5th rum and diet, does it REALLY matter? 

Now, the music- I personally loved it. Classic crappy bar music, some guy actually dedicated a song to "all of his Ho's" yes, the DJ really did say that. I never did get to meet all of "his Ho's" but I have a sneaking suspicion that one of them MIGHT have been wearing a jean one piece jump suit with camel toe action... but I am only guessing here peeps... I can not say for sure. 

Anyway, back to the music- My friend Lyn convinced her hook up at the holy cow (how hot is that?) to coat check our bags for free (we saved the 2 bucks!) and made sure that I always had a drink in my hand for a few hours, and THEN she asked the DJ to play THE song, yes, I got out on the floor and showed all of the "Ho's" how to in fact bring sexy BACK- now, I know you're thinking, "but you didn't have a jean one piece jump suit complete with zipper and camel toe or a red slutty prom dress on, how did you bring sexy back Jessica? HOW did you compete with the classiest of classy and sexy?" Well, I have pictures of exactly how it was done, and I can assure you that to put the "Ho's" to shame. I really did. 

On to the patio situation... I don't even know where to begin........ 
.......... 
There is a patio. I think the people who hang out there though may have "issues" which is why they are not allowed INSIDE the "Holy Cow": 

Dear Weird Irish men on the patio of the Holy Cow, 
I thought you were very weird. It is NEVER okay to try and kiss a girl when you 1) just met her 10 seconds ago and 2) when she is making weird faces and backing away from you. It is just never okay. And please tell your short friend not to run away with my friends expensive camera documenting the whole thing, because I am 5'10 and your friend can not be more then 5'2, and i am not nice AT ALL. 

Thanks for posing for the pictures though, now we can post them and make sure that women EVERYWHERE know what you look like and to walk on the opposite side of the street when they see you coming. I know that we appear to be fans of yours in the pictures, but really if you look close you will see the sheer horror in our faces when you actually put your arms on us. What you don't know is that we took bleach and wire brushes to ourselves when we got home to start fresh on the skin. 
Kisses!

Stay off the patio is the moral of that WHOLE story, if you smoke, the Holy Cow is a good place to decide to quit just to stay off the patio. Its not worth it people. 

Now, I was so excited about all of the happenings that I actually called my best friend in Chicago to tell her about it, and when she didn't answer I called her live in boyfriend to tell him about it. Mostly I just really wanted the world to know about the girl in the jean jump suit with the camel toe.
author: Jessica R.

description:
HOLY COW... the drinks are half off friday night till 11

HOLY COW... it stinks in here

HOLY COW... there's a lot of uhm...ugly people here

HOLY COW...  there's a couple of cows dancing on the stage over on      
                           the corner

HOLY COW...  why am I here?!?!?!

DON'T DO IT PEOPLE....JUST DONT!
author: Adrian D.

description:
I've been here many times but had a particularly good time last weekend (Saturday night).  There was no cover to get in and the DJ was really good, he was playing some booty shaking mash ups when we got in and then there was a string of dance pop songs and a perfect mix of hip hop.  I was pretty impressed, our group danced until closing and didn't complain about the music once.  

Maybe I just got lucky but I got pretty quick service at the bar both times I went up there.  

Holy cow has a smallish dance floor in the main room so it can get kind of crowded and hot so come dressed for that but with a good DJ and a relaxed atmosphere it's a lot more fun than stuffy places in SF.  

There's a certain club down the street that charges $12 to get in with a long line, bouncers that think they are god, and only accepts cash at the bar so in many ways Holy Cow makes for a much more enjoyable night.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Come on!! No cover, cheaaaaap drinks, fun crowd, and good music - most of the time. This place is dope!
author: Camille R.

description:
Only reasons for this review:

1. Friendly bartenders. They chat a bit with you and tend to you fairly quick... might be because the place was a little empty

2. Half Off Firday nights!! Cant go wrong when your drinks are cheap! $3 for a pint and $3 for a Jack and Coke? cheap. if they were regular price at $6, that would still be a bargain.

3. No cover.

The bads? Empty, Older crowd (kinda weird), and a weird vibe...

O well, 1/2 off drinks are always good right?
author: Gordon L.

description:
Holy Cow reminds me of a really bad high school dance... reenacted!!! The theme, Cowboy up!
Remember the days when your high school dance committee got really into a theme for a dance? Well, here you go. Take your average joe schmo school, through a couple hundred awkward 16, 17 years olds in the same room, put some rap music on, and let them mingle. Holy Cow, It's awkward, smelly, creepy dirty, and after a cocktail you still want to get the hell out of there!

No one could ever drag me back there.
author: Dee C.

description:
I have been to this place a few times before, so this review is not one of those "on bad experience so I give it one star" reviews.  We never really plan on going here, but kinda show up here when A. there is nowhere else to go or B. we got tired of the lace we were at and just want one more drink before we grab some late night grub.

This past weekend was plan B.  Showed up to this place with some friends and didn't even think twice about the dress code because that's the kind of place this is.  They pretty much let anyone in as long as they have clothes on.  Apparently, that's not the case anymore.  Being in the back of my group, I watched them all get in wearing sneakers, t-shirts, etc.  I'm in the back wearing jeans, a sweater, and some dark brown boots, and I'm the ONE who CANNOT get in because of dress code.  WTF?!?!  

It was raining all day, so I decided to wear my Timberland boots out like most normal people would do on rainy days.  But according to Holy Cow, it is much more appropriate to wear my nike free gym shoes into this place.  I understand the entire stigma behind Timberland boots as they normally have that thugged out look, which most places want to avoid, along with giant white t-shirts, etc.  But let me tell you what else I was wearing.  A north face sweater and rock and republic jeans.  Rock and republic does not know the meaning of baggy, so I hardly looked like a gangster.  I actually laced up my timberland boots and had my jeans cover the top, so it was not like I was looking like the missing member of the Wu-Tang Clan out there.  And I wasn't even wearing those yellow construction boot looking boots, mine were dark brown suede.  Can I paint an even clearer picture than that?  I looked nothing like a trouble maker, yet my boots were clearly public enemy no. 1 that night.

Now here is what really got my blood boiling upon being denied entry.  When I got to the front of the line, this Tim Tebow looks alike looks at my boots and asks for a closer look.  I oblige because I think there is nothing wrong with them.  He then proceeds to STEP ON MY DAMN SHOE!  What the F kind of service is that?  Who the hell literally steps on a potential customer's shoe in order to tell them that their shoes are not on their dress code?  Obviously, I was pretty heated when I had to call my friends and tell them that they would not let me in that place.  When my friends finally made it out, I pushed the little line divider thing and here comes Kenyon Martin's brother out of the woodworks talking sh*t to me and my friends.  Again, what kind of bouncer instigates trouble outside of his establishment?  To make things worse, I was already irritated at his partner's treatment of me a few minutes earlier. 

A shouting match ensued with the Kenyon Martin look alike, and while I was being restrained by my friends, this loser decides to follow us an entire block trying to egg on more trouble.  Daring him to hit me, the response was "I have nothing better to do tonight."  Ummm, you're kinda working aren't you?  Why are you following us still?  Like another recent review claimed, these bouncers do not know what the F they are doing and seem like they are the ones who are provoking trouble outside their own place.  Also calling me "shrimp fried rice," because I am Asian is probably not the most appropriate thing to do.  Just my 2 cents.  

This place will NEVER get my money ever again.  I do NOT recommend it to anyone, free or not.  I would rather pay an extra dollar or 2 for drinks than support an establishment that has these kinds of people employed.  

Also, the times I have gone in there, the music is your typical top 40 mix with rock mash ups, and the people are either ghetto-noying or living out their mid-life crisis.  Not worth your time.
author: JP T.

description:
First of all, yes I'm biased slightly because my friend works here, but I still would tell you if I thought it wasn't worth going to.

I know there are it's low points but I know one of the managers here and so my night was fantastic with half price drinks! Too really understand why it was a great night see my bff J.R.'s review....hilariously true!

HOLY COW BABY ...IT'S A GLOWING COW!

I'm not generally a nightclub kind of girl but I did enjoy getting J.R. wasted on drinks from the bartender we were introduced to and then getting her on the dance floor for some MOST EXCELLANT old school music!

There's no cover so why not try it out, at least once!
author: Lynda O.

description: Great dance club if you like top 40 / hip-hop / club music. On one visit here, it was too crowded to get to the bar. But on most visit it's just the right amount of packed. Room to dance, but not so empty you feel like everyone is staring at you. The DJ isn't always good, and last time he was playing all the weird remixed B-sides (hellooo...not what I came for) but we had fun anyway.
author: jori m.

description:
The first time I came to this place was a nice summer Friday evening. We'd just left a cliquey Asian party at Loft 11, and we were seeking another venue. Place was ghastly empty, so we took a quick lap and jetted ASAP.

The second time was for a friend's birthday.  Within the first five minutes, it became clear we should've stayed at the pre-party.  Look, I love that my female friends are attractive, but it's disappointing when they're the only good looking girls there.  

Plus, did I mention the DJ was terrible?  It just sounded like someone's terrible iPod hip-hop reggae mix, with each crap song lasting way too long.
author: Huey K.

description:
Holy Cow is a strange beast. 

They have some clear things going for them:
1. Huge Bar that spans several rooms
2. A good sized dance floor
3. A large, and potentially, AWESOME patio
4. Pretty bartenders

However, something about it is always just a little off. 
1. It always smells really bad. 
2. The bartenders seem to be having a better and more exclusive party of their own behind the bar. 
3. The other people there, and I'm going to sound like a jerk, are generally really odd. Like I really don't think most of them are locals. 
4. It's like it's spring break all the time, but not in a good way. You dig?
5. Drinks come in little soft plastic cups. I feel like I'm at the little kids table whenever I'm there. It's indicative (telling?) of a business and it's clientle if it has to serve in indestructible and even humiliating vessels. 

So, I guess maybe you can have a blast at Holy Cow, but I'm still doing my best to understand just how the hell to do it.
author: Jake R.

description:
HOLY COW...its not great!

 I rolled out on a Thursday night.
Pros-NO COVER!!!!  half off drinks till 12 and i like there big outdoor patio in the back
Cons-  Usually a line. if you want to be crowded shoulder to shoulder with a bunch of young college kids and dudes then this is your place. I prefer a more relaxed setting.
 
There's 2 or 3 bars if u wanna call it. 1 bar in the far back and a round bar which technically constitutes as 2.

Ill only go if i know a bunch of people that go. Then again you'll always see people you know there.
author: Brent W.

description:
Sometimes I try to explain to my West Coast friends what bars in New Jersey are like. Next time I will just take them here. We were taken here by a friend of a friend and I really wish I'd read the reviews first.  We all kept trying to figure out who these people were and where they came from. I think sometimes I forget these people exist, and that I grew up around them.

Oh jeez, I really sound like a snob now. Ok, how bout this: drinks are 1/2 price till 11 which is good because you'll need them. Shit, I still sound like a jerk... um... it's really fun to point and laugh at the guy who dances in front of the mirror? Ok, fuck it I really can't say a non-snarky thing about this place. Bridge and Tunnel. Fo' real.
author: Sharon T.

description:
So I actually hate Holy Cow but there are 3 good reasons it is going to get 3 stars from me...

There are 3 reasons you go to Holy Cow:
#1) To get hit on by drunk out-of-towners
#2) To dance for free
#3) a combo of 1 and 2

I often end up here because Ali Gato R is dying to shake her booty. I then proceed to drink myself into oblivion,  otherwise I am BOUND to get pissed off at some smelly guy or slutty girl - either of which can be found here falling all over the place. 

Once good and drunk you'll see me doing my best white girl dance and hip-hop and pop music singing - I sight to behold. Overall, this place pretty much blow - BUT if you want to dance for free and can get over the B&Ts here, it can be fun.
author: Jessica L.

description:
I hated this place.  It had a popular song playing and from the outside drew me in, I guessed I had hoped for my house than hip hop.  But if you know you like that music, then a good spot for you, music wise.

The place just felt dirty, slimey and the people were way gross.  Maybe it was just that particular night but people were rude, one couple looked like they were  . . . . . in a side corner and in general wasn't a good spot.

The drinks were fairly pricey but the bartender was kind of nice.  That was nice to have, especially it being so busy and all.  It was crazy packed on a Saturday night.  Later there was a fight brewing outside upon closing, great . . . . . .
author: Sabrina A.

description: The Holy Cow is the best place to kick it on a Thursday, Friday or Saturday. The security is Awesome and the Bartenders are not only HOT but they make great drinks and they are half off before Midnight. I love this place and they have a DJ and a dance floor, not a very big one but you still have room to dance oh and they have a nice patio in the back. This place is my #1 spot to go to!!!!!! I totally recommend you go check this place out!
author: JESSICA M.

description:
If I wanted to hang out with a bunch of East Bay folk, I'd actually stay in the East Bay.  This way you get to save on bridge toll and God forbid, save some gas.

Every time I come here, it seems like I run into the entire Cal State Hayward Greek system and random girls who live around Pleasanton.  I even meet East Bay ex-pats in this place

"Hey, didn't you live at the Bronco Billy's house?"

"Yeah, but I live in the City now."

Going to the Holy Cow is like eating nothing but McDonald's on a foreign trip.
author: Kenny L.

description:
Holy Cow will always equal one of the three below:
-drunken haze
-drunken dancing while belting out the lyrics to Journey
-drunken making out with new guy (who turned into guy I dated. eek! but atleast he was a friend of a friend! i do have some standards aka no randos!)

I think i'll leave it at that and never venture back there again.
author: Lauren Y.

description:
If you're looking for free cover, wide variety of music, fun crowd, a slightly smaller club that's easy to find in SF, then this place is worth checking out. Good service, affordable drinks and a backyard patio area to get a breather and cool off are very nice perks.

Downsides are parking is scarce if it's after 11pm, gets really crowded around midnight, music might not be your cup of tea at times.
author: Marc Y.

description: My first experience here was really fun.  All the drinks were half off and there's no cover.  I guess whenever that's the case, you know all the Asians in San Francisco will be there.  That means I got to kick it with all the friends from high school and alumni from my fraternity that I haven't seen it a while.  They have one large bar in the front and a smaller one in the back. and tables to sit at.  There's people dancing everywhere and getting to the bathroom or the patio means a lot of pushing and shoving.  Get there early, cuz the line gets long!  Hungry afterward?  There are food carts right around the corner.
author: Dean W.

description:
THREE CHEERS FOR THE HOLY COW!!! (And no I'm not being sarcastic).

I had to say that because it got so badly dissed on this site I had to laugh out loud. I've never seen so many bad reviews for one listing. Yep, what they say is true. It is a total dive. Hot, sweaty, crowded, the floors are sticky, you have to practically scream to talk to your friends (I don't remember it smelling like anything except liquor but I suppose it has its off-nights). I haven't been to this place in a looong time but from what I remember the bathrooms were just horrible, toilets broken, doors barely closed. Lots of trampy looking and acting women and at least as many manly morons. Get out the riff raff repellent. High forecast for some idiot bumping into you with a drink. Fights break out. I even got my purse stolen here ON MY BIRTHDAY 6 years ago and vowed if i ever found that bi-ch who got away with my $400 digital camera and then used my credit card to charge $100 worth of booze, I would wrap my hands around her neck and keep squeezing till I couldn't feel a pulse.

No, the holy cow is not for the pamered Parises of the universe. You gotta be slightly nuts to like the holy cow. Which is probably why I loved it.

Even after that trama of getting ripped off, The Holy Cow was still my favorite place to go dancing. Yep, it's a damn piece of work all right. But that was part of what made it special. IT'S A FREE FRICKIN DANCE CLUB FOR CHRISSAKE! What in the world do people expect when most dance clubs charge 20 bucks? (Complaining about the riff raff is like going to McDonald's, ordering a Big Mac with Fries, and then wondering why you're not getting the same experience as when you went to Ruth Chris' Steakhouse). Yep, the Cow has it's share of riff raff, but... it's also like shopping at the Goodwill As-Is Store  http://www.yelp.com/biz/xWWdKbmMTR-VgFwdJeA8JA . You have to dig through lots of crap to find the gems but it's all in the joy of the dig. If you don't like getting your hands dirty, FORGET IT. 

Or perhaps what's really going on is I've learned to embrace my own riff-raffiness....

My roommates owned the joint 10 yrs ago (when the cow hanging off the bldg actually looked like a cow and not some bizzare half-leopard) so I used to go there quite a bit.  I don't know what kind of music they're playing these days but I LOVED how they used to play the Clash, the Cure, Right Said Fred.... The campier the better!!! (And I hated techno so I was so happy with their quirky, upbeat alt. pop / rock selection). Even when my friends and I would pay full price to go to other clubs, we'd wind up back at the cow because we really did like the music they played back then. But I guess it's a new generation now (Christina Aguilera was barely known back then, though I do like her). I suppose me talking about how much fun it was to dance to "Come on Eileen" by Dexy's Midnight Runners must sound like my parents talking about what a great time they had boppin' to "Rock around the clock" by Bill Haley and the Comets...  

My girl friends and I haven't been here in about 5 years, partly because they're shacked up, settled, and all of us are now so keenly aware that we're now we're the thirtysomething  "grandmas" we used to joke about when we were in our 20's! (yep, karma's a bitch). True, I haven't been there in awhile but man the reviews on this site sure do make it sound like nothing's changed and people are still flocking to it like they did back when I used to go there. I'm glad to see The Cow is still the same as ever. 

Love it or leave it!

-----------
UPDATE:  Apparently there's another Yelp review/listing for the Holy Cow.  http://www.yelp.com/biz/StBt7OkmqkNDe6brfe2MGQ. Weird...it's almost as if calling it THE Holy Cow makes it entirely different club. The reviewers at the other review site weren't nearly as mean as they are on this one. What's with everybody jumping on the Hate Train here?
author: Laura S.

description:
What's with the cheetah outside. It's supposed to be a cow, but every time I look at it, I think cheetah.

So this is the spot on Thursdays night for underage drinking. They offer a half off until midnight special. I think the cheetah on Thursdays turns into a Cougar, because this is where they all come.

What's with the black dude always dancing on 'stage' in the corner?
author: Dennis L.

description:
This is fine if you just turned 21 today and don't know where else to go in the city ( ie. you don't have internet or have no friends) but if you are over 21 and hanging out here, something is wrong with you.  

It's a mess, in here..........crowded, bad service, weak drinks and too many people with fake IDs or that just shouldn't be out in public.  The drinks come in glasses that are so dirty that I actually question what disease I may catch drinking from it.   No one in here is good looking and the older men in here are sketchy and just waiting for a girl who is too drunk to know who she is going home with to succumb to their cheesy pick up lines.

That said, yes this was fun for me once, a long time ago, but then I discovered places that weren't gross, had sticky floors, had attractive people, and decent drinks.  And I have not been back since.

This is one of the few places I would actually say that I don't want to go to if someone suggested it.  And people that know me know that I rarely say that-I'm open to anything and anywhere almost if I have good company.  But good company can't compensate for the less than desirable crowd here.

Yeah there is no cover here but maybe that is because the kids that come here are still using mom and dad's money to pay for their dining hall cards and don't' have cash to buy much more than the cheap weak drinks they make here!
author: Denise B.

description:
Dirty, smelly, nasty latino fat dudes, wine that tastes like cocktail onions......

don't touch me.

no, i don't want to dance with you.

please wear deodorant.

i'm smoking by myself and would like to keep it that way!!

i really loathe this place.  i hope it dies in a fire!
author: Christina S.

description:
Came here this past Thursday with a couple of my friends and met up with a couple more there.

Arrived a little before 11 and there was no line to get in.  Drinks are definitely cheap as advertised ($20 for 4 jaeger bombs = HELL YEA!).  Dance floor is definitely small and by the end of the night you had a hard time moving around more than just in your immediate area.  The crowd is mixed though i would say predominantly Asian and mostly younger (early to mid 20's).

Only knocks are the crowded-ness of the place and also the fact that the neighborhood is a bit sketchier than I originally thought.  I had my window smashed in and some stuff stolen from my car (obviously not Holy Cow's fault but still a factor).  If you go, it's definitely worth it to spring for parking in one of the garages nearby and having some peace of mind about your car.

All in all though, I like the chill atmosphere (figuratively not literally cuz it was hot as hell in there) and the cheap drinks.  Definitely a good hangout for poor college kids/post-grads.
author: Chris C.

description:
Horrible!!! awful !!! Worse place in San Francisco, I would take away stars if I could. This placed ruined my night. Normally i don't give reviews,, but this place really deserve my review..
I took my friends (turist) to show the nice and the beauty of the city...
but it was a complete disaster...the took the worse perception of the bars in the city..
we ordered drinks and the bartender told us that the place will close in about half and hour but ,we will have enough time to finish the drinks.. couple minutes after the security guy (bold tall guy) walked by and told us that we need to leave (around 1:35pm) and we explained what the bartender told us, and THE SECURITY GUY  said " I DON'T CARE YOU HAVE TO LEAVE NOW".. 
so we asked to the bartender and he said that we can finish the drink by the door... 
when we were by the door trying to finish the drink the same security (bold guy) walked by and took my drink out of my hands.. i didn't know how to react !! and he start sworn,, saying the F word... twice  The worst part about the whole thing is it was more customers inside the bar and he discriminate us because our nationality...
 I won't ever come here again ,,, also i found two girls having sex on the bathroom and having drugs and the bold security was outside the bathroom allowing this happens..!!!!

BTW: i click on one start cuz doesn't let me do the review... but this place deserve minus 10 starts
author: Nina K.

description:
A member of our group that night heard hip hop wafting past the front door as we walked by and made the rest of us go in.  Not knowing what kind of sh!t-show we were getting ourselves into, the rest of us obliged.  A moment or two after walking in, you have to ask yourself if this place is for real. 

Absolutely horrible music/DJing, sticky floors, tons of frat boys types and international guys looking for an easy, American-girl lay.  Girls, stay away from this place--walk in and you've become a target...it's like a prison yard in here. 

In my 10 years of frequenting bars, I'd never seen a middle aged man on a dance floor with his hand down his pants, flagrantly pleasing himself--thanks to the Holy Cow, I can now claim such an acheivement.
author: Oggie B.

description:
Not a fan of this place. For some reason, the bouncers told us we couldn't wear jackets with hoods when we walked in. AND, they actually enforced it. Pretty lame, since it was cold. 

Pool table was crooked. I've never seen a billiard ball curve towards a pocket that way before... Plus, you had to pay for each game.

Drinks were pretty standard. Was impressed with the bartender's speed. Rum and coke was meh. Kamikazes were good. 

Big plus is of course the happy hour which lasts till I believe...11pm? 

Check out Wish, which is literally next door. Way better place. Wish (no pun intended) they had the same happy hour times as Holy Cow but whatever.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
I have a theory that no one who actually lives in San Francisco actually goes to this place. 

What's the best way to describe it?

Oh I got it:
It's like a meat market where all the meat is past due.

It is capital of chode city.
author: Jackie I.

description:
Holy cow, this place sucks!

Bouncers and bartenders were unfriendly. Drinks were expensive. $10 for a shot of grey goose!!!!

+1 for the friendly crowd.
author: Matthew J.

description: Nothing to see here. Should be on my worst of SOMA list...
author: Jeremy S.

description:
The Good: Cheap drinks on thursdays, generally not overcrowded considering its size
The Bad: 25$ minimum for a card, one time the bouncers didn't let my friend in because he was black, they said it was a dress code issue...it wasn't a dress code issue. The place is small, this isn't a place where you go get VIP treatment bad music
The Ugly: Alright so check it out, its not a "dive bar" its a "i don't give a fuck" bar, the girls are okay the music is really not that good but if you're a guy going to a bar for the music you probably aren't worried about the girls anyway... I go there because its hassle free, it doesn't attract stuck up assholes
author: Danny b.

description:
This is a review coming from someone who does NOT drink. So, if you don't drink but still know how to have fun at bars read on. 

As I said before I don't like to drink; so, cheap drinks don't have any appeal to me. I came here on the suggestion of a friend. I was looking for a chill place where I could dance and my friends could get drinks. The appeal was that there was no cover. 

When I got there me and my friends were immediately pushed ahead of the line to the front; so, I thought "Yes awesome! No wait and no cover!". BUT then we got inside. 

Crowded doesn't even begin to describe how packed it was. I have been in plenty of crowded clubs and bars but I think almost falling over 5 times (not exaggerating) because you are sandwiched between people and can barely stand, is a bit too much for me. It seemed like the only places on the dance floor that had room were surrounded by creepy guys. 

They had okay music, definitely some songs you could dance too but as I said its really small; so, being able to dance is really hard. I like to go all out when I dance and only having enough room to shift back and forth is not my idea of a good time. 

Maybe it's not always this crowded but I'd rather go somewhere else.
author: Jessica F.

description: This is my favorite joint to go dancing in SF. We came here for my sister's bachelorette party and got free drinks from the bar most of the night. We were also able to take over the back room so we had our own tables and dance area. The music is kind of old school rap/hip hop/r&b, as well as new pop. Really good stuff to dance too, no techno garbage. The bartenders are always crazy nice, the place is huge so it's easy to find a spot to take over with your friends, the bathroom line is never more than 4 gals, there is a coat check and their isn't a cover charge, or if there is, it's cheap. Things don't really get going here till about 10-10:30 though so don't show up too early. I'm not into yuppy, overpriced clubs, so this is right up my little alley.
author: Sam H.

description:
Wow, a TWO STAR average for this place! Don't be such a hater!

Okay, so maybe it's kinda true what they say: yes, it's a tad ghetto...we even saw a pretty intense bar fight break out inside between like, ten people. Not cool. 

But geez, other than that, this is a centrally located, fairly spacious and well-ventilated place to go dancing without having to pay a cover, with a mixed crowd...I am morally opposed to paying covers, I just can't bring myself to do it. They played cool, fun, dancy top 40 music and people who I didn't want to talk to pretty much left me alone for the most part. One of the bartenders hooked us up with drinks the whole night...I mean, really, aside from the fight, which happened at the very end of the night, I can't complain!
author: Shannon R.

description:
love gettin ur ass rubbed? COME HERE! ahha

chill bar to go to when u have no other options. watevaa..............
author: Rosalynn D.

description:
Holy Cow? Holy sh*t is more apt. 

I went here twice on different occasions always after a slew of drinks and this bar still failed to impress. The crowd is strikingly "ghetto" (and I know ghetto because I lived in Oakland) and it's worse than that, the crowd is just absurdly crass. In their defense, I think these partially clad patrons are newbies to drinking legally in bars so they make the most of it. 

A letter to the Holy Cow crowd: 

Ladies-
No, I have my own g-string thanks & I don't need to see yours, girlfriend and when you quit wildly gyrating on that young dudes crotch you can put your left boob back in the spandex headband that you're wearing as a shirt. 

Guys- 
Dude, you look all thugged out frat boy but your two facial hairs are growing in opposite directions and that chain of aluminum foil needs to go. I know you wore the blazer and the sunglasses to accessorize your cranium but you look plain dumb standing there watching that chick with the headband shirt do that there.
author: Jessica D.

description:
I came here a few weekends ago with some of my girlfriends.  As it seems to be a common practice, we walked right in past the line of mostly dudes.  And no cover, right on.  Cheap drinks, yes. $4 vodka redbull is pretty much unheard of.  The sleaze is definitely present but, really, where is it not?  At least here it's not dressed in Armani trying to disguise itself! 

The outback porch is a nice touch as it gets pretty steamy inside with all the drunkies dancing their cares away.  The coat check is convenient too.

Let's be honest, Holy Cow is not a classy place... but it's not meant to be.  It's a younger crowd, top forty music, and totally unpretentious.
author: Olivia D.

description:
No.  Just no.  

This place is nasty, and not in an "overly divey so therefore it's hip" kind of way, but rather an "ohmigod please please please get me outta here, why the f*ck did you drag me into this hell hole?!" kind of way. 

No.  Just no.
author: Thuy L.

description:
This bar is exactly what you would expect from the moment you want in...it's somewhat of a meat market.
This is the thing...you want to get sweat on you?...you want to get bumped a bunch o' times and then feel like you're for sale with the amount of eyes on your butt....go to Holy Cow. 

That being said...I usually always get my dance on here - my friend actually gasped at my adoration for Top 40 "crap" music...
but if I want to "drop it like it's hawt" ...I will tell people that this place will guarantee your best friend a make-out session (if you're a good wing woman)...a good dance work out, a decent beverage and a lot of great people watchin'.

However...if you want any room to dance, want eyes not to be directly pointed at your butt by 10 dudes and would like to listen to somethin' a little more creative - go elsewhere.

Being that I'm not 22 anymore...I know there are better dance clubs in the city...but still think of this place when I think of my younger days and the crazy-times vibe you'll always find here.
author: Katy A.

description:
This is bar 5 of 5 of the ENTIRE labor day weekend, and 3 of 3 on the Sunday of Labor Day weekend, read my reviews on Milk and Club 6, and you will then understand that, THE HOLY COW NEVER LETS YOU DOWN!!!

1st off, after having 2 bad experiences with whack ass security guards at the previous places, I was surprised to see extremely cheery and welcoming security guards greeting us. Not to mention cute!

The music was off the hook, and drink prices are reasonable. There is a mixed crowd, preppy, ghetto, college kids, you name it. I like that. 

I have come to this establishment as a plan b after many other clubs (read my review on Loft 11) , and have always been pleased by the outcome. I will be sure to be back again soon!!!
author: Stacy S.

description:
Vaguely dodgy for the most part. I walked in to the muted tones of "I get knocked down" and wiggled a right hip whilst trying to siddle up to the appropriate bar-waitress. 

"I love your t-shirt!" she screamed.

Right; common sense says repay the compliment with a nifty "I love yours too!" But a brief neck drop to her twins left that thought swirling in sexual misdemeanor. Drat.

So to the joint... the music was a bit naffy (in many respects I'm too white to gyrate). The drinks were a bit fancy, and almost helped compensate for my distinct inability to pick up girls in an environment of "oh, I love hip hop! don't you?" - "no!"

It was fun, mind you.
author: Marc M.

description:
This place has no class.

The big black man out front makes guys tuck their shirts in.... and lets them in if they partake in the act of half assing a shirt tuck, where it's only tucked in the front. 

Why even ask guys to tuck in their shirts? = Fake class

This was a bad sign. 
We get in, Yep I was right

Go here if you want to be poked and prodded and stared at inappropriately by second class humans who are desperately on the prowl. 

The air is filed with testosteroned out sleazy horniness, any minor disagreement would turn into a full on fight with stab wounds and gsw's
author: ZacKandMeL M.

description:
I always liked Holy Cow on THURSDAY nights. bit less crowded than normally and 1/2 off drinks til midnight. Ive usually enjoyed my holy cow nights, but can see why it can leave a bad tastes in some mouths. 
You really get what you pay for and since Holy Cow is free, well there ya go. Its a perfect college bar. I know many clubs I was in threw parties down at the holy cow and all the boys and girls had fun. Parking usually sucks.

I miss my hot college girl friends dancing on the little stages.
author: Bryan N.

description: I've only been here on Thursdays with the half off drink specials till midnight.  Music is okay.  Space to boogie is definitely limited.  Pool table is available for those who want to be socially awkward.  Big smoking area in the back.  Crowd generally consist of your college-aged party goers.
author: Allen T.

description:
HOLY COW this place SUCKS!

There are so many better places to go in the city, why waste your time & money here.

The bouncer had the nerve to see if I was wearing a collared shirt!
author: Keith R.

description:
What?!?! How is it that this place only has 2.5 stars? Cuz from what I remember...

It was a house full of friendly, non-pretentious, "Come on, dance with me!" kind of people. I loved it! 

I got pretty tipsy that night...rather quickly, thanks to the yum drinks! The kind-of-bright lighting in there gave this place a casual vibe. It was literally packed with people that Saturday night, and we had a hell of a time battling the dancing drunks to get to the restrooms.

They played a few of my fave Britney songs, and I had so much fun dancing with my friends! They wrapped up the last 20 minutes of the night with 80's pop/rock. It was unexpectedly awesome! 

I wish there were places like this in Oakland.
author: Shiki W.

description:
aw come on guys! this place isn't so bad.

but different tastes do exist. this place happened to fit mine. wandered in around 10:30ish, the place was a bit empty so the mister & i managed to get seats at the bar. i got a gin & tonic, he tried ordering a vodka collins, but:

"a vodka what?"
"a vodka collins?"
"a vodka and what? how do you make that?"
"uh. i'll just get a gin & tonic."
"a what?"
"i'll have what she's having."

so basically don't expect some mixological gastronomical experience (/sarcasm), this place is definitely a place for some grungy gritty dancing fun. the place quickly filled up. lots of people dancing like they don't care, and a couple of solo dudes waving their hands around trying to make eye contact with groups of ladies. but if you don't care, no one else cares, which is a perfect kind of place to let your hair down and your weird out.
author: Jenny T.

description:
It was August 2003, we were leaving a party and someone in our group convinced us to go the Holy Cow.  When my girl friend and I swung open the door to the place, I think we both audibly gasped.  It was an intimidating sea of dudes.  Don't get me wrong, I like dudes, but the ratios felt like 6:1 or  so.   

We got hit on, we got hassled, we got out as fast as we could.  

I recently received an evite to a bachelorette party that listed the Holy Cow as one of the "stops".  I declined the invitation.
author: Karen F.

description:
Horrid.  I consider each of the two times I wandered in here (must have been very inebriated, confused, lost, or all of the above), to be a complete mistake.

One time, they played the last Christina Aguilera album from beginning to end.  Now, I'm not trying to hate on X-tina (sisterhood, ya'll), but COME ON!  get a real dj. And Holy Cow, get some clientele that aren't 40-somethings wearing cowboy boots.
author: Sid D.

description:
When I start comparing the bathroom to Zeitgeist, you know your ass is getting crabs. 

I was dragged into here with friends of friends and had to use the bathroom. After making my way through The Popped Collar Ocean, I found the bathrooms which were unisex, nothing wrong with that. After waiting for five minutes I entered the worst bathroom ever. I am not kidding!

Recalling my time in Turkey, using a hole in the ground, was much more enjoyable than this. Not to mention, I feel really bad for the guy next to me who was vomiting. When I would rather *SLEEP* in the porta potty at Zeitgeist. This bathroom is on par with a Tijuana whorehouse.

1) Don't sit on the toilet seats
2) Go to 1
author: Bathrooms Only ..

description:
this review is for THURSDAY nights... 

always super jam packed. filled with drunkkk kids, probably the most DISGUSTING crowd, SWEAT everywhere. and from the looks of it, i wouldn't be surprised if more than half the crowd was underage. 

one word: gross.
author: Lisa N.

description: Someone is pickpocketing at this place. My peeps went Thursday, Sept 16 & got her phone stolen outta her back pocket & another person got hers stolen outta her purse. Don't go here with your eyes closed...
author: Donna D.

description:
This is a horrible, horrible place.  Never come here.  I agree with the Yelpster who said the staff is obnoxious.  Also, the music sucks...it's like turning on a cheesy radio station and trying to get your party on...so, so sad.  I've only been to the Holy Cow once and I still have nightmares.  Save yourself.

I'm disappointed I had to give them one star to post this review.
author: Cat M.

description:
As opposed to the majority of the reviews given for Holy Cow, I had a good time at this bar! 

The dance floor was packed, but that's why we danced on the stage...and on the bar. The DJ was spinning hot hot hot music - a good mixture of House, Hip-Hop, and Top 40, and even threw in "Everyday People" by Arrested Development, heeeey. Looking back, his music, and dancing on the stage/bar was the perfect combination for the night. 

Also, watch out for the lurky guys that roam around this place, they're super aggressive.

I only have one complaint: the credit card minimum is $25.00, what the hell?
author: Angelica C.

description: This is my Thursday party.  I really only go here because me exboyfriend is one of the bouncers and they a have half price drinks until midnight.  It is really crowded, you will get groped on the dance floor while trying to get to the back patio, and the bar tenders are... lets say busy.  Though it is easy to talk shit about the cow, everybody does come here, its a good place to take friends from out of town, and sometimes it gets you a make-out session with one of the drunk girls in line outside. Ah, the cow....
author: Meara G.

description:
You WILL get a drink spilled on you. You WILL get mad at someone for elbowing you. You WILL get a hangover from cheap vodka. You WILL get hit on by the creepster in the corner.

But you will have the freaking funnest Thursdays of your life. I promise you that.

Ladies, take my advice and do not show up in your "Get Some" Heels and booty shorts. You will look out of place and wish that you were wearing Uggs or Converses like the rest of us. You will not have to wait in line because who makes ladies wait outside in the cold?

Show up at 1100pm on Thursday night and pound down as many drinks as you can until 1200 midnight when the half off special ends. You WILL have to fight your way into the dance floor but once you get there it is all good! They play Top 40 and random oldies but when you are drunk off your ass from JagerBombs and Redbull Vodkas...who cares what they play?!

The bartenders are friendly. The bouncers don't take girls wait in line. The alcohol is cheap. In my book, this makes Holy Cow a-okay.

College kids, take advantage of the cheap alcohol. Trust.
author: Jo Ann E.

description:
I read the yelp reviews before I went there on Saturday, so I had low expectations.. . 

Its located in an area where I found street parking a couple of blocks away.  It's a good idea to walk with friends.  There is no cover charge but a bit of a trashy crowd. We arrived there near midnight so the line was short.  Annoyed that a few (ugly and not so classy) men cut in front of me in line. We claimed an empty booth were we were able to sit and put our things down.

There's a lounge area near the bathrooms which I thought was weird because it mostly had couples making out there. 

The music was okay, I not a fan of techno music.  The did play some old and fun songs though.  Overall, I had a good time because I was with a group of friends who know how to have fun. But if you are looking for something upscale go else where!
author: Jill C.

description: Seriously, holy cow no pun intended. It was a Thursday night and I heard it's half off, but we didn't go for that. We went because it was our cousin's last night before being ship back to his motherland. We arrive here late (long story) around 1:00 pm so it was packed. As I was waiting to get in, there's a guy who made a big ruckus and the bouncer whom I thought was very nice took him to the side to talk to him nicely not like most bouncers. This place was so packed that we had to push our way through. It was crazy and it's only Thursday! The decor was very mid western like. I didn't get anything to drink which was a shame but I couldn't get through. Oh well...maybe next time, but I still had fun, but next time maybe not with so many people.
author: Nha H.

description: If there was an epicenter of everything that is terrible about bars in the city, Holy Cow would be it. Barely legal crowd, obnoxious staff, and a nasty atmosphere make this place the top of the wrecking ball list.
author: Michael G.

description:
This place is fun. I came here with a group of friends after the initial part of my birthday celebration ended; we wanted to go dancing but no one was down to pay a cover and Holy Cow was walking distance from the restaurant. 

I like the layout, with the two rooms, but the stages are hilarious- actually, I always think they're funny because girls get up on them and think they are SOO cool and...well ok that's enough.

It was crowded but not overwhelmingly so. I didn't personally order a drink so I can't attest to those, but it looked like the ones my friends had were decent sized and couldn't have been that expensive.

I'd go again...but probably less dressed up and not carrying giftbags.
author: Emilia S.

description:
I was gonna start off my review with "Holy cow, this place stinks!  Literally."  But damn...someone beat me to it!  That tells you a whole lot in terms of swaying people AWAY from this place though!  

No cover charge here.  Cool.  But I kept asking myself if that was worth walking through the pool of what my friends and I describe as "hot breath, stinky feet, body odor, butt, and sweaty balls."  No, absolutely not.  Luckily, we found seats somewhere away from the crowd.  According to my friends, the drinks are very cheap for a lot of alcohol.  They had trouble sipping on their mixed drinks!

We left after my friends reached the height of their buzz.  You will not find me there again unless I somehow lost my sense of smell. *knock on wood*
author: Zee W.

description:
This place is a complete dive that no self-respecting San Franciscan should ever step into. 

Unless you are completely hammered from all the drinks that were sent to your table of four girls at The Public a couple doors down and need to dance it off to bad music in a "safe" environment (read: a place where no one you know will witness your repressed pole dancer alter ego emerge).
author: Deb I.

description: Went out on Saturday to check out the place. The staff was INCREDIBLE! Very professional security staff, attentive (and hot) bartenders-everyone was definitely enjoying themselves. The bridge was closed and the place was still hopping. Can't wait to return!
author: Mara T.

description:
The Holy Cow is consistently good place for regular people to go. 
There is lots of room to escape from the crowded main area. You can either go off into the newer bar area off to the left or outside. The best thing about this place is there is never a cover! And, the bartenders are usually very quick and work the bar very consistently.

As always, the bouncers can be dicks...and aren't very good at managing the capacity of this place. And, the music is often too loud.

Great place to end-up at night - getting a cab down on Folsom is a chore tho, so plan to leave before last call.
author: Dan M.

description:
I remember going to The Holy Cow when I first moved to the bay area and I wasn't even 21 yet, I remember thinking man this place is terrible but fun. I would go there like it was a college bar and get as wasted as possible and find some lucky girl to make out with :-)  Thankfully I realized that I cannot keep going to this place and I have to find girls that I can make out with even without having 10 drinks and a couple shots...

Now when I go to Wish Bar or Sushi Groove South I can only smile and think of all of the fun times I had there. If you are interested in being like the bridge and tunnel crowd, getting so wasted you or your new friend you just met will probably puke then this is your place. Party buses full of drunks are always more than welcome to this place.  I love the picture of the cop car in front, it is soooo true, there is always some sort of shit going down there. Maybe one night on a dare I will go in there and see if I still have the magic touch, probably not though.
author: Bobby B.

description:
You walk in and the first words you'll utter are 'HOLY COW!'.

And when they give you your bar tab..you'll 'HOLY COW' twice!  It's dirt cheat..it's not the best place nor even close to it.  But hey, if you want to pre-party in SOMA at a makeshift stop (and no one's home to go to).  Once in a while..I'll come here from 9-10 to get the night started.  :)

This place just makes you want to drink more.  I'm not sure why...well I might know why...
author: Yup S.

description: Went on sat. Pretty fun. Everybody crowds to one side and dances infront of exits. That was Kinda retarded. Music was a mix of 80s and todays hits. Easy to get drink. Bartenders were cool. Over all I had a good time
author: Rico G.

description:
Holy Cow!!!

I come here with my 20+ year old friends who always refer to me as "their coolest 39 year old friend they know"...I really didnt like it as much because the alcohol although not as expensive are what i usually refer to as "kool-aid"...maybe because i dont know the bartenders enough to hook me up with alcohol....almost the same as the other clubs at Broadway...i dont like them because their filthy...but then again there is no cover charge.

After watching THIS IS IT!!! Teddybear suddenly feel the need for some dancing and surprised me with going here....the thing is he was wearing his work boots which wasnt accepted as far as their dress code is...really? Well, i guess when my baby want s to go dancing he has to go dancing so we went back to his dad's house to get some shoes and went back.

So its all good, we were let in...we were ID'd... okay a couple of 40 year olds...we ordered our first cocktail...and yes we went there to dance...of course like I said the place was full of 20 year olds....but my babe whom i usually refer to as 20 year old...doesnt mind dancing since we came there to have a good time....we hit the dance floor and started dancing....we started it...and everyone just dance....it was all good.
author: Malou C.

description: Gets dirty, crowded, and hot...but I've spent a many days dancing on their stage in a drunken haze. No cover, no really buff scary bouncers. Just down right fun!!! Thursdays are the night as it is half price booze. Good college hang out...but I've moved on to better places...I'd go back for their cheap drinks.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Ah, The Cow.

Rarely does a "straight" bar get good nods from me, but this place tight here is certainly one of my favorite spots.

Obviously, Thursday nights are the nights to go. Great music. CHEAP AS HELL drinks...all in all a good time.

The place gets EXTREMELY crowded. I'm talking the guy next to you smells bad because his deodorant he just put on is running crowded.

Take a Thursday night trip there. It'll be great.
author: Trav M.

description:
I heard it mentioned in hushed voices and because there was no cover decided to go in.

As you walk across the dance floor, you can just watch people assigning you a number on a scale of one to ten. If they like you, they go for your butt. I've been to classier frat parties. 

The funny part is if you see someone you know and you're both like, "Uh, what are *you* doing here? Uh, my friend wanted to go." Uh, yeah.
author: Ellie P.

description:
Okay, everyone, it is the Holy Cow.  It is that place you never want to plan a night out at, or never really intend to end up at, but when you end up there, you will have an amazing night.

It is free, so, really, can you complain?  Drinks are nicely priced, so, again, can you complain? Bouncers are very friendly.  They have two bars, a dance floor, outside smoking area in the back, pool tables, lounge area....  Oh, and you can't forget the pizza place, crepe truck, and hotdog cart all ready for inebriated eating within stumbling distance.  

Truthfully, I have had a wonderful time every single time I go.  So, why is there this stigma of it being "the holy cow......." instead of being said with a smile?  I'm torn between a 3 star and a 4 star rating......and I think it has more to do with the stigma that I can't quite rid myself of than with the fun nights out had there...

But go with good company (and lots of dudes if you're a lady), and you won't notice the rest of the freaks, except when you're drunk and people watching.  Take good company, but good cheap drinks, and you're set.
author: MiYong E.

description:
Holy Cow is nothing more than a run-down meat market renovated into what the owners call a "bar."

Here's a quick review of the lay out.  When you first walk in, there is a coat check to your immediate left, a row of small booths to your right and a large circular bar in front of you.  When you make a left you walk into a pool area with "thugs" but you want to stay away from this area because it smells like stinky feet all the time.  As you make your way towards the back, there is a dance floor area to your right and left.  In the far back left there are restrooms but it's so friggin small that you can't even turn around (and I'm small to begin with).  If I remember correctly there's an outdoor patio in the back but I was drunk so maybe I was just imagining things.

There is no cover charge and drinks are half off up until midnight when I last went on a Thursday.  In essence, this place is for poor college students, creepers who are too cheap to pay for a cover charge and "thugs" who sit around a pool table acting tough yet they sip on their beers.

I'd only come back if I were drunk enough so that I'd forget I was ever here.

==========

-3 Stars for its trashy-ness

*2 Stars out of 5*
author: Chris Y.

description:
NOPE

I went here for my friend's birthday and had a terrible night. Be prepared to be groped by drooling drunken fools. Someone even snapped my photo when I wasn't looking. What's that for? Show your friends some girl you didn't talk to? Late night alone time?

I was out of cash, obviously, but I didn't expect a $25 minimum!

No cover means more creeps, and the streets get scarier as more dudes keep pumping booze in.
author: Brittany L.

description:
This place is a horrible parody of itself. Drunk girls dancing on the bar/pretending to be lesbians, check. Popped collars and striped shirts, check. Drama mamas crying in the corner, check. Bartenders that would rather dance on and grope each other than serve drinks, check (aside: the bartenders were attractive, but the softcore action would have been far more enjoyable if my BAC were above 0%). Horrible top 40 music, check. 
The drinks were weak when i was there, or maybe they just weren't strong enough. A slight buzz would have really helped as I had to wade through the undulating sea of gropers, bros, and college freshmen that can't hold their liquor.
+ one star because apparently if it's your birthday, you get free drinks, and if you get the dumb floozy bartender (HA! Nevermind -- they all are) she won't check your ID.
author: Amanda L.

description:
No cover charge, an eclectic group of people, and interesting decor.

As clubs go, the Cow is pretty good. Sure, you have the bitchy bar babies that think all the guys that look at them want them - then go throw up in the bathroom while their nominally more sober friends cock block and gossip in grating voices as you wait for some drunk chick to get out of a stall so you can pee, and there's the drunk pervs that breathe all over you, spill their drinks on your shirt, or grind on your ass with their roll of dimes without asking, but what bar doesn't have all that?

The bouncers are usually pretty strict about the dress code. No jeans, tshirts, tennis shoes/sneakers, sports or team wear, or excessively baggy clothes.   

The music is typical club fare.  If you aren't a pompous music snob bent on holding your nose in the air, you can dance and have a good time.  Or watch the people dancing and have a laugh.

I'd recommend you go as a group. It's more fun that way.
author: L.A. W.

description:
So I've heard a lot about this place and apparently "everyone" goes but I've never been until yesterday. And I don't think I'll be coming back anytime soon... unless someone drives me there & back and bribes me with Seniore's or Nation's afterwards, hahaha.

This place isn't as janky as I thought it would be but it's definitely one of those places where you have to have a good buzz & good company to have fun. Otherwise, the crowdedness, dirtiness, piss smell on the dance floor, drunk girls who shove and step on your feet with their stiletto heels, and aggressive/creepy/ugly guys are a recipe for a bad night.

One extra star on top of the lowest rating because I actually had fun!
author: Miss H.

description: If I end up here one more drunk time because my drunk friends insist on going here, I will......harm myself. It is filthy, dirty, cheap, and sweaty. The bathrooms are filthy with not enough toilet paper. I don't know why I let them convince me. Oh yeah, because I'm drunk too. Last time we came, the men's bathroom was overflowing and water was seeping out of the door. GROSS!!!!!!!!!!
author: Claudia L.

description:
I like to dance.  I like to drink.  That's my justification for the 2 - Stars.  I can only be persuaded to come to this San Diego, whorish kind of place if I am so drunk that I revert to Middle - School/High - School tendencies. 

You know, getting a woody on the fact that there is music and drunk people around.  How pathetic.

I've been there twice and the second time I was so drunk that while I was dancing with a girl she cut her foot on broken glass and I proceeded to pick up her foot and lick the blood off.  I can live without that night.

Trust me, I've had my HIV check up since.  I GOT LUCKY!
author: Justin C.

description:
Rowdy, low-culture, smelly, dirty, anything-goes no-cover dance bar.  It's not classy, but neither am I, so this place is my jam. Love it!

Yelpers voting down Holy Cow for not being upscale, clean, classy, and otherwise unsavory are totally missing the point. 

This place is a riot.  Cheap drinks, cheesy music you know by heart, ample room to dance, and a HUGE amount of space for private time with friends and dates.  Everything about Holy Cow is a defiant karate chop to the nuts to the pretense that pollutes SoMa nightlife, and you won't find a drop of that here.  People dance like nobody's watching.

You're also shit out of luck if you came here to fight or want to get aggressive when dancing with women that aren't feeling it -- I saw bouncers snatch and eject a few rightfully deserving low-lifes and the crowd just rolled with it.  The DJ was very in-tune with the groups, calling out people and requests at all hours, and there seemed to be an idealistic distribution of men/women and ethnicities to boot. 

My only beef -- don't bring a coat and hat, you'll pay double to check your stuff.  The bar minimum is reasonable but the drinks are so cheap that you're going to have to pound at least four if you're alone, so bring a friend!  See you on Thursdays in your trashy clothes :)
author: niero g.

description: How can you miss it? A cow statue is hanging in front of it. There's no cover charge, but you get what you pay for. Waiting in line for that long isn't worth all the trouble. Seems like they play the same music over again each weekend. Only redeeming quality I see about this place is that they have pool table. Pass... Let me say this again... This place is crappy. I wish we would give zero stars on Yelp. This place is in need of that.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
So this is the place to be when you're back from college and wanting a grand thirsty Thursday night. I like how there isn't a cover, there aren't promoters at the end of the night shoving every possible flyer hot off the press shoved in your hands, and I bump into ol' friends here from time to time. 

The cons: dance floor is puny, it's hot and musty, the drinks aren't too great, it's hella mothereffin crowded once 11:30pm strikes, and there are way too many creepers (or what is it with men turning into creepers when they get drunk?). 

The music is pretty okay for variety but once that dance floor is filled you know what it feels like to be sardines in a can. It's not safe to push yourself through and it doesn't help at all when someone is pushing from all sides around.... This isn't my favorite place to be but i don't mind coming here once ever so often.
author: Marie G.

description:
All I have to say is

HOLY COW

It seemed like a promising place? Good music, lots of people, fast bartenders. 

But honestly

1) If it's crowded, there is no room to dance, AT ALL.
2) Some of the people that go here are really shady. One guy grabbed my friend's butt and another was stroking my arm and smiling at me funny? Overall, it was just weird people. Maybe it's like this at a lot of places in SF, but I don't like that type of crowd.
3) The outdoor patio is just a smoking section to the EXTREME. I don't mind cigarette smoke, but I stepped out there and I couldn't take it.
4) Normal drink prices are steep. They have a good cosmo though :)

Maybe just don't go thursday nights? It was a happy hour (from 9-12, drinks half off, 1 dollar beers) but it was STILL busy at 1 and there was still a large line to get in.

Good thing? You get in easily if you are a girl :)

Yea, I probably won't be going back, because I'd only want to go back if it wasn't busy, but I would have to pay normal prices for drinks, and that's definitely not worth it. It was entertaining for a little bit though. There were tons of funny drunk people to watch :)
author: Sarah M.

description:
This is a place to go to when you want to make mistakes.  These can be small mistakes, like choosing to listen the blandest party music there is or wearing club gear that doesn't quite fit properly on you anymore.   Or they can be mistakes of a much larger scale.   Somehow I think your chances of being roofied, getting your pocket picked or catching a really bad commmunicable disease are higher here than any other place in SF.  

That said (and the reason for the second star) there is a time and a place for embracing nighttime behavior that is completely wrong.   The Holy Cow isn't a form of rebellion, it's nihilism.
author: Beau G.

description:
Holy $#)@! This place has gone downhill in the past few years. Sad to say, but it's true. Sure the bartenders are hot, and the music is good, but there is just TOO much B&T! Seriously, a bus from Manteca?! Skeeeeetch.

No cover though, and the drinks are very reasonably priced.
author: Misha F.

description:
so, 3 stars.. you ask me why? THURSDAY NIGHTS ARE FUCKIN CRACKIN! 

1/2 off drinks and the bartender tony fuckin ROCK! Always hooks it up with fatass shots...! 

The crowd pretty much sucks... it's like a bunch a cocks in one room.. not many girls... well cute girls. haha 

They also don't take credit card.. which really sucks. I hate going to the atm.

ok i'm going to edit my review, you're down to two stars now, from three. Seriously i hope the owner of The Holy Cow reads this. You guys or girls really need to clean this place up. The whole place smells like piss.It smells worse then any alley way in the TL, where all the bums have been pissing and pooping. Every time i come here i want to yack. The only reason i come back is for the 1/2 off thursday special. PLEASE CLEAN THE PLACE UP!
author: Brian P.

description:
I don't care what anyone says about this place. 

Thursday nights before 12, drinks are half off. In other words, $4 shots of Grey Goose deserves 5 stars in my book.

------------------------------

Okay... came here last night -- I'm going to have to dock some points. Perhaps I was too drunk to notice last time, but it is a sausage fest in here. And the crowd last night seemed like they all just hit 21.
author: Edward Y.

description:
If you are single, horny, cheap, wild, 23 or younger, and pretty buzzed, you will have fun here.

All other folks should probably avoid this place. 

I am giving this place one star because I am not single, I don't go to bars to get laid, I don't mind paying more money for quality, I am over 23, and I usually don't go out to get hammered anymore.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
Def. A great hole in the wall.. not to say the DJ was spinnin amazing hits! a solid star for that! parking was easy right around the corner!  Great room to dance and if you wanna talk theres tables!! 

so, if you  wanna got out and have a chill night! well HOLY COW.. is your spot!!

LUV. IT!
author: Char K.

description:
Picture this.. an intoxicated young woman dressed in a marc jacobs top, jeans, knee high boots, & a veil, sporting a giant 14 inch blow up penis, humping the line of frat boys & sleazoids trying to get in to the Cow to the rhythm of Salt N Pepa "Push It". Yes, that was me at my bachelorette party. 
This place is HILARIOUS! Pure comedy. Do you like people watching? You will looooove this place. The music is horrendous & the crowd is pathetic. This is where the desperados roam!

(Realistically, we lasted here about 20 minutes before we were completely skeeved out. This place is SAD.)
author: Melisser E.

description:
Place is alright, circular bar, dance floor, 2 small ledges for booty shakers brave enough not to fall down on them. Another bar in the back, place seems bigger then it is because of the mirrors set all over the joint. But the place is pretty damn big.

Yes i agree, it is a college dive, most patrons are college students,  but who cares. People need to have fun, and I like the fact that there is no cover and dress code. Sneakers and T's are good. Oh and Thursday nights are poppin'... They have a happy hour special that goes from 9-12. Buy one take one on drinks... Music is top 40ish, with a dab of old school hits.

Errr... can't really hate on the place for what it is, cheap drinks, dress down and fun folk. Can't really love the place either.
author: Jose S.

description:
Fun diverse place that's layback but doesn't allow hooded jackets. Wierd. Go on Thursday nights when drinks are half off until midnight.  The music can be whatever, but some cheap drinks can fix that right up for you. 

Thursday nights are fun here, but going to work the next morning is not. It's also doubly worse if you know the bartender. : /
author: James C.

description:
I'm enthusiastic girl, really. Occasionally I'm checking out something new, something different.

Well, now the place - if I could describe it as cowish - I would probably be right about that. Looked like the only skinny chicks there were booty-cheek flashing, wanna-be-porn-stars bartender cow-girls.

The rest of the crowd amazed me - overweight bachelor-dushe-bag dudes surrounded by pasific or latino chubby chicks.

Well, ok ok, screw, that I will take a drink, thank you.... that was fast & smileyish- 1 star *

Dancing...? Wait a min - what is that music? 80-s? 90-s? Mc Hammer? R u kiddin me? OK, I got it, DJ, you did it just for kicks to see if people wil have a 5 min fun with it.
Can I have another drink plz? - that was fast and smileyish - 2-nd star * Yeah, by the way, what's with that music still? U want me to bagonkashake for Madonna's "Ray of Light?" OH hell naw...
author: Cat of a Donut J.

description:
It's a place to dance in SOMA and gets a pretty motley crew of peeps.  I wouldn't put it on the top of my list but it's never a bad time.

The do have a back patio area to cool down and the drinks aren't bad but I'd prob stick to beer.
author: Jason S.

description:
REVIEW BASED ON CHEAPY THURSDAY NIGHT.
Positives:
1)  Buds/Well drinks are $1 from 9pm-11pm (1/2 off drinks after that)
2)  Patron shots 4 each.
3)  No Cover
4)  Big Patio outside
5)  The crowd demographic was well mixed 
      (e.g. vertical and horizontal stripe wearing crowd)

Negatives:
1)  Red Bull Vodka's not $1.
2)  Bouncers do not like head gear (what if you are balding)
3)  Blond bombshell Bartendress OVER CHARGING YOU FOR DRINKS (eg. Ordered a Bud before 11pm and she charged me $2-YES I AM CHEAP, but I expect the price to not change even if I am intoxicated.)
4)  Music is mixed and not consistant (eg.  Playing Survivor's "Eye of the tiger" after Snoop/Akon's "I wanna fuck you" WTF)

Fin..................
author: ronzilla x.

description:
When I first came here - we had a blast and it was great. Since then the quality and fun of this place has been going down and I don't think I'll want to come back any time soon. 

There's no cover which explains sleazy, nasty men trying to grab you and offer you drinks for the 10th time a night in their poor english. I've noticed a few regular creepsters here too, like the guy who thinks he's t-pain or something and always goes up on the little corner stage...

The drinks depend on the bartender. I don't know when they started this but they now have a $25 minimum on cards - boo!
author: Tatyana K.

description:
I would say if you just wanna get drunk for cheap come here on a Thursday or friday from 9-11. No cover, half off drinks on Thurs from 9-12 and Fri from 9-11. The DJ's vary in their greatness, but nonetheless I always come outta that place lightly blasted and remember how the DJ messed up some really good music. NOT ALL MASH-UPS ARE GOOD! Pink and Journey DO NOT MIX, Kelly Clarkson and David Guetta DO NOT MIX! I woke up feelin as if the stale taste of the cheap vodka they use for the half off drinks permeated throughout my walls. 
It's an ok joint. The bouncers need to fall off their stools. You can not pretend that this club is in Vegas and allow no dudes in when the couches are ripped with duct tape covering the blemishes. PLEASE, C'MON!! All in all, just another "let's get trashed" establishment.
author: Eric A.

description:
This place is the quintessential college bar (or those trying to relive their better college years). Sticky floors, 'dudes', nasty hoes, cheap booze, the smell of desperation. The douchy Marina crowds made its way over with their untucked 'going out, button up shirt', dirty grinding with some nasty hoes too plastered to know any better, and drinking from plastic(!) cups.... ewww. Is this what ASU is like??

Been here once, and I'm sure never again. Oh and the bouncers! What the F? Why so dressy and enforcing a dress code for what is essentially a glorified college grope bar? No sweatshirts? Seriously?? Fuck this place.
author: Rocky K.

description:
Crowd:  For the most part, haggard.  The good thing is that you don't need to get cute for the place since all of the guys are whack.
  
Venue:
1.  The place is always packed.  I'm pretty sure the bouncers seem to let everyone in without worrying about exceeding the bar's maximum capacity limit.

2.  Let me reiterate, the crowd is whack.  That and I always seem to find the most awkward/random people inside.  For example, a 30-something year old man air-guitaring on stage and mid-40-something couple grinding on the dance-floor in a sea of 20-somethings.

3.  Bathroom isn't that bad, it's not a long wait like other clubs.

4.  Imagine a country western themed bar playing hip hop and top 40 music.

5.  The DJ normally sucks.  It's the type of DJ that would play Snoop Dog followed by Cascada followed by Kelly Clarkson followed by Chacka Demus...yeah I don't get it.

6.  It's free to get in.

Drinks:
HELLO BARTENDER!  The wait is slow, but no worries, you can just gawk at that one bartender (I forgot his name) while you wait for your drinks.  The drinks are so-so and reasonably priced.  I heard that if you go there before 11?, you can get drinks for extra cheap.  

Overall:
It's an okay place to go to pre-game before heading out to a bigger and far better club.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description:
3.25 stars.

They have cheap drinks (1/2 off!!!) during their happy hour (and their happy hour is at a great time, 9-12!!!). There is no cover too, since it's also a semi-clubish-place with a dance floor. Because there is a dance floor, there isn't much tables and seats if you want to sit and relax. The blonde bartender is hot!

This place also has a diverse crowd, which is a nice plus. At times (I don't know if it's random or pre-arranged), you can hear the cow go moooooooo (or was it the cow bell, I forgot)! Either way, I would recommend checking this place out for yourself, and you can decide if you want to come here. I would if there's an event (like friend's birthday), but I would rather chill at a more traditional bar/lounge.
author: Sam W.

description:
I have to chime in with all the other 5 star reviews the Holy Cow has received - it is a great place. Went there for a night out on Friday and had one of the best times I've had in a LONG time. Great, sweaty dancing (is there every anything better?!) and cheap drinks add to the 5 stars.

Loved it so much I think I'm going to do my birthday there!

The two things I have a problem with are...

1. No water is served in cups. WTF mate! You can buy a 2 dollar bottle of water or just continue with mixed drinks, which is how I handled the situation.

2. $25 credit card minimum. Eh. 

All in all though, it is an awesome place with a very diverse crowd. Worth a try, for sure!!
author: Petra J.

description:
Holy Cow, you're interesting.  Diverse crowd, love it.  

What I didn't like was:

1.  Some asshole was dancing too fiercely I suppose and hit me on the head.  Then rubbed my shoulders like crazy and held me a little too close to say he was sorry. EW.

2.  Dance floor is WAY too crowded and everyones hair kept getting in my face.

3.  I danced with some guy and never got to see how he looked like but kept pulling me.  Geez....

I'll still come back here, no cover is the best part! Haha.
author: Tina L.

description:
The Holy Cow is very touch and go. In the past my friends and I have gone here and managed to have a good time. Recently though it is beginning to be some what of a joke.

The number 1 selling point of the Holy Cow is that its free. I'm broke, so since it is free I'm usually down to go.

For the most part you get what comes a long with a free admission.
- creepy guys
- so- so music ( it's very iffy)

But if you don't need a flashy environment to have a good time than the Holy Cow is the place to be.

What I find hilarious is the Holy Cow's sad attempt at being a high class club. They have a ridiculous amount of security who are all dressed in suits and where their little secret service ear pieces. They try to enforce a dress code, and kicked out a guy I know who was minding his own business because he wouldn't tuck in his shirt! Give me a break if you want to act like your bar is a top notch club than do some renovating, hire a better DJ and start charging a cover. Otherwise Holy Cow will continue to be a step up from a dive bar, that is a convenient cheap place to get trashed and dance your ass off.
author: Danielle S.

description:
Awesome music! Some good old school nor-cal beats!

Cheap drinks, $5 vodka soda

Pretty ghetto, sticky dancefloor, bartenders with black eyes, and bathrooms that need some serious disinfectant.....

All around, standard A-OK
author: Adrienne F.

description: As an update, someone from The Holy Cow staff just sent me a very professional message, and I offer a big "Yee Haw" to her.  Indeed, it's true.  Every night brings a different crowd, different vibes and different atmosphere to Holy Cow.  One night among many does not make a norm. And the odds of having another bachelorette stampede the likes of which I witnessed? Shoot, partner.  Unlikely.  Heck, I'll probably mosey on back to Holy Cow one of these nights just because of the staff--and the cool, conscientious message they sent.  Thanks, folks!
author: Shadi G.

description:
Post-Sushi Groove we hit Holy Cow for some booty-shaking. This is a surprisingly large venue. When you first walk in, you think it's just another long, narrow SF bar. But as you walk down along the bar and the cushy seating, you realize that this is only one half. No, it's not a mirror you're looking into, it's the other side of the bar, which took me a bit to realize. As you get way into the back, you see they not only have a dance floor, but a side room as well next to the bathrooms. And if you were to go to your left immediately as you enter, you'd find a pool table to boot.
Although they do take credit cards, it's a $25 minimum which I'm used to about $10-$15.
author: Donna W.

description:
Somewhere my girl and I like to go when we just want to dance and have a few drinks. Good mix of music from 80s, funk and pop. Its definitely a dive. But if we just want to get down and dont want to dress up, be around a pretentious crowd, and want some inexpensive drinks... you cant go wrong. 

Never had to pay a cover, huge cocktails for around 3-4 bucks before 11. I think right around 11 they have one of their bartenders pouring shots straight down your throat. gets the party people on the floor. 

Nice deck in the back when you want to get some "fresh" air. Its not the place I would bring a bunch of friends to nor out of towners. But if you want to pre party or just have a fun time... great choice. If not, Wish right next door kicks it up a notch. 

But I know why theyve been around for so long.
author: Roy L.

description:
