How many days of the week does this bar have half off discounts!?  It seems like at least 3/4 of the times I've been here (on different days of the week), there were always discounts on drinks.  I'm not complaining, but it just amazes me.

This place gets a lot of people, probably because of the drink specials and NO COVER CHARGE!  The music is pretty good.  They play a lot of hip hop and even 70's-90's rock songs.  I love it when they play GnR's "Sweet Child O' Mine."

There's always way more guys than girls though, and the girls usually go with their guy friends (4+ guys:1 girl ratio in their group).
author: Kev H.

description:
"Is this the only place open on a Thursday night in this city?" exclaimed my friend as we were waiting in line for a good twenty minutes. For some reason they do try and enforce a dress code here and tried to deny my brother entrance for having a TShirt on UNDER his sweater. Yea, UNDER his vneck sweater (it was one of those really small vneck openings) but after a few minutes we all got in.

When I got in I felt like I was taken to a grimier version of Pink, which is good and bad. 

A. Pink sucked and was too pretentious for what it was 
B. If Pink were a little more rundown and grimy it would make more sense for what it was

The music never got really good even though they tried to mash some of it up in their mixes. The place really must have been one of the only ones open on Thursdays because it was PACKED and about 3 fights broke out in the first 20 minutes.

For a place with no cover and half price drinks three nights a week, I think, its perfectly fine but its nothing really great.

I suppose if you come with the right people it can be pretty fun.
author: Ali L.

description:
Raging boners, vapid faces, last month's top 40 slop.  Don't go.

I know you think the blonde girl who just went in (obviously fresh from either the sorority house or the tanning bed) is smokin', but don't fall for it.

I know you think the fake cow is kitchy, but don't be seduced!

Basically, I am ashamed to have had the experience necessary to write this review.
author: Karin H.

description:
It's pretty ghetto, but it's hard to knock free!

- No cover.
- Large dance floor and bar.
- Great dance music and a revv'd up crowd.
- Above the entrance hangs a cow in leopard print with a halo above its head.
- A little dirty and divey.
- Really diverse, rough crowd.  Bad in many ways, but it keeps things interesting here.
- Smells funny.  And the bathrooms smell really funny.
author: Wayne K.

description:
Friday nights, half off drinks from 9-11.

But not for us super texters!  We scored open bar from 9-10.  Text "cow" to 83361.  Not sure if it works for every Friday, but it sure made our night.

+ Drinks are strong and hits hard.
+ There is a guy that looks like Dwight Schrute that dances by himself.  Apparently he's there every night.  He's awesome.
+ The DJ is awesome, too.

Please don't post our bad pictures on your MySpace, Holy Cow.  Please.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Holy F*'N' Cow.. 

This place is ghetto.. If your into having some type of social class- stay away from this place..

Ok,for no cover fee
author: Joe D.

description:
I used to come dance here a lot... back in the day... when i used to go dance... when i was in college. good times good times. 

oh, and it's free.
author: Jessica W.

description:
Ah, the holy cow. I've spent many a night at the Cow. A place a friend and I lovingly call the "chow", a nickname short for "cheetah cow". A lot of people i knew  were in love with this place for the longest time and then they actually turned 21 and found better places. 

I think I have a special place in my heart for the cow, seeing as my friends know the bouncers and I once frequented this place so often that people I knew saw me there every weekend to the point where they thought I actually worked there.

The cow is only cool until you go somewhere else. Then its just ok. 

The last time I went here they did last call at like 1:30. LAME. The guys here are total creepers.
author: Sarah S.

description: drinks are cheap on a thursday night half off. Not impressed a bunch of asians. Bar is crowded. Place is old and the deck is gross. Music is good top 40 and a whole lot of rap.
author: Diane S.

description:
The cattle called, they want the heard back. Mooooo-ve-it.

I've been once, it was sooooo packed, I walked out drenched in sweat, from the hundred clubbers who stepped on my feet and sprinkled sweat onto me.
author: qirk z.

description:
I wish zero stars was an option. This place sucks a lot. I mean, it's great if you're into sketchy fat dudes, overpriced drinks, and bad music. 

All that on top of the fact that my visit included a clumsy bartender tossing a vodka bottle across the table and spilling drinks all over my friends. Jerky, fat bouncers too. If anyone ever suggests going to this place, just say you'd much rather drink alone on the pot.
author: Cody E.

description:
There's various stories my friends & I can tell you as to why this place is called "HOLY COW." The same dude owns the spot and u can catch him outside talking to people standing in-line. Place gets crazy-crowded on weekends, and back in the day they had a bomb-ass team of bartenders and then things changed....

Still a decent place to go party if ur looking for the "Dive Bar" type place, music differs depending on the night and who the DJ is..... Drinks are okay as well
author: Static J.

description:
"One mans trash is another mans treasure" is the phrase a friend of mine has coined for this place.

"It is what it is", is what I would say. It's a 'dive club'. Fairly decent size (bar in the middle, small dance floor with 'hoochie' stages, a token dark 'make out room', nice little outdoor patio (for a frequent dose of fresh air). Mixed music from Bon Jovi to whoever sings "I like big butts". Kind of a mixed crowd, also this place seems to be a frequent stop of the party buses. 

Staff is great. Security lets you bypass the line if you bring girls (and you probably should) . Bar tenders are quick and friendly, drinks are pretty cheap although there may be a minimal cover ($5). 

Overall, you have to keep the above in mind. If you are looking for a 'dive club' and to have a good time either with some 'wing men' or a group of friends, it will make for some good war stories.
author: Rob H.

description: Fun place to end the night/or get it started.  This bar has no cover and is prety laid back.  The music is so-so, top 40's and some throw backs.  The drinks are not the best, probably should stick with beer or straight shots.  The bartender actually made us the wrong drinks and still made us pay for them insisting that we called it the wrong thing, wtf!?  I've been drinking chocolate cake shots for a few years now and it has never been that disgusting thing he gave us.  Eventhough he was crap I will still continue to go here, I just wont order fancy drinks.  If you haven't been here it's worth checking out.  You can find parking pretty easily here, and can't miss the club since it has a giant cow outside.  Have fun!!!
author: Crystal L.

description:
CREEPS GALORE! The bartender did not know how to make a White Russian and then ended up not pouring any alcohol into the Sex on the Beach that I ordered instead. The atmosphere is nice, but the ratio of male to female is waaay off. Too many creepy guys just lurking around trying to take advantage of a drunk girl.

They have outside smoking area where you can take a breather from all the drinking and dancing, which is nice.
author: Karina A.

description:
Not my scene. 
It just ain't.
Went on a Friday, and walked right back into the year 2000. If I wanted a high school reunion, I would've attended mine. What bullshit music they were playing! It was outdated and lame, and even the sprawling dance floor area couldn't make up for it because of the poor quality of the patrons. It's like someone else said in their review: the guys there looked pretty skeezy.
Won't be back.
author: Addyline L.

description:
**Edit**
So the below was the result of writing a review around 3am in the morning after having drinks in the city.  :-P  I'll leave it since I actually did have a good time last night.  The Holy Cow is a good place to go with a group of friends for some dancing and good times.  The crowd is unpretentious, and the music was a pretty decent mix of hip hop and 90s music.  I wouldn't come out here *just* to go to The Holy Cow, but it could be a good pit stop on the way to a more happening club or something.  I like that there's no cover since some clubs I've been to have charged a lot for cover, but I didn't have nearly as much fun at.  

--------
Oh dude.  How come everyone be giving this place crap?  Cuz it's awesome!  We were over at Wish for a bit, got the drank going on, and then we headed out to find us some dance action.  What happens to be next door but HOLY COW.  Awesomal.  There's this huge cow hanging over the entrance with a halo over it.  It's so coolios.  Man.  Awesome.  Did I say awesome?  Cuz it's awesome.  No cover charge, and it was hoppin'.  Totally hoppin'.  The best part was the four phat and fat guys grinding ass in the corner on the platform.  AWESOME.  I heart those guys man; they totally made my night.  YEAH BABY, HOLY COW, IT WAS AWESOME!!!!
author: Diana C.

description:
Club:  The music was okay...there was some Brittney Spears then Rihanna then Gloria Estefan! Also they do not allow white t-shirts or hooded jackets! Coat check is also available when you enter. Also I loved that giant cow sticking out from the top of the entrance! I'd return but would prefer to go to another club that's a bit more trendy and vibrant. 

Atmosphere: Different mixture of people here, mostly college kids. I also remember sticky floors! My heels were stuck to the floor while I was trying to dance! Very small and crowded in here also.

Location: Located in the Mission, parking can be difficult in this area...might be better to take a cab.
author: Miss H K.

description:
*Shaking my head to Holy Cow.
Although I've lost my hatred for Holy Cow years ago, I still dislike this place. The bouncers are assholes, drinks take forever, and the lines never move. 
Why the hatred toward Holy Cow?
Well....let me tell you! 
It was cold that day, and like any other normal human being, i wore a jacket. When i got to the club, i decided to pay $3 to check in my coat because I didn't want to carry it around the whole time. What is the purpose of coat check? You pay them money and they watch your coat for you right?! WRONG at HOly Cow!! When i went to retrieve my jacket at the end of the night, they told me it wasnt there.  WHAT?! Where is it?! Believe me, it was not pretty after that.
Ok they reimbursed me, but still...Jacket stealers!!!!!
author: Linda L.

description: Love popping over here for a shot with the girls behind the bar! I'll have the house special Patron please! ;)
author: Andrea M.

description: Never a boring night at Holy Cow. My friends and I are always down to come here. They usually have happy hour from 9-11 and the bartenders are good about keeping tab. Love this place!
author: Rosario N.

description:
I wouldn't exactly call this place the authentic SF nightlife experience.  But I do have to give this place some credit for being a predictable place to drink and have fun with a big group of friends.  I think I've probably gone here more times than I can remember or even want to admit (in my much earlier 20s of course) and had an awesome time not being sober.  I think its fair to say that I have been better educated in the ways of SF nightlife since those days, however I don't mind a throwback every now and then!

Cue up some Kelly Clarkson "Since You've Been Gone" and mix in some "Don't Stop Believing" and "Livin' On a Prayer" and you've got a recipe for success.  After all - when you're enjoying fun times with the besties, you'll tend to ignore things like ugly, creepy guys and/or sweaty, step-on-your-feet college kids oh, and/or the usual B&T bachelorette party and/or all of the above.  Drinks are extremely iced down but they're cheap.  If you really want to rock the party recession style - re-live your college years and drink before you get here.  The bouncers are way friendly anyway.
author: Jean A.

description:
Gross. 

so. not. a fan. of this place. It reminds me of college which can be good or bad. Lots of drunks spilling beverages all over the place and falling all over the place. 

There are also some wonky d00ds here..you know, the kind that look you all up and down and touch your ass...as if that's okay and normal?!? 

gross. 

I hope never to return.
author: Natalie C.

description:
This SOMA venue could hardly be named any more literally - You want cows with holes, this is your joint. 

When I first arrived in the US, I tried this venue a number of times, as it had been described in a several guides as "a good place to meet people". Now I have come to I realize that these descriptions were due to most printed press groups being unwilling to use the words "slut", "drunk slut" or "on the verge of puking on you - slutilly" in their publications.

People of SF, there are much better places to meet people. Look on your street corner for example. But come here only if alcohol has already caused you to take leave of your senses and your sole focus is obtaining your pound of flesh.
author: Kevin R.

description:
Omg I can't believe the crowd that this place caters to now.  The first time I came here it was pretty fun.  I mean it was a thursday and it was mostly my friends and I.  The crowd was a bit nicer looking.  

The last time that I came here (also on a thursday) I can not believe how ghetto the crowd was.  A friend of mine had his leather coat stolen.  Also the walk to the outside patio smells like urine.  I am definitely not coming back. 

My one star is for the bacon hotdog cart that sits outside this place.
author: Allison T.

description:
I like the huge cow above the door. Very small place, only been here twice on two thursdays, and I drive past it from time to time on Fridays and Saturdays.  Also there is no cover charge.

Fridays and Saturdays it looks dead so I dont even bother.

On thursdays it seems like the place to go, super packed, cannot move, cant dance without being butt humped by another guy (im a guy). They should really control the door. There really is not a dress code since it is a bar but note that they would not allow hoodies in.

The place is really dirty, bathrooms, floor, everything you can think of. Smoking area is a nice small area in the back, lots of tables and chairs and small booths. You have to go through the men's bathroom to get here, so the ladies will get to meet a bunch of drunk, touchy feely guys on the way to the outside.

The real positive of this place is the cheap drinks. I think they cost somewhere between 3-4 bucks for a mixed drink, now that is one hell of a deal. Drinks are quite strong, good for some people, bad for others.

Come here for cheap drinks and to get drunk, otherwise I recommend you go elsewhere.
author: Anthony C.

description:
I've been here twice and while I definitely have no plans to return, I know I could probably be persuaded (i.e. dragged kicking and screaming) to come back.  The one thing that makes this place bearable...no cover.  If not for that fact, I'm sure one of the many many many disgruntled patrons would have burned this sticky, smoky place down by now.

Don't get me wrong, I like divey joints.  Slumming is fun and even necessary sometimes (helps keep things in perspective), so I've always enjoyed the occasional jaunt to the less desirable parts of town.  But the problem with The Holy Cow isn't that it's a bad club/bar.  The real issue is that it's a very, very bad house party.  It makes me actually want the parents to come home early to break things up.

The dealbreaker for me is the music.  I can tolerate the funky crowd, pricey drinks, and bad decor.  But the music...oh, the inhumanity!!!  The DJ (and I use that term extremely loosely here) is ridiculously bad.  I would do better just switching tracks on a few CDs.  He/she wouldn't be able to mix if their life depended on it and their song selection makes no rhyme or reason.  I think the management should buy an MP3 player, download a bunch of music, plug it into the sound system, and just press the shuffle button.  That would be a VAST improvement.

So in conclusion, go here by all means, but only if you are hard of hearing and are already drunk.  Otherwise, you might as well go home and throw a house party.  At least that way you can control the kind of disreputable people that will harass you on the dance floor.
author: Helen T.

description: Wow really?? only 2.5 stars?? Holy cow, people need to give this place a chance!! Sure, the decor wasn't all that, but the music was awesome and the crowd was very diverse.  I had a lot of fun!! My ears were treated with Lil Wayne's music to Journey to Lady Gaga to Michael Jackson. AWESOME!! Will definitely come back here!
author: Anna G.

description:
3.5 stars

I've been on a Thursday and a Friday.  Thursday they have half off drinks till midnight.  Starts getting packed around 11pm.  That makes it difficult to get around and you'll feel like getting into a fight.  Definitely a better place with a good group of friends.  There is dancing and the music is pretty good.

Be sure not to dance near the speakers where people feel like they must hop up and dance on.  I've had a couple land on me.... again.

Fridays were ok.
author: Po L.

description:
I'm a kind of guy who likes to grab a drink and kick back...and if I want to dance...I will. If you are also that kind of guy, Holy Cow is probably not your scene. If I liked to dance, this place would be awesome. So don't take my 2 stars in a bad way...it just wasn't for me. But it's very likely that it would be a great place for you. 

The neighborhood is pretty sketchy...I never feel like my car is safe. And someone got their ass beat in line...pretty crazy! Had to stand in line for a while before getting in as well. And you'll probably end up running into half of your graduating class at Lowell High School. 

Check it out if you want to run into high school friends you havn't seen in a while. Maybe that girl you always had a crush on but never got to talk to...and thought graduation was the last you'd see of her? Good chance you'll see her here!
author: Allan M.

description:
This place is hilarious and fun.  I came here w/ some friends on a Saturday night and had a goooood time.  We weren't even that drunk.

No cover
Good very danceable music
Cheap drinks (4 G&T and it didn't meet the minimum of $25 for credit card)
Random free shots announced in the middle of the night
Hilarious drunk girls to laugh at.

Oh yes, the hilarious drunk trashy-ish girls.  You can see in their eyes they've had WAY too much to drink and thought wearing those slightly too-long tops as a dress stretched over their rotund booties and climbing up on those corner platforms to grind against the wall was a great idea.  These girls gave me a good giggle all night.  

yes, there are sketchy guys.  It's a bar w/ no cover, what do you expect?  Whatever, I danced away and shoo-d away any of the creepers who tried to mac on me and my girls.  We're not interested, can' you tell by the way we're NOT responding to your attempt to start a conversation?

Anyway, it's a fun place. Probably not for everyone but if you're just looking for a good fun time, then Holy Cow just might be your place.
author: Naoko M.

description: I was at this bar for about 45 min and had a pretty good time - only had one drink and had good service from a female bartender. I ended up leaving my credit/ID there and had to come back the same night. When I came back and interacted with the male bartender on staff, he was cordial until he realized that I needed by credit card/ID at which point he could care less if I found them and proceeded to push me off onto the other bartender without giving her any notice that I was there so I had to make my way through the whole crowd again to regain my credit card and ID. The female bartender who I had previously interacted with was very nice! However her nice-ness could not make up for the other bartender's rude and mean attitude. Needless to say I will never go back.
author: Mary M.

description:
Holy cow! I had such a fun night here for a friend's birthday. 
The drinks were flowing like crazy. The DJ was playing classics. Everyone was dancing. The women's bathroom was clean and not very busy. 
This place rocks. Almost too much though. My birthday boy friend and my boyfriend both drank too much. Whoops. Luckily, we knew a bouncer that made sure he was taken care of and taken home safely. 
The area was  little dodgy, but just for the dancing fun this place is super cool.
author: Emma B.

description:
Holy Cow! My bf got hit on by a T.H.U.G while I was standing right next to him. Awesome! I guess we don't look like a couple or something? Anywho, this place was popin' with sweaty, grindin' bodies even when the songs weren't playin' a beat! It's a party and a  COSTCO sized bag of chips up in here!

UPDATE!
Apparently it was only fun because of the cool peeps I was with. Never ever step foot here.
author: Charm N.

description:
It's not a bad bar/ club. The doorman can be an ass. A dress code? For a bar? Not like i'm wearing a white beater and shorts in SF.  Strict dress code for dudes. Alot of drunk college co-eds, which is fine and dandy. A few times I went, which is usually a Thursday night, they have $1 piss beer (Bud Light) Can't complain when it's for a dolla. 

The atmosphere is mixed. Mixed crowd, lots of ladies ready to dance and drink. Can't hold a conversation inside. One thing about the music, the 8+ times I went, same EXACT songs. In ORDER! WTF? They have a DJ, but he useless. Same burned CD each and every week. 

When you go, i'm willing to bet my 2007 1 million doller Bently that an African older gentleman will be grinding and grooving with the younger females in the corner of the dance floor. Yes, he is a sight to see and yes, I don't have a 2007 Bently.
author: David L.

description:
"Security to the ladies room," " Security to the patio,"  "Security to the back bar"  In a matter of an hour, no less than 3 fights broke out. Is it the sweaty, smelly dance floor?  The minuscule (weak!) drinks? The super-random (and dirrrrty) women's restroom with the naked Grecian statue?  Whatever it is about the Holy Cow, it makes people wanna brawl. I have to admit, after a night out here, I kind of want to hit something myself.

One star for security guards who obviously have their work cut out for them, and another for no cover/no line in an area filled with 45 minute waits.
author: Jenni D.

description:
I have to agree with Mel below.

"This place is good...if you're broke."

Someone told me this: "The people here are people that got kicked out or was rejected by the cool clubs, and came to this spot because it's free and cheap and the closest place."

Hahha!! seeing that place... i don't doubt that comment. It was a nite filled with comedy though... although we left at 11pm-12am, got there at 10pm. Why we were here? We weren't even supposed to come, but were practically dragged here and our friend begged.. so yah!! Def 1 star for the cool bartender who hooked it up with drinks. But the bathrooms stunk, the people were sleeze, and the music they played were like hits when I was in Jr High- High School. Uh? that was like late 1990's... hahaha!!
author: Joanne D.

description:
3 Stars because I know and like some of the staff outside of the place.  The bar is big, no cover except New Years, prices are low, booths often open...this would be a description of a pretty great place if it weren't for the most godawful, bridge and tunnel, unattractive (women in too-tight clothes and people without style wearing crazy things in a way that won't even pass in SF), obnoxious, creepy crowd I have ever witnessed.  Every single night.

A shame.  The upside is a place like this may see the crown change in cycles.  When the freaks and creeps leave, it might become inhabited by normal people again.  I can hope.
author: Lauren J.

description:
The GOODS:
Let me start off with the music..I've been here a bunch of times and every time I come here, they always play Journey and Bon Jovi...(not that there's anything wrong with it) other than that, they play a variety of music.  
Thursdays are always packed because drinks are half off until midnight which is cool.  
The BADS:
The bathroom stalls are dark! 
Some bartenders are nice and the others fricken suck! There were two incidents where a bartender said they don't have my friends card, so I'd ask for it, and all of a sudden they have it.  WTF right? 
AND another WTF moment..they don't give tap water..they say they only have bottled...isn't that illegal?
author: Tes ..

description: Friday night Bachelorette- I don't have any complaints. We were ushered in right away and given a free round of shots. We hit the dance floor and had some fun. Mostly Top 40 with lots of Lady Gaga, but some older awesome hits thrown in. $25 min for your bar tab (Frown). It gets pretty hot in there and crowded around midnight, but overall I would go back.
author: Nicole F.

description: Great place, decent music, but a LOT of randoms will try and sneak up and dance with you
author: Sarah K.

description: Why the low rating? I love this place! It's free and its next door to 3 other bars so if you want to change locations, easy does it.  There are a lot of bartenders and the place has room to dance or sit.  Music is mixed and so is the crowd. Def a cool spot to go if you are in the folsom area.
author: Kimberly C.

description:
Ok yes.  The Holy Cow is a meat market.  If you come expecting to be able to be treated like lady or do anything but be pawed on all night, then you will be sorely disappointed.  Having said that, I love this place.  No cover and danceable music always spells good times for me.  And provided you are aware that this is a sausage fest and all that entails, it's good for the ego once in awhile to go to a place where you know someone is going to try to pick up. I don't think I have ever left this place where I haven't gotten hit on by at least three separate guys in the same night.  Although I strongly recommend coming here with a posse in case you want to avoid the inevitable man handling.  I've been here three separate times and the only time I couldn't handle it, I was only there with one girlfriend.  So clearly you need more than one wingman can handle.  

But straight up this place is for dancing and getting picked up.  No bones about it.  There is something so massively unpretentious about it which is just they way I like to go dancing.  Hell I'm there to have fun.  Not to look good.  If I wanted to do that I'd go to the Supper Club or something.
author: Alexis B.

description:
I've been here a few times.  I had some friends in town last night and the place we were at was getting empty so we strolled down the street to Holy Cow.  There was a long line, but fortunately we had a couple of hot chicks with us, that are more than willing to make out with each other.  Yeah, we didn't wait in line.

The atmosphere was cool, we used the bar in the back corner so we didn't have to wait for drinks...or maybe it was because the girls were ordering.  Either way it was a great time.
author: Luke M.

description:
Quite possibly the worst club I've ever been to.  This place is overcrowded, the clientle sketchy (and painfully unattractive), and the music selection god-awful (who the fuck dances to Tears for Fears?!?!).  

If only I had the guts to launch a Molotov cocktail at that stupid-ass,  leopard-print cow that hangs over the front door.  That's the only reason I'd ever go back to the Holy Cow.
author: Mike M.

description:
So first off, I wouldn't recommend you going here at all. A couple of reasons, so Im a guy, so I'm not picky about the bathrooms, but they are pretty rough. Another is the somewhat hostile feeling in the air and another is that it just feels rough.

So with all that said here is why I gave it 3 stars:
1) Every so often I get a little "riled up", froggy, rowdy and what have you. This place somehow fulfills that ambiance.
2) It reminds of me the many many bars/clubs in Houston that can be scandalous......ah Houston land of the guns, trucks and freeways
3) You can dance your ass off sometimes and not just in a "oh im dancing, but im still occasionally watching to see who is watching me" kind of way, but in a who the fuck cares kind of way.
author: Fabian O.

description:
Went back here this weekend...had so much fun! 

So many cute guys to dance with. Free to get in, nice security, bartenders. Friendly crowd, great music....
author: Krista T.

description:
...too crowded and sweaty to even enjoy. I'd only come here again if there was no where else to go.

But hey, it's free!
author: Lindsay A.

description:
Kinda small, gets packed easily, and thus hot, sticky, and gropy. The music is loud, the tunes are hip hop/dance, and the dancing, with all those flailing arms and elbows in that space, is bordering on aggro.

Can't figure out the decor... Texan saloon? Wasn't able to study it through the swarms of sweaty, shiny-skinned, sticky-haired bodies. 

Can't make your way to the bar, can't push your way through, can barely fight your way through. It'll be hours before you make it and come back to your spot. So it's a good device in getting rid of someone, by asking them to get you a drink.

But how this place manages to bring in all these people every night, I don't know.
author: Clar L.

description:
Not a terrible place for what it is, which is a place to go when you don't want to be at home and you don't want to spend a ton of money going out.  But if you looking for anything more this is not the place for you.  

The drink are okay but i think the next time that i go i am going to stick with beer and shots because depending on the bartender the drinks were either okay or weak.  At least with beer and shots i know what i am getting.  

People are okay.  Though some got to know when to stop.  I have never been in a restroom where i didn't want to pee, standing up mind you, because the toilet and floor are covered in throw up and god knows what else.  Did talk to a few cool people and drunk people.  NO love connections here though but you may get lucky.  You better wrap it though.  

A good place for what it is:  Cheap, okay drinks, okay music, some nice eye candy.  If you want to go out and it is the day before payday and you not a saver this is the place for you.  If not then go some place nicer you cheap bastard!
author: Ralph S.

description:
HAHA - this place definitely deserves its 2 star Yelp rating. 

Stopped by since, of course - it's right next to Wish. Sure, why not? 

Crowded as hell. People - ugly as... hell. haha. I'm sorry, but this place was boring and the music was uninteresting.
author: Leily P.

description:
This place is good...if you're broke.

No cover and good deals on drinks. Perfect for college kids and it seems like there were tons. I would only go back if I wanted to get my pre-party/drink on, and then go somewhere else (with a designated driver, of course) Other than that, don't waste your time. There's other places in the city to check out.
author: Mel R.

description:
This place is a lot of fun, but expect to find some creepers!

First off, this place is great to go if you don't want to spend a crapload of money. No cover, very reasonably priced drinks, and they usually have pretty good DJ's.

Now because there is no cover, and cheap drinks, it has a tendency to attract some creepy old men, and haggard looking singles. On the opposite end of the spectrum, because it's so cheap, it attracts some good looking college kids.

Bar service is moderate. About what you would expect from a crowded bar. Bathrooms are gross and smaller than my closet, and it's in kind of a shady neighborhood. (Friends car got broken into when we went there).

All in all, I really enjoy this place. Nice when you don't want to dress up too much, and save some money while having fun.
Sooo take a taxi, get your drink on, and hope the creepers don't try to dance with you!
author: Reid E.

description:
To the Management, 

Please put Briana at the front bar.  It is a shame to have her in the dark, back bar.  Further, the asian girl with the fake tits and tattoos thinks way too highly of herself.

Thanks.

Note: my rating applies only to Thursday nights.
author: Matt J.

description:
I have been to this place only once, and I thought it was pretty cool. A friend of mine that attended with me even said it was like club. An incredibly small club if you ask me. 

I liked the fact that there were 2 bars and 2 rooms to add more space at least. The bartenders were skilled and entertaining. The bodygaurds were friendly and good-looking. And the drinks are half off Thursday nights. 

Some of the music sucked, but some of it was really good. And lastly, I liked the leopard-printed cow hanging from above the door. It was a cute touch.
author: Michele C.

description:
Warning: not a "pretty bar".  Unless you came with them, don't come here expecting to hook up with a Paris Hilton look-a-like or Colin Farrell's twin.  That being said, if you love to dance and could care less about the hook-up, come here!  I love that they have a smoking patio in the back...even though I swear I'm quitting.  They also have a quieter bar area if you managed to swig enough beers to get the goggle effect and don't mind hooking up with Chewbacca.  Ok...that was a li'l harsh.  It's not that bad...but it ain't that good either.  

The bartenders are really nice.  My friends and I were invited to stay after the bar closed and drink a bit more.  "A bit more" ended up being "pass out on the nearest flat surface" more...but it was fun.
author: Erin H.

description:
I have only been here once, a few years ago. But I just got invited to an event here, which reminded me to review it. Needless to say, I will not be attending this event.

This place is like a frat party. But not even like a Marina frat party, which would be bad enough.  It's like a frat takes a road trip for spring break and goes to a foam party. Without the foam.

Hated it!
author: Janet G.

description: No cover and inside you'll find lots of dance floor space, and all your favorite jams to go along with it!
author: Erin G.

description: This is def NOT the place to go if you don't like crowds.  We we walked in there was no way to get back out.  People were everywhere.  It was so packed that you couldn't walk, couldn't stand because people were pushing into you, & couldn't dance even though there was a dance floor.  This place is not very diverse either.  Not really my scene.
author: Sarah H.

description:
This place is pretty fun if you're there for JUST that. 

People watching is amazing and the music is not bad. I love watching the girls watching themselves shake their moneymakers on platforms. My friend once stuck a dollar down a chicks pants and she LOVED it. 

I would NEVER ever go there to meet someone though. The guys there picking up ladies are totally grease. Just for denying them in an intellectual way, they got INSANELY defensive.
author: nicole l.

description:
This place is hella weird. The minute you walk in their (sober at least) you notice that _something_ is off, you can't really put your finger on it at first, but once you take it all in, it all becomes clear. 2.5 stars because this place can either be your worst nightmare, or just a really interesting almost SF cultural experience depending on what you are going for, I'll just list the pros and cons so you can get an idea of what you can expect; I'm not sure every night is like this, but this is what it was like 5/2

Pros
Cheap drinks for the area
No cover, which is probably its best feature because the rest of the place charge cover dead or not, one place had the balls to charge $40!!!
"Cultural" experience
Lesbians making out, freaking, pulling clothes off, etc.

Cons
40 year old uberdouches huddling around the dance floor like wolfs encircling a helpless fawn
Trannys everywhere, got pictures to prove it
Too well lit for that type of atmosphere
author: Eduard J.

description: This place has a lot of bad reviews, but both times I've been there I've had fun.  No cover, loud, not classy, but it's a good place to dance if you don't want to dress up and go to a nice club.  The people who frequent the place seem pretty ok.
author: Eric N.

description: Lame crowd. See the above posted "Exhibit A" and "Exhibit B". Extra star for playing a couple good 80s. Needless to say, we left. EARLY.
author: Esther A.

description:
holy cow is just A-OK.

the music is ALWAYS the same, it looks like they have a dj but they dont. or whoever that guy is sitting in the dj booth playing the same damn mix. 

same girls, same guys, same thing!

get there early on thursday and get drinks for HALF OFF then....leave and check out another bar.

but its free so i shouldnt complain.
author: Carol Y.

description: This place was alright.  Yes.  It is a meat market (so guys you should have no problem meeting girls here), but you will have fun.  The music is top 40 with some 80's hits.  The dance floor is kinda of small, but after afew drinks you dont care.  Plus, the drinks are good and competitively priced.  Also, no cover....
author: Mike M.

description: Plays good music, no real space for dancing...
author: Sheree A.

description:
Ok, so I had a really fun time here... they have really good bartenders and a fun venue.  Usually, you pay $5-$20 for a club in the city to give you bad service.  Here, you pay NO cover and get some attention, especially if you show up early.  Granted, my friends and I were here early (for an open well bar on Friday from 9-10pm) and there were also 1/2 off drinks from 9-11pm (which happens on Thursdays and Fridays).  Despite the free drinks, my friends and I tipped amply and the bartenders gave us amazing service and a sample of the house special (the Blue Ball).

But back to the place in general, most of the place is covered by the two large bar areas so you can't complain about getting a drink in time.  It is also spacious with a large outdoor area.  Really, you can't ask for more in a venue in the city.  They play fun hit music that will cater to anyone of any genre from old school hip hop heads to hipsters.  It is one of the better places in the city and with the bovine banner out front, you can't miss it even though you might have to circle the block and park on Howard.
author: Joey S.

description:
True story...

While me and my buddy were downing another bud, he said, "The only type of people that come here are hairdressers, dental hygenists and car mechanics."

At the point, someone nearby started talking about dropping a 427 into a a '67 Chevy.

Think Bridge and Tunnel, but with less class. It is what it is.
author: Patrick N.

description:
An SF native took us here, but we saw an ad for the Holy Cow on the back of a tourist map. That kinda put me off. 

I give it one star, but in all fairness I was drunk before I got there.
author: Jen K.

description:
My friends always come here Thursday nights, but I never went because I always had work in the morning. Since last Friday I didn't have to go into work until noon, I figured why not check it out. So out of curiosity I decided to come out and have a drink to finally see how this place was for myself.

What did I think of it? Let's put it this way. I got there at 11:30 intending to stay until 1 at the latest (just to try to be responsible). I left at 12:10. Safe to say, I wasn't feeling it. They get a star for the 1/2 off drink specials and no cover or dress code, which, sad to say, might be incentives for me not to immediately brush it off if my friends bring up going again.
author: Joel J.

description:
Holy Cow has a deceivingly fun facade with it's leopard print cow hanging from above.  However, it is an appropriate mascot because you do feel like you're walking into a cow ass!  Okay more like driving with full ventilation through Coalinga on 5 freeway.  

Maybe it's not as bad as its music but it's pretty bad.  My beer wasn't even topped off, Mat K. had to convince me he didn't drink it.  so unholy.
author: Christina C.

description:
I'm almost embarrassed to review this place.  The first time I went here was my first business trip after college where the concierge at the Ritz where I was staying recommended this place for 'people like me'

Well, I was fresh outta college so I guess from that perspective he was spot on.  Of course he forgot to do a more careful psychological profile on me.  Anyhow, this place is perfect for what it is.  If you don't wanna see lots of grinding and boobies and guys with shirts with collars scamming and workin the crowd then this isn't the place for you.

Thursday nights they seem to have a bunch of drink specials so go then for the full on experience
author: Gene X.

description:
HORRIBLE!!! So before I begin, I should let you know that this is the ONLY bar in my life that has made me regret getting ready to go there. My guy friend and I and a group of others went there last friday for the first time after  hearing mixed reviews I had to check it out myself. The BOUNCERS where the biggest a-holes I have ever met! Once my ID got checked one laughed and then when my guy friend gave his ID they demanded his passport!! WTF!!?So I get that my friend is here on a student visa for college, but the bouncer didnt have to be such a jerk, he had a valid ID from his country!!!! Its not like he was some wet bag trying to get in...PLEASE! I have lived in sf all my life and have never been so disgusted with these bouncers. Needless to day we left Holy Cow and went to Cha Cha Chas to trash the ass bouncers that denied my friend entrance and had a great time. Let me mind you this is the first time that has ever happened, and the LAST TIME I ever go there. 

Please note: I do not mean to offend anyone but you have to understand our experience there was nothing short of horrible.
author: Christina M.

description:
The Holy Cow used ro be the place to hang out a few years ago.  That was before all of the kids from other cities found out about it, crowded it up, and basically turned it into Ghetto/Creepy Thursday's night.  


Now you got a bunch of wanna be tuff fools starting something out of nothing and creepy kids trying to get with any girl.
author: Carlos M.

description: It's not really a club, it's more like a bar but with a DJ and people dancing around the bar. I didn't see a real dance floor. The place is kind of dirty and there's really no decoration or anything. The DJ was ok. The only thing I liked was that the drinks were cheaper than most clubs/bars/lounges. A good place to just grab a few drinks and hang out. Not a place to go if you wanna get dressed up and have a fancy night.
author: Jennie K.

description:
I used to love this place; then my friend and I were there one night. We sat on the stools for over a half hour trying to get a bartender. He was helping other people who weren't waiting before us. When we finally got his attention, he yelled at us " You should know better than to flag me down." WE didn't leave a tip. 
My friends forced me back there again and I went to the back bar and the guy behind the counter was a little stuck up but nicer. He agreed with my complaint about the previous bar tender and said that he had gotten alot of complaints. Why is he still there then? 
When they have a DJ the bar can be really fun when its not some ethnic focused night.
author: C L.

description:
I gave it 3 stars because 3 out of the 5 times I've been there, I've had a good time. 

Let's start with the cons:
-the DJ is less of a DJ and more of a manual CD-changer.  yes, I can mix a better dance track on my iTunes than the music person here.  
-music is alright if you like dancing to hip hop one minute, throwing up your fingers for Aerosmith the next, and grabbing your crotch for Jacko's "Billy Jean" a moment later.
-tacky people.  sketchy men that ogle at...
-the even sketchier women dancing on the corner platforms.  excuse me, the word 'dancing' is giving them too much credit.  i mean, wiggling like upright worms.  
-the 50,000 bachelorette parties that end up there.  the minute you're done stepping on a train from one of the headbands, you're knocking into penis-shaped charms hanging off another bachelorette's neck.

But the pros are...
-no cover.  ever.
-cheap cheap drinks.  even cheaper if you get there before 11 PM on weeknights (i think fridays excluded) because they're all 1/2 off!  come on!  a shot of patron for $3.50???  after a couple of those, by 11:01 PM all the cons are out the door!
-decently sized.  you can always avoid the tacky mess that is the dance floor by slipping into the neon-tainted side room.
-pool table.
-outdoor smoking patio that's not smokey because it is actually...OUTDOORS.
-the ladies bathroom with an imitation david statue.  let me tell ya..that statue is BEAUTIFUL after some drinks.  makes waiting in line there so much more bearable...
author: Liz C.

description:
I discovered that this place has a dress code: the bouncer told me I had to take off my beloved N-Judah hoodie. I'm not sure what they're thinking. I guess they're trying to change their image or they're taking themselves way too seriously, because, c'mon, they've got a freakin' spotted cow hanging above the door, and the DJ blasts bad dance hits from 2003, and still a beer costs $4.50.

Skip this place.
author: John C.

description:
It's a cool spot since it's free! LOL
They have pool tables, a separate room with tables to lounge at, a very  very small dance floor but a decent sized smoking patio.
The dance floor gets damn crowded but why wouldn't it since it's like 5'x5'. I guess most of the people are dancing or playing pool since the other parts of the place were rather empty.
author: Britney C.

description:
If u like frat boys and bars go here.. Oh and trashy chicks that are on the prowl for the ext guy they can get to buy them a drink and hopefully a dinner!  
HAHAHA this place sucks.. it is a bridge and tunnel bar. SO if u like those go HERE! 

Also one of the bouncers got shot and killed one night a few months ago.. for kicking out the wrong guy apparently ... Now i am a very sympathetic person.. 
but i think that just add to the class this bar has to offer.
author: Samantha R.

description:
you can catch me here almost every thursday if im trying to go out.
-best place to go for a thursday night hands down....
-FREE COVER...
-security is cool they never gave me a hard time just dont dress hella bummy...
-drinks are HALF OFF till midnight.... which means i go with 3 friends we all buy rounds by the end of the night we are all wasted and we paid probably 15 each... 
- the music is alright they do a mix of different kinds hip hop with some pop and all that other stuff it has some good and some alright....
-dance floor does get packed but hey what do you expect for a nightclub? the more the better right?
- the range of ages vary from early 20s to some late 20s I would say the younger crowd,  alot of asians but you can still see all kinds of races inside..

OVERALL: this is my thursday spot and I see a lot of people I used to go to highschool with and old friends so its a cool place to see your city locals. So if your looking for a cool spot to check out on a thursday night I would suggest checking out holy cow, this is the best place to go for a thursday night hype.
author: Marvin C.

description: No cover, decent prices, tolerable music, but nothing distinguishes this place.  The decor is downright ugly.  I'm pretty sure some frat houses have better looking basements.  One bonus is the outside area in the back if you need to cool off or have a smoke.  Also, I left my jacked unattended in a booth for the whole evening and it didn't get stolen, so that's a bonus.
author: Dmytro A.

description:
I call this place a human meat market.Every one knows this place and for the place that have such a land mark cow hanging outside above their door is such a site.By the way I want the cow's purple boots back. It looks so plain now.If you are a local,you will usually steer clear of coming here.Unless of course you want to meet new meat to the Bay Area.I have to say that most people who comes here are not stuck up bitches or the "I'm too sexy for your love" a**hole.

Now let me explain why it's a meat market.Most Friday and Saturday they are packed.You can get in on most night and usually it's free to hang in there.Once you walk right in,you will get the feeling of being grab(not your imagination)You very do get grabed and to guess who did it is like guessing which sperm will make it to an egg.If you get grab more than twice,then that means you have been considered a good meat.It's such a raw atmosphere that all you want to do is walk out or have a dancing party with a bunch of strangers.Which at time as I recalled can be fun.

The good thing about this place is that drinks are cheaper than most bars and also that if you don't like it ,you can leave and not feeling bad cuz you didn't spend a dime to get in.Other bars are located all around the area.Also sometime you do get to meet a nice guy or gal but who goes to a bar or a club to have a serious relationship anyway.If you say you do then you are one of the lucky ones.I don't hate this place but I am not in love with it either.Good place to go when you don't want to be alone(litterally)Go see it for your self and let the bidding begin.
author: S F.

description: They fixed they place up, no cover, and pretty cheap drinks.  Old school hip hop and some new stuff, cool place for thursdays.
author: Matthew P.

description:
My first experience with this club was when I couldn't get in.  Myself and 3 friends went there on a Friday night and each one got in before me wearing pretty casual clothes.  Unfortunately, I was wearing a hooded sweatshirt and somehow that equates into being a thug and I couldn't get in.   Apparently you cannot get in wearing a white shirt or baggy jeans that aren't really that baggy.  I can't forget wearing a hat or beanie won't get you in here.  Did I  mention that this is a shitty dive bar?  

With all that said, I can't lie, this place is entertaining to me.  Even with it's bullshit dress code, I still enjoy coming into here. The place usually has a decent and lively crowd and I enjoy the mix of music.  Time in and time out though, the crowds seem to go buckwild for "Pour Some Sugar on Me" or "You shook Me all night long".  Maybe its always the same people who go when i go.  

The crowd is a good mix but it seems like most of the patrons are kids who just turned 21 and can't wait to get drunk.  I guess most of us were like that so I can't be mad at that.  If you are looking for a classy joint, please don't come here.  Try next door at Wish, it's like day and night.

Service is not bad and the deals on Thursday are pretty good.  I usually don't have to wait long for a drink and there's a good amount of cuties who come in here.  Don't forget to say what's up to the older black dude who I always see grinding on young white chicks.  That dude has more game than you....
author: Jason Y.

description:
Ew.


My feet are stuck to the floor, which is ok because there's nowhere to move to anyway. The bar down the middle leading to a dance floor that blocks the bathrooms is a genius idea. Really.
author: Rachel B.

description:
Oh what a dive, when I walk in I'm expecting sawdust on the floor.  I don't usually like to mingle with the B&T kids, but they go nuts here and it can be a butt-rocking good time.  Order a Long Island Iced Tea, hit the dance floor, and be prepared for a test of your sexual politics.  

Cheap drinks, loud music, lots of room to dance, smoking section, pool table, girlsgirlsgirls, and an expensive cab and a hangover.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
I can't stand this place.... I have no clue why I went back... I told the other people in my group it was garbage... The crowd is mixed... Lot of larger people go there that probably don't exercise too much..
The staff is average... Nothing special...
Please don't let me go back to this place..
The ownership keeps changing.. There has to be a reason for that..
author: Joe B.

description:
Drinks: Cheap during happy hour, reasonable after. Drinks were made to my liking. I can't remember who, but one of the blonde female bartenders makes your shots VERY potent. Be nice to the bartenders and they'll be nice to you.

People: WEIRD crowd. This is what happens when the bar attempts to attract different crowds to come inside. As long as you bring your friends you should have a good time and not be weirded out by the widened age group (no joke; on one intoxicated night, I could have sworn I saw my professor getting thrown out of the bar).

Atmosphere/venue: I like how there's a ginormous golden cow outside so even an intoxicated individual could find his/her way back inside from three blocks away. I do not like, however, the sticky dance floor and some peoples' lack of personal hygiene when they are dancing, as body odor is quite apparent. The place does look a bit run down inside and needs to clean up a bit.

The bartender and the drinks IMO save me from giving this place less than 3 stars, however I cannot give it more than 3 either. As with all bars, I try to make the best of the experience, whether it is under favorable or unfavorable conditions.

NOTE: Some pics in my album labeled "Holy Cow" if you want to see what some of it looks like.
author: Gene P.

description:
in accordance with Rebecca H., I have to give this place a good review. Its not that bad as long as you are with good friends. Hot bartenders, music you can dance to , that's all I ask.. It was fun for me, despite all the groping my body underwent. Hey, does anyone know what's up with all those security gaurds though?
OH yeah, the bathroom, I've had worse, but then again I AM a dive bar kinda girl.
Anyways, I think if your thinking about it, you should just give it a try. Its not as bad or crowded as these other reviews suggest. Of course, its all a matter of perspective, respecitvely.
author: Yvonne Q.

description:
I went to the Holy Cow last night to meet up with some friends.  I will have to agree that the way the bar is arranged is kind of funky.  

The bar is in the front, the dance floor is in the middle and the patio in the back.  This means the dance floor is in the way of getting out to the patio and the dance floor was packed!  Can I complain really?  Nah, this place is popular.  It's just a pain making your way through the crowd without spilling your drink.

To Lauren S. most places that get crowded like HC will not let people with any kind of boots in.  It's for the safety of other patrons.  If you were wearing open toed heels and some guy in boots stomps on your toe that's the end of the night for you.  Get your guy some nice dress shoes or even some decent kicks.  I got in there wearing a pair of black and gold Asics.

As for people complaining about the patio smelling like piss, I didn't really get that.  Maybe I got luck or maybe it was because I was in the middle of it and not on the outskirts.  -shrug-

All in all, I'd come back and revisit this joint.  I will have to check out butter and see what's good there though.
author: El T.

description:
Could have been great, but the security really are full of themselves.
They took my wallet out of my back pocket, while i was sitting at a bench and didnt tell me who they were.  I thought they were a bunch of (big) knuckleheads who had taken my wallet.  After a short exchange (me working out they were security, not them telling me) they took me outside and told me i had stolen it.  When it was proven that i had not, they would not let me back in the bar.
author: Nathan H.

description:
Granted, I'm basing this on the one experience I had over six months ago.
But it was on my birthday.
Work was stupid and kept me late, so I got there wayyy after my friends did, and had to wait in line for nearly an hour, and it was starting to drizzle a little bit. Can a bouncer really not let a girl in when she's by herself? On her birthday???
It was better when I got in, sure. First thoughts in after the horrendous line adventure I suffered alone all demanded I make straight for the bar. The bartender was nice, the drink was good, I had no problems. But no personal space either. With my Long Island in hand, I proceeded to scan the club for a familiar face. Initially no luck, though I saw some very wasted girls dancing on the bar, and I do believe that had one of them been on Jersey Shore I would've heard her laugh about her "cooka" being out. That, and had the music not been so unbelievably loud, even for a nightclub. Though, if you're curious, that doesn't prevent  you from hearing creepy boys named Gabriel yell in your ear that you're hot and offer you a free birthday makeout. 
Thank baby Jesus, as soon as his hand slithered around my waist, I saw it: a friend! The night got much better after that, granted because I'd had to wait in line so long I was only inside for a meager 45 minutes. Though by that time my group had more than made up for lost time and gotten me pretty wasted. 
I guess all in all it really comes down to who you're with. 
That being said, this place just is not my scene. Though I'm tempted to add one more star because they played Journey that night. But it was Don't Stop Believing, and you can hear that anywhere a Glee soundtrack is sold.
author: Amber B.

description: It just goes to show no matter how many times you give crappy places a chance, they'll always find new ways to suck, in this case the abnormally large bouncer says I cannot wear a laker shirt inside the bar (mind you I'm wearing a jacket covering the shirt,) b/c they don't let anyone wear sports gear inside, fine... 30 mins later I come back new shirt I get inside, much to my shhgrin and what do I see? Giants hats, a paul pierce jersey, some dude rock'n an Oakland Raiders beanie, so which is it? You don't allow sports apparel in a bar, (which is already crazy) or you don't allow certain sports teams inside the bar?
author: Sean V.

description: No cover which is a plus.  Predominantly asian crowd but a lot of guys.  Went on a Saturday night by the way.  There's also a random pool table.  Lots of seating areas and access to the bar. The dance floor was kinda small but does the job.  Can't really miss it...there's a cow above the door!
author: Vincent N.

description: Thursday night. No cover and half off drinks!!! What more do you want?!?!? Bartenders are super fast!!!!!!!
author: Teison S.

description: I haven't been to Holy Cow a whole lot, but each time I have been, I have had a blast! Dancing, decent priced drinks, monkey statue when you enter (i love monkeeeys). Good times here! Lot's of room too, and an outside area!
author: Chrissy A.

description: All I remember is groups of frustrated drunk dudes in backwards baseball caps fishing for fights with one another and yelling unintelligible fail pickup lines to groups of big loud republican women (was gonna say hence the name but my PC-check blocked it).
author: Jack H.

description:
Every time I hear this place's name I laugh.  Its not that its because I had a great time here ever.  Okay, one time this girl that I was hangin with started to dance on the table but...    

Its like a frat house party.  HUGE drinks on the cheap.  Hoards of barely legal folks gulping down previously mentioned HUGE drinks.  

Lame "party" music.  If you have some obnoxious friends that you want to ditch - take them hear and get a cab when they arent paying attention.  

ThumbsUP:  Cheap drinks 
ThumbsDOWN:  No real redeeming qualities
author: Jeff C.

description:
It's hard to believe bars in this neighborhood have dress codes.  Kind of silly if you ask me.  We were denied at the door because I was wearing a hooded sweatshirt and my friend was wearing shorts.  After some deliberation, our female friends flirted our way in and the bouncer let my friend bend the rules if I took off my sweatshirt.  Whatever, it was 10:15 and they needed the business anyways.

Half price drinks Fridays before 11; not bad.

Loud dance music and dance floor if you're into that sort of thing.

Don't play pool cause the table is missing 2 balls and there are 2 five balls.
author: Alex K.

description:
I love this place, the bartenders are incredibly nice and friendly, the prices are fair, this place was made for bad dancers such as my self who want to be surrounded by others who suck at dancing so as to not stand out..

I rarely see hood rats and unsavorys, everyone is friendly and everytime I go here I drink to blackout state and am told by friends I apeared to be having the time of my life.. 

Yes the music sucks, yes the bar is tacky, but its free to get in, cheap to drink, the dress code is relaxed.. the people are all friendly and theres a good mixture of guys and girls.. only once have I gone here and not had a good time, and thats because of the company I brought and the fact that I wasn't drinking.. but that has nothing to do with the bar.

Holy Cow is what is it.. a dive where you go on Thursdays to just have a killer time and no regrets.
author: Oliver S.

description:
Holy Cow? Holy Crap!

This place is rank! Tha two starts in for the drink prices and the no cover charge, oh and it was packed (SFSU was all up in that bitch..lol). Going to this place in a big group is  a HUGE must to even phathom having a decent time. The music..awful! You never know what page the DJ is on...no cute guys and the girls wear sneakers and awful clothes. 

If you just need to get out of the house and go get some stiff drinks, get drunk and make-out randomly....hit this place up! Its free and you have nothing to loose but time, but just don't expecting anything..it will ruin your experience.
author: Natalie F.

description:
I almost feel sorry for Holy Cow after reading some of the reviews, but you've got to appreciate their honesty.  This place really does attract the less-than-average crowd.  The people are less than average in virtually every way possible.

If you're just looking for a bar where you don't have to wait a lifetime to get a drink, the bartenders are decent, and you want a dance floor and smoking area, then this is the place for you.  I simply encourage you to either get piss ass drunk before you look at who's dancing with/near you on the dancefloor, or just don't look at anybody.

The only actual perk to this place is that on some nights the music can be OK, and there is a fenced outdoor smoking area in the back for those of you who need it.  And after seeing what kind of people are inside the bar with you, you will probably need that cigarette.  

I'd normally only give 2 stars... but the smoking area gave it a 3rd star.
author: Mikolo R.

description:
How would I describe Holy Cow on a Saturday?  Hmmm....

No dress code
No cover charge
Pretty good music
Small dance floor
Pretty big outdoor patio (smoking) area with booths
Tables and chairs if you get there by 10.30 pm
Dudes dancing on the tables/boxes at the rear of the bar
Mixed crowd

Point of reference (Not bad if you look at what was ordered....):
6 shots of Goose, chilled
1 Bud Light
2 Grey Goose Tonics
2 Cosmo's
11 Drinks total = $90 (Avg. $8.18/drink)

Parking is a bit hard as there are a couple of other night spots in the area.  But other than that, Holy Cow usually guarantees a good time!
author: Daniel M.

description:
I can understand how people can hate this place. And that's ok. That just means more space for me and girls! (Sorry, that's sound bitchy...)

If you're looking for a club that's like a place on Broadway or North Beach, the SOMA is not the place to find it. 

SOMA bars and clubs are for folks who are looking to spend a little less so don't expect too much.

I'll list my pluses and cons and you can be the judge.

[+] 
NO COVER, EVER!
cheap drinks
top 40 music that will definitely make you dance (80's 90's and 00's)
awesome outdoor patio in the rear with seating and smoking 
decent bathrooms
lots of places to sit in the bar because all the haters leave anyway

[-]
the guys are pretty douchey, as is any club
the possibility of getting in a fight/shot is a bit higher than other establishments
the music can be a little weird on the mash-ups

All in all, come here to dance, drink, and get drinks spilled on you.
author: Kristina C.

description: Great if you like sausage-fests or you are a cheap ass. (No cover)
author: BYRON D.

description:
3 STARS

Only reason it gets 3 stars for the cheap drinks on thursdays. It's always overly crowded but I do like the lounge area in the back, VERY CHILL. It give is the loungey/chit chat feeling. Mixed crowd, nothing else really to it. Also no cover charge always helps. This place does need more bartenders. Takes forever to get a drink.
author: HENRY M.

description:
Ed to the M said:

"If I were the DJ for Holy Cow, this is how I'd end every night:..."

Fuck that, if I were the DJ for Holy Cow I'd kill myself.
author: Joe D.

description:
Wow the reviews for this place seem to be scathing!
So I've only been to the Holy Cow once, but I actually had a decent time.
I always love a bar/club with no cover, and I thought the music was actually pretty fun - like 80s remixes fun, if that's your thing - so I don't know why so many people are claiming that the DJ sucks so much.
The comments about the men are also true - some guy from Egypt kept stalking my friend and some guy kept trying to convince me that his finance job was a form of art.
But whatever, we were both more amused than annoyed; and I don't think it was all that different from what you'd find at a whole lot of other bars and clubs.
Conclusion: If you're in SOMA and you want to go somewhere for free with some fun dancing (and you're definitely not alone), I maintain that you could do a lot worse.
author: Rachel L.

description:
This place is rather scary.  Not because it's located in a shady area of San Francisco, not because the people there are crazy, not because there is a big cow fixture situated above the entrance of the place.  It is because you could probably die from going to the bathroom.  

Seriously, that room is pitch dark and you have 10 other people bumrushing you so they can unzip their pants and pee.  Taking a piss and darkness do not mix.  I've tried that.  It's not really awesome.  Plus you don't know what you're touching in the bathroom, I try to release myself as far away from the urinals as possible so that I won't catch any kind of disease or STD.  Ironically you probably could get it.

Anyway, it's not a place I would recommend, it's a hole-in-the-wall bar simple as that, there's nothing eye-catching or great about it.  You can get your drinks on and sit around, maybe stand in a puddle of urine, but that's about it.
author: Simon L.

description:
I feel for all the ladies who get nothing but cock knocked at this crappy bar with bad DJ's. 

Nothing remotely interesting is what you'll find at Holy Cow.
author: Collin S.

description:
So a group of 7 of us got together to celebrate my boys 30'th birthday and we where suppose to head to 1015 Folsom !club "pura" ! but our stupid drunk asses gave the taxi driver the wrong address and somehow ended up here......!! HOLY COW ,LMFAO!!!!! I must say this was not Club PURA!!!! ....anyways it turned out to be a GReat Fun NIGHT!!!
-So it was free to get in (i was expecting to pay $20 for me and my girl at PURA)
-Nice size decent layout. Big bar, Good , cool bartenders n security, Cheap drinks!!
-They got a nice side lounge area w smaller bar and booths/couches for vip
-DJ was tight. Spacious enough to dance and as well as places to sit.  We went on a sat night and it was krakn, not toooooo packt.
-Coat Check as you walk in --always a plus
As far as negatives , i dont recall ther being a bad oder in the air and ther is no dress code so as far as the crowd that night it was ok. I was w a group of friends, and my girl, and drunk, so i wasnt paying to much attention to other ppl/chicks. Also this club aint super fancy or high tech lighting nor sound. But it gets the job done
I cant say i would recommend this spot to my boys rolling solo looking for a club thata attracts the hottest ladies, but if u with a group thats not into the jersey shore club scene, but still want to go out and party i HIGHLY recommend this place. Especially as a BACK UP Plan in the SF City  cuz you never know what will happen with directions, taxi's, capacitys, dresscodes  etc....
author: Chingon V.

description:
Great nightclub. 

No cover
Outdoor patio w/ drinks
Great music
Good dance floor
More then 1 bar
Several rooms to chill in

I worked there in college at the door. Bill is the man and built a hell of a club.
author: Isaac N.

description:
This place sucks.  The night I went had already started out bad....we went with the hope it would get better, but unfortunately, the bouncers didnt let half of our party in, and when we got in there it went from bad to worst.  

This place gets packed, its dirty, and the dj sucks.  I had heard so many  mixed reviews about it, and now I know why.  

DONT GO.
author: kari s.

description:
Good:

The DJ rocks!! 
No cover.
Patio is kinda cool.
Be sure to check out David in the ladies' room.

Bad: 

Weak drinks - like very weak.
Agree with Alberto, it's smelly.

Would go back again just for the music.
author: Josie K W.

description:
Thursday nights half off all drinks until Midnight really brought up the fun factor here. I went with a friend of mine and 2 other guys. Earlier in the night it seemed as if there was a solid guy to girl ratio but as the night wore on the scale started tipping. It seemed as if all the woman were chased away but the ass grinding "I don't ask before I get my freak on with you" crew. Even with the slim pickins I managed to strike up a decent conversation with some girls and a pretty cool dude at the back patio area. 

The back patio was a huge positive as well as the nice bartenders. (They know they're hot and they make sure that you know it.) Another plus is that it wasn't that crowded. Although if there were anymore people it would be uncomfortable. (huh, I wonder how it is on Friday or Saturday) Music was decent with some old school hip hop, new jams and all time classic bar rock. There were also women dancing on two small stage areas adding to the feel of the place.

All in all a pretty good time although I suspect that Thursdays is probably their best night.
author: Rodney V.

description:
At first I was apprehensive about going because all the reviews on here sound so bad. I am used to going to dive bars like delirium so for me and my friends this was like a step up.

The bartenders are nice and they seem to enjoy being there. There was one guy with a beard behind the bar that kept dancing, he was enjoyable. 

The crowd was eclectic, but in general fun. If your there with a few good friends and drinking its not a bad time. BTW the floors were not sticky and the bathroom wasn't all that gross but I was already drunk when I went in so my word can't be trusted on that issue; because when I am drunk a f***ing bush to pee behind is like heaven sometimes.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
The best thing about this bar is the Cow with the halo over it's head. 

Everything else just doesn't do it for me. The drinks are weak and the size is small for the amount they charge you. 

Really the only good thing about this place is that it's in a central location to other bars/clubs.

and for all you people with fake ID's out there, dont bother, they'll catch ya.
author: Tedi O.

description:
I really love going to this BAR to hang out with my girls. The bartenders are great and drinks as well. THe dj/music is defintely kool..they really know how to blend the right musik. All the times that I have been here there is never one time were i have ever been dissatisfied with the place. The crowd are kool and laid back. Peopz that come here just wanna come out and hang out w/their friends and just have a good time. No drama from all the times ive been there.. I love going for Happy Hour b/c i believe its from monday-saturday and happy hour dont end until 10pm WOW'pretty kool.
Anyways I would defintely recommend this place for those of you who are spectacle about this place or if you are down in the CITY and wanna kick back drink, and dancee!!!!!
author: elia g.

description: I love the Holy Cow! Never had a boring time there, that's fo sho!
author: Soryya S.

description:
Ahhhh the Holy Cow.  How many nights I spent there when I was 21, drunkenly hooking up with random creepy guys...

The Holy Cow is dependable for a party, plus there's no cover which is great.  And the drinks are cheap (and strong!).  The music, on a scale from 1-10, is about a 6.5.  They'll mix in some good hip-hop, only to follow it with one of those requisite 80's songs (beat it, that def leppard sugar song...)

The patio is great for escaping outside when they start playing sucky music.  The inside gets pretty crowded though and you start to get shoved a lot.  To remedy this I simply do my elbow shoving dance.

It's fun, but it gets old after a while.
author: Lydia H.

description: Definitely something to check out, if in the area. It's an experience with girls dancing on platforms and the bar. The music is hot and cold, depending on your taste. (I don't like mash-ups) No cover, never really a line and regular drink prices. The main floor gets pretty crowded (you will get bumped, so flare your elbows), the smoker's patio is chill if you can handle the cloud of smoke. The other side of the bar/ club is pretty empty (near the women's bathroom). If it's not crackin'  which it usually is, it's not far to the next establishments in the area for food or more drinking and dancing.
author: Dennis S.

description:
probably one of the worst bars in SF. no character. bad music. terrible bartenders. sketchy bouncers, probably why more than one has been shot and killed or involved in shootings, true story, check the news. not exactly the place i want to hang out. 

if i weren't already drunk when we got there, you couldn't have paid me to go in. 

lots of other great bars in the area. don't even bother checking this place out.

but don't take my word for it. i wasn't surprised to see that the majority of people gave it only 1 star.
author: danielle m.

description: This place was great. Got here on a Sunday for a private event. Cheap drinks, fast service, and a smoking patio are all good touches. Nice wrap around bar finish this place off. I will have to check this place out on a regular night to see if my experience matches more closer to other patrons
author: Jason O.

description:
What do you expect from a place that's called Holy Cow?!

Besides the fact that it can get jammed packed crowded,  to the point where I'm dancing like I'm in a mosh pit and how the hottest bartender is a total bitch....this place can be hella fun. 

No cover.
Big outdoor smoking area. 
Line in the girl's bathroom goes by pretty fast.
Half off drinks till midnight on Thurs. 
and fuck the music...you'll be hella gone by midnight so you wouldn't care if you're jumping up and down to Journey's "don't stop believing"

Great place to go with friends and have a good time without spending hella money. I swear every time I go, I bump into at least 1 person I know. 

OH and the best part of the place is....THE BACON WRAPPED HOT DOGS...at the end of the night.
author: Trina E.

description:
I should have listened to the yelp reviews. 

Here's what happened. Saturday night, going out, looking good. Started off at House of Shields, which BTW is a great place to start off, and then decided to hit SOMA, because I'm still figuring out what's around there. 

So we decide to go to Holy Cow, because my friends are in the mood to dance or whatever. 

This next detail is important. I'm wearing this really nice woolen Irish cap to compliment my tweed blazer. Yeah, I kinda look like a poser, but whatever. I can back it up and the clothes are nicer than that cheap stuff hipsters wear. It's all about prosperity, folks.

Anyways getting derailed here- - I arrive at Holy Cow with my hat on and the bouncer tells me I need to check it. Well, I thought since the cap is pretty big that maybe he wanted to check it for weapons or drugs or whatever, so I took it off. That's when his tone changed. "No, you need to take that hat and get it checked." I understood, but I followed up with a question anyways. "Do you mind if I ask why?" He abruptly spouts, "We have a standard of dress that we enforce here, and I'm getting tired of talking to you about it. Now you have two choices, you can leave, or you can come in." 

I don't care about the hat, I would have checked it if they acted like they wanted me to come inside. But I can't dig any place that purports to be  classy by enforcing dress codes, and then treats people rudely before they even get inside. 

So I made my choice, went next door to Wish (which was really mellow and nice) and decided to flame these clowns on the Internets. This place sucks worse than my new vacuum, and the music was twice as obnoxious. Avoid it like the plague.
author: Christian P.

description: The reason I love this place is because you can go dancing without feeling like you need to wash the STD's off of you at the end of the night.  This is a fun bar with music and a dance floor NOT a club.  I love that.  The drinks are solid, no cover charge and usually AWESOME music is playing.  By awesome of course I mean you could be at a high school dance where they will always play things like "baby got back".  To me, this is a good time.  Plus there is easy parking nearby and plenty of other clubs/bars within walking distance.  There was a dress code last time we went though- I think my husband had on shorts and was told he needed pants...  Not sure if that is still true though.
author: Karey G.

description: This place is fun when you want to walk around getting hit in the ass by sleazy guys' hard dicks. Or pushed into walls and dated raped on the dance floor. Fun times.
author: Ahnui Y.

description:
I really liked the place, but one of the bartenders was being extremely rude to my friend. She playfully asked if the birthday girl would get a free drink, and he went off on her. He said it was his pet peeve and kept yelling about how he hates being asked. When my friend said it wasn't even for her, he snarled and insisted that it was for her benefit. We left after one drink.

Can't blame the place for the a-hole bartender, but other than him, the music and the atmosphere were cool.
author: Marcos E.

description:
i went to this place a couple of times when i was underage.  i can't believe it's still there. it was sweaty, dirty and polluted with old guys perving on underage girls.  one of my friends saw someone that looked like her dad once.  gross.  

another time, a guy took me there because we were in the neighborhood and the bouncer lit up and said, "hey, you're back again!"  my date swore he'd never been there before in his life and tried to say the bouncer was talking to me.  please.
