so to me, the holy cow is all about old pervs and the not so honest, including me since i was underage.
author: Seong P.

description:
first time here, whoohooo

parked in the parking lot thing for 5 bucks not bad.
came before the crazy rush of ppl, half off drinks, very niceeee

the crowd...is veryyy mixed, young to old and i mean oldddd o.o
henney shots, amf, more henney, down it allll and ur good for the nighttt. 

i liked the music....not realllyyy the oldies but i can dance to watever. it gets toooo hot in there. the patio is a breather but everyone is smoking blah. wish the dancing area was biggerr

oh and it was mostly guys for some reason...LOL 

bring friends,dance drink,have fun. thirsty thursdaysss
author: Christine M.

description:
Dear Holy Cow,
I have never actually stepped foot in your establishment.  Yet how could I have the audacity to rate you, you ask?  Simply because walking past your entrance is like walking past a coughing, spewing child who you want to rush past at all costs.  Your bouncers look as serious as Buckingham Palace guards on steroids and in far worse attire, but to be frank, it is hard to feel intimidated by their rigidity whilst "Love Shack" (barf) is blaring from your depths.  
I've spent many a night in your neighborhood, perusing Wish, Butter, etc. etc.,  and every time I am forced to walk past your doors I feel a little dead inside.  The painfully-outdated-and-not-in-a-good-way music is only slightly overshadowed by the sloppy clientele you encourage to flop around the street corner like beached, nicotine soaked whales.  If you would just accept yourself for what you are- a tacky, run-down drinkery that would be better suited with a polyester clad wedding singer at the door rather than giant bouncers, you might stand a chance.  But for now, please, PLEASE get over yourself.
Sincerely, 
Christine
author: Christine M.

description:
okay yelpers, before i start with my bid, i just want to give you guys a heads up before coming to this joint.
 
***so anyone that came here before knows that you need a minimum of $25 to use plastic (and if you don't know, now ya DO!) and that was our case last night. we were getting our night started with drinks all around, the bartender was obviously got confused after order 3 drinks and probably because she was DRUNK..... anyways.. we order 5 drinks, but she shafted us one corona = $5.00 = no bueno. we let her know, but she said, "fuck no, i didn't"... well little bit*h... if you weren't drinking you would know for sure... oh yea, she also threw a hissy fit because we gave her a small tip and if she was sober she would know why and how dumb her ass was acting... she is this one small latin/white chick with black hair, watch out for her yelpers***

anyways.. i've been to this joint numerous times for their thirsty thursday night.. personally i had alot of fun going in the past, but this past saturday was the worst... 16th and valencia is 1000000000000000000000000000x better for satuday night dive bars! also.. if you're trying to get in...bring a couple of girls for easier entry.. or just make sure you look good cause the bouncers are really discriminatory. hahaha

+Thursdays: cheap drinks, no cover, asian sausage fest... cute girls though.... if you can find them

+Saturday: cheap drinks, no cover, less crowded, drunk bartenders that try to shaft your ass... hm....

hope this helps!
author: Alex C.

description:
THE GOOD: THURSDAYS 1/2 off drinks. i've gottten two shots of patron for $10, no joke. the music is definitely better on thursdays compared to saturday's bon jovie 30 yr old crowd. again, no lie. this is one of the better dive bars because of its no cover charge ever!

THE BAD: if your a guy, good luck getting in on thursdays unless your loved one or girlfriends are gonna sneak you in! since theres never a cover charge, there is a higher potential of male activity. (haha, guys: vegas all over again?) BRING CASH! this joint requires at least a $25 charge in order to use debit/credit. Also, no cheap free water here. They charge a buck for a bottled water (at a dive bar? i know...). The bouncers here are jerks, and selective as well. exhibit A: my friend from hawaii was celebrating her going away trip, and wanted to hit holy cow. we had a system of bringing in all of our guy friends by coupling up. Her being the odd number, but still a girl went up first. Showed her legit Hawaiian ID, and was denied entrance due to the fact that a lil plastic was peeling off, and that she was probably from out of town. The douchebag bouncer then tries to "examine" it some more by holding the id against the wall lights, and continued to call for security check. At this point, another bouncer came out and shined a flashlight to it, and instead of scanning it like a professional or using a BLACKLIGHT, they both decided it wasn't going to happen. Be warned, these bouncers think they are hot shit, but if your a girl or if you can butter them up its all good.

It gets super crowded when it hits around 11-12, so especially if your a guy get in before 10:30 or else bienviendos.

THE UGLY: bartenders. yes, either they are selective punks who will never follow the order of getting some drinks or they are drunk and overcharge your ass. Yes, i was one of those victims who was charged for a extra corona. The crowd on saturday's are not poppin... it is a older crowd compared to fridays or thursdays, and the miusic is more of a 90's oldies/hiphop or rock flashbacks. i've seen a whole family with the daughter and the mom getting down on the ledge corners...
author: Shirley L.

description:
i've had many first experiences here.
-first time at a nightclub/bar
-first bachelorette party
-first stripper
-first bruises from dancing the night away

hmmm...there had to be a couple more firsts, but who can remember in a place like this.  the private room is good for bachelorette parties.  the bouncers do a great job of keeping guy off the small platform.  not bad for a nightclub...then again, i was only 19 when i went here and my taste for such ventures have changed in the past 6 years...so i'll cherish my early partying memories and will probably never walk through these doors again.

thanks for the firsts, holy cow!
author: Marjie T.

description:
dorm parties.  never liked them.  cheesy music on repeat.  full of kids who had to reach for another natty lite before they could interact w/the opposite sex.  i always wondered what happened to these kids.  ...until i was dragged to holy cow, that is.

i sat at the bar the whole time i was there.  ...drowned my sorrows in cranberry grey gooses as i stared out into the sea of people on the dance floor and contemplated the unfortunate fate of humanity.
author: Ting A.

description: I've been here a few times with last night being the most recent. Besides the cheap drinks, this is not the place to go if you're looking for great music and an attractive crowd. Besides all of the fat girls(I'm not a hater) who were hogging up the dance floor, lesbian couples (i'm not a hater) and weird ass guys with no moves or too many moves, it was ok. I spent the majority of my night laughing my ass off.
author: Elizabeth F.

description:
we only come here on thursdays for the half price drinks.  a shot of remy for $4 - $5 dollars?  hell yeah!  i`m asian, and i love a deal!  that`s the only reason i gave this place 2 stars.

thursday nights are crowded and crazy...and it`s a total dickfest!  the guys are drunken assholes here! 

once, while i was walking through the dancefloor to get to the bar, a guy reached out and patted/ran his fingers through my hair!  seriously, WTF?!  don`t go patting/running your dirty ass fingers though my hair!!  i`m not your fucking dog!!  that guy was hella LUCKY the dancefloor was so crowded, cuz i was seriously about to kick him in the balls!

every single time i come here, there`s always some guy [or guys] who tries to touch me.  honestly, didn`t your mother teach you to keep your hands to yourself?  disgusting.
author: Dee W.

description: HOLY COW THIS PLACE STANKED, literally!  i'm still not sure why my group and i kept dancing in such close proximity with the bathroom area but damn dude, they need some serious chlorox action up in that place. i had to pee real bad but would rather get an UTI than to relieve myself there. okay so aside from my poor olfactory senses taking a beating, the music was alright, not bad, danceable.. given you're under the influence of some alcohol, anything is danceable right? so we went on a thursday, half off night apparently, and the place was omfgPACKEDDD to the ceiling, i felt like i was in a mosh pit.
author: Jennie L.

description: This place was definitely not worth finding parking for, but my friend insisted we go. Drinks are cheap enough for young kids to come by. I hear this place is always packed,  but not the night I went. It was pretty empty and it was a friday night. There were no female bartenders so the place did not really have any good looking women, just scantly clad ones. The music was loud, I guess some people like that. I am more of a laid back person. Dont think I will ever be coming back, unless miraculously all my friends want to, and I mean all.
author: Dorian T.

description:
good---no cover, great music, clean bathrooms except for the unisex one 

bad----crowded, bar tenders are more worried about each other and the bouncers are cocky jerks!!! They have two bars and only have one open.... dosnt make any sense!!
author: Kendra S.

description:
The bouncers try to implement a dress code, but I just don't see why. It's like dressing up to go to McDonalds...just don't make any sense.

Drinks are good, and not too pricey. But this place is sticky and smells like a C-list frat house.

Probably don't need to come here again
author: Jenny L.

description: holy leopard cow utters~!@!...tumblin' early...long been out of loop....familiar strip from early 20s years....years foward to present....pack of 30s traveling down memory lane...stopping by familiar leopard cow....check of i.d...and pack walking in.....surprised by hearing from behind..."no white t-shirt!..no hoodies!"....holy cow doing some filtering of patrons...happy hour 'til 11:30pm...fat tire in glass...chug 'n' chat..familiar wooden bar...three bartenders main...quick friendly drink servicing.......young crowds slowly moving in the later hours...music turning up...time for oldies to move on out....
author: Hen A.

description:
THE YOUNG MALE BARTENDER IS A DOUCHE BAG!
He thinks he's the shit and always has a stupid comment to whatever drink you order. I first got a chambord and he gives me this look and complains to me that there's no alcohol in there. Near the end of the night, my friend asks for two shots of Hennessey and he starts pouring us some Remy. We thought  he heard wrong, and explained to him nicely we asked for Hennessey. Instead of giving us what we wanted, he starts rambling that they're the same thing and continues pouring the Remy. My friend gets upset and tells him she wants what she ordered. He finally gives us what we want but is still complaining about bullshit we don't want to hear. We pay him and my friend even tips him after all of that. A guy walks by and the bartender dares to tell him that we did not pay and we were trying to get free drinks! He then tells us to never go back there again or else he will kick us out. 
MY FRIENDS AND I ARE NEVER GOING BACK THERE AS LONG AS THAT LAME ASS BARTENDER IS STILL THERE.
author: Gina P.

description:
there are way worse spots that have higher ratings on yelp than this beefy joint... smh

sip:
I bought a round of tron silvers for the 3 birthday party-goers, myself included.. it was under 40? I forget, we were blasted. the goose and belvedere shots weren't too small but they weren't overflowing like some other spots where the bartenders get so overwhelmed they waterfall the pours.. the bartenders are cute and nice, but there could be one or two more for the size of the bar and number of people that roll through on thursdays.

CROWD:
thursday night got pacccked. i heard this was the night to hit this spot from several heads, a mixture of "its so easy to pull females on thursdays @ holy cow!" to.. "fellas are total creeepers there!" anyways, sardine, shoulder to shoulder status. the ratio and mixture of different crowds was cool for the size of this place. its not the biggest spot in SF but i had a cool time.

GROOVE:
two dancefloors with pyramid shaped dance stages. tiers going up, and although the floors are tiny, ladies still got it rockin. the mix was alright and they played mostly newer mainstream rap/hip-pop. some of the chics were cuties but we were all blassssted 

no lights in the bathroom + my drunk ass = close calls ALMOST pissing all over my kicks
author: Braden K.

description: Great place for a bachlorette party! The staff is really friendly & accommodating for our group. The place is dank 7 the bathroom is pretty dark & disgusting.
author: Dorothy M.

description: The best and simultaneously worst part of this place are all the gross, sweaty makeout sessions that continually bump into you because the dance floor is the size of my bathroom.
author: chris w.

description: I always have a good time here.  The crowd is younger but the bartenders are awesome and the prices are great!
author: Kiki A.

description: Maybe if I was 20 I'd go here, then again maybe not. The juxtaposition between the crowd here and the hipsters at Wish (almost next door) is something to see.
author: Nish N.

description:
holy cow i can't say no to free drinks!

i would give it 5 stars
but only on fridays
every other day
1 star
cuz no free drinks
or 4 stars between 10-11
so that rounds out to be
3 stars

maybe minus another star for throwing up after so many said free drinks.
author: Ronald T.

description: how to start off your thrusday night @ holy cow with min. cost?! come early with your friend, pick up bottle from your local market like bottle of gray gosse $30 tops... bring chaser... bring some cups and get smashed out on the streets... go inside about 1030, there shouldn't be a line but sometime there are... remember drinks are HALF OFF until midnight, so you get a few rounds and you already drunk out your mind... that's when the place start getting pack and nice... been coming this place for years and i just love it... some people think this place is boring but if you bring a group or couple friend... you going to have one hell of a krazy thursday night... i got into fights and kick out before, so noting new to me... haha... bring you sister or brother id and come out to party!!!
author: JessePanda C.

description:
friday nights drinks are half off from 9-11

great music here last night, lots of dancing crazy ppl
good crowd
nice bartenders

pool for a buck
def check this place out if you want to have a good time and not have to pay cover
author: Mimi Z.

description: A friend from work was called a fag here, and then was busted over the head with an empty beer bottle by the same asshole... So i was reluctant to go here myself... But I was impressed, the decor is flashy and fun, The bar tenders are nice (maybe it helps that I already know a couple of them, but whatever)... and I love The big cow angel watching over the entrance.  May be spending some more time here in the future :)
author: Caleb D.

description: Ok I was really skeptical going here.  One of my friends said it was "off the hook"....another said it was just a  really good time.  THEN I ready the yelp reviews and was totally not enthused to go.  I'm a clean cut white chick...I like to party.  I like diversity but I like energy and fun too.  This place had a great mix of people and the vibe I was looking for.  A variety of good music...hip hop, rock, 80's...Only drawback...too crowded at the later part of the night.  Not just crowded but I'm talkin like sardines on the dance floor!  Not comfortable at all!  If you're just lookin to shake your thang with a younger cute crowd then I suggest you check this place out!
author: karla k.

description: Shitty ass crowd. My money, blackberry, and CAR KEYS were stolen from my zipped purse. When I left, after discovering my purse had been emptied out, I found that my CAR was STOLEN as well. Never stepping foot in this shit hole again.
author: Shelby P.

description:
i came and then i ran.
douchebags and non-sf whores. (0 points) + awesome happy hour (2 points) = 2 stars.
subtract the fact that the pool table is old and ghetto = a very large total of 1 whole star.
the door guys seem pretty nice though.
author: Andrea F.

description:
if you like to dance on poles to get attention, give attention to people who dance on poles to get attention, get drunk and throw up, slip and slide on vomit, smell like smoke or test out your beer goggles!?!? then this place is for you.  

and the music?  imagine "NOW THATS WHAT I CALL MUSIC"  on repeat mixed with journey, aerosmith, jefferson starship and twisted sister thrown in.  

i came here once.  one time too many.  all i kept thinking was: shoot me.  medula oblongatta.  i wont feel a thing

One star.  not my bag baby.  couldnt wait to leave
author: Charlie S.

description: This is definitly a dirty little secret. A total dump. Cheap drinks, dirty atmosphere, and no dress code. Why is this place fun? Because you can actually get real down and hella dirty before you leave. Everyone in there is cool with everyone. There is no crowd here because everyone is literally stuck in one place. If you dont mind the smell, o dear this is the place for you.
author: Harry L.

description: Holy Cow is o.k. if you can ever get inside the door.i wasn't let in because of what i was wearing i.e. jeans and a t-shirt. When I went back with "dress code" acceptable clothes it was overcrowded and the d.j. barely played any songs we liked.
author: James C.

description: i was there for the bearracuda party. the place i love has lots of room nice patio to be out and smoke. the bar staff are friendly not negativity about them ...the girls working behind of the bar are hot, hot.... and the music was amazing just let you know.
author: B H.

description: If you want to experience the east bay in all its splendor without leaving San Francisco, head to the Holy Cow.
author: Dave S.

description:
I love how this place galvanizes such extreme opinions. You either love it or hate it. My general opinion of it has always been that like many clubs in the bay area, it's the epitome skankhood for both men and women and all the worse things a meat market can be. Having said that, I hadn't been here in a very long time.
At the invitation of one of my old coworker friends, I had decided to get on one of those godforsaken Partybuses, or the mini Fresno tourbuses that an earlier reviewer so hilariously described it. If it weren't for the great company, I think I would have been in hell.
This was the first club of the evening, although it befuddles me as to why it's on the roster at all, since it's free. What struck me first was how different the mood seemed to me. The lights were dimmed down, house music was playing, and the crowd sparse. But this could be because it was earlier in the evening. What hadn't changed was the three girls and one dude who you always see freaking up on the corner stages, the mish mash music from house to 80's to top 40, and just the general vibe of ho hum-ness. The staff were all quite nice, from the smoking hot bartender to the bouncer at the front chomping down a burrito (gotta have carbs when you're guarding a joint) to the coat check girl texting somebody on her cellphone. Laid back, with my mind on my money and my money on my mind
author: Kevin A.

description:
3 stars cuz its half off drinks thursdays before 12 -- and i was here on a thurs before 12

crowd is meh

oh, and the urinal overflowed and made everyones shoes wet =[

no cover makes me smileee
author: Justin T.

description: no cover charge is a plus, the music here is alright i dont ever go agian this place is not to memorable for me , last time i went i met a really nice bartender! she hooked me up!
author: eric l.

description:
I give you two stars Holy Cow... but take your two stars and know that sometimes, I need a little double star action in my life.  Sometimes, I need to dance to shit I would never own, borrow, download and/or admit to liking.   Sometimes - I need to make out with transient 5' tall Irish men in your bathrooms. Sometimes I like to pretend that I'm dating the girls I'm with so that I can avoid dancing with men glued to my ass. Sometimes I like creepy people squeezing past me, just because I get the chance to elbow the inappropriate. 

Sometimes I like to be two star trashy myself.  Not often..

...but sometimes.
author: M. M.

description: i kinda like Holy Cow a lot and I don't care who knows it. Its pretty sketch, but i always have a blast. The outside section is clutch and everyone in the bar is always wasted. If you are looking for a good party with no frills Holy Cow can be a good time.
author: Bobby P.

description:
or, holy sh*t?

the music was alright (decent variety, but bad mixing), and there were a lot of people dancing, but it's one of those clubs that decided to make a walkway from the bar area to the patio through the dance floor...

why do bar/clubs do that!?

actually, the thing about "the cow" that was really nasty was the prowling guy factor.  seriously.  made it feel like an 18 + club.  yuck.
author: Jill k.

description:
is this place still open??? i used to hit it with a fake id back in the day and it was a dump then.  scary to think of what the bathrooms look like these days.  and wtf...i thought someone stole the cow - did they bring it back or did the owners really pony up the cash for a new cow?

bad music, scary strong drinks, disgusting bathroom, way too small dance floor and i was way too drunk to remember anything else that may or may not have happened in this establishment. 

three stars for the scary strong drinks, minus 1 for the icky bathroom.
author: Jennifer G.

description: The only day I've ever been in this place is Folsom Street Faire Sunday and then it's packed to the rafters with ass baring chaps, naked submissives and women wrapped into shiny black latex and people are dancing and drinking and spanking and caning and licking and I have to say... I love it!  I also have to say that I would NEVER be caught DEAD in this place any day other then Folsom Street Faire Sunday.  In my world, The Holy Cow only exists on that one day.
author: Cosmolicious L.

description: I recall going here for a bachelorette party.  We didn't stay long.  I haven't been back since.  They do serve booze, which garners them 2 stars, on GP.
author: Nikki c.

description: Perhaps I was a bit judgemental on the first go-around.  Don't get me wrong, the bouncers are still dicks, but this place does have the potential to be fun if 1) you can get your boot-clad men past the bouncers, 2) you enjoy Top 40 hits of yesterday and today, including favorites from the Bloodhound Gang and Prince, and 3) you don't mind a creepy sausage fest on the dance floor.  Seriously, creepiness of epic proportions.  I should have come armed with a fly swatter or something.  Other than that, though, I had  a decent time.
author: Lauren S.

description: This place sucks.  This is the 24-28 year old version of city nights.  Can you say meat market?  I felt like I caught an std just having a drink here.  I ordered a 18-dummy and they didn't know what it was.  I told them "it is a vodka redbull with cuervo 1800 instead of vodka" and they said "we don't have 1800 we only have patron".  sheesh.
author: Matt N.

description:
the place it grimmy. but i like the fact that their drinks are half off before 12 and that there isnt cover to get in.  the bad thing is, guys have to wait in line, unless they have a girl with them. 

if you know the bouncers, you you dont gotta wait in line. but if you dont, you gotta get in line. unless you pay them on the side. 

thursday nights are usually the best and most busiest nights. Bartender that usually works the front bar, he's hot, not gonna lie. back bar is cash only. there is an atm and they do have coat check. smoking area in the back
author: Bombdiggity b.

description: Screaming bachlorettes, people with no sense of fashion (looking like they rolled out of bed), horrible music, and just awful in general. will never go back.
author: Marina K.

description: Should be called Holy Shit.  This place is where everyone with a fake ID goes.  How do I know?  I used to get in with my sorry ass fake ID back in the day.  Drunk ass chicks like to dance on the bars and benches but beware if they've had too many drinks and they fall on you.  I never fell but I was a drunk ass chick dancing.  It's always packed with tourists and East Bayers so be prepared.  Just such a cliche.  It gets two stars strictly for nostalgia and letting me in with a fake ID.
author: Jill D.

description:
one star for no cover charge.  another star for simply being the place where my bf and i started flirting with each other 2+ years ago.

and i haven't been back since.
author: Jolene T.

description: I feel compel to write a review even I haven't set foot here for a while.  This is by far the most friendly club ever.  No cover!  They'll just let you in to have a good time.  Music is always loud, 80s, POP.  Dress code varies, depending on who goes there that night and decides what to wear.  Drinks can be cheap on a certain night with just $1 or  $2 a bottle of Budweiser and people were downing it like it's H2O...  It's a popular scene to see guys holding 2 bottle of beers there lol....  The dancing crowd is crazy and happy.  I went with my friends and we did have some crazy wild moments in there.  Sweet memories :)
author: Bella A.

description: Holy cow, this place sucks balls.
author: Trav W.

description:
"now this is what i call a target-rich environment."

for some reason, a friend really wanted to have a drink here. there were about four other people at the bar when we got there (around 11p); we had the entire patio to ourselves. the drinks were cheap. we must have had more than a few... when we got up to leave, the bar was packed and there was a line outside.

after dinner at a thai restaurant down the street, i walked by the bar again... yes, a younger crowd. girls half naked. enough said.
author: vincent m.

description:
God, I'm old. 

I mean, hell. I'm really, really old. 

As stated in my review of Butter, any night that lands you at the Holy Cow is scary, to say the least. 

There were four of us in our little troop. At 32, I was the youngest. The oldest was 35. No spring chickens, but certainly not geriatric either. But an hour in the Holy Cow was enough to convince me that I should immediately check into the nearest retirement facility for active seniors. How did we end up there? The mammas, temporarily unencumbered by children and husbands wanted to go dancing. The BF and I have no clue where thirty somethings go to dance. Or twenty somethings for that matter. Not that we don't like to shake it and all, but we prefer to do it to some live music at the Fillmore or some such place. Or on the coffee table. Naked. But that's another story. 

Basically the Holy Cow was within spittin' distance of Butter and there wasn't a cover (Thank you, baby Jesus!) to pay for the frivolity within. But the music sucked (go figure), the drinks were weak (and wrong. The tarted up 21 year old bartender kept giving me Jack and cokes when I asked for Beam and sodas). The crowd (as previously stated) might as well have been teenagers (I'm sure some of them were). The overriding feeling of the whole experience can be summed up in three words: 
                                         PROM FROM HELL.

But clearly I was out of my element. Had I been more in people- watching mode, I may have had a better time. Alas, I was just there to drink and to see if I still knew how to dance. I am sure if I was an 18 year old from Sunnyvale with a passable fake ID, a bootlicious little outfit and a nice peach-shnapps buzz, I would have had the time of my life.
author: Sage R.

description:
god i can't stand this place.

so why the 2 stars you might ask....

1. i went there with awesome people=fun no matter where we are

2. the dj was pretty good.

3. the drinks are on the cheaper side.

that said, the people in this place suck and it gets waaay too crowded for being such a lame place. it feels kinda like the place that all the rejects resort to when they get turned down at other bars...

i guess i fit in perfectly after all...
author: rachel c.

description: I dunno, it's tough for me to demote anyplace that offers half price drinks til 11pm on Friday nights.  Granted, the bouncers are curiously discriminating with regards to who gets and and why, if you're all bent on a dress code, try filtering out the demographic by charging cover.  The maze to the dungeon of a bathroom is about as inviting as a Klan run highway rest stop in Alabama to a brownie like me.
author: Sam N.

description: This is an okay place. Not great but not bad. The drinks are CHEAP (btw 9 & 11), so why not? The crowd that showed up on Friday night was random at best. Danced here for awhile, but the music was not as danceable as it could be. I would go back if I were with right people and for the cheap drinks :)
author: Allisoto P.

description:
I've been tryin to think of places to review that suck, because so far I've yelped only places I've rated positively.

Holy Cow definitely is a place that sucks...sucks hard!!!

I don't go there anymore, and I can't believe that I've gone there more than once. For one, its a free bar among a club district of SOMA that often has cover, so people stumble in for a quick peek and find that this place is not worth 2 more minutes.

Yeah, it gets crowded, but that doesn't mean it's a great spot to party. It's filled with young bucks "party like rock stars', but don't know how...spilling drinks on eachother, trying to dance, but end up bumpin into you, and like most bars, has a high guy to girl ratio. The thing is most guys that come here make it a meat fest to prey on the young. Not to mention the music sucks with your typical mix of 'Top 20' dance tracks that have no originality, tru soul or beat.

That's my take, and 'suck' is the best adjective I can give it.
author: Barbie D.

description:
it gets old real fast, but the smell of stale urine will linger forever.

cheap drinks. that's it
author: Celso C.

description: I really want to like this place because of the half off drinks. But the crowd has gotten a lot weirder and people you have old perverted drunks trying to grab your butt, its just disgusting and on thursdays the place reeks of sweat.
author: Karena P.

description: The first time I went here was on a Thursday night, which was a very busy night. Security let us three girls cut, because there was a long line of gentleman. What a sausage fest. As soon as you walk through the door, it felt like a sauna filled with a smell you didn't want to inhale too much. It may be bothersome to some people, but I just ignore it. Although I would have liked to dance the night away, I could not, because the dance floor was so packed. It was so packed, I spilled some of my drink on some guy's back, on my way to the patio. Oopsy, I think he was drunk and grinding on some girl, so he didn't care. I wish they made another entrance to the patio, but then again, maybe it's not always that packed. The place is pretty huge. And probably one of the most random clubs ever, with the big leopard printed cow hanging off the walk and really diverse quality of music, that I definitely could see myself jamming to if I was super wasted. A little bit of it, reminded me of my college days in Isla Vista/Santa Barbara. It's like a house party and a club in one. It's strange, but I like it. But I definitely need to check it out a few more times, to be sure.
author: April D.

description: Alright. Can get packed fast and the wait for a bartender can be horrible from time 2 time.
author: Michael M.

description:
Thirsty Thursdays!! You will be thirsty alright. Good luck getting a drink with this many people. 

No cover
1/2 off drinks
Packed like a can of sardines
Reminds me of a frat party 
Drunk girls dancing on top of everything and anything they can find.. (fugly btw)
Smells like piss
By the end of the night you will be soaked in other peoples sweat. 

Eek, me thinks not.
author: Simon S.

description: Horrible crowd. Perfvect on a thursday night tho for cheap drinks/ Definitely a pre party place, from 10-12 it's half off drinks! that's 2 dollar beers people. . .
author: Annette M.

description:
i used to love going to this place. my boy tony which bartend every thursday was the man. im sure he bartend other days but thursday was the best night to go. he always hooked me and my boys up no matter how crowded it got. it used to be fun when the regular san franciscan went but now its everyone and their mommas so the place gets crowed and i swear there are a bunch of people there who forgets to put on deodorant and it just makes the places all smelly and musty which fuckin sucks! OH..and the walls get all wet from all the sweat and thats just nasty. 

they dont accpet credit cards there also which sucks!
author: Tuan D.

description: This is only the second time I've been here. The experience you have really depends on who's with you when you go there. Luckily I have a group of friends who keep it fun regardless of where the party is, but I don't think I'll be coming back here any time soon. The music was okay, the drinks were good, but having someone I know get kicked out because he attempted to break dance is ridiculous. The bouncers are dumbasses. I even told a friend about it the next day and he just shook  his head like "I can't believe you went there!" For someone who doesn't get out much, he told me to never go back there because the staff is racist. I don't remember the racial profiling since I was in a good mood after a few drinks, but I think I've been there enough times to say it's better to go somewhere else.
author: Rhia R.

description:
Holy Cow is not thaaaaaaat bad.  I mean, come on, you should know what you're getting into before you come in here.  Yes, it isn't the cleanest or classiest of places, but on Thursdays, you can shake what your mama gave you to some pretty bad ass music and decent, CHEAP drinks!  Plus, who doesn't love a place that has no cover?  I don't really mind that the male to female ratio here is about 50:1.5, I usually don't pay attention to the guys anyway.

I'm definitely dragging my friends back here when we're tired of getting all gussied up for nicer joints and just want to have a fun, cheap time.
author: Dwigt K. S.

description:
it was cool back in 2002 but its gone downhill from there.. 

the place gets ridiculously crowded.. THROW THEM BOWS!... i guess thats why they have such a long line... full of guys... girls dont have to wait.  

one of the bartenders actually gave me shit for not tipping on a round when i tipped fat the round before... i guess his big muscle wouldnt  allow him to remember the people that tipped but has a fascination with people that dont.  get off the 'roids chump. 

its halfoff drinks until 1/2 on thursday but the 1/2 off shots are 1/2 the size... i guess its like ordering a mcd's mini meal.

the place is a shit hole.  music is tolerable..  but the drinks suck.... but im pretty sure i'll be back ... god i hate myself
author: Doug ..

description:
holy cow!

holy shit!
 
this place charged me FOUR freakin separate times (coming up to 130.00) on my open tab  when i signed only for 25.00....wtf 8$#@)$($*%*%*%*%*%?

anyone know what to do? 

no wonder that bulky bartender was so nice to me.
author: Jennie T.

description: Great place to hang out if you come with friends.  It's a bar, but not like those loner bars where people keep to themselves.  At least on Thursday it's not.  People come here as if its a club.  They dress in their club attire, not too semi-formal but better than if you walked in in your street clothes.  Depending on when you go, it goes from packed to fire hazard.  During the school year, it gets packed.  During the summer, winter break, spring break or any kind of holidays, the line goes out the door.  It sucks waiting.  The club knows this and they try to make some money off of you by asking you to pay $50 for a table.  I didn't mention yet that because this is a bar, they don't charge a cover fee EVER!  It says so on the sign they leave on the street.  So, it is kind of ridiculous when they offer this.  They play a mix of top 40's and at times EDM.  They always have a birthday shout out.  There is a happy hour special, half off until 12 on Thursday nights.  I don't know about the other nights because well, I for the most part come on Thursday nights.  The bartenders make the drinks pretty strong and larger than the one shot size you paid for.   A lot of people congregate in the back patio: smoking and talking as a disco ball slowly spins around reflecting little neon dots on your body.  It's very entrancing................  They let you stay out there until I'd say about 1 and then everyone is forcibly migrated to the main dance floor.  It was already packed inside already and with the addition of the people on the patio, you barely have any space to move.  If you feel a tap on your back, it's most likely someone trying to move around you.  Some people forget to be polite and shove.  I've almost gotten into a fight with one of those people.  Play nice people. Last call is usually around 1:15 and by 1:30, they turn the lights on.  Usually you'll know when it's time to go when Michael Jackson's "PYT" or Journey's "Don't Stop Believin'" comes on.  I've come here on a Saturday night out of pure boredom and it's dead.  They play some old rock music.
author: Brandon Y.

description: On Saturday February 2, 2013 I attended a birthday celebration at The Holy Cow. A friend of mine was shoved while dancing and an argument ensued, and while we were telling the girl and her two friends to be quiet and walk away from us, the bouncers in the club began pushing us towards the door. I became extremely upset because there was no reason for us to be asked to step outside, considering the fact that we were not the aggressors in this situation. While outside, the club owner and two other bouncers began to yell at us and also made several racially discriminating comments. As we stood outside and tried to explain that we had done nothing wrong and that there was no reason for us to be escorted outside, one of the bouncers pulled out his iPhone and started recording us. I told him to put his phone away because it was clearly inappropriate and extremely unprofessional. A girl standing next to him (who I assume to be his girlfriend) began to yell at me and when I replied back to her, the bouncer then proceeded to yell in my face, pushing me backwards. As he continued to yell, his coworkers pulled him inside the club and right before the door shut he yelled "I'll kill you!" to me. When the club owner came back outside, I told him what his staff had said to me and he responded by denying the statement, although he had not been anywhere near us so he clearly had no idea what was said. I then tried to explain that to him but he seemed incapable of listening so my friend and I left shortly after. All in all, I would not recommend attending The Holy Cow. Fulsom Street has so much more to offer and the fact that there's no cover charge doesn't make up for the fact that the staff is beyond unprofessional and is incapable of running a successful business.
author: Brianna W.

description:
this place to me was alright. i was kindof dragged there. but on the long run i did get a free zippo lighter. i guess thats always a plus. 

the place is nasty some areas it just stunk of alcohol and some places just smelled like urine so you tell me where can i actually be in that place. NO WHERE. some areas its just dirty you think that on the weekends its such a busy place they would have workers cleaning the place up. but no. 

forrreal though you go there to pick up chicks and thats the bottom line or if your a girl you pick up guys. 

also its just MAD crowded i am  a big guy so i am squeezing through all these drunk people its not fun.
author: Nicholas Y.

description: Well I've been there once and had a blast on a Thurs (where else can you go on a Thursday that is poppin) and had a lot of fun. But came back the next Thursday and was told I could not get in because of my Jordans. So not that big of a fan anymore because 2 guys in front of me got in wearin Jordans I know this cause we were talkin about shoes in line. Selective Service is never a good thing. Its cool though, there are better places in the city
author: Jimmy U.

description: Holy shit this place sucks now. The bouncers are morons. Wouldn't let my friend in for wearing jeans but everyone inside looks homeless. If your scared of someone just say it, don't feed us B.S. Crowd is young and dumb and the bartenders were shitfaced. Cool if your a youngster in college. Not my cup of tea anymore.
author: Erik W.

description: Hoooooooly Cow! All drinks are half off before 12am on Thursday nights! No cover charge! However, if you pay with card, there's a $25 minimum and they suggest you keep the tab open. I ended up using my card when I went there and I had to open a tab because two Tokyo Teas and one Buttery Nipple was only $14. That's like usually 1 1/2 drinks at normal price. Pretty amazing. There's one bartender who wasn't very friendly and was kinda rude. Don't remember her name, but it's she's a Caucasian lady with short hair. I wouldn't suggest going to her. The coat check is right when you enter Holy Cow. $2 for one item, $3 for two items. It gets very very very crowded! Which means, there's not much dance space. The security guards are polite, for the most part. I mean, my friends and I ended up getting kicked out the night I went because our birthday girl wasn't able to keep her eyes open or stand up/walk on her own. Hahaha. But, they were nice about it and helped her out. Most security guards are douchebags and yell at you. But eh, the time spent there was pretty chill. I'd come back on a Thursday!
author: Ava A.

description: Drunken debauchery: No cover, huge bar and small bar in the back... Hate it or love it, the place has been packed with folks having good times everytime I've been dragged in there...
author: Yuichi S.

description: If the name of the place was any indication of what the atmosphere was like then maybe this place wouldn't be as bad as it was when I saw it the few times I've been. The place is a very mixed age group which is frustrating and its entirely way too crowded to even move let alone dance. The back area is a little better but not enough to save this dank pit. Avoid like the Plague
author: Richard N.

description:
this place sucks.  only thing cool is the cow outside. dress code my ass, full of lame asses.

ok - to make this a little more useful, if you are into places like this...
1. do not wear a hat - unless you like snotty security guards and really want to talk to them up close
2. appreciate that you can walk right out and not deal with a cover charge
3. it does get a crowd in there if you want a crowd... with no qualifications
3. um, that's it.
author: Today Y.

description:
thrusday nights... half off till midnight.
used to go there all the time with one friend
and then switches friends and went all the time
this week all three of us went....

who are we kidding???? we love holy cow on thrusdays... lol. why even lie to ourselves like we want to go some where else. give me my pumas and my wife beater.... its on and poppin every thrusday... and yes u have seen me and my friend dancing on the right hand side stage with  Pete!!!! yup thats us!!!!

im gonna stop fronting... i love this place!
author: Ashley H.

description: Why the bar need dress code it's not a fancy restuarant. This place is only great because of there price for drinks and mix group of people and the hot bartender
author: V S.

description: Tooo crowded of a place for my taste, but def a place to check out on thurs nights..
author: Shane S.

description: "If I have had too many drinks and just want a free place to dance it works."
author: Lisa K.

description: La Carniceria...meat market!!!  No cover, $2 drinks then half price drinks, gangster posers, and haters make a fine recipe for an ugly, beligerent crowd. Unless you're broke or shopping for a cheap chunk of meat or training for fight club, go elsewhere!  If you want to have a good time, avoid this place.
author: Kimo S.

description: Unpretentious, Upbeat, Unmatched vibe! This place has been here FOREVER. It's had it's share of up's and down's, but believe me... if you have any sense of humor and how to have a good time, this place is  blast. 1/2 price drinks on Friday w/ Dj Jays One....one of the most solid dj's in the bay? Yes, please.
author: Josh O.

description:
I went here Sat night for my boyfriends friend's going away party and I have to say all of the reviews are dead on about this place. 

Free entrance, great! Nice outdoor patio that is way underused... Have you guys heard of heat lamps and people there's nothing wrong with the smoking of a joint or 2 in between dances. I think the patio has potential to be the best spot in a club! Anywho...the bartender was nice, although my drinks were weak. I had 2 Jager shots and a pineapple and vodka...(crickets chirping) Nothing! Hmm, makes me think that wasn't Jager in that bottle. THE CROWD... Oh the crowd. There were tons of "cows" and average Janes galore. I give kudos to the chicks bold enough to dance on the platforms, but man at least put as much effort into your attire as you do your dance moves. At times it seemed like I was overdressed compared to what a lot of these chicks were wearing. It's like they were trying not to get hit on by guys. And, don't even get me started on the Google employees (i.e. the Nerdy Indian guys). How are you allowed to come in the club with a striped polo shirt more suitable for a 6yr olds play date! Get the F outta here! I don't think I've ever seen one of those shirts in a club. The smell in this club is like WOW! I was dancing with my boyfriend and turned my back towards him so I could do a little sexy dance and I turned right back around because the guy behind had breath that reeked of shit! Literal shit. It was gross! I had it by then and decided to spend the rest of the night on the patio.... 

Oh and Mr DJ, maybe you should play a whole song or even 3/4th of a song so people can actually dance for a minute to a good song instead of having to get up to dance and then leave the dance floor a second later because you just ruined their groove with a shitty song... Just a thought.
author: Eclectic C.

description:
Do you know anyone that's been blacklisted at a club, bar, or restaurant? I do, me, and this is the place. Well, that was 5 years ago, so this review may be outdated, you tell me.

Based on what I've experienced though, I can't tell you how little I think of this place. Choosing to plan your night around it may be the worse decision you make this year, or life. First of all, it's ghetto, people get shot and stabbed here. If your a girl, you WILL get gropped/molested. Those should be reasons enough to avoid the place, right? OK, you don't mind dodging bullets, avoiding knives, and wandering hands. Well, then you might think that the music is just BAD. Or you might find the odor repulsive. If all that doesn't stop you, I will say "I told you so". And of course, the bouncers are big shots who like to push their weight around in their yellow jackets, and unfortunately bad things happen to them from time to time. It's a tough gig, I understand, but I can speak for myself and tell you that I mean no harm. OK, fine, I need to be more careful with the pool table. OK, sure, it's a dance floor and to be on it you need to dance rather than stand. My argument though is, who are you to tell me what "dancing" is or isn't. Whatever, I was blacklisted, but it worked out for me....I lived to find better places.
author: M S.

description: mine and my friend's cell phones were stolen last night.  seriously watch out.
author: R G.

description:
I'm actually impressed at how incredibly AWFUL this place is. But I'm more embaressed to admit I ever stepped foot into this sad attempt at a bar.

I stupidly agreed to go check this place out with a friend who had just moved to SOMA and wanted to experience every single bar/club/lounge. I only wish she had skipped the Holy Cow.

LADIES: Don't go here expecting classy men or even remotely attractive men.
GUYS: Don't go here expecting pretty girls either. I've never seen such a tackier group in my life.

My girlfriend Erica got hit on by a guy so drunk we could not understand what he was saying. His speech was so effected by his state of under-the-influence that it almost sounded like he was foreign. When we asked where he was from he revealed that he and his buddies (there were about 8 other clones of him lingering behind) were from Sac-Town (his word, not mine).

Once we ditched the drunken Sac-Towners, we headed to the bar. If I was going to endure anymore of the Holy Cow, I knew I'd be needing a big old drink.

That seemed to be asking a lot. Erica ordered a beer...it arrived in a lukewarm glass. 

I cannot stress enough how incredibly LAME this bar is. The drinks might be on the cheap side, but they are awful. The crowd is gross, tacky and immature. The music is trying too hard to be "cool." 


Please.

Just don't go here.
author: Nicole R.

description: Came here for a friend's birthday on a Thursday.  Line was long, but for some odd reason couples and singles get to go in first.  There is no cover.  The music gotten better (hip hop, rnb, pop, 80's).  It's a casual Thursday night, so there is no need to be razzle dazzle in a dress ladies.  Simple nice top with jeans and heels are good.  Hell some even wear converse.  As usual females grinding up on each other in that small small corner with beaming bright lights on their sweaty face.  Lots of areas to sit around and drink.  No line in the female bathroom (i love).  According to a friend, the drinks are 1/2 off before midnight.  So go get your drink on here on a thursday night.  Bring a female friend just in case you need to skim through the line.
author: Mimi S.

description: I've had some good times here because of the company I was with. I came here twice and was on the dance floor for hours... BUT it's a hold in the wall room they call a club. nothing special, kinda dirty
author: Lucky N.

description: Came here after bouncing from WISH due to stuck up attitudes there. SInce we were a bachelorette party, the manager? head bartender? said the first round of shots was on him. That was pretty cool and tasted better than I was expecting lol. The music was really good and the bouncers were hella cool. One in particular Niko (spelling?) was joking around with us about our drunk friend and was super fun to people watch with. Another one of the bouncers gave our drunk friend a piggy back ride at the end of the night back to our party bus, which was super brave of him knowing she had been getting sick :-/ I thought that was so cool though and he was really cool about it, just telling us to get her home safe and hoped she felt better. I would definitely go back just for the bouncers. I took away one star because the people that actually occupied the bar were kinda weird but that's with any bar I guess lol.
author: K B.

description: Bros and Bro Hos, muffin tops, party buses, scantily clad bartenders, and crappy tunes. The works! Luckily my friend works here so I get free drinks, but I swear if you're a normal down to earth person with a good sense of humor you should definitely stop by and watch all the people that frequent this "fine establishment," as I'm sure your belly will be aching from all the laughter. They have a really cheap happy hour on Fridays too, but I have not personally attended (My FRIDAY? at THE HOLY COW? For shame!). Puny-sized martini glasses. Yeah.
author: Johnny C.

description: my best friend wanted to go here for her 21st bday, but we didn't make it, however last night i did make it out there. It was crowded and they played hella good music. The bartender was really HOTT! THANKS TONY FOR ALL THE SHOTS. Another cool thing that they had at this bar is a pool table. The one thing that i didn't like however ws this dude dancing behind me.. he kept pushing me and i felt like i wanted to punch him out, but no biggey. overall i had a great time!
author: Kim E.

description: If you want to get drunk for cheap Thurs is the night for you.  Beware though Went on a fri and had only 2-3 drinks with a few buddies, on the ride home to the east bay both friends got really sick, both were drinking the same thing????  Seems a little strange to me
author: Zac C.

description:
holy cow!  so many skeezy bros and marina hos in one place.

also, they made me coat-check my bottles of wine.  granted, walking into a bar with a grocery bag of booze is not one of my classiest moments, but the holy cow should stop kidding itself.  come on, hc.  you ain't classy.  

oh and, please tip the girl bartenders a little more.  they're so poor that they can't afford enough clothing to cover up their midriffs.
author: Katherine K.

description: The only fistfight I've been part of since I moved out of State College, PA happened at the Holy Cow.  Go figure.  A million drunk people packed in like sardines and a certain energy in the crowd that tends towards trouble, and not in the good way.  If you still get kicks out of downing a row of shots, puking all over your date, and then taking more shots and bragging about it the next day, this is your bar.
author: Anony M.

description: The Holy Cow.  I have to agree with Johnny C on the muffin tops.   There is a male dress code of gap button down pin stripped shirts and the girls all gotta be fat.  Luckily for me as well, i get free whiskey there.  Nothing is better than watching all the white girls dance to "i'm bossy"  while their large-and-in-charge male friends grind their weiners on their butts.  If i went every night, I would have a 6 pack from laughing so hard. I guess its cause I never made it as a wise man.
author: Katie Sue A.

description: Cheap drinks and cheap people.  Almost every person in there is usually wasted by the time midnite hits.  Thursday nights are half off all drinks till midnite.  No cover, that's pretty much the only positive thing I have to say about this place.
author: Jamie Q.

description: This place is sooo stuck in the last century...kinda smells like a frat filled w. dirty socks and sweaty b.o.....it just got sooo claustrophobic that shouldn't one want elegance after college? Or if you are wanting to pick up those 18 year olds w. fake ids maybe it IS the place for exploration. You decide.
author: miriam b.

description: "Trashy" type of place with a minimum charge on credit cards?  Crowd is more of 80s loving, rock, & country type.  Not for me...
author: Derrick V.

description: Holy Cow does not charge cover which explains the horrible music and the trashy crowd you will find at this venue. You have to be completely drunk out of your mind to find this place amusing. Don't even think about going there alone as a girl. Just go to WISH next door and pay $10 cover - it is definitely worth it.
author: Maria V.

description:
roomy.... 
kinda dead....
but it's nice that there's a bar across the street so you can do short distant bar hopping....two totally different atmosphere!

edit: so in the last year or so ive been coming to Holy Cow few times here and there... and i just had to add another star!
event tho this place get shit crowded.... this place is the bar in Cheers or Central Perks from Friends. You just end up here... like home (well not really but you get my drift...rite?) neways... holy cow makes for a great last resort or just wanna get out on a monday nite...tuesday nite...or any nite.

interesting mix crowded.... came here on labor day and yeah.... "interesting" people... very much  local bar
and did i mention no cover?
author: Lynn T.

description: I think the name Holy Cow suits the place well because it's full of CHEESE!
author: Ben M.

description: I wish, wish, wish there were more bars like this is San Jose. Great music, nice bartender ladies and strong drinks are all I need to have a good time. Crowd was a tad skeezy, but I still had a blast!
author: Janette W.

description:
It's a bar with a dance floor, deejay, & NO COVER.  You can't go wrong with that! 

And  for me, the MOST important thing is-- PLENTY OF BATHROOM STALLS!!!
author: Sheila S.

description: This place sucks! Went there with some buddy's of mine and there was no where to walk or dance. place is small too. 1 star baby! thats all you get!
author: Oscar H.

description: my friend and i were trying to find a place to throw a party and someone suggested this to us. we immediately said this is not the place and had a great time making fools of ourselves, having the bartender ignore us to the point that we got free drinks and a BBW hit on my friend's boyfriend in front of the both of us. RIDICULOUS. I've decided that the only time I'd go there again would be if I were drunk in need for a good laugh...
author: Anita C.

description: It is what it is. Party Bus HQ. This bar is literally the antithesis of its next door neighbor, Wish.
author: Tal K.

description: It gets an extra star just because the drink was okay. We ordered a long island and vodka cranberry drinks. There was no cover charge. The place was pretty empty on a Friday night and the music was pretty bad. But I have heard from friends that it can be a fun place to hang out just didn't get that vibe when we went.
author: R And J.

description: This place has okay music but is a meat market for sure! Everytime I danced with either my girlfriend or my boyfriend, some sleazy dude would eye me from like 5 feet away and I could feel his nasty eyes burning holes in me. Also, I was dancing with my boyfriend and some dude came up to me and got hella close and asked me if he could join in. I pushed him away from me and yelled no at him and then he asked what I said. Ewww. The crowd is like Marina douches mixed with trashy girls. The drinks are okay. The bartender didn't know what an 18 dummy was but I bet most people who don't know how to shake their dreads do either though.
author: Tiffany D.

description: Holy Crap!  I could not believe a place this lame could exist in San Francisco!  Certainly it may not charge a cover, but they make up for the lack of a cover charge by making their drinks more expensive than other bars and hiring the lamest DJs, who I suspect moonlight at weddings, confirmations, and bar/bat mitzvahs, to pop into the CD/MP3 player the cheesiest, most overplayed dance tracks known in America.  It sadly reminds of the overcrowded and noisy "college bars" that catered exclusively to the fraternity and sorority set that I tried desperately to avoid like The Plague back in Jersey.
author: Rick E.

description: Thank You Holy Cow for Being there. This is a great place, no cover, blacklights and dancing. It Does get crowded and crazy sometimes, but thats the WHOLE point of going out on a weekend. This was one of my favorite bars to stop by in SOMA, and lots others have come and gone.
author: jen t.

description:
After reading the reviews, I felt I had to throw my 2 cents into the ring.  The Holy Cow is by far the best local bar in SoMA.  This place is not intended to be a meat market like "clubs".  It is a place where you get drunk, dance a little and meet up with friends.  I am sick of hearing the bridge and tunnel low lifes saying that some local places suck.  Get a fucking job, make some money and move to San Francisco!  

I have been to the cow many times.  Every time, the employees make me feel right at home.  They rarely ask for a cover, the drinks are reasonable and the music is "chick friendly".  They have been doing some restoration so the bathrooms perform better.

Overall, stop bagging on the cow.  It is a safe place to go and have some fun.
author: James B.

description: Holy Cow is a perfect example of a dive bar with a big dance floor for people to drink cheap drinks and dance dirty.  Its a great place to relive the fraternity scene if you miss it time to time.  Beware though, this place is definitely not the nicest place
author: Charles C.

description: Been here a few times and each time it was just okay.  They should definitely fix their bathroom situation here.  I definitely would not put this place first on my list of places to visit during a night out to SF - maybe toward the end of the list and end up here before last call, have a drink, and then get out of town.  There's definitely better bars in the immediate area.
author: Paul C.

description: My friend took me here for my 21st bday..All I remember is that I got free drinks and had fun!! Good times..
author: Andy D.

description:
Was introduced to this place not so long ago, by a few of my brazilian friends, fist thing I noticed when u come in is the big statue of a cow at the entrance. (no wonder they used to call it 'vaquinha' meaning little cow) lol
Anyway u come in and the atmosphere is good, lots of people dancing a few crazy girls dancing on the top of a corner stand, hey it's fun u come to the bar you are helped pretty quick, no need to mention the 1/2 drinks that everybody  talks about.
I usually go on thursday nights but I'm not a big fan of going out during the week cause of work so I now I go on saturday nights I usually go there when I don't feel like spending a lot of money. No cover, cheap drinks and easy parking. Big diversity of people you'll find ugly chick and cute chick it's always different but at least they are not stock up conceited girls like in most posh places in SF.
The smoking area is cool spacious and chill. You can actually have a good conversation in case u wanna take a break from dancing.

This is my review for the holy cow hope it helps you making your decision!

P.S. guys good place to go to hook up.
author: Al N.

description: Ahh The Holy Cow.... fun place to go every so often.  Fantastic because it doesn't have a cover, but then again you get what you pay for.
author: Kevin T.

description: Everyone in the city claims this is a bridge and tunnel crowd and then secretly goes here. It is packed and filled with hoochie mamas and douchebag guys but that in its own way can be fun. I love the no cover cause I'm po' and if you're a guy the girls dancing on the "stages" practically amount to a free strip show. I mean who can turn their nose up at such a good deal.
author: Cathy T.

description: I've been here a couple of times, and enjoyed myself both times. Never a cover charge which means I am already a fan.  The drinks, if I remember correctly are reasonably priced, and were strong the last time I was there.  They usually have drink specials on Thursday nights.
author: Catherine K.

description:
this is a good place if you feel like getting drunk, shaking your ass on a crowded floor and finding a cute piece of ass. there is an outdoor smoking area, but even you non-smokers are gonna need it to cool off! 

this isn't a place that i can go all the time, but it's still enjoyable from time to time! :)
author: Kristin Y.

description: Oh Holy Cow...how I miss you! I have only fond memories of this place, granted I haven't been here in almost 2 years!!! When I lived in the East Bay, I would come into SF and this would be my first stop. The drinks were cheap and strong and admissions was free. The crowd was friendly and the music just made me smile. Every time I hear "Pour Some Sugar On Me", "Walk this Way," or "Sweet Child 'O Mine"...I can't help but think of Holy Cow and the weekends spending my youth here drinking myself to oblivion...hahaha.
author: Charleen S.

description:
Thursday Nights are great.
They have a superb music on Thursdays- 
Dj Von throws Bangin Electro Beats and it got everybody dancing. New Music for an okay crowd. 
The drinks are cheap and the location is sometimes questionable but the Thursday Dj - DJ VON does a whole bunch of other venues worth following. You should check out Temple Club and his website. 
www.djvon.com
I have been a big fan and follower for a couple years now.
author: Paula H.

description: I had a great time at Holy Cow - but Holy crap! $25 minimum on cards?! It's a little give and take. I was forced to spend $25 because I ran out of cash, but I ended up getting two blue moons and two jack and cokes. It's a great atmosphere, but $25 minimum on cards? ...everyone has plastic now-a-days.. they should really think about changing that up.
author: Mel C.

description: You have to be already intoxicated when you go here or else... I agree with everyone else. At least it's free. But the music, ohhhhhh. Learn how to mix, isn't that why you're a dj? Sheesh. Random music plays here, be prepared. Drinks aren't that strong. I think on Thursdays before midnight drinks are half off.
author: Beth W.

description: Holy Crap this place still exist!!!  Now I know I'm REALLY OLD!  I think I was twenty something when I was coming here and I didn't like it then.
author: May A.

description: Apparently someone has hacked into my yelp account then felt the liberty to write bad reviews.
author: John F.

description: I love the Cow.  I don't care what the other reviews say.  It was the first bar that I legally went to in San Francisco and it was great.  Yes, it gets crowded.  Yes, sometimes the dj sucks.  But  come on people it's FREE and they have a dance floor and bartenders who make nice stiff drinks.  (Especially Adrian, who is adorable.)  Thursday and Friday nights are the best.  Saturday not so much, it can be kind of empty ad there tend to be an older crowd.   I love Holy Cow and always will.  Don't forget to tip your bartender and check out the David statue in the ladies room.
author: Julia E.

description:
Everybody seems to be really knocking this place, and I think I know why.
I went to Holy Cow having read the bad reviews on Yelp, but my friends had been and wanted to go back. I was a little wary, but I went in with low-expectations... and had a pretty decent time!
The crowd can be a little bit sketchy, but it was a Friday night, no line, and the drinks weren't bad at all (although I recommend staying with simple drinks, like well drinks or beer). The music was good to dance to, a little bit cliche but most of them reminded me of high school dances--fun and nostalgic [EX: Baby Got Back, Brass Monkey, AC/DC]. 
The ladies room... well, I watched a girl run and puke in the trashcan near the sink, but hey at least she didn't actually use the sink! There was TP and the stalls locked properly, I mean, maybe my standards are low but I wasn't horrified.
I really appreciated the security guards. We were dancing up on one of the boxes and this creeper started taking pictures of us and as soon as I pointed it out to the security guy, he made the creeper stop. Much appreciated!
Ended the night dancing with a cute blonde dude from Norway... good times. :)
author: Shannon B.

description: I don't know why but I totally like this place. My friend says it's because of the place next door that sells garlic fries until like 3 am but Holy Cow is always fun. It gets crowded and the place is full of sketch guys taking pictures with their camera phones of almost equally sketch girls dancing on the two little platforms but I still have a good time. The bouncers and the bartenders are cool and even give you free drinks sometime. And I swear they pay that 40-year-old man who dances on that little platform EVERY time I go with his beer belly hanging out...he is too awesome for words. His special dance is him holding out his cell phone and pointing to random girls on the dance floor...come on, for that alone, I give you 5 stars, Holy Cow.
author: Esther K.

description: I was going to give this place more credit...because I had a decent time until the bouncer started hassling us while we were going to the restroom.  He was a gem.
author: Olivia R.

description: Man, maybe I was drunker then I thought.  Lets see what I can draw back on... the line was short, the drinks came quick, the music was pretty good, crowd was a pleasantly sleazy but cleaner then a lot of other places in SOMA, pretty crowded but it was a warm weather Saturday night, ran into an x and she seemed her same old neutral emotions self, impossible to find a cab but pretty central so easy to hike out.  I dont know about going here every night of the week but for a last call Saturday night stop, I'd give it a shot.  3.5, good but not great
author: Porfirio R.

description: I was dragged in here to begin with. But I had to be dragged out. I love this place. Good music. An eclectic group of people in it. And the drinks are not too pricy. You also have the ability to sit. What a day and age we live in. Sitting. You can get pleanty here. And I am too drunk to remember it, but I think they had snacks. If not those pencil shavings were delishious.
author: F B.

description: I really don't have anything negative to say about this place, other than the lack of attractive guys. But who cares? We took a bride here for the start of her bachelorette party and we had such a great time. There was such a range in ages of all of us in attendance, and everybody had a great time. We basically owned the place, which probably makes it better. I'm not a regular so I can only rate it on this experience, but friends of mine frequent it and enjoy themselves. It's small, but the atmosphere is fun.
author: Kimberlee J.

description: 5 stars because my friends work here. I read all the reviews on this place and I have to laugh. Its a bar people I do believe it is free. I know there are 10,000 other places in this fine city that you can go to. This is a staple in SF always has been always will be. It is a good place for the youngins to go and shake their booty. They have average priced drinks and if you are nice to them (as with any bar) they might be a little more generous with the pour. Holy Cows is not trying to be anything other than what it is. so for that I give them 5 stars.. the coat check ladies are super cool as well!!!
author: Jennifer O.

description: It's FREE and it is possible to have fun here with friends.  Of course don't expect vegas-like clubs here; it could be a fun thursday night!
author: Hana ..

description: Good place to go on Thursday nights during the summer or a major college break, because until 12am it's half-priced drinks. I've only been there on a non-Thursday once and it was a forgettable experience. The crowd is mixed, the bartenders are pretty good, and the music is a little bit random, rotating hip hop with 80s rock (Imagine freaking some girl to Lil John, then hearing Bon Jovi coming on next. Why do you do that? Play sets, so I don't maneuver my way through the HUGE crowd to dance, then want to leave the floor because they're playing a song that I don't like.). Bathrooms weren't that bad, but that's because I'm a guy. And when this place fills up, it gets crowded, and it's pretty hard to move around.
author: Rod M.

description:
Pros: They have the nicest bartender's and make great drinks. 

Cons: The bouncer that looks like that guy from the Green Mile is horrible. He picks on people for no reason. Has some sort of ego trip. (Selects certain people and forces them to tuck in their shirts)
author: Brian W.

description: Not the swankest place ever, but the 1/2 off drinks before 11:30 specials hit the spot. They have a nice chill area in the back, and decent dance area and responsive bar staff. I would go here again. Oh, and it's open when other bars aren't.
author: Anders N.

description: The dance floor is right by the bathroom so not only are people constantly trying to elbow their way through the horde of sweaty dancers but the whole dance floor smells like urine. Awesome.
author: Rachel F.

description: Id give this place a 4 star if it wasn't for the buff guy with the tight shirt behind the bar. Came here plenty of other times and everything was pretty chill. Not much of a line and no cover charge. But still a good crowd and had a good time. But for this one sat night, was out with a few friends. Bought a couple rounds. Happened that my friend didnt write a tip on the receipt, he picked up the receipt and pretty much demanded us to write a tip. We looked at each other like wtf is his problem. He then picked up our three drinks we just bought and threw them away with an attitude. Im sure glad we didnt tip him after all. I know its respectful to tip, but i didnt know it was required or get your drinks thrown away.
author: Greg N.

description: Poppin' music and a heater near your feet while you're sitting at the bar. Nice bartenders. However, it's OK.  The place needs some cleaning.  We arrived and left early.
author: Jeannine L.

description: I used to go to this place years ago and would have the time of my life....dancing like no tomorrow, up on the wood box in the corner dancing the night away. Either I am getting older or this place is getting younger. It's the, "i just turned 21 crowd"  or not sure if people are even 21 in this place. Sauna is another thought that comes to mind, this place is warm and ventilation is something you will find outside.
author: Ricquel N.

description: Its a laid back place. Good bar..Just straight folks go here so it may feel like a meat market for some of us..but well, its a fun place to take a group out for a dance.
author: Victoria M.

description: One of the cheesiest bars in SF. If you like to be taken back in the late 1980s, that's a place to go. Do yourself a favor, walk over to Wish Bar and get yourself a true drink that is not watered down.
author: Crisa M.

description:
I absolutely loved this place!  Great music, plenty of room to dance.

Just when I thought I had explored the whole place my friend showed me the back patio which was a great area to cool down and chat for a second.  

Bartenders were a little more concerned about their drinks then yours but that didn't slow things up too much.

Definitely a laid back crowd, not too dressed up mostly jeans and tees.  Not my style but it didn't stop me from having fun one bit.

Another great thing...no cover! LOVE IT
author: Carina A.

description: The cow is awesome because cheap drinks + good friends = fun.  I have never been there to meet someone, or to dance/talk with random people and I don't plan on it.  If you are looking for that, I can see why people don't like the place.  Oh and the music can be erratic, from some hyphee stuff to the mickey mouse song... at least those songs I am not fond off give good reason to get another 1/2 off shot and have a smoke.
author: rocky b.

description: One of the great bars in SF. I was visiting the Bay area and happened to come across this little bar. The bartenders poured very stiff drinks even without a big tip. The crowd was a good mixed and very relax.
author: Tony N.

description: HOLY COW!!!  so many memories here (if only Holy Cow walls could talk lol)......  Guaranteed fun everytime!!!! Marcus our fave bartender makes the best drinks!!!!!  Great music, NO COVER and friendly staff!!!! We dont come here often as we use to but Holy Cow will always hold a special place in my heart..... oh and you gotta love the David statue inside the ladies room hahaha :P
author: Jazzmin T.

description: Bad music, bachlorettes, crappy drinks, hot and crowded pretty much sums it up.  Does get a two-star because it's a guaranteed hook-up with one of the bridge-and-tunnel crowd if you are desparate.
author: PaT F.

description: This place was poppin' on a thursday night! Half price drinks, plenty of dancing and fun.  They are trying to up their image because when we went in, they said this is the last time they will let anyone with shirts (ie button ups only).  Thats a good call.  It reminded me a little of the typical college bar but with a little more flair.  Definitely worth a shot.
author: Joey M.

description:
I went here last Thursday night (but more like a Friday night because Friday was a holiday) as part of a friend's 21st birthday celebration and this place was packed! .... but NOT with the best crowd (Don't go here if you're used to a Marina-type atmosphere, or ANY sort of class, haha. Not kidding.). If I wasn't with a large group, I would have been Way uncomfortable/ pretty sure I'd have been robbed.

THAT put aside, it was actually pretty fun. Decently priced drinks (1/2 off Thursdays? Something like that...) The music selection was... an interesting mix of late 90s/early 00s pop/hip hop and 60-70s rock. Ok, not for everyone, but I happen lo love that combo. 

Tips: Don't go in the unisex bathrooms if you're a girl (worse than the dirtiest frat house's), and don't stay too long at Holy Cow... get out before the crowd gets too rowdy. Only go here with a good/large group of people and in a good mood... and ready to fight off creeps and thugs that you'll most likely run into. 
Oh, and I think this place's back outdoor patio, that I noticed on my way to the SKETCH bathrooms, could be a cool place to chill, IF/when I go back... which is a Maybe.
author: Kelly G.

description: So I was supposed to have my brithday party at this "Bar" last Friday and wow, what a bunch of DRAMA! I had spoke with the owner for two weeks about my party and asked him several times about the dress code, cover, and what time we should show up. I got to the place at 9:00pm to help set up and I guess a few people in my party arrived a little earlier. The bouncers told them they could not enter because they were not meeting the dress code?!?!? I friend had very nice levi jeans on, a polo shirt, and some casual shoes. The bouncer kept exclaiming that his pants were too baggy (even though the guy basically had on nut huggers!) I explained to the bouncer that I had a big party that was about to take place and I needed to speak to the owner. The bouncer replied with, "He doesn't know you and doesn't want to see you!" Anyways after a half hour of arguing with this guy and having the guy insult me and my friends, we decided to just take off to broadway street and enjoy the rest of the night. We went to several other CLUBS and my friend had no problem getting in. Funny that a BAR would turn down his dress attire! I'm not saying this place sucks or what ever, but the bouncers are real A Holes. Beware!!!!! I've heard this place is racist and now I truly believe it!!!!!!
author: Tousaint C.

description:
yeah, certainly not a place i would frequent... but when that occasional thursday rolls around when you just want to black out and have a good time in spite of your own friday morning, $1 drinks from 9-10 isn't a bad way to go.  $15 later, I assure you, your perspective of holy cow will impove... not significantly, but just enough to say "i don't mind that this place exists."  

outside of those hours, this place doesn't exist as far as i'm concerned.
author: luda h.

description:
This place is HORRIBLE!!
