There are wayyy to many bouncers and the one wearing a scarf all the time thinks he's a cop or something! who are you kidding, you're a bouncer at holy cow. and to top it, theres one guy bartender who is tall and muscular who works the bar in the back who is ridiculously rude! he looks down to people and drinks wayy to much then he can handle to be bartending at the same time. if you cant drink and and also give good customer service then dont drink buddy, because you obviously cant handle it!!!! his presence just isnt welcoming and he needs to stop acting like mr. tough guy because you aint!! 
i feel bad for the other bartenders who have to work with him!! maybe thats why he gets stuck in the back bar!!!
avoid this place, it also smells and there's a bunch of creepers!!!
author: ashley j.

description:
open bar at holy cow?? AWESOME! although it was only from 9-10 for well drinks, got a few drinks out of it. 10-11 was 1/2 off everything. another AWESOME! pretty good night without having to spend a crap-load of money, except the tips. some people took advantage of the open bar more than others, haha... but good times.
oh, and another thing, we saw dwight schrute!...look-a-like. haha, extra good times.
author: Jimmy N.

description: last year i met this guy who asked me to meet him for drinks with him and his friends... at first he seemed so sweet and was really cute... but when he said they were going to the Holy Cow i knew i could not date him! he had no idea why i never called him back, but any guy (or girl) who frequents this place better have a good reason. *see all other reviews for explanation. its all true.
author: Michelle I.

description: been going to holy cow on thursdays for who knows how long! .. love the environment, people, and drinks! ... whenever me and my buddies need a thursday night out, its always been holy cow! ..... daniel (bartender) is an awesome dude. nice music and back smoking patio ... thumbs up!
author: Frankie L.

description: the female bartender challenged my buddy to a pull up contest=5 stars
author: Heather B.

description: no pun intended, but Holy Cow was this place crowded last night(a Thursday). walked in and immediately lost my 2 buddies. circled the bar about 3 or 4 times(half hour through the crowd). ok, so i got distracted a couple times. sue me... finally found them, just in time to leave. not because it was awful, but because we had come from another club and were already hammered and starving to death. the music was cool, and the crowd was...ok... this place had a creepy feel to it however. i dont know how to describe it, it was just...yeah...creepy.
author: Andrew T.

description: Holy shit.  Ew.  I would have never gone here on my own, and being dragged in with people whom I hardly knew (friends of a friend) was not fun, either.  I bet the air in this place has herpes.  Probably the least city-bar in the city, this place seemed full of out-of-touch 20 and 30-something year-old girls wearing cut-up tank tops that made their sweaty back fat sparkle.  The music was AWFUL- think remix of "Hey there, Delilah," and of course the detestable "Beautiful Girls" and "Umb-er-ella."  I've probably had more fun at frat parties in college, and those were not my scene, either.  An incompetent female bartender overcharged my friend ($24 dollars for a shot of Yager and a double Crown and coke), and the other female bartender was two centimeters of fabric away from naked, confusing a black bra and sheer cropped piece of fabric with a shirt.  Needless to say, they do not have Pabst.  If this bar had a mascot, it would probably be a vulture holding a Miller Chill.
author: Liza W.

description: HOLY COW you suck ass...so it's not the first time I go to Holy Cow but it was the first time I went there sober. The last time I was incredibly drunk off my ass and too my dismay I have heard a few friends of mine speak of this Holy Cow spot...well 6 of us went there this past Saturday and it was fucking nasty. The Bouncer was a douche bag to some guys who were wearing shorts but watever they were gay men getting ready for the Folsom street fair, but none the less he was an ass. So we step inside and its ridiculously hot as hell. All the guys in there were 30+ and the girls were 21. I kid you not it was insane at how young the broads were and how old and gross the men were...BAD UGLY TOOLS WEARING FAKE ED HARDY/ CHRISTIAN AUDIGEIR shirts....double bad I kno...my beer was cold and yummy...thats about it...only thing i did like is that they had plenty of seat action. As a side note this spot has plenty of cutty spaces if you are into the public acts of indecency this place sure lends itself to "public poking" if you will...lmfao...dont think u will be seeing me again unless i am incredibly wasted and numb....ciao holy cow!
author: Yolanda O.

description: OMIGOD HOLY COW IS RIGHT! Came in on a Saturday night, 3rd stop on the drunken trolley and I was pretty much hammered at this point but I do remember it being so stupid packed that I didn't even bother to get a drink.. oh, and the bathroom situation was co-ed and to me that is just weird sir.. 2 stars because not  one of our party of 20 was involved in any fist fights, door guy was pleasant and the music situation was decent and I'd pretty much come here over any dive in San Jose any night of the week
author: Danielle M.

description: This place is trash. Never going back. There is no cover and the drinks are cheap but you pretty much get what you pay for. They also have a no in and out policy that they don't tell you about. After making a phone call my friend tried to come back in and the bouncers pretty much assaulted him and took him to the ground while my friend didn't resist at all. They then called the police and claimed my friend was drunk and was being violent which he was not. Save yourself the trouble and find another bar.
author: Josh S.

description: I love Holy Cows, I only go on thursday tho because as we all know THURSDAYS at holy cow are the best days, On top of that Half price drinks before mid night. The bouncers are mainly jerks to guys. Sorry Guys. Most of the time guys can't get in unless they are partnered with a girl. But Hey I haven't had a bad experience yet so in my book this is the best bar to go to on a thursday night. And no cover charge too. Perfect. I la la la love this place
author: Kelly B.

description: your door guy last night was stellar.  i didn't catch his name, but in the face of a huge line, he maintained a subdued, gracious attitude, which isn't easy on a holiday weekend.
author: Kathleen R.

description: Ever REALLY want to feel like a female? This is the place to be. With a male to female ratio of 12:1, someone is bound to grope you within 5 minutes. The moment you step in, you can't help but be overwhelmed by the oozing primal male desperation. Of the 15 minutes we stayed, we elbowed a few guys who "accidentally" brushed against us too intimately. I kicked one who grabbed my ass and shoved away a bastard leaning in too close with his alcohol breath. I never had to fend for my female dignity as hard as those 15 minutes. If their game was as simple as getting cheap feels, I doubt any of them got laid that night. Perhaps it's a vicious cycle that those arseholes fell into, no game = no lay = growing desperation. Newsflash: Girls do not enjoy being molested by strangers. Shocking, isn't it? Next time talk with your mouth not with your hands. Did I mention the people were unattractive? Let's just say the place was adequately named.
author: Tif W.

description: Holy Cow...What a fuckin cock fest...Im never commin back here again ever
author: d n.

description: kindova ghetto crowd. last time i was here, there was a super ho-ey girl dancing on the bar. always a meh experience.
author: Kan L.

description: I'll admit it...I've been here like five times =-(  It's never my choice but what can ya say when you're being driven lol.  The Holy Cow reminds me of an unwanted HS reunion.  3 out 5 times I've seen people from HS that I could care less about.  The drinks are questionable...the prices vary on what I'm assuming is the bartenders drunkenness price rating system?? The dance floor really isn't a dance floor at all and there's this one raised spot where drunk women squish into to dance freaky and feel sexy I guess...feel sorry for them.  Everyone is drunk drunk drunk.  Toooo drunk. But if you're at The Holy Cow you have to be drunk drunk drunk or you simply won't survive the evening.  I've met a lot of losers there that attempt to "get to know me" but I can usually get rid of them in the first 2 minutes after explaining to them what I do, who I am, and where I'm going.  Not a place for people of quality.  But if you're looking to target a dumb drunk chick this is the perfect place and you'll have a ton of options.  Last time I went, I walked in drunk, never ordered a drink, sat outside talking to security most of the time while dealing with the random drunk men approaching me.  Holy Cow is right...I beg my few friends that frequent this place to try something new but they're cheap and there's no cover charge with music.  Blah...I'd rather dance alone in my living room. lol
author: Alicia K.

description: The club was good, music was bumpin, the fake tities were bouncin. The atmosphere was fly, the asians were multiplying and the booze was expensive. What else can I say, everytime you order a drink it's a different price. The place was nice, but the parking situation SUCKS. We had our car destroyed by a bunch of hooligans. They took the $80 sterio and our tab was $75. WTF. So I must say, if I was to go back I would definatelly not DRIVE. the mexican club Caliente seemed to be jumping. No crackers inside.
author: chris h.

description: there's already been so much said about this joint, it would behoove me to move on... but i can't ... it's like a car wreck... you gotta see it... i've seen the staff beating on people & people beating on the staff... obviously upon entering, you are immersed in a cheese whiz fantasy party, with bridge & tunnel bimbos tumbling in and out at a surprising rate... despite being the most lecherous straight bar in the city, the owner is a draq queen/tranny...and from 1968 to about 1988, the place was once the site of The Stud , a venerable or at least surreal venereal memory of homo party  culture...
author: Donny N.

description: It is a total dive.  Imagine your buddy's college apartment, the one you always threw crazy parties at and that was never ever cleaned up.  That is the Holy Cow.  I've been there once, I was already drunk and only stayed 15 minutes.  Its no where you want to be long and has all the lewd tackiness of every frat party I've ever had the displeasure of being at.
author: B B.

description: I always come on tursdays to Holy Cow. If you ever want to go to a chill bar with a couple of friends, this is a great place. Drinks are pretty decent too. Music is mainstream normal stuff. Dress code is casual.  And the best is that there is never any cover!
author: Noora T.

description: for some reason my girlfriends and i always come here on thursday nights. its half-off drinks from 9-11pm. free cover. full of d-bags with no manners... since when is it ok to just come up behind a girl and practically molest her on the dance floor. not cool. the music is usually a good mash up of oldies and new stuff. it is always hot as hell in there. since when did this place become asian central? it used to be so diverse. despite all the negatives though, we always seem to have a good time. go fig.
author: Linda N.

description: BRIDGE AND TUNNEL- Notice that the only good reviews are from people who do not live in San Francisco but rather drive into the city or hop on Bart for a night out.  This place is terrible- the bar staff thinks they are good looking when they are not.  They have a $25 minimum for credit cards which is outrageous.  The place smells like shit and generally caters to an ugly crowd.  I am not into ugly parties and had to leave.  I will never return to the Holy Cow and I suggest you do the same.  P.S. it was full of D Bag sweaty guys and all the girls were ugly.  Did I already mention that????
author: Mike H.

description: it's like going to butter, the place down the street on 11th. but instead of faux white trash. it's white trash. but being sf, white trash comes in a variety of colors.
author: Shinn Z.

description: when you walk inside.. you really feel like you're walking into a cow's ass. the floors are dirty, security is rude, and its a huge cock fest.  if you're looking for a cheap drink on thurs. nights and no females then this is the place for you. this place is full of thugs.. fights breaking out every week. now they got 5o waiting outside so shit don't pop off.  this place is not worth you're time.
author: Cedric F.

description: I love this place forever and for always and there will never be a time where I don't, at the very least, consider it as a back up plan. I'm not sure why I love it- it's often too crowded, there's a ton of nasty guys and gals, the music isn't always great... but for some reason never a bad time is had at The Cow. It's superb for people watching, and it's even better for being one of those people that people who like to watch people watch: have a few drinks and embrace your inner slut, because no matter what you look like, you're guaranteed to have action accessible to you here. Or if you're in the mood for playing it sober, try meeting some new friends on the back patio, or tearing it up on the sweaty dance floor or one of the handful of semi-stages. Good times, good times.
author: M Z.

description: You must get trapped here at least once when you first move to SF. The outdoor patio is nice, but the people are sorta ghetto since there's no cover. Feels like a college dive, probably because it is.  Lots of cute girls for some reason though, or maybe that's just because I've been wasted when I've gone here. Not a bad place to get a quick beer before hitting the nearby clubs.
author: Hmmm W.

description:
back in 1999 this place was cool.. fun people having a good time.. but nowadays, you're more likely to get shot than laid! 

avoid this spot, unless you are rolling deep with your "backup", yo, and everyone be strapping. now get yo-self some hoochie ass.. feel me?
author: David F.

description: its like an abbatoir in there, a meat market is being generous to this place and generous is what this place isn't at all peeps
author: Derek Alistair J.

description: I was excited about going to this place because I heard the drinks were really cheap on thursday nights and its usually really packed too. I went outside to meet a friend and when I tried to go back in this short white bald guy who is apparently a bouncer there was such a DICK!! He accused me of pushing him which I didn't do and therefore he wouldn't let me go back in and because of his stupid ass my friends who were already inside had to leave too. And while I was waiting for my friends to come out I witness the bouncers telling this couple they couldn't go in and for no reason at all! what the hell is wrong with these bouncers?!?!
author: Jezebel B.

description:
this is where the weirdos dwell.

thursdays are the best days to go because the drinks are half off until midnight but the music is always hit or miss because of all that damn house music.  my boyfriend litereally had someone hang on his shirt and she tried to get down low to the floor!  she better go to some more squats or somethin'!  

although its free and theres barely a dress code---it may not be worth the trip out to the city when there's a lot better spots out there.
author: Aubrey M.

description: Ok, I read some reviews and I agree there were a couple weird guys...but there will always be weird ppl anywhere you go!  Anyway, we had a pretty large fun group of 10+ who just wanted to dance and have fun...and that we did. The secret is to just go with a bunch of people and you WILL have a good time. Good music that night, did nothing but dance from 11-2am.  Free before 11.  Drinks weren't bad either and the bartender gave me a free bottle of water :)
author: M M.

description: some nights music is wrack... other nights is cracking.. very mix crowds ranging in age n race...outdoor patio for all the smokers..two bars... ocassionally drinked fights n broken glasses...okay juss that one time...
author: Lily T.

description: Cheap drinks.  Good dancing.  Nice patio area.  Overall it's a great place to go!
author: Laura C.

description: what is up w/ the hate for this place.... it's cheap, it's got a good vibe w/ decent music and if you roll in w/ a good crew, then you're bound to have a good time.  the stupid thing here is the fact that you have to shell out 2 bucks for water.  definitely sucks when you're the b-day boy and are being bombarded w/ shot after shot and all you need to prevent that hangover is some h20...
author: Swarup B.

description: interesting place. the atmosphere was very weird. i mean there were lots of young people there but when you see 40-50 year olds hitting on chicks that is just weeeeeird. i don't think i'll ever go back here again. i had fun though that night cause i had the right lady to keep me bumpin' to the crappy music they played. i definitely will skip this place next time i'm going drinking.
author: Jonathon C.

description: i freakin love this place! i don't know why everyone hates on it.  i've been there about three times, everytime i'm with a group of people and we're always able to get a table and chill.  we went there this past friday and the bouncers weren't letting some guy in cause his pants were too baggy, so the bouncer told us that he couldn't let us in until they dealt with baggy pants guy so we went around the corner to butter. butter was lame so after a drink we went back to holy cow. the bouncer remembered us and took us all inside up to the bar and had the bartender give all 8 of us patron shots. i thought that was really nice and unexpected.  so yay for holy cow. they play good music (britney spears and soulja boy!!! haha) and there is space to dance and to just sit back and chill with your friends.
author: Meghan H.

description:
crowded as hell, so i didn't have much fun cuz im the type to dance like a fool when im tipsy. drinks are reasonably priced, but the bars always packed on thursday nite. and ppl were kinda shady looking, but not all of em. i give it a-o-kay.

p.s. i like the shiva hands below.
author: RJ C.

description: I like this place. It's not fancy or pretentious or trying to be something it isn't. It's just hella chill. No cover charge, small dance floor, but not too small. Music is standard. But overall it's just a really good place to hang out. It's a great place to pre-game if you're going out, but i probably wouldn't stay there for an entire night.
author: Julian B.

description: Wow...talk about bad reviews. Wasn't expecting this. When I went here awhile back, I had a lot of fun and enjoyed myself. Lot of people to meet and mingle with and the age group that usually hangs out here is in their mid to low 20's which is good in my book. They have a lot of happy hour deals, mainly on thursdays and fridays. I forget what times they are, but they have it on their billboards. Go on these days if you're going to get your drink on. They play good music too. The only problem I have about this place is when the floor gets packed. You can barely move. Also when you go outside to the patio in the back that you think you'll catch a breather from all the heat being produced inside, think again. Lot of people are outside, and a lot of them take their smoke breaks there which is suffocating (no offense to the smokers). Entry is free. It's a good place to meet with new people and to have a good time. I recommend this place to people in their low 20's to mid 20's since that's mainly the age group I see that hangs around here primarily.
author: Sean E.

description: I would give this place zero stars is I could.  The bouncers here think they are hot shit when really they aint nothin but a piece of shit.  Me and brother went out with two bad females and the whole night was going according to plan.  We took them out to eat then we went to fuze to get some drinks then across the street to impala to dance and then finish off the night at holy cows where I heard they free entry and cheap drinks. Plus it was right by the teli we rented and we wanted to end off the night there and do the dam thing until the sun came up BUT we get to holy cows and they tried to say that me and brother we out of dress code. HUH? I was wearing ed hardy jeans, a long sleeve Tommy hilfiger dress shirt and gator dress shoes. My brother was wearin basically the same type of thing. So i look inside and there are people wearing shoes with hooded sweatshirts with hats and raggy ass jeans with holes in them.  HUH? So i say to the bouncer, "they can get in wearing that but we cant get in wearing this?" he said "sorry guys i dont make the rules GOODBYE and have a good night" I said "F**k you" and walked away.  I didnt see the what the problem was, especially since we were better dressed then everyone inside.  Maybe because we were Latin and everyone inside was white? Who knows, all i know is, you better bleach your skin and hair if you wana come into this piece.
author: supa m.

description: used to go only on thursdays and thought it was ok, came on a friday night and i will never go back. this place is ok if your looking for very CHEAP drinks. lots of underaged people in the crowd. tons of drunk girls falling over if thats what your into. would suggest thursdays, but def. not fridays.
